 14838	--She never let them in, he cried again through his laughter as he
 14839	stamped on gaitered feet over the gravel of the path. That's why.
 14840	
 14841	On his wise shoulders through the checkerwork of leaves the sun flung
 14842	spangles, dancing coins.
 14843	
 14844	
 14845	Ineluctable modality of the visible: at least that if no more, thought
 14846	through my eyes. Signatures of all things I am here to read, seaspawn
 14847	and seawrack, the nearing tide, that rusty boot. Snotgreen, bluesilver,
 14848	rust: coloured signs. Limits of the diaphane. But he adds: in bodies.
 14849	Then he was aware of them bodies before of them coloured. How? By
 14850	knocking his sconce against them, sure. Go easy. Bald he was and a
 14851	millionaire, _maestro di color che sanno_. Limit of the diaphane in. Why
 14852	in? Diaphane, adiaphane. If you can put your five fingers through it it
 14853	is a gate, if not a door. Shut your eyes and see.
 14854	
 14855	
 14856	Stephen closed his eyes to hear his boots crush crackling wrack and
 14857	shells. You are walking through it howsomever. I am, a stride at a time.
 14858	A very short space of time through very short times of space. Five, six:
 14859	the _nacheinander_. Exactly: and that is the ineluctable modality of the
 14860	audible. Open your eyes. No. Jesus! If I fell over a cliff that beetles
 14861	o'er his base, fell through the _nebeneinander_ ineluctably! I am
 14862	getting on nicely in the dark. My ash sword hangs at my side. Tap with
 14863	it: they do. My two feet in his boots are at the ends of his legs,
 14864	_nebeneinander_. Sounds solid: made by the mallet of _Los Demiurgos_.
 14865	Am I walking into eternity along Sandymount strand? Crush, crack, crick,
 14866	crick. Wild sea money. Dominie Deasy kens them a'. Won't you come to
 14867	Sandymount, Madeline the mare?
 14868	
 14869	
 14870	Rhythm begins, you see. I hear. Acatalectic tetrameter of iambs
 14871	marching. No, agallop: _deline the mare_.
 14872	
 14873	Open your eyes now. I will. One moment. Has all vanished since? If I
 14874	open and am for ever in the black adiaphane. _Basta_! I will see if I
 14875	can see.
 14876	
 14877	See now. There all the time without you: and ever shall be, world
 14878	without end.
 14879	
 14880	They came down the steps from Leahy's terrace prudently, _Frauenzimmer_:
 14881	and down the shelving shore flabbily, their splayed feet sinking in
 14882	the silted sand. Like me, like Algy, coming down to our mighty mother.
 14883	Number one swung lourdily her midwife's bag, the other's gamp poked in
 14884	the beach. From the liberties, out for the day. Mrs Florence MacCabe,
 14885	relict of the late Patk MacCabe, deeply lamented, of Bride Street. One
 14886	of her sisterhood lugged me squealing into life. Creation from nothing.
 14887	What has she in the bag? A misbirth with a trailing navelcord, hushed
 14888	in ruddy wool. The cords of all link back, strandentwining cable of
 14889	all flesh. That is why mystic monks. Will you be as gods? Gaze in your
 14890	omphalos. Hello! Kinch here. Put me on to Edenville. Aleph, alpha:
 14891	nought, nought, one.
 14892	
 14893	Spouse and helpmate of Adam Kadmon: Heva, naked Eve. She had no navel.
 14894	Gaze. Belly without blemish, bulging big, a buckler of taut vellum,
 14895	no, whiteheaped corn, orient and immortal, standing from everlasting to
 14896	everlasting. Womb of sin.
 14897	
 14898	Wombed in sin darkness I was too, made not begotten. By them, the man
 14899	with my voice and my eyes and a ghostwoman with ashes on her breath.
 14900	They clasped and sundered, did the coupler's will. From before the ages
 14901	He willed me and now may not will me away or ever. A _lex eterna_ stays
 14902	about Him. Is that then the divine substance wherein Father and Son are
 14903	consubstantial? Where is poor dear Arius to try conclusions? Warring
 14904	his life long upon the contransmagnificandjewbangtantiality. Illstarred
 14905	heresiarch' In a Greek watercloset he breathed his last: euthanasia.
 14906	With beaded mitre and with crozier, stalled upon his throne, widower of
 14907	a widowed see, with upstiffed omophorion, with clotted hinderparts.
 14908	
 14909	Airs romped round him, nipping and eager airs. They are coming, waves.
 14910	The whitemaned seahorses, champing, brightwindbridled, the steeds of
 14911	Mananaan.
 14912	
 14913	I mustn't forget his letter for the press. And after? The Ship, half
 14914	twelve. By the way go easy with that money like a good young imbecile.
 14915	
 14916	Yes, I must.
 14917	
 14918	His pace slackened. Here. Am I going to aunt Sara's or not? My
 14919	consubstantial father's voice. Did you see anything of your artist
 14920	brother Stephen lately? No? Sure he's not down in Strasburg terrace with
 14921	his aunt Sally? Couldn't he fly a bit higher than that, eh? And and and
 14922	and tell us, Stephen, how is uncle Si? O, weeping God, the things I
 14923	married into! De boys up in de hayloft. The drunken little costdrawer
 14924	and his brother, the cornet player. Highly respectable gondoliers! And
 14925	skeweyed Walter sirring his father, no less! Sir. Yes, sir. No, sir.
 14926	Jesus wept: and no wonder, by Christ!
 14927	
 14928	I pull the wheezy bell of their shuttered cottage: and wait. They take
 14929	me for a dun, peer out from a coign of vantage.
 14930	
 14931	--It's Stephen, sir.
 14932	
 14933	--Let him in. Let Stephen in.
 14934	
 14935	A bolt drawn back and Walter welcomes me.
 14936	
 14937	--We thought you were someone else.
 14938	
 14939	In his broad bed nuncle Richie, pillowed and blanketed, extends over the
 14940	hillock of his knees a sturdy forearm. Cleanchested. He has washed the
 14941	upper moiety.
 14942	
 14943	--Morrow, nephew.
 14944	
 14945	He lays aside the lapboard whereon he drafts his bills of costs for
 14946	the eyes of master Goff and master Shapland Tandy, filing consents and
 14947	common searches and a writ of _Duces Tecum_. A bogoak frame over his
 14948	bald head: Wilde's _Requiescat_. The drone of his misleading whistle
 14949	brings Walter back.
 14950	
 14951	--Yes, sir?
 14952	
 14953	--Malt for Richie and Stephen, tell mother. Where is she?
 14954	
 14955	--Bathing Crissie, sir.
 14956	
 14957	Papa's little bedpal. Lump of love.
 14958	
 14959	--No, uncle Richie...
 14960	
 14961	--Call me Richie. Damn your lithia water. It lowers. Whusky!
 14962	
 14963	--Uncle Richie, really...
 14964	
 14965	--Sit down or by the law Harry I'll knock you down.
 14966	
 14967	Walter squints vainly for a chair.
 14968	
 14969	--He has nothing to sit down on, sir.
 14970	
 14971	--He has nowhere to put it, you mug. Bring in our chippendale chair.
 14972	Would you like a bite of something? None of your damned lawdeedaw airs
 14973	here. The rich of a rasher fried with a herring? Sure? So much the
 14974	better. We have nothing in the house but backache pills.
 14975	
 14976	_All'erta_!
 14977	
 14978	He drones bars of Ferrando's _aria di sortita_. The grandest number,
 14979	Stephen, in the whole opera. Listen.
 14980	
 14981	His tuneful whistle sounds again, finely shaded, with rushes of the air,
 14982	his fists bigdrumming on his padded knees.
 14983	
 14984	This wind is sweeter.
 14985	
 14986	Houses of decay, mine, his and all. You told the Clongowes gentry you
 14987	had an uncle a judge and an uncle a general in the army. Come out of
 14988	them, Stephen. Beauty is not there. Nor in the stagnant bay of Marsh's
 14989	library where you read the fading prophecies of Joachim Abbas. For whom?
 14990	The hundredheaded rabble of the cathedral close. A hater of his kind
 14991	ran from them to the wood of madness, his mane foaming in the moon,
 14992	his eyeballs stars. Houyhnhnm, horsenostrilled. The oval equine
 14993	faces, Temple, Buck Mulligan, Foxy Campbell, Lanternjaws. Abbas
 14994	father,--furious dean, what offence laid fire to their brains? Paff!
 14995	_Descende, calve, ut ne amplius decalveris_. A garland of grey hair
 14996	on his comminated head see him me clambering down to the footpace
 14997	(_descende_!), clutching a monstrance, basiliskeyed. Get down, baldpoll!
 14998	A choir gives back menace and echo, assisting about the altar's horns,
 14999	the snorted Latin of jackpriests moving burly in their albs, tonsured
 15000	and oiled and gelded, fat with the fat of kidneys of wheat.
 15001	
 15002	And at the same instant perhaps a priest round the corner is elevating
 15003	it. Dringdring! And two streets off another locking it into a pyx.
 15004	Dringadring! And in a ladychapel another taking housel all to his own
 15005	cheek. Dringdring! Down, up, forward, back. Dan Occam thought of that,
 15006	invincible doctor. A misty English morning the imp hypostasis tickled
 15007	his brain. Bringing his host down and kneeling he heard twine with his
 15008	second bell the first bell in the transept (he is lifting his) and,
 15009	rising, heard (now I am lifting) their two bells (he is kneeling) twang
 15010	in diphthong.
 15011	
 15012	Cousin Stephen, you will never be a saint. Isle of saints. You were
 15013	awfully holy, weren't you? You prayed to the Blessed Virgin that you
 15014	might not have a red nose. You prayed to the devil in Serpentine avenue
 15015	that the fubsy widow in front might lift her clothes still more from the
 15016	wet street. _O si, certo_! Sell your soul for that, do, dyed rags pinned
 15017	round a squaw. More tell me, more still!! On the top of the Howth tram
 15018	alone crying to the rain: Naked women! _naked women_! What about that,
 15019	eh?
 15020	
 15021	What about what? What else were they invented for?
 15022	
 15023	Reading two pages apiece of seven books every night, eh? I was young.
 15024	You bowed to yourself in the mirror, stepping forward to applause
 15025	earnestly, striking face. Hurray for the Goddamned idiot! Hray! No-one
 15026	saw: tell no-one. Books you were going to write with letters for titles.
 15027	Have you read his F? O yes, but I prefer Q. Yes, but W is wonderful. O
 15028	yes, W. Remember your epiphanies written on green oval leaves, deeply
 15029	deep, copies to be sent if you died to all the great libraries of the
 15030	world, including Alexandria? Someone was to read them there after a few
 15031	thousand years, a mahamanvantara. Pico della Mirandola like. Ay, very
 15032	like a whale. When one reads these strange pages of one long gone one
 15033	feels that one is at one with one who once...
 15034	
 15035	The grainy sand had gone from under his feet. His boots trod again
 15036	a damp crackling mast, razorshells, squeaking pebbles, that on the
 15037	unnumbered pebbles beats, wood sieved by the shipworm, lost Armada.
 15038	Unwholesome sandflats waited to suck his treading soles, breathing
 15039	upward sewage breath, a pocket of seaweed smouldered in seafire under a
 15040	midden of man's ashes. He coasted them, walking warily. A porterbottle
 15041	stood up, stogged to its waist, in the cakey sand dough. A sentinel:
 15042	isle of dreadful thirst. Broken hoops on the shore; at the land a maze
 15043	of dark cunning nets; farther away chalkscrawled backdoors and on the
 15044	higher beach a dryingline with two crucified shirts. Ringsend: wigwams
 15045	of brown steersmen and master mariners. Human shells.
 15046	
 15047	He halted. I have passed the way to aunt Sara's. Am I not going there?
 15048	Seems not. No-one about. He turned northeast and crossed the firmer sand
 15049	towards the Pigeonhouse.
 15050	
 15051	_--Qui vous a mis dans cette fichue position?_
 15052	
 15053	_--c'est le pigeon, Joseph._
 15054	
 15055	Patrice, home on furlough, lapped warm milk with me in the bar MacMahon.
 15056	Son of the wild goose, Kevin Egan of Paris. My father's a bird, he
 15057	lapped the sweet _lait chaud_ with pink young tongue, plump bunny's
 15058	face. Lap, _lapin._ He hopes to win in the _gros lots_. About the nature
 15059	of women he read in Michelet. But he must send me _La Vie de Jesus_ by
 15060	M. Leo Taxil. Lent it to his friend.
 15061	
 15062	_--C'est tordant, vous savez. Moi, je suis socialiste. Je ne crois pas
 15063	en l'existence de Dieu. Faut pas le dire a mon p-re._
 15064	
 15065	_--Il croit?_
 15066	
 15067	_--Mon pere, oui._
 15068	
 15069	_Schluss_. He laps.
 15070	
 15071	My Latin quarter hat. God, we simply must dress the character. I want
 15072	puce gloves. You were a student, weren't you? Of what in the other
 15073	devil's name? Paysayenn. P. C. N., you know: _physiques, chimiques et
 15074	naturelles_. Aha. Eating your groatsworth of _mou en civet_, fleshpots
 15075	of Egypt, elbowed by belching cabmen. Just say in the most natural
 15076	tone: when I was in Paris; _boul' Mich'_, I used to. Yes, used to
 15077	carry punched tickets to prove an alibi if they arrested you for murder
 15078	somewhere. Justice. On the night of the seventeenth of February 1904 the
 15079	prisoner was seen by two witnesses. Other fellow did it: other me.
 15080	Hat, tie, overcoat, nose. _Lui, c'est moi_. You seem to have enjoyed
 15081	yourself.
 15082	
 15083	Proudly walking. Whom were you trying to walk like? Forget: a
 15084	dispossessed. With mother's money order, eight shillings, the banging
 15085	door of the post office slammed in your face by the usher. Hunger
 15086	toothache. _Encore deux minutes_. Look clock. Must get. _Ferme_. Hired
 15087	dog! Shoot him to bloody bits with a bang shotgun, bits man spattered
 15088	walls all brass buttons. Bits all khrrrrklak in place clack back. Not
 15089	hurt? O, that's all right. Shake hands. See what I meant, see? O, that's
 15090	all right. Shake a shake. O, that's all only all right.
 15091	
 15092	You were going to do wonders, what? Missionary to Europe after fiery
 15093	Columbanus. Fiacre and Scotus on their creepystools in heaven spilt from
 15094	their pintpots, loudlatinlaughing: _Euge! Euge_! Pretending to speak
 15095	broken English as you dragged your valise, porter threepence, across
 15096	the slimy pier at Newhaven. _Comment?_ Rich booty you brought back; _Le
 15097	Tutu_, five tattered numbers of _Pantalon Blanc et Culotte Rouge_; a
 15098	blue French telegram, curiosity to show:
 15099	
 15100	--Mother dying come home father.
 15101	
 15102	The aunt thinks you killed your mother. That's why she won't.
 15103	
 15104	     _Then here's a health to Mulligan's aunt
 15105	     And I'll tell you the reason why.
 15106	     She always kept things decent in
 15107	     The Hannigan famileye._
 15108	
 15109	
 15110	His feet marched in sudden proud rhythm over the sand furrows, along by
 15111	the boulders of the south wall. He stared at them proudly, piled stone
 15112	mammoth skulls. Gold light on sea, on sand, on boulders. The sun is
 15113	there, the slender trees, the lemon houses.
 15114	
 15115	Paris rawly waking, crude sunlight on her lemon streets. Moist pith of
 15116	farls of bread, the froggreen wormwood, her matin incense, court
 15117	the air. Belluomo rises from the bed of his wife's lover's wife, the
 15118	kerchiefed housewife is astir, a saucer of acetic acid in her hand. In
 15119	Rodot's Yvonne and Madeleine newmake their tumbled beauties, shattering
 15120	with gold teeth _chaussons_ of pastry, their mouths yellowed with the
 15121	_pus_ of _flan breton_. Faces of Paris men go by, their wellpleased
 15122	pleasers, curled conquistadores.
 15123	
 15124	Noon slumbers. Kevin Egan rolls gunpowder cigarettes through fingers
 15125	smeared with printer's ink, sipping his green fairy as Patrice his
 15126	white. About us gobblers fork spiced beans down their gullets. _Un demi
 15127	setier!_ A jet of coffee steam from the burnished caldron. She serves me
 15128	at his beck. _Il est irlandais. Hollandais? Non fromage. Deux irlandais,
 15129	nous, Irlande, vous savez ah, oui!_ She thought you wanted a cheese
 15130	_hollandais_. Your postprandial, do you know that word? Postprandial.
 15131	There was a fellow I knew once in Barcelona, queer fellow, used to call
 15132	it his postprandial. Well: _slainte_! Around the slabbed tables the
 15133	tangle of wined breaths and grumbling gorges. His breath hangs over our
 15134	saucestained plates, the green fairy's fang thrusting between his lips.
 15135	Of Ireland, the Dalcassians, of hopes, conspiracies, of Arthur Griffith
 15136	now, A E, pimander, good shepherd of men. To yoke me as his yokefellow,
 15137	our crimes our common cause. You're your father's son. I know the voice.
 15138	His fustian shirt, sanguineflowered, trembles its Spanish tassels at
 15139	his secrets. M. Drumont, famous journalist, Drumont, know what he called
 15140	queen Victoria? Old hag with the yellow teeth. _Vieille ogresse_
 15141	with the _dents jaunes_. Maud Gonne, beautiful woman, _La Patrie_, M.
 15142	Millevoye, Felix Faure, know how he died? Licentious men. The froeken,
 15143	_bonne a tout faire_, who rubs male nakedness in the bath at Upsala.
 15144	_Moi faire_, she said, _Tous les messieurs_. Not this _Monsieur_, I
 15145	said. Most licentious custom. Bath a most private thing. I wouldn't let
 15146	my brother, not even my own brother, most lascivious thing. Green eyes,
 15147	I see you. Fang, I feel. Lascivious people.
 15148	
 15149	The blue fuse burns deadly between hands and burns clear. Loose
 15150	tobaccoshreds catch fire: a flame and acrid smoke light our corner. Raw
 15151	facebones under his peep of day boy's hat. How the head centre got away,
 15152	authentic version. Got up as a young bride, man, veil, orangeblossoms,
 15153	drove out the road to Malahide. Did, faith. Of lost leaders, the
 15154	betrayed, wild escapes. Disguises, clutched at, gone, not here.
 15155	
 15156	Spurned lover. I was a strapping young gossoon at that time, I tell you.
 15157	I'll show you my likeness one day. I was, faith. Lover, for her love he
 15158	prowled with colonel Richard Burke, tanist of his sept, under the walls
 15159	of Clerkenwell and, crouching, saw a flame of vengeance hurl them upward
 15160	in the fog. Shattered glass and toppling masonry. In gay Paree he hides,
 15161	Egan of Paris, unsought by any save by me. Making his day's stations,
 15162	the dingy printingcase, his three taverns, the Montmartre lair he sleeps
 15163	short night in, rue de la Goutte-d'Or, damascened with flyblown faces of
 15164	the gone. Loveless, landless, wifeless. She is quite nicey comfy
 15165	without her outcast man, madame in rue Git-le-Coeur, canary and two
 15166	buck lodgers. Peachy cheeks, a zebra skirt, frisky as a young thing's.
 15167	Spurned and undespairing. Tell Pat you saw me, won't you? I wanted to
 15168	get poor Pat a job one time. _Mon fils_, soldier of France. I taught him
 15169	to sing _The boys of Kilkenny are stout roaring blades_. Know that old
 15170	lay? I taught Patrice that. Old Kilkenny: saint Canice, Strongbow's
 15171	castle on the Nore. Goes like this. O, O. He takes me, Napper Tandy, by
 15172	the hand.
 15173	
 15174	     _O, O THE BOYS OF
 15175	     KILKENNY..._
 15176	
 15177	
 15178	Weak wasting hand on mine. They have forgotten Kevin Egan, not he them.
 15179	Remembering thee, O Sion.
 15180	
 15181	He had come nearer the edge of the sea and wet sand slapped his boots.
 15182	The new air greeted him, harping in wild nerves, wind of wild air of
 15183	seeds of brightness. Here, I am not walking out to the Kish lightship,
 15184	am I? He stood suddenly, his feet beginning to sink slowly in the
 15185	quaking soil. Turn back.
 15186	
 15187	Turning, he scanned the shore south, his feet sinking again slowly
 15188	in new sockets. The cold domed room of the tower waits. Through the
 15189	barbacans the shafts of light are moving ever, slowly ever as my
 15190	feet are sinking, creeping duskward over the dial floor. Blue dusk,
 15191	nightfall, deep blue night. In the darkness of the dome they wait,
 15192	their pushedback chairs, my obelisk valise, around a board of abandoned
 15193	platters. Who to clear it? He has the key. I will not sleep there when
 15194	this night comes. A shut door of a silent tower, entombing their--blind
 15195	bodies, the panthersahib and his pointer. Call: no answer. He lifted his
 15196	feet up from the suck and turned back by the mole of boulders. Take
 15197	all, keep all. My soul walks with me, form of forms. So in the moon's
 15198	midwatches I pace the path above the rocks, in sable silvered, hearing
 15199	Elsinore's tempting flood.
 15200	
 15201	The flood is following me. I can watch it flow past from here. Get back
 15202	then by the Poolbeg road to the strand there. He climbed over the sedge
 15203	and eely oarweeds and sat on a stool of rock, resting his ashplant in a
 15204	grike.
 15205	
 15206	A bloated carcass of a dog lay lolled on bladderwrack. Before him the
 15207	gunwale of a boat, sunk in sand. _Un coche ensablÃ©_ Louis Veuillot
 15208	called Gautier's prose. These heavy sands are language tide and wind
 15209	have silted here. And these, the stoneheaps of dead builders, a warren
 15210	of weasel rats. Hide gold there. Try it. You have some. Sands and
 15211	stones. Heavy of the past. Sir Lout's toys. Mind you don't get one
 15212	bang on the ear. I'm the bloody well gigant rolls all them bloody well
 15213	boulders, bones for my steppingstones. Feefawfum. I zmellz de bloodz odz
 15214	an Iridzman.
 15215	
 15216	A point, live dog, grew into sight running across the sweep of sand.
 15217	Lord, is he going to attack me? Respect his liberty. You will not
 15218	be master of others or their slave. I have my stick. Sit tight. From
 15219	farther away, walking shoreward across from the crested tide, figures,
 15220	two. The two maries. They have tucked it safe mong the bulrushes.
 15221	Peekaboo. I see you. No, the dog. He is running back to them. Who?
 15222	
 15223	Galleys of the Lochlanns ran here to beach, in quest of prey, their
 15224	bloodbeaked prows riding low on a molten pewter surf. Dane vikings,
 15225	torcs of tomahawks aglitter on their breasts when Malachi wore the
 15226	collar of gold. A school of turlehide whales stranded in hot noon,
 15227	spouting, hobbling in the shallows. Then from the starving cagework city
 15228	a horde of jerkined dwarfs, my people, with flayers' knives, running,
 15229	scaling, hacking in green blubbery whalemeat. Famine, plague and
 15230	slaughters. Their blood is in me, their lusts my waves. I moved among
 15231	them on the frozen Liffey, that I, a changeling, among the spluttering
 15232	resin fires. I spoke to no-one: none to me.
 15233	
 15234	The dog's bark ran towards him, stopped, ran back. Dog of my enemy. I
 15235	just simply stood pale, silent, bayed about. _Terribilia meditans_. A
 15236	primrose doublet, fortune's knave, smiled on my fear. For that are you
 15237	pining, the bark of their applause? Pretenders: live their lives. The
 15238	Bruce's brother, Thomas Fitzgerald, silken knight, Perkin Warbeck,
 15239	York's false scion, in breeches of silk of whiterose ivory, wonder of
 15240	a day, and Lambert Simnel, with a tail of nans and sutlers, a scullion
 15241	crowned. All kings' sons. Paradise of pretenders then and now. He saved
 15242	men from drowning and you shake at a cur's yelping. But the courtiers
 15243	who mocked Guido in Or san Michele were in their own house. House of...
 15244	We don't want any of your medieval abstrusiosities. Would you do what he
 15245	did? A boat would be near, a lifebuoy. _NatÃ¼rlich_, put there for you.
 15246	Would you or would you not? The man that was drowned nine days ago off
 15247	Maiden's rock. They are waiting for him now. The truth, spit it out. I
 15248	would want to. I would try. I am not a strong swimmer. Water cold soft.
 15249	When I put my face into it in the basin at Clongowes. Can't see! Who's
 15250	behind me? Out quickly, quickly! Do you see the tide flowing quickly in
 15251	on all sides, sheeting the lows of sand quickly, shellcocoacoloured? If
 15252	I had land under my feet. I want his life still to be his, mine to be
 15253	mine. A drowning man. His human eyes scream to me out of horror of his
 15254	death. I... With him together down... I could not save her. Waters:
 15255	bitter death: lost.
 15256	
 15257	A woman and a man. I see her skirties. Pinned up, I bet.
 15258	
 15259	Their dog ambled about a bank of dwindling sand, trotting, sniffing on
 15260	all sides. Looking for something lost in a past life. Suddenly he made
 15261	off like a bounding hare, ears flung back, chasing the shadow of a
 15262	lowskimming gull. The man's shrieked whistle struck his limp ears. He
 15263	turned, bounded back, came nearer, trotted on twinkling shanks. On a
 15264	field tenney a buck, trippant, proper, unattired. At the lacefringe of
 15265	the tide he halted with stiff forehoofs, seawardpointed ears. His
 15266	snout lifted barked at the wavenoise, herds of seamorse. They serpented
 15267	towards his feet, curling, unfurling many crests, every ninth, breaking,
 15268	plashing, from far, from farther out, waves and waves.
 15269	
 15270	Cocklepickers. They waded a little way in the water and, stooping,
 15271	soused their bags and, lifting them again, waded out. The dog yelped
 15272	running to them, reared up and pawed them, dropping on all fours, again
 15273	reared up at them with mute bearish fawning. Unheeded he kept by them as
 15274	they came towards the drier sand, a rag of wolf's tongue redpanting from
 15275	his jaws. His speckled body ambled ahead of them and then loped off at a
 15276	calf's gallop. The carcass lay on his path. He stopped, sniffed, stalked
 15277	round it, brother, nosing closer, went round it, sniffling rapidly like
 15278	a dog all over the dead dog's bedraggled fell. Dogskull, dogsniff, eyes
 15279	on the ground, moves to one great goal. Ah, poor dogsbody! Here lies
 15280	poor dogsbody's body.
 15281	
 15282	--Tatters! Out of that, you mongrel!
 15283	
 15284	The cry brought him skulking back to his master and a blunt bootless
 15285	kick sent him unscathed across a spit of sand, crouched in flight. He
 15286	slunk back in a curve. Doesn't see me. Along by the edge of the mole he
 15287	lolloped, dawdled, smelt a rock and from under a cocked hindleg pissed
 15288	against it. He trotted forward and, lifting again his hindleg, pissed
 15289	quick short at an unsmelt rock. The simple pleasures of the poor. His
 15290	hindpaws then scattered the sand: then his forepaws dabbled and delved.
 15291	Something he buried there, his grandmother. He rooted in the sand,
 15292	dabbling, delving and stopped to listen to the air, scraped up the sand
 15293	again with a fury of his claws, soon ceasing, a pard, a panther, got in
 15294	spousebreach, vulturing the dead.
 15295	
 15296	After he woke me last night same dream or was it? Wait. Open hallway.
 15297	Street of harlots. Remember. Haroun al Raschid. I am almosting it. That
 15298	man led me, spoke. I was not afraid. The melon he had he held against my
 15299	face. Smiled: creamfruit smell. That was the rule, said. In. Come. Red
 15300	carpet spread. You will see who.
 15301	
 15302	Shouldering their bags they trudged, the red Egyptians. His blued feet
 15303	out of turnedup trousers slapped the clammy sand, a dull brick muffler
 15304	strangling his unshaven neck. With woman steps she followed: the
 15305	ruffian and his strolling mort. Spoils slung at her back. Loose sand and
 15306	shellgrit crusted her bare feet. About her windraw face hair trailed.
 15307	Behind her lord, his helpmate, bing awast to Romeville. When night hides
 15308	her body's flaws calling under her brown shawl from an archway
 15309	where dogs have mired. Her fancyman is treating two Royal Dublins in
 15310	O'Loughlin's of Blackpitts. Buss her, wap in rogues' rum lingo, for, O,
 15311	my dimber wapping dell! A shefiend's whiteness under her rancid rags.
 15312	Fumbally's lane that night: the tanyard smells.
 15313	
 15314	     _White thy fambles, red thy gan
 15315	     And thy quarrons dainty is.
 15316	     Couch a hogshead with me then.
 15317	     In the darkmans clip and kiss._
 15318	
 15319	
 15320	Morose delectation Aquinas tunbelly calls this, _frate porcospino_.
 15321	Unfallen Adam rode and not rutted. Call away let him: _thy quarrons
 15322	dainty is_. Language no whit worse than his. Monkwords, marybeads jabber
 15323	on their girdles: roguewords, tough nuggets patter in their pockets.
 15324	
 15325	Passing now.
 15326	
 15327	A side eye at my Hamlet hat. If I were suddenly naked here as I sit? I
 15328	am not. Across the sands of all the world, followed by the sun's flaming
 15329	sword, to the west, trekking to evening lands. She trudges, schlepps,
 15330	trains, drags, trascines her load. A tide westering, moondrawn, in
 15331	her wake. Tides, myriadislanded, within her, blood not mine, _oinopa
 15332	ponton_, a winedark sea. Behold the handmaid of the moon. In sleep
 15333	the wet sign calls her hour, bids her rise. Bridebed, childbed, bed of
 15334	death, ghostcandled. _Omnis caro ad te veniet_. He comes, pale vampire,
 15335	through storm his eyes, his bat sails bloodying the sea, mouth to her
 15336	mouth's kiss.
 15337	
 15338	Here. Put a pin in that chap, will you? My tablets. Mouth to her kiss.
 15339	
 15340	No. Must be two of em. Glue em well. Mouth to her mouth's kiss.
 15341	
 15342	His lips lipped and mouthed fleshless lips of air: mouth to her moomb.
 15343	Oomb, allwombing tomb. His mouth moulded issuing breath, unspeeched:
 15344	ooeeehah: roar of cataractic planets, globed, blazing, roaring
 15345	wayawayawayawayaway. Paper. The banknotes, blast them. Old Deasy's
 15346	letter. Here. Thanking you for the hospitality tear the blank end off.
 15347	Turning his back to the sun he bent over far to a table of rock and
 15348	scribbled words. That's twice I forgot to take slips from the library
 15349	counter.
 15350	
 15351	His shadow lay over the rocks as he bent, ending. Why not endless till
 15352	the farthest star? Darkly they are there behind this light, darkness
 15353	shining in the brightness, delta of Cassiopeia, worlds. Me sits there
 15354	with his augur's rod of ash, in borrowed sandals, by day beside a livid
 15355	sea, unbeheld, in violet night walking beneath a reign of uncouth stars.
 15356	I throw this ended shadow from me, manshape ineluctable, call it back.
 15357	Endless, would it be mine, form of my form? Who watches me here? Who
 15358	ever anywhere will read these written words? Signs on a white field.
 15359	Somewhere to someone in your flutiest voice. The good bishop of Cloyne
 15360	took the veil of the temple out of his shovel hat: veil of space with
 15361	coloured emblems hatched on its field. Hold hard. Coloured on a flat:
 15362	yes, that's right. Flat I see, then think distance, near, far, flat
 15363	I see, east, back. Ah, see now! Falls back suddenly, frozen in
 15364	stereoscope. Click does the trick. You find my words dark. Darkness is
 15365	in our souls do you not think? Flutier. Our souls, shamewounded by our
 15366	sins, cling to us yet more, a woman to her lover clinging, the more the
 15367	more.
 15368	
 15369	She trusts me, her hand gentle, the longlashed eyes. Now where the blue
 15370	hell am I bringing her beyond the veil? Into the ineluctable modality of
 15371	the ineluctable visuality. She, she, she. What she? The virgin at Hodges
 15372	Figgis' window on Monday looking in for one of the alphabet books you
 15373	were going to write. Keen glance you gave her. Wrist through the
 15374	braided jesse of her sunshade. She lives in Leeson park with a grief
 15375	and kickshaws, a lady of letters. Talk that to someone else, Stevie: a
 15376	pickmeup. Bet she wears those curse of God stays suspenders and
 15377	yellow stockings, darned with lumpy wool. Talk about apple dumplings,
 15378	_piuttosto_. Where are your wits?
 15379	
 15380	Touch me. Soft eyes. Soft soft soft hand. I am lonely here. O, touch me
 15381	soon, now. What is that word known to all men? I am quiet here alone.
 15382	Sad too. Touch, touch me.
 15383	
 15384	He lay back at full stretch over the sharp rocks, cramming the scribbled
 15385	note and pencil into a pock his hat. His hat down on his eyes. That is
 15386	Kevin Egan's movement I made, nodding for his nap, sabbath sleep. _Et
 15387	vidit Deus. Et erant valde bona_. Alo! _Bonjour_. Welcome as the flowers
 15388	in May. Under its leaf he watched through peacocktwittering lashes the
 15389	southing sun. I am caught in this burning scene. Pan's hour, the faunal
 15390	noon. Among gumheavy serpentplants, milkoozing fruits, where on the
 15391	tawny waters leaves lie wide. Pain is far.
 15392	
 15393	     _And no more turn aside and brood._
 15394	
 15395	His gaze brooded on his broadtoed boots, a buck's castoffs,
 15396	_nebeneinander_. He counted the creases of rucked leather wherein
 15397	another's foot had nested warm. The foot that beat the ground in
 15398	tripudium, foot I dislove. But you were delighted when Esther Osvalt's
 15399	shoe went on you: girl I knew in Paris. _Tiens, quel petit pied!_
 15400	Staunch friend, a brother soul: Wilde's love that dare not speak its
 15401	name. His arm: Cranly's arm. He now will leave me. And the blame? As I
 15402	am. As I am. All or not at all.
 15403	
 15404	In long lassoes from the Cock lake the water flowed full, covering
 15405	greengoldenly lagoons of sand, rising, flowing. My ashplant will float
 15406	away. I shall wait. No, they will pass on, passing, chafing against the
 15407	low rocks, swirling, passing. Better get this job over quick. Listen: a
 15408	fourworded wavespeech: seesoo, hrss, rsseeiss, ooos. Vehement breath of
 15409	waters amid seasnakes, rearing horses, rocks. In cups of rocks it slops:
 15410	flop, slop, slap: bounded in barrels. And, spent, its speech ceases. It
 15411	flows purling, widely flowing, floating foampool, flower unfurling.
 15412	
 15413	Under the upswelling tide he saw the writhing weeds lift languidly and
 15414	sway reluctant arms, hising up their petticoats, in whispering water
 15415	swaying and upturning coy silver fronds. Day by day: night by night:
 15416	lifted, flooded and let fall. Lord, they are weary; and, whispered to,
 15417	they sigh. Saint Ambrose heard it, sigh of leaves and waves, waiting,
 15418	awaiting the fullness of their times, _diebus ac noctibus iniurias
 15419	patiens ingemiscit_. To no end gathered; vainly then released,
 15420	forthflowing, wending back: loom of the moon. Weary too in sight of
 15421	lovers, lascivious men, a naked woman shining in her courts, she draws a
 15422	toil of waters.
 15423	
 15424	Five fathoms out there. Full fathom five thy father lies. At one, he
 15425	said. Found drowned. High water at Dublin bar. Driving before it a loose
 15426	drift of rubble, fanshoals of fishes, silly shells. A corpse rising
 15427	saltwhite from the undertow, bobbing a pace a pace a porpoise landward.
 15428	There he is. Hook it quick. Pull. Sunk though he be beneath the watery
 15429	floor. We have him. Easy now.
 15430	
 15431	Bag of corpsegas sopping in foul brine. A quiver of minnows, fat of a
 15432	spongy titbit, flash through the slits of his buttoned trouserfly.
 15433	God becomes man becomes fish becomes barnacle goose becomes featherbed
 15434	mountain. Dead breaths I living breathe, tread dead dust, devour a
 15435	urinous offal from all dead. Hauled stark over the gunwale he breathes
 15436	upward the stench of his green grave, his leprous nosehole snoring to
 15437	the sun.
 15438	
 15439	A seachange this, brown eyes saltblue. Seadeath, mildest of all deaths
 15440	known to man. Old Father Ocean. _Prix de paris_: beware of imitations.
 15441	Just you give it a fair trial. We enjoyed ourselves immensely.
 15442	
 15443	Come. I thirst. Clouding over. No black clouds anywhere, are there?
 15444	Thunderstorm. Allbright he falls, proud lightning of the intellect,
 15445	_Lucifer, dico, qui nescit occasum_. No. My cockle hat and staff and
 15446	hismy sandal shoon. Where? To evening lands. Evening will find itself.
 15447	
 15448	He took the hilt of his ashplant, lunging with it softly, dallying
 15449	still. Yes, evening will find itself in me, without me. All days make
 15450	their end. By the way next when is it Tuesday will be the longest
 15451	day. Of all the glad new year, mother, the rum tum tiddledy tum. Lawn
 15452	Tennyson, gentleman poet. _GiÃ _. For the old hag with the yellow teeth.
 15453	And Monsieur Drumont, gentleman journalist. _GiÃ _. My teeth are very
 15454	bad. Why, I wonder. Feel. That one is going too. Shells. Ought I go to a
 15455	dentist, I wonder, with that money? That one. This. Toothless Kinch, the
 15456	superman. Why is that, I wonder, or does it mean something perhaps?
 15457	
 15458	My handkerchief. He threw it. I remember. Did I not take it up?
 15459	
 15460	His hand groped vainly in his pockets. No, I didn't. Better buy one.
 15461	
 15462	He laid the dry snot picked from his nostril on a ledge of rock,
 15463	carefully. For the rest let look who will.
 15464	
 15465	Behind. Perhaps there is someone.
 15466	
 15467	He turned his face over a shoulder, rere regardant. Moving through the
 15468	air high spars of a threemaster, her sails brailed up on the crosstrees,
 15469	homing, upstream, silently moving, a silent ship. +
 15470	
 15471	
 15472	
 15473	
 15474	-- II --
 15475	
 15476	Mr Leopold Bloom ate with relish the inner organs of beasts and fowls.
 15477	He liked thick giblet soup, nutty gizzards, a stuffed roast heart,
 15478	liverslices fried with crustcrumbs, fried hencods' roes. Most of all
 15479	he liked grilled mutton kidneys which gave to his palate a fine tang of
 15480	faintly scented urine.
 15481	
 15482	Kidneys were in his mind as he moved about the kitchen softly, righting
 15483	her breakfast things on the humpy tray. Gelid light and air were in the
 15484	kitchen but out of doors gentle summer morning everywhere. Made him feel
 15485	a bit peckish.
 15486	
 15487	The coals were reddening.
 15488	
 15489	Another slice of bread and butter: three, four: right. She didn't like
 15490	her plate full. Right. He turned from the tray, lifted the kettle off
 15491	the hob and set it sideways on the fire. It sat there, dull and squat,
 15492	its spout stuck out. Cup of tea soon. Good. Mouth dry. The cat walked
 15493	stiffly round a leg of the table with tail on high.
 15494	
 15495	--Mkgnao!
 15496	
 15497	--O, there you are, Mr Bloom said, turning from the fire.
 15498	
 15499	The cat mewed in answer and stalked again stiffly round a leg of the
 15500	table, mewing. Just how she stalks over my writingtable. Prr. Scratch my
 15501	head. Prr.
 15502	
 15503	Mr Bloom watched curiously, kindly the lithe black form. Clean to see:
 15504	the gloss of her sleek hide, the white button under the butt of her
 15505	tail, the green flashing eyes. He bent down to her, his hands on his
 15506	knees.
 15507	
 15508	--Milk for the pussens, he said.
 15509	
 15510	--Mrkgnao! the cat cried.
 15511	
 15512	They call them stupid. They understand what we say better than we
 15513	understand them. She understands all she wants to. Vindictive too.
 15514	Cruel. Her nature. Curious mice never squeal. Seem to like it. Wonder
 15515	what I look like to her. Height of a tower? No, she can jump me.
 15516	
 15517	--Afraid of the chickens she is, he said mockingly. Afraid of the
 15518	chookchooks. I never saw such a stupid pussens as the pussens.
 15519	
 15520	Cruel. Her nature. Curious mice never squeal. Seem to like it.
 15521	
 15522	--Mrkrgnao! the cat said loudly.
 15523	
 15524	She blinked up out of her avid shameclosing eyes, mewing plaintively
 15525	and long, showing him her milkwhite teeth. He watched the dark eyeslits
 15526	narrowing with greed till her eyes were green stones. Then he went to
 15527	the dresser, took the jug Hanlon's milkman had just filled for him,
 15528	poured warmbubbled milk on a saucer and set it slowly on the floor.
 15529	
 15530	--Gurrhr! she cried, running to lap.
 15531	
 15532	He watched the bristles shining wirily in the weak light as she tipped
 15533	three times and licked lightly. Wonder is it true if you clip them they
 15534	can't mouse after. Why? They shine in the dark, perhaps, the tips. Or
 15535	kind of feelers in the dark, perhaps.
 15536	
 15537	He listened to her licking lap. Ham and eggs, no. No good eggs with this
 15538	drouth. Want pure fresh water. Thursday: not a good day either for a
 15539	mutton kidney at Buckley's. Fried with butter, a shake of pepper. Better
 15540	a pork kidney at Dlugacz's. While the kettle is boiling. She lapped
 15541	slower, then licking the saucer clean. Why are their tongues so rough?
 15542	To lap better, all porous holes. Nothing she can eat? He glanced round
 15543	him. No.
 15544	
 15545	On quietly creaky boots he went up the staircase to the hall, paused by
 15546	the bedroom door. She might like something tasty. Thin bread and butter
 15547	she likes in the morning. Still perhaps: once in a way.
 15548	
 15549	He said softly in the bare hall:
 15550	
 15551	--I'm going round the corner. Be back in a minute.
 15552	
 15553	And when he had heard his voice say it he added:
 15554	
 15555	--You don't want anything for breakfast?
 15556	
 15557	A sleepy soft grunt answered:
 15558	
 15559	--Mn.
 15560	
 15561	No. She didn't want anything. He heard then a warm heavy sigh, softer,
 15562	as she turned over and the loose brass quoits of the bedstead jingled.
 15563	Must get those settled really. Pity. All the way from Gibraltar.
 15564	Forgotten any little Spanish she knew. Wonder what her father gave for
 15565	it. Old style. Ah yes! of course. Bought it at the governor's auction.
 15566	Got a short knock. Hard as nails at a bargain, old Tweedy. Yes, sir. At
 15567	Plevna that was. I rose from the ranks, sir, and I'm proud of it.
 15568	Still he had brains enough to make that corner in stamps. Now that was
 15569	farseeing.
 15570	
 15571	His hand took his hat from the peg over his initialled heavy overcoat
 15572	and his lost property office secondhand waterproof. Stamps: stickyback
 15573	pictures. Daresay lots of officers are in the swim too. Course they do.
 15574	The sweated legend in the crown of his hat told him mutely: Plasto's
 15575	high grade ha. He peeped quickly inside the leather headband. White slip
 15576	of paper. Quite safe.
 15577	
 15578	On the doorstep he felt in his hip pocket for the latchkey. Not there.
 15579	In the trousers I left off. Must get it. Potato I have. Creaky wardrobe.
 15580	No use disturbing her. She turned over sleepily that time. He pulled
 15581	the halldoor to after him very quietly, more, till the footleaf dropped
 15582	gently over the threshold, a limp lid. Looked shut. All right till I
 15583	come back anyhow.
 15584	
 15585	He crossed to the bright side, avoiding the loose cellarflap of number
 15586	seventyfive. The sun was nearing the steeple of George's church. Be a
 15587	warm day I fancy. Specially in these black clothes feel it more. Black
 15588	conducts, reflects, (refracts is it?), the heat. But I couldn't go in
 15589	that light suit. Make a picnic of it. His eyelids sank quietly often as
 15590	he walked in happy warmth. Boland's breadvan delivering with trays our
 15591	daily but she prefers yesterday's loaves turnovers crisp crowns hot.
 15592	Makes you feel young. Somewhere in the east: early morning: set off at
 15593	dawn. Travel round in front of the sun, steal a day's march on him. Keep
 15594	it up for ever never grow a day older technically. Walk along a strand,
 15595	strange land, come to a city gate, sentry there, old ranker too, old
 15596	Tweedy's big moustaches, leaning on a long kind of a spear. Wander
 15597	through awned streets. Turbaned faces going by. Dark caves of carpet
 15598	shops, big man, Turko the terrible, seated crosslegged, smoking a coiled
 15599	pipe. Cries of sellers in the streets. Drink water scented with fennel,
 15600	sherbet. Dander along all day. Might meet a robber or two. Well,
 15601	meet him. Getting on to sundown. The shadows of the mosques among the
 15602	pillars: priest with a scroll rolled up. A shiver of the trees, signal,
 15603	the evening wind. I pass on. Fading gold sky. A mother watches me from
 15604	her doorway. She calls her children home in their dark language. High
 15605	wall: beyond strings twanged. Night sky, moon, violet, colour of Molly's
 15606	new garters. Strings. Listen. A girl playing one of those instruments
 15607	what do you call them: dulcimers. I pass.
 15608	
 15609	Probably not a bit like it really. Kind of stuff you read: in the track
 15610	of the sun. Sunburst on the titlepage. He smiled, pleasing himself. What
 15611	Arthur Griffith said about the headpiece over the _Freeman_ leader: a
 15612	homerule sun rising up in the northwest from the laneway behind the bank
 15613	of Ireland. He prolonged his pleased smile. Ikey touch that: homerule
 15614	sun rising up in the north-west.
 15615	
 15616	He approached Larry O'Rourke's. From the cellar grating floated up the
 15617	flabby gush of porter. Through the open doorway the bar squirted out
 15618	whiffs of ginger, teadust, biscuitmush. Good house, however: just the
 15619	end of the city traffic. For instance M'Auley's down there: n. g. as
 15620	position. Of course if they ran a tramline along the North Circular from
 15621	the cattlemarket to the quays value would go up like a shot.
 15622	
 15623	Baldhead over the blind. Cute old codger. No use canvassing him for an
 15624	ad. Still he knows his own business best. There he is, sure enough, my
 15625	bold Larry, leaning against the sugarbin in his shirtsleeves watching
 15626	the aproned curate swab up with mop and bucket. Simon Dedalus takes him
 15627	off to a tee with his eyes screwed up. Do you know what I'm going to
 15628	tell you? What's that, Mr O'Rourke? Do you know what? The Russians,
 15629	they'd only be an eight o'clock breakfast for the Japanese.
 15630	
 15631	Stop and say a word: about the funeral perhaps. Sad thing about poor
 15632	Dignam, Mr O'Rourke.
 15633	
 15634	Turning into Dorset street he said freshly in greeting through the
 15635	doorway:
 15636	
 15637	--Good day, Mr O'Rourke.
 15638	
 15639	--Good day to you.
 15640	
 15641	--Lovely weather, sir.
 15642	
 15643	--'Tis all that.
 15644	
 15645	Where do they get the money? Coming up redheaded curates from the county
 15646	Leitrim, rinsing empties and old man in the cellar. Then, lo and behold,
 15647	they blossom out as Adam Findlaters or Dan Tallons. Then thin of the
 15648	competition. General thirst. Good puzzle would be cross Dublin without
 15649	passing a pub. Save it they can't. Off the drunks perhaps. Put down
 15650	three and carry five. What is that, a bob here and there, dribs and
 15651	drabs. On the wholesale orders perhaps. Doing a double shuffle with the
 15652	town travellers. Square it you with the boss and we'll split the job,
 15653	see?
 15654	
 15655	How much would that tot to off the porter in the month? Say ten barrels
 15656	of stuff. Say he got ten per cent off. O more. Fifteen. He passed Saint
 15657	Joseph's National school. Brats' clamour. Windows open. Fresh air
 15658	helps memory. Or a lilt. Ahbeesee defeegee kelomen opeecue rustyouvee
 15659	doubleyou. Boys are they? Yes. Inishturk. Inishark. Inishboffin. At
 15660	their joggerfry. Mine. Slieve Bloom.
 15661	
 15662	He halted before Dlugacz's window, staring at the hanks of sausages,
 15663	polonies, black and white. Fifteen multiplied by. The figures whitened
 15664	in his mind, unsolved: displeased, he let them fade. The shiny links,
 15665	packed with forcemeat, fed his gaze and he breathed in tranquilly the
 15666	lukewarm breath of cooked spicy pigs' blood.
 15667	
 15668	A kidney oozed bloodgouts on the willowpatterned dish: the last. He
 15669	stood by the nextdoor girl at the counter. Would she buy it too, calling
 15670	the items from a slip in her hand? Chapped: washingsoda. And a pound and
 15671	a half of Denny's sausages. His eyes rested on her vigorous hips.
 15672	Woods his name is. Wonder what he does. Wife is oldish. New blood.
 15673	No followers allowed. Strong pair of arms. Whacking a carpet on the
 15674	clothesline. She does whack it, by George. The way her crooked skirt
 15675	swings at each whack.
 15676	
 15677	The ferreteyed porkbutcher folded the sausages he had snipped off with
 15678	blotchy fingers, sausagepink. Sound meat there: like a stallfed heifer.
 15679	
 15680	He took a page up from the pile of cut sheets: the model farm at
 15681	Kinnereth on the lakeshore of Tiberias. Can become ideal winter
 15682	sanatorium. Moses Montefiore. I thought he was. Farmhouse, wall round
 15683	it, blurred cattle cropping. He held the page from him: interesting:
 15684	read it nearer, the title, the blurred cropping cattle, the page
 15685	rustling. A young white heifer. Those mornings in the cattlemarket, the
 15686	beasts lowing in their pens, branded sheep, flop and fall of dung, the
 15687	breeders in hobnailed boots trudging through the litter, slapping a palm
 15688	on a ripemeated hindquarter, there's a prime one, unpeeled switches in
 15689	their hands. He held the page aslant patiently, bending his senses and
 15690	his will, his soft subject gaze at rest. The crooked skirt swinging,
 15691	whack by whack by whack.
 15692	
 15693	The porkbutcher snapped two sheets from the pile, wrapped up her prime
 15694	sausages and made a red grimace.
 15695	
 15696	--Now, my miss, he said.
 15697	
 15698	She tendered a coin, smiling boldly, holding her thick wrist out.
 15699	
 15700	--Thank you, my miss. And one shilling threepence change. For you,
 15701	please?
 15702	
 15703	Mr Bloom pointed quickly. To catch up and walk behind her if she went
 15704	slowly, behind her moving hams. Pleasant to see first thing in the
 15705	morning. Hurry up, damn it. Make hay while the sun shines. She stood
 15706	outside the shop in sunlight and sauntered lazily to the right. He
 15707	sighed down his nose: they never understand. Sodachapped hands. Crusted
 15708	toenails too. Brown scapulars in tatters, defending her both ways.
 15709	The sting of disregard glowed to weak pleasure within his breast. For
 15710	another: a constable off duty cuddling her in Eccles lane. They like
 15711	them sizeable. Prime sausage. O please, Mr Policeman, I'm lost in the
 15712	wood.
 15713	
 15714	--Threepence, please.
 15715	
 15716	His hand accepted the moist tender gland and slid it into a sidepocket.
 15717	Then it fetched up three coins from his trousers' pocket and laid them
 15718	on the rubber prickles. They lay, were read quickly and quickly slid,
 15719	disc by disc, into the till.
 15720	
 15721	--Thank you, sir. Another time.
 15722	
 15723	A speck of eager fire from foxeyes thanked him. He withdrew his gaze
 15724	after an instant. No: better not: another time.
 15725	
 15726	--Good morning, he said, moving away.
 15727	
 15728	--Good morning, sir.
 15729	
 15730	No sign. Gone. What matter?
 15731	
 15732	He walked back along Dorset street, reading gravely. Agendath Netaim:
 15733	planters' company. To purchase waste sandy tracts from Turkish
 15734	government and plant with eucalyptus trees. Excellent for shade, fuel
 15735	and construction. Orangegroves and immense melonfields north of Jaffa.
 15736	You pay eighty marks and they plant a dunam of land for you with olives,
 15737	oranges, almonds or citrons. Olives cheaper: oranges need artificial
 15738	irrigation. Every year you get a sending of the crop. Your name entered
 15739	for life as owner in the book of the union. Can pay ten down and the
 15740	balance in yearly instalments. Bleibtreustrasse 34, Berlin, W. 15.
 15741	
 15742	Nothing doing. Still an idea behind it.
 15743	
 15744	He looked at the cattle, blurred in silver heat. Silverpowdered
 15745	olivetrees. Quiet long days: pruning, ripening. Olives are packed in
 15746	jars, eh? I have a few left from Andrews. Molly spitting them out. Knows
 15747	the taste of them now. Oranges in tissue paper packed in crates. Citrons
 15748	too. Wonder is poor Citron still in Saint Kevin's parade. And Mastiansky
 15749	with the old cither. Pleasant evenings we had then. Molly in Citron's
 15750	basketchair. Nice to hold, cool waxen fruit, hold in the hand, lift it
 15751	to the nostrils and smell the perfume. Like that, heavy, sweet, wild
 15752	perfume. Always the same, year after year. They fetched high prices too,
 15753	Moisel told me. Arbutus place: Pleasants street: pleasant old times.
 15754	Must be without a flaw, he said. Coming all that way: Spain, Gibraltar,
 15755	Mediterranean, the Levant. Crates lined up on the quayside at Jaffa,
 15756	chap ticking them off in a book, navvies handling them barefoot in
 15757	soiled dungarees. There's whatdoyoucallhim out of. How do you? Doesn't
 15758	see. Chap you know just to salute bit of a bore. His back is like that
 15759	Norwegian captain's. Wonder if I'll meet him today. Watering cart. To
 15760	provoke the rain. On earth as it is in heaven.
 15761	
 15762	A cloud began to cover the sun slowly, wholly. Grey. Far.
 15763	
 15764	No, not like that. A barren land, bare waste. Vulcanic lake, the dead
 15765	sea: no fish, weedless, sunk deep in the earth. No wind could lift those
 15766	waves, grey metal, poisonous foggy waters. Brimstone they called it
 15767	raining down: the cities of the plain: Sodom, Gomorrah, Edom. All dead
 15768	names. A dead sea in a dead land, grey and old. Old now. It bore the
 15769	oldest, the first race. A bent hag crossed from Cassidy's, clutching a
 15770	naggin bottle by the neck. The oldest people. Wandered far away over
 15771	all the earth, captivity to captivity, multiplying, dying, being born
 15772	everywhere. It lay there now. Now it could bear no more. Dead: an old
 15773	woman's: the grey sunken cunt of the world.
 15774	
 15775	Desolation.
 15776	
 15777	Grey horror seared his flesh. Folding the page into his pocket he turned
 15778	into Eccles street, hurrying homeward. Cold oils slid along his veins,
 15779	chilling his blood: age crusting him with a salt cloak. Well, I am here
 15780	now. Yes, I am here now. Morning mouth bad images. Got up wrong side of
 15781	the bed. Must begin again those Sandow's exercises. On the hands down.
 15782	Blotchy brown brick houses. Number eighty still unlet. Why is that?
 15783	Valuation is only twenty-eight. Towers, Battersby, North, MacArthur:
 15784	parlour windows plastered with bills. Plasters on a sore eye. To smell
 15785	the gentle smoke of tea, fume of the pan, sizzling butter. Be near her
 15786	ample bedwarmed flesh. Yes, yes.
 15787	
 15788	Quick warm sunlight came running from Berkeley road, swiftly, in slim
 15789	sandals, along the brightening footpath. Runs, she runs to meet me, a
 15790	girl with gold hair on the wind.
 15791	
 15792	Two letters and a card lay on the hallfloor. He stooped and gathered
 15793	them. Mrs Marion Bloom. His quickened heart slowed at once. Bold hand.
 15794	Mrs Marion.
 15795	
 15796	--Poldy!
 15797	
 15798	Entering the bedroom he halfclosed his eyes and walked through warm
 15799	yellow twilight towards her tousled head.
 15800	
 15801	--Who are the letters for?
 15802	
 15803	He looked at them. Mullingar. Milly.
 15804	
 15805	--A letter for me from Milly, he said carefully, and a card to you. And
 15806	a letter for you.
 15807	
 15808	He laid her card and letter on the twill bedspread near the curve of her
 15809	knees.
 15810	
 15811	--Do you want the blind up?
 15812	
 15813	Letting the blind up by gentle tugs halfway his backward eye saw her
 15814	glance at the letter and tuck it under her pillow.
 15815	
 15816	--That do? he asked, turning.
 15817	
 15818	She was reading the card, propped on her elbow.
 15819	
 15820	--She got the things, she said.
 15821	
 15822	He waited till she had laid the card aside and curled herself back
 15823	slowly with a snug sigh.
 15824	
 15825	--Hurry up with that tea, she said. I'm parched.
 15826	
 15827	--The kettle is boiling, he said.
 15828	
 15829	But he delayed to clear the chair: her striped petticoat, tossed soiled
 15830	linen: and lifted all in an armful on to the foot of the bed.
 15831	
 15832	As he went down the kitchen stairs she called:
 15833	
 15834	--Poldy!
 15835	
 15836	--What?
 15837	
 15838	--Scald the teapot.
 15839	
 15840	On the boil sure enough: a plume of steam from the spout. He scalded and
 15841	rinsed out the teapot and put in four full spoons of tea, tilting the
 15842	kettle then to let the water flow in. Having set it to draw he took off
 15843	the kettle, crushed the pan flat on the live coals and watched the lump
 15844	of butter slide and melt. While he unwrapped the kidney the cat mewed
 15845	hungrily against him. Give her too much meat she won't mouse. Say they
 15846	won't eat pork. Kosher. Here. He let the bloodsmeared paper fall to
 15847	her and dropped the kidney amid the sizzling butter sauce. Pepper. He
 15848	sprinkled it through his fingers ringwise from the chipped eggcup.
 15849	
 15850	Then he slit open his letter, glancing down the page and over. Thanks:
 15851	new tam: Mr Coghlan: lough Owel picnic: young student: Blazes Boylan's
 15852	seaside girls.
 15853	
 15854	The tea was drawn. He filled his own moustachecup, sham crown
 15855	
 15856	Derby, smiling. Silly Milly's birthday gift. Only five she was then. No,
 15857	wait: four. I gave her the amberoid necklace she broke. Putting pieces
 15858	of folded brown paper in the letterbox for her. He smiled, pouring.
 15859	
 15860	     _O, Milly Bloom, you are my darling.
 15861	     You are my lookingglass from night to morning.
 15862	     I'd rather have you without a farthing
 15863	     Than Katey Keogh with her ass and garden._
 15864	
 15865	
 15866	Poor old professor Goodwin. Dreadful old case. Still he was a courteous
 15867	old chap. Oldfashioned way he used to bow Molly off the platform. And
 15868	the little mirror in his silk hat. The night Milly brought it into
 15869	the parlour. O, look what I found in professor Goodwin's hat! All we
 15870	laughed. Sex breaking out even then. Pert little piece she was.
 15871	
 15872	He prodded a fork into the kidney and slapped it over: then fitted the
 15873	teapot on the tray. Its hump bumped as he took it up. Everything on
 15874	it? Bread and butter, four, sugar, spoon, her cream. Yes. He carried it
 15875	upstairs, his thumb hooked in the teapot handle.
 15876	
 15877	Nudging the door open with his knee he carried the tray in and set it on
 15878	the chair by the bedhead.
 15879	
 15880	--What a time you were! she said.
 15881	
 15882	She set the brasses jingling as she raised herself briskly, an elbow on
 15883	the pillow. He looked calmly down on her bulk and between her large soft
 15884	bubs, sloping within her nightdress like a shegoat's udder. The warmth
 15885	of her couched body rose on the air, mingling with the fragrance of the
 15886	tea she poured.
 15887	
 15888	A strip of torn envelope peeped from under the dimpled pillow. In the
 15889	act of going he stayed to straighten the bedspread.
 15890	
 15891	--Who was the letter from? he asked.
 15892	
 15893	Bold hand. Marion.
 15894	
 15895	--O, Boylan, she said. He's bringing the programme.
 15896	
 15897	--What are you singing?
 15898	
 15899	--_La ci darem_ with J. C. Doyle, she said, and _Love's Old Sweet Song_.
 15900	
 15901	Her full lips, drinking, smiled. Rather stale smell that incense leaves
 15902	next day. Like foul flowerwater.
 15903	
 15904	--Would you like the window open a little?
 15905	
 15906	She doubled a slice of bread into her mouth, asking:
 15907	
 15908	--What time is the funeral?
 15909	
 15910	--Eleven, I think, he answered. I didn't see the paper.
 15911	
 15912	Following the pointing of her finger he took up a leg of her soiled
 15913	drawers from the bed. No? Then, a twisted grey garter looped round a
 15914	stocking: rumpled, shiny sole.
 15915	
 15916	--No: that book.
 15917	
 15918	Other stocking. Her petticoat.
 15919	
 15920	--It must have fell down, she said.
 15921	
 15922	He felt here and there. _Voglio e non vorrei_. Wonder if she pronounces
 15923	that right: _voglio_. Not in the bed. Must have slid down. He stooped
 15924	and lifted the valance. The book, fallen, sprawled against the bulge of
 15925	the orangekeyed chamberpot.
 15926	
 15927	--Show here, she said. I put a mark in it. There's a word I wanted to
 15928	ask you.
 15929	
 15930	She swallowed a draught of tea from her cup held by nothandle and,
 15931	having wiped her fingertips smartly on the blanket, began to search the
 15932	text with the hairpin till she reached the word.
 15933	
 15934	--Met him what? he asked.
 15935	
 15936	--Here, she said. What does that mean?
 15937	
 15938	He leaned downward and read near her polished thumbnail.
 15939	
 15940	--Metempsychosis?
 15941	
 15942	--Yes. Who's he when he's at home?
 15943	
 15944	--Metempsychosis, he said, frowning. It's Greek: from the Greek. That
 15945	means the transmigration of souls.
 15946	
 15947	--O, rocks! she said. Tell us in plain words.
 15948	
 15949	He smiled, glancing askance at her mocking eyes. The same young eyes.
 15950	The first night after the charades. Dolphin's Barn. He turned over
 15951	the smudged pages. _Ruby: the Pride of the Ring_. Hello. Illustration.
 15952	Fierce Italian with carriagewhip. Must be Ruby pride of the on the floor
 15953	naked. Sheet kindly lent. _The monster Maffei desisted and flung his
 15954	victim from him with an oath_. Cruelty behind it all. Doped animals.
 15955	Trapeze at Hengler's. Had to look the other way. Mob gaping. Break your
 15956	neck and we'll break our sides. Families of them. Bone them young so
 15957	they metamspychosis. That we live after death. Our souls. That a man's
 15958	soul after he dies. Dignam's soul...
 15959	
 15960	--Did you finish it? he asked.
 15961	
 15962	--Yes, she said. There's nothing smutty in it. Is she in love with the
 15963	first fellow all the time?
 15964	
 15965	--Never read it. Do you want another?
 15966	
 15967	--Yes. Get another of Paul de Kock's. Nice name he has.
 15968	
 15969	She poured more tea into her cup, watching it flow sideways.
 15970	
 15971	Must get that Capel street library book renewed or they'll write to
 15972	Kearney, my guarantor. Reincarnation: that's the word.
 15973	
 15974	--Some people believe, he said, that we go on living in another body
 15975	after death, that we lived before. They call it reincarnation. That
 15976	we all lived before on the earth thousands of years ago or some other
 15977	planet. They say we have forgotten it. Some say they remember their past
 15978	lives.
 15979	
 15980	The sluggish cream wound curdling spirals through her tea. Bette remind
 15981	her of the word: metempsychosis. An example would be better. An example?
 15982	
 15983	The _Bath of the Nymph_ over the bed. Given away with the Easter number
 15984	of _Photo Bits_: Splendid masterpiece in art colours. Tea before you
 15985	put milk in. Not unlike her with her hair down: slimmer. Three and six
 15986	I gave for the frame. She said it would look nice over the bed. Naked
 15987	nymphs: Greece: and for instance all the people that lived then.
 15988	
 15989	He turned the pages back.
 15990	
 15991	--Metempsychosis, he said, is what the ancient Greeks called it. They
 15992	used to believe you could be changed into an animal or a tree, for
 15993	instance. What they called nymphs, for example.
 15994	
 15995	Her spoon ceased to stir up the sugar. She gazed straight before her,
 15996	inhaling through her arched nostrils.
 15997	
 15998	--There's a smell of burn, she said. Did you leave anything on the fire?
 15999	
 16000	--The kidney! he cried suddenly.
 16001	
 16002	He fitted the book roughly into his inner pocket and, stubbing his toes
 16003	against the broken commode, hurried out towards the smell, stepping
 16004	hastily down the stairs with a flurried stork's legs. Pungent smoke shot
 16005	up in an angry jet from a side of the pan. By prodding a prong of the
 16006	fork under the kidney he detached it and turned it turtle on its back.
 16007	Only a little burnt. He tossed it off the pan on to a plate and let the
 16008	scanty brown gravy trickle over it.
 16009	
 16010	Cup of tea now. He sat down, cut and buttered a slice of the loaf.
 16011	He shore away the burnt flesh and flung it to the cat. Then he put a
 16012	forkful into his mouth, chewing with discernment the toothsome pliant
 16013	meat. Done to a turn. A mouthful of tea. Then he cut away dies of bread,
 16014	sopped one in the gravy and put it in his mouth. What was that about
 16015	some young student and a picnic? He creased out the letter at his side,
 16016	reading it slowly as he chewed, sopping another die of bread in the
 16017	gravy and raising it to his mouth.
 16018	
 16019	Dearest Papli
 16020	
 16021	Thanks ever so much for the lovely birthday present. It suits me
 16022	splendid. Everyone says I am quite the belle in my new tam. I got
 16023	mummy's Iovely box of creams and am writing. They are lovely. I am
 16024	getting on swimming in the photo business now. Mr Coghlan took one of me
 16025	and Mrs. Will send when developed. We did great biz yesterday. Fair day
 16026	and all the beef to the heels were in. We are going to lough Owel on
 16027	Monday with a few friends to make a scrap picnic. Give my love to
 16028	mummy and to yourself a big kiss and thanks. I hear them at the piano
 16029	downstairs. There is to be a concert in the Greville Arms on Saturday.
 16030	There is a young student comes here some evenings named Bannon his
 16031	cousins or something are big swells and he sings Boylan's (I was on the
 16032	pop of writing Blazes Boylan's) song about those seaside girls. Tell him
 16033	silly Milly sends my best respects. I must now close with fondest love
 16034	
 16035	Your fond daughter, MILLY.
 16036	
 16037	P. S. Excuse bad writing am in hurry. Byby. M.
 16038	
 16039	Fifteen yesterday. Curious, fifteenth of the month too. Her first
 16040	birthday away from home. Separation. Remember the summer morning she
 16041	was born, running to knock up Mrs Thornton in Denzille street. Jolly old
 16042	woman. Lot of babies she must have helped into the world. She knew from
 16043	the first poor little Rudy wouldn't live. Well, God is good, sir. She
 16044	knew at once. He would be eleven now if he had lived.
 16045	
 16046	His vacant face stared pityingly at the postscript. Excuse bad writing.
 16047	Hurry. Piano downstairs. Coming out of her shell. Row with her in the
 16048	XL Cafe about the bracelet. Wouldn't eat her cakes or speak or look.
 16049	Saucebox. He sopped other dies of bread in the gravy and ate piece after
 16050	piece of kidney. Twelve and six a week. Not much. Still, she might do
 16051	worse. Music hall stage. Young student. He drank a draught of cooler tea
 16052	to wash down his meal. Then he read the letter again: twice.
 16053	
 16054	O, well: she knows how to mind herself. But if not? No, nothing has
 16055	happened. Of course it might. Wait in any case till it does. A wild
 16056	piece of goods. Her slim legs running up the staircase. Destiny.
 16057	Ripening now.
 16058	
 16059	Vain: very.
 16060	
 16061	He smiled with troubled affection at the kitchen window. Day I caught
 16062	her in the street pinching her cheeks to make them red. Anemic a little.
 16063	Was given milk too long. On the ERIN'S KING that day round the Kish.
 16064	Damned old tub pitching about. Not a bit funky. Her pale blue scarf
 16065	loose in the wind with her hair. _All dimpled cheeks and curls, Your
 16066	head it simply swirls._
 16067	
 16068	
 16069	Seaside girls. Torn envelope. Hands stuck in his trousers' pockets,
 16070	jarvey off for the day, singing. Friend of the family. Swurls, he says.
 16071	Pier with lamps, summer evening, band,
 16072	
 16073	     _Those girls, those girls,
 16074	     Those lovely seaside girls._
 16075	
 16076	
 16077	Milly too. Young kisses: the first. Far away now past. Mrs Marion.
 16078	Reading, lying back now, counting the strands of her hair, smiling,
 16079	braiding.
 16080	
 16081	A soft qualm, regret, flowed down his backbone, increasing. Will happen,
 16082	yes. Prevent. Useless: can't move. Girl's sweet light lips. Will happen
 16083	too. He felt the flowing qualm spread over him. Useless to move now.
 16084	Lips kissed, kissing, kissed. Full gluey woman's lips.
 16085	
 16086	Better where she is down there: away. Occupy her. Wanted a dog to pass
 16087	the time. Might take a trip down there. August bank holiday, only two
 16088	and six return. Six weeks off, however. Might work a press pass. Or
 16089	through M'Coy.
 16090	
 16091	The cat, having cleaned all her fur, returned to the meatstained paper,
 16092	nosed at it and stalked to the door. She looked back at him, mewing.
 16093	Wants to go out. Wait before a door sometime it will open. Let her wait.
 16094	Has the fidgets. Electric. Thunder in the air. Was washing at her ear
 16095	with her back to the fire too.
 16096	
 16097	He felt heavy, full: then a gentle loosening of his bowels. He stood up,
 16098	undoing the waistband of his trousers. The cat mewed to him.
 16099	
 16100	--Miaow! he said in answer. Wait till I'm ready.
 16101	
 16102	Heaviness: hot day coming. Too much trouble to fag up the stairs to the
 16103	landing.
 16104	
 16105	A paper. He liked to read at stool. Hope no ape comes knocking just as
 16106	I'm.
 16107	
 16108	In the tabledrawer he found an old number of _Titbits_. He folded it
 16109	under his armpit, went to the door and opened it. The cat went up in
 16110	soft bounds. Ah, wanted to go upstairs, curl up in a ball on the bed.
 16111	
 16112	Listening, he heard her voice:
 16113	
 16114	--Come, come, pussy. Come.
 16115	
 16116	He went out through the backdoor into the garden: stood to listen
 16117	towards the next garden. No sound. Perhaps hanging clothes out to dry.
 16118	The maid was in the garden. Fine morning.
 16119	
 16120	He bent down to regard a lean file of spearmint growing by the wall.
 16121	Make a summerhouse here. Scarlet runners. Virginia creepers. Want to
 16122	manure the whole place over, scabby soil. A coat of liver of sulphur.
 16123	All soil like that without dung. Household slops. Loam, what is this
 16124	that is? The hens in the next garden: their droppings are very good top
 16125	dressing. Best of all though are the cattle, especially when they are
 16126	fed on those oilcakes. Mulch of dung. Best thing to clean ladies' kid
 16127	gloves. Dirty cleans. Ashes too. Reclaim the whole place. Grow peas in
 16128	that corner there. Lettuce. Always have fresh greens then. Still gardens
 16129	have their drawbacks. That bee or bluebottle here Whitmonday.
 16130	
 16131	He walked on. Where is my hat, by the way? Must have put it back on the
 16132	peg. Or hanging up on the floor. Funny I don't remember that. Hallstand
 16133	too full. Four umbrellas, her raincloak. Picking up the letters.
 16134	Drago's shopbell ringing. Queer I was just thinking that moment. Brown
 16135	brillantined hair over his collar. Just had a wash and brushup. Wonder
 16136	have I time for a bath this morning. Tara street. Chap in the paybox
 16137	there got away James Stephens, they say. O'Brien.
 16138	
 16139	Deep voice that fellow Dlugacz has. Agendath what is it? Now, my miss.
 16140	Enthusiast.
 16141	
 16142	He kicked open the crazy door of the jakes. Better be careful not to get
 16143	these trousers dirty for the funeral. He went in, bowing his head
 16144	under the low lintel. Leaving the door ajar, amid the stench of mouldy
 16145	limewash and stale cobwebs he undid his braces. Before sitting down he
 16146	peered through a chink up at the nextdoor windows. The king was in his
 16147	countinghouse. Nobody.
 16148	
 16149	Asquat on the cuckstool he folded out his paper, turning its pages over
 16150	on his bared knees. Something new and easy. No great hurry. Keep it a
 16151	bit. Our prize titbit: _Matcham's Masterstroke_. Written by Mr Philip
 16152	Beaufoy, Playgoers' Club, London. Payment at the rate of one guinea
 16153	a column has been made to the writer. Three and a half. Three pounds
 16154	three. Three pounds, thirteen and six.
 16155	
 16156	Quietly he read, restraining himself, the first column and, yielding but
 16157	resisting, began the second. Midway, his last resistance yielding, he
 16158	allowed his bowels to ease themselves quietly as he read, reading still
 16159	patiently that slight constipation of yesterday quite gone. Hope it's
 16160	not too big bring on piles again. No, just right. So. Ah! Costive. One
 16161	tabloid of cascara sagrada. Life might be so. It did not move or touch
 16162	him but it was something quick and neat. Print anything now. Silly
 16163	season. He read on, seated calm above his own rising smell. Neat
 16164	certainly. _Matcham often thinks of the masterstroke by which he won the
 16165	laughing witch who now_. Begins and ends morally. _Hand in hand_. Smart.
 16166	He glanced back through what he had read and, while feeling his water
 16167	flow quietly, he envied kindly Mr Beaufoy who had written it and
 16168	received payment of three pounds, thirteen and six.
 16169	
 16170	Might manage a sketch. By Mr and Mrs L. M. Bloom. Invent a story for
 16171	some proverb. Which? Time I used to try jotting down on my cuff what she
 16172	said dressing. Dislike dressing together. Nicked myself shaving. Biting
 16173	her nether lip, hooking the placket of her skirt. Timing her. 9.l5.
 16174	Did Roberts pay you yet? 9.20. What had Gretta Conroy on? 9.23. What
 16175	possessed me to buy this comb? 9.24. I'm swelled after that cabbage. A
 16176	speck of dust on the patent leather of her boot.
 16177	
 16178	Rubbing smartly in turn each welt against her stockinged calf. Morning
 16179	after the bazaar dance when May's band played Ponchielli's dance of the
 16180	hours. Explain that: morning hours, noon, then evening coming on, then
 16181	night hours. Washing her teeth. That was the first night. Her head
 16182	dancing. Her fansticks clicking. Is that Boylan well off? He has money.
 16183	Why? I noticed he had a good rich smell off his breath dancing. No use
 16184	humming then. Allude to it. Strange kind of music that last night. The
 16185	mirror was in shadow. She rubbed her handglass briskly on her woollen
 16186	vest against her full wagging bub. Peering into it. Lines in her eyes.
 16187	It wouldn't pan out somehow.
 16188	
 16189	Evening hours, girls in grey gauze. Night hours then: black with daggers
 16190	and eyemasks. Poetical idea: pink, then golden, then grey, then black.
 16191	Still, true to life also. Day: then the night.
 16192	
 16193	He tore away half the prize story sharply and wiped himself with it.
 16194	Then he girded up his trousers, braced and buttoned himself. He pulled
 16195	back the jerky shaky door of the jakes and came forth from the gloom
 16196	into the air.
 16197	
 16198	In the bright light, lightened and cooled in limb, he eyed carefully his
 16199	black trousers: the ends, the knees, the houghs of the knees. What time
 16200	is the funeral? Better find out in the paper.
 16201	
 16202	A creak and a dark whirr in the air high up. The bells of George's
 16203	church. They tolled the hour: loud dark iron.
 16204	
 16205	     _Heigho! Heigho!
 16206	     Heigho! Heigho!
 16207	     Heigho! Heigho!_
 16208	
 16209	
 16210	Quarter to. There again: the overtone following through the air, third.
 16211	
 16212	Poor Dignam!
 16213	
 16214	
 16215	By lorries along sir John Rogerson's quay Mr Bloom walked soberly, past
 16216	Windmill lane, Leask's the linseed crusher, the postal telegraph office.
 16217	Could have given that address too. And past the sailors' home. He turned
 16218	from the morning noises of the quayside and walked through Lime street.
 16219	By Brady's cottages a boy for the skins lolled, his bucket of offal
 16220	linked, smoking a chewed fagbutt. A smaller girl with scars of eczema
 16221	on her forehead eyed him, listlessly holding her battered caskhoop. Tell
 16222	him if he smokes he won't grow. O let him! His life isn't such a bed of
 16223	roses. Waiting outside pubs to bring da home. Come home to ma, da.
 16224	Slack hour: won't be many there. He crossed Townsend street, passed
 16225	the frowning face of Bethel. El, yes: house of: Aleph, Beth. And past
 16226	Nichols' the undertaker. At eleven it is. Time enough. Daresay Corny
 16227	Kelleher bagged the job for O'Neill's. Singing with his eyes shut.
 16228	Corny. Met her once in the park. In the dark. What a lark. Police tout.
 16229	Her name and address she then told with my tooraloom tooraloom tay.
 16230	O, surely he bagged it. Bury him cheap in a whatyoumaycall. With my
 16231	tooraloom, tooraloom, tooraloom, tooraloom.
 16232	
 16233	
 16234	In Westland row he halted before the window of the Belfast and Oriental
 16235	Tea Company and read the legends of leadpapered packets: choice blend,
 16236	finest quality, family tea. Rather warm. Tea. Must get some from Tom
 16237	Kernan. Couldn't ask him at a funeral, though. While his eyes still read
 16238	blandly he took off his hat quietly inhaling his hairoil and sent his
 16239	right hand with slow grace over his brow and hair. Very warm morning.
 16240	Under their dropped lids his eyes found the tiny bow of the leather
 16241	headband inside his high grade ha. Just there. His right hand came down
 16242	into the bowl of his hat. His fingers found quickly a card behind the
 16243	headband and transferred it to his waistcoat pocket.
 16244	
 16245	So warm. His right hand once more more slowly went over his brow and
 16246	hair. Then he put on his hat again, relieved: and read again: choice
 16247	blend, made of the finest Ceylon brands. The far east. Lovely spot it
 16248	must be: the garden of the world, big lazy leaves to float about on,
 16249	cactuses, flowery meads, snaky lianas they call them. Wonder is it like
 16250	that. Those Cinghalese lobbing about in the sun in _dolce far niente_,
