 30857	blown across. Yes, it is. Because those spice islands, Cinghalese this
 30858	morning, smell them leagues off. Tell you what it is. It's like a fine
 30859	fine veil or web they have all over the skin, fine like what do you
 30860	call it gossamer, and they're always spinning it out of them, fine as
 30861	anything, like rainbow colours without knowing it. Clings to everything
 30862	she takes off. Vamp of her stockings. Warm shoe. Stays. Drawers: little
 30863	kick, taking them off. Byby till next time. Also the cat likes to sniff
 30864	in her shift on the bed. Know her smell in a thousand. Bathwater too.
 30865	Reminds me of strawberries and cream. Wonder where it is really. There
 30866	or the armpits or under the neck. Because you get it out of all holes
 30867	and corners. Hyacinth perfume made of oil of ether or something.
 30868	Muskrat. Bag under their tails. One grain pour off odour for years. Dogs
 30869	at each other behind. Good evening. Evening. How do you sniff? Hm. Hm.
 30870	Very well, thank you. Animals go by that. Yes now, look at it that way.
 30871	We're the same. Some women, instance, warn you off when they have their
 30872	period. Come near. Then get a hogo you could hang your hat on. Like
 30873	what? Potted herrings gone stale or. Boof! Please keep off the grass.
 30874	
 30875	Perhaps they get a man smell off us. What though? Cigary gloves long
 30876	John had on his desk the other day. Breath? What you eat and drink gives
 30877	that. No. Mansmell, I mean. Must be connected with that because priests
 30878	that are supposed to be are different. Women buzz round it like flies
 30879	round treacle. Railed off the altar get on to it at any cost. The tree
 30880	of forbidden priest. O, father, will you? Let me be the first to. That
 30881	diffuses itself all through the body, permeates. Source of life. And
 30882	it's extremely curious the smell. Celery sauce. Let me.
 30883	
 30884	Mr Bloom inserted his nose. Hm. Into the. Hm. Opening of his waistcoat.
 30885	Almonds or. No. Lemons it is. Ah no, that's the soap.
 30886	
 30887	O by the by that lotion. I knew there was something on my mind. Never
 30888	went back and the soap not paid. Dislike carrying bottles like that hag
 30889	this morning. Hynes might have paid me that three shillings. I could
 30890	mention Meagher's just to remind him. Still if he works that paragraph.
 30891	Two and nine. Bad opinion of me he'll have. Call tomorrow. How much do
 30892	I owe you? Three and nine? Two and nine, sir. Ah. Might stop him giving
 30893	credit another time. Lose your customers that way. Pubs do. Fellows run
 30894	up a bill on the slate and then slinking around the back streets into
 30895	somewhere else.
 30896	
 30897	Here's this nobleman passed before. Blown in from the bay. Just went as
 30898	far as turn back. Always at home at dinnertime. Looks mangled out: had a
 30899	good tuck in. Enjoying nature now. Grace after meals. After supper walk
 30900	a mile. Sure he has a small bank balance somewhere, government sit. Walk
 30901	after him now make him awkward like those newsboys me today. Still you
 30902	learn something. See ourselves as others see us. So long as women don't
 30903	mock what matter? That's the way to find out. Ask yourself who is he
 30904	now. _The Mystery Man on the Beach_, prize titbit story by Mr Leopold
 30905	Bloom. Payment at the rate of one guinea per column. And that fellow
 30906	today at the graveside in the brown macintosh. Corns on his kismet
 30907	however. Healthy perhaps absorb all the. Whistle brings rain they say.
 30908	Must be some somewhere. Salt in the Ormond damp. The body feels the
 30909	atmosphere. Old Betty's joints are on the rack. Mother Shipton's
 30910	prophecy that is about ships around they fly in the twinkling. No. Signs
 30911	of rain it is. The royal reader. And distant hills seem coming nigh.
 30912	
 30913	Howth. Bailey light. Two, four, six, eight, nine. See. Has to change or
 30914	they might think it a house. Wreckers. Grace Darling. People afraid of
 30915	the dark. Also glowworms, cyclists: lightingup time. Jewels diamonds
 30916	flash better. Women. Light is a kind of reassuring. Not going to hurt
 30917	you. Better now of course than long ago. Country roads. Run you through
 30918	the small guts for nothing. Still two types there are you bob against.
 30919	Scowl or smile. Pardon! Not at all. Best time to spray plants too in
 30920	the shade after the sun. Some light still. Red rays are longest. Roygbiv
 30921	Vance taught us: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet. A
 30922	star I see. Venus? Can't tell yet. Two. When three it's night. Were
 30923	those nightclouds there all the time? Looks like a phantom ship. No.
 30924	Wait. Trees are they? An optical illusion. Mirage. Land of the setting
 30925	sun this. Homerule sun setting in the southeast. My native land,
 30926	goodnight.
 30927	
 30928	Dew falling. Bad for you, dear, to sit on that stone. Brings on white
 30929	fluxions. Never have little baby then less he was big strong fight his
 30930	way up through. Might get piles myself. Sticks too like a summer cold,
 30931	sore on the mouth. Cut with grass or paper worst. Friction of the
 30932	position. Like to be that rock she sat on. O sweet little, you don't
 30933	know how nice you looked. I begin to like them at that age. Green
 30934	apples. Grab at all that offer. Suppose it's the only time we cross
 30935	legs, seated. Also the library today: those girl graduates. Happy chairs
 30936	under them. But it's the evening influence. They feel all that. Open
 30937	like flowers, know their hours, sunflowers, Jerusalem artichokes, in
 30938	ballrooms, chandeliers, avenues under the lamps. Nightstock in Mat
 30939	Dillon's garden where I kissed her shoulder. Wish I had a full length
 30940	oilpainting of her then. June that was too I wooed. The year returns.
 30941	History repeats itself. Ye crags and peaks I'm with you once again.
 30942	Life, love, voyage round your own little world. And now? Sad about her
 30943	lame of course but must be on your guard not to feel too much pity. They
 30944	take advantage.
 30945	
 30946	All quiet on Howth now. The distant hills seem. Where we. The
 30947	rhododendrons. I am a fool perhaps. He gets the plums, and I the
 30948	plumstones. Where I come in. All that old hill has seen. Names change:
 30949	that's all. Lovers: yum yum.
 30950	
 30951	Tired I feel now. Will I get up? O wait. Drained all the manhood out of
 30952	me, little wretch. She kissed me. Never again. My youth. Only once it
 30953	comes. Or hers. Take the train there tomorrow. No. Returning not the
 30954	same. Like kids your second visit to a house. The new I want. Nothing
 30955	new under the sun. Care of P. O. Dolphin's Barn. Are you not happy in
 30956	your? Naughty darling. At Dolphin's barn charades in Luke Doyle's house.
 30957	Mat Dillon and his bevy of daughters: Tiny, Atty, Floey, Maimy, Louy,
 30958	Hetty. Molly too. Eightyseven that was. Year before we. And the old
 30959	major, partial to his drop of spirits. Curious she an only child, I an
 30960	only child. So it returns. Think you're escaping and run into yourself.
 30961	Longest way round is the shortest way home. And just when he and she.
 30962	Circus horse walking in a ring. Rip van Winkle we played. Rip: tear in
 30963	Henny Doyle's overcoat. Van: breadvan delivering. Winkle: cockles and
 30964	periwinkles. Then I did Rip van Winkle coming back. She leaned on the
 30965	sideboard watching. Moorish eyes. Twenty years asleep in Sleepy Hollow.
 30966	All changed. Forgotten. The young are old. His gun rusty from the dew.
 30967	
 30968	Ba. What is that flying about? Swallow? Bat probably. Thinks I'm a tree,
 30969	so blind. Have birds no smell? Metempsychosis. They believed you could
 30970	be changed into a tree from grief. Weeping willow. Ba. There he goes.
 30971	Funny little beggar. Wonder where he lives. Belfry up there. Very
 30972	likely. Hanging by his heels in the odour of sanctity. Bell scared him
 30973	out, I suppose. Mass seems to be over. Could hear them all at it. Pray
 30974	for us. And pray for us. And pray for us. Good idea the repetition. Same
 30975	thing with ads. Buy from us. And buy from us. Yes, there's the light in
 30976	the priest's house. Their frugal meal. Remember about the mistake in the
 30977	valuation when I was in Thom's. Twentyeight it is. Two houses they have.
 30978	Gabriel Conroy's brother is curate. Ba. Again. Wonder why they come out
 30979	at night like mice. They're a mixed breed. Birds are like hopping mice.
 30980	What frightens them, light or noise? Better sit still. All instinct
 30981	like the bird in drouth got water out of the end of a jar by throwing
 30982	in pebbles. Like a little man in a cloak he is with tiny hands. Weeny
 30983	bones. Almost see them shimmering, kind of a bluey white. Colours depend
 30984	on the light you see. Stare the sun for example like the eagle then look
 30985	at a shoe see a blotch blob yellowish. Wants to stamp his trademark on
 30986	everything. Instance, that cat this morning on the staircase. Colour of
 30987	brown turf. Say you never see them with three colours. Not true. That
 30988	half tabbywhite tortoiseshell in the _City Arms_ with the letter em on
 30989	her forehead. Body fifty different colours. Howth a while ago amethyst.
 30990	Glass flashing. That's how that wise man what's his name with the
 30991	burning glass. Then the heather goes on fire. It can't be tourists'
 30992	matches. What? Perhaps the sticks dry rub together in the wind and
 30993	light. Or broken bottles in the furze act as a burning glass in the sun.
 30994	Archimedes. I have it! My memory's not so bad.
 30995	
 30996	Ba. Who knows what they're always flying for. Insects? That bee last
 30997	week got into the room playing with his shadow on the ceiling. Might
 30998	be the one bit me, come back to see. Birds too. Never find out. Or what
 30999	they say. Like our small talk. And says she and says he. Nerve they have
 31000	to fly over the ocean and back. Lots must be killed in storms, telegraph
 31001	wires. Dreadful life sailors have too. Big brutes of oceangoing steamers
 31002	floundering along in the dark, lowing out like seacows. _Faugh a
 31003	Ballagh!_ Out of that, bloody curse to you! Others in vessels, bit of
 31004	a handkerchief sail, pitched about like snuff at a wake when the stormy
 31005	winds do blow. Married too. Sometimes away for years at the ends of the
 31006	earth somewhere. No ends really because it's round. Wife in every port
 31007	they say. She has a good job if she minds it till Johnny comes marching
 31008	home again. If ever he does. Smelling the tail end of ports. How can
 31009	they like the sea? Yet they do. The anchor's weighed. Off he sails with
 31010	a scapular or a medal on him for luck. Well. And the tephilim no what's
 31011	this they call it poor papa's father had on his door to touch. That
 31012	brought us out of the land of Egypt and into the house of bondage.
 31013	Something in all those superstitions because when you go out never know
 31014	what dangers. Hanging on to a plank or astride of a beam for grim life,
 31015	lifebelt round him, gulping salt water, and that's the last of his nibs
 31016	till the sharks catch hold of him. Do fish ever get seasick?
 31017	
 31018	Then you have a beautiful calm without a cloud, smooth sea, placid,
 31019	crew and cargo in smithereens, Davy Jones' locker, moon looking down so
 31020	peaceful. Not my fault, old cockalorum.
 31021	
 31022	A last lonely candle wandered up the sky from Mirus bazaar in search of
 31023	funds for Mercer's hospital and broke, drooping, and shed a cluster
 31024	of violet but one white stars. They floated, fell: they faded. The
 31025	shepherd's hour: the hour of folding: hour of tryst. From house to
 31026	house, giving his everwelcome double knock, went the nine o'clock
 31027	postman, the glowworm's lamp at his belt gleaming here and there through
 31028	the laurel hedges. And among the five young trees a hoisted lintstock
 31029	lit the lamp at Leahy's terrace. By screens of lighted windows, by equal
 31030	gardens a shrill voice went crying, wailing: _Evening Telegraph, stop
 31031	press edition! Result of the Gold Cup race!_ and from the door of
 31032	Dignam's house a boy ran out and called. Twittering the bat flew here,
 31033	flew there. Far out over the sands the coming surf crept, grey. Howth
 31034	settled for slumber, tired of long days, of yumyum rhododendrons (he was
 31035	old) and felt gladly the night breeze lift, ruffle his fell of ferns.
 31036	He lay but opened a red eye unsleeping, deep and slowly breathing,
 31037	slumberous but awake. And far on Kish bank the anchored lightship
 31038	twinkled, winked at Mr Bloom.
 31039	
 31040	Life those chaps out there must have, stuck in the same spot. Irish
 31041	Lights board. Penance for their sins. Coastguards too. Rocket and
 31042	breeches buoy and lifeboat. Day we went out for the pleasure cruise in
 31043	the Erin's King, throwing them the sack of old papers. Bears in the zoo.
 31044	Filthy trip. Drunkards out to shake up their livers. Puking overboard
 31045	to feed the herrings. Nausea. And the women, fear of God in their faces.
 31046	Milly, no sign of funk. Her blue scarf loose, laughing. Don't know what
 31047	death is at that age. And then their stomachs clean. But being lost they
 31048	fear. When we hid behind the tree at Crumlin. I didn't want to. Mamma!
 31049	Mamma! Babes in the wood. Frightening them with masks too. Throwing them
 31050	up in the air to catch them. I'll murder you. Is it only half fun? Or
 31051	children playing battle. Whole earnest. How can people aim guns at each
 31052	other. Sometimes they go off. Poor kids! Only troubles wildfire and
 31053	nettlerash. Calomel purge I got her for that. After getting better
 31054	asleep with Molly. Very same teeth she has. What do they love? Another
 31055	themselves? But the morning she chased her with the umbrella. Perhaps so
 31056	as not to hurt. I felt her pulse. Ticking. Little hand it was: now big.
 31057	Dearest Papli. All that the hand says when you touch. Loved to count
 31058	my waistcoat buttons. Her first stays I remember. Made me laugh to see.
 31059	Little paps to begin with. Left one is more sensitive, I think. Mine
 31060	too. Nearer the heart? Padding themselves out if fat is in fashion. Her
 31061	growing pains at night, calling, wakening me. Frightened she was when
 31062	her nature came on her first. Poor child! Strange moment for the mother
 31063	too. Brings back her girlhood. Gibraltar. Looking from Buena Vista.
 31064	O'Hara's tower. The seabirds screaming. Old Barbary ape that gobbled all
 31065	his family. Sundown, gunfire for the men to cross the lines. Looking
 31066	out over the sea she told me. Evening like this, but clear, no clouds.
 31067	I always thought I'd marry a lord or a rich gentleman coming with a
 31068	private yacht. _Buenas noches, seÃ±orita. El hombre ama la muchacha
 31069	hermosa_. Why me? Because you were so foreign from the others.
 31070	
 31071	Better not stick here all night like a limpet. This weather makes you
 31072	dull. Must be getting on for nine by the light. Go home. Too late for
 31073	_Leah, Lily of Killarney._ No. Might be still up. Call to the hospital
 31074	to see. Hope she's over. Long day I've had. Martha, the bath, funeral,
 31075	house of Keyes, museum with those goddesses, Dedalus' song. Then that
 31076	bawler in Barney Kiernan's. Got my own back there. Drunken ranters what
 31077	I said about his God made him wince. Mistake to hit back. Or? No.
 31078	Ought to go home and laugh at themselves. Always want to be swilling in
 31079	company. Afraid to be alone like a child of two. Suppose he hit me. Look
 31080	at it other way round. Not so bad then. Perhaps not to hurt he meant.
 31081	Three cheers for Israel. Three cheers for the sister-in-law he hawked
 31082	about, three fangs in her mouth. Same style of beauty. Particularly nice
 31083	old party for a cup of tea. The sister of the wife of the wild man of
 31084	Borneo has just come to town. Imagine that in the early morning at close
 31085	range. Everyone to his taste as Morris said when he kissed the cow. But
 31086	Dignam's put the boots on it. Houses of mourning so depressing because
 31087	you never know. Anyhow she wants the money. Must call to those Scottish
 31088	Widows as I promised. Strange name. Takes it for granted we're going to
 31089	pop off first. That widow on Monday was it outside Cramer's that
 31090	looked at me. Buried the poor husband but progressing favourably on
 31091	the premium. Her widow's mite. Well? What do you expect her to do? Must
 31092	wheedle her way along. Widower I hate to see. Looks so forlorn. Poor man
 31093	O'Connor wife and five children poisoned by mussels here. The sewage.
 31094	Hopeless. Some good matronly woman in a porkpie hat to mother him. Take
 31095	him in tow, platter face and a large apron. Ladies' grey flannelette
 31096	bloomers, three shillings a pair, astonishing bargain. Plain and loved,
 31097	loved for ever, they say. Ugly: no woman thinks she is. Love, lie and be
 31098	handsome for tomorrow we die. See him sometimes walking about trying to
 31099	find out who played the trick. U. p: up. Fate that is. He, not me. Also
 31100	a shop often noticed. Curse seems to dog it. Dreamt last night? Wait.
 31101	Something confused. She had red slippers on. Turkish. Wore the breeches.
 31102	Suppose she does? Would I like her in pyjamas? Damned hard to answer.
 31103	Nannetti's gone. Mailboat. Near Holyhead by now. Must nail that ad
 31104	of Keyes's. Work Hynes and Crawford. Petticoats for Molly. She has
 31105	something to put in them. What's that? Might be money.
 31106	
 31107	Mr Bloom stooped and turned over a piece of paper on the strand. He
 31108	brought it near his eyes and peered. Letter? No. Can't read. Better go.
 31109	Better. I'm tired to move. Page of an old copybook. All those holes and
 31110	pebbles. Who could count them? Never know what you find. Bottle with
 31111	story of a treasure in it, thrown from a wreck. Parcels post. Children
 31112	always want to throw things in the sea. Trust? Bread cast on the waters.
 31113	What's this? Bit of stick.
 31114	
 31115	O! Exhausted that female has me. Not so young now. Will she come here
 31116	tomorrow? Wait for her somewhere for ever. Must come back. Murderers do.
 31117	Will I?

 31120	message for her. Might remain. What?

 31135	Mr Bloom effaced the letters with his slow boot. Hopeless thing sand.
 31136	Nothing grows in it. All fades. No fear of big vessels coming up here.
 31137	Except Guinness's barges. Round the Kish in eighty days. Done half by
 31138	design.

 31140	He flung his wooden pen away. The stick fell in silted sand, stuck. Now
 31141	if you were trying to do that for a week on end you couldn't. Chance.
 31142	We'll never meet again. But it was lovely. Goodbye, dear. Thanks. Made
 31143	me feel so young.

 31149	again. No harm in him. Just a few.

 31189	Send us bright one, light one, Horhorn, quickening and wombfruit. Send
 31190	us bright one, light one, Horhorn, quickening and wombfruit. Send us
 31191	bright one, light one, Horhorn, quickening and wombfruit.
 31192	
 31193	Hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa! Hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa! Hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa!
 31194	
 31195	Universally that person's acumen is esteemed very little perceptive
 31196	concerning whatsoever matters are being held as most profitably by
 31197	mortals with sapience endowed to be studied who is ignorant of that
 31198	which the most in doctrine erudite and certainly by reason of that in
 31199	them high mind's ornament deserving of veneration constantly maintain
 31200	when by general consent they affirm that other circumstances being
 31201	equal by no exterior splendour is the prosperity of a nation more
 31202	efficaciously asserted than by the measure of how far forward may
 31203	have progressed the tribute of its solicitude for that proliferent
 31204	continuance which of evils the original if it be absent when fortunately
 31205	present constitutes the certain sign of omnipotent nature's incorrupted
 31206	benefaction. For who is there who anything of some significance has
 31207	apprehended but is conscious that that exterior splendour may be the
 31208	surface of a downwardtending lutulent reality or on the contrary anyone
 31209	so is there unilluminated as not to perceive that as no nature's boon
 31210	can contend against the bounty of increase so it behoves every most just
 31211	citizen to become the exhortator and admonisher of his semblables and
 31212	to tremble lest what had in the past been by the nation excellently
 31213	commenced might be in the future not with similar excellence
 31214	accomplished if an inverecund habit shall have gradually traduced
 31215	the honourable by ancestors transmitted customs to that thither of
 31216	profundity that that one was audacious excessively who would have the
 31217	hardihood to rise affirming that no more odious offence can for anyone
 31218	be than to oblivious neglect to consign that evangel simultaneously
 31219	command and promise which on all mortals with prophecy of abundance
 31220	or with diminution's menace that exalted of reiteratedly procreating
 31221	function ever irrevocably enjoined?
 31222	
 31223	It is not why therefore we shall wonder if, as the best historians
 31224	relate, among the Celts, who nothing that was not in its nature
 31225	admirable admired, the art of medicine shall have been highly honoured.
 31226	Not to speak of hostels, leperyards, sweating chambers, plaguegraves,
 31227	their greatest doctors, the O'Shiels, the O'Hickeys, the O'Lees,
 31228	have sedulously set down the divers methods by which the sick and the
 31229	relapsed found again health whether the malady had been the trembling
 31230	withering or loose boyconnell flux. Certainly in every public work which
 31231	in it anything of gravity contains preparation should be with importance
 31232	commensurate and therefore a plan was by them adopted (whether by having
 31233	preconsidered or as the maturation of experience it is difficult in
 31234	being said which the discrepant opinions of subsequent inquirers are not
 31235	up to the present congrued to render manifest) whereby maternity was so
 31236	far from all accident possibility removed that whatever care the patient
 31237	in that all hardest of woman hour chiefly required and not solely
 31238	for the copiously opulent but also for her who not being sufficiently
 31239	moneyed scarcely and often not even scarcely could subsist valiantly and
 31240	for an inconsiderable emolument was provided.
 31241	
 31242	To her nothing already then and thenceforward was anyway able to be
 31243	molestful for this chiefly felt all citizens except with proliferent
 31244	mothers prosperity at all not to can be and as they had received
 31245	eternity gods mortals generation to befit them her beholding, when the
 31246	case was so hoving itself, parturient in vehicle thereward carrying
 31247	desire immense among all one another was impelling on of her to be
 31248	received into that domicile. O thing of prudent nation not merely in
 31249	being seen but also even in being related worthy of being praised that
 31250	they her by anticipation went seeing mother, that she by them suddenly
 31251	to be about to be cherished had been begun she felt!
 31252	
 31253	Before born bliss babe had. Within womb won he worship. Whatever in that
 31254	one case done commodiously done was. A couch by midwives attended with
 31255	wholesome food reposeful, cleanest swaddles as though forthbringing were
 31256	now done and by wise foresight set: but to this no less of what drugs
 31257	there is need and surgical implements which are pertaining to her
 31258	case not omitting aspect of all very distracting spectacles in various
 31259	latitudes by our terrestrial orb offered together with images, divine
 31260	and human, the cogitation of which by sejunct females is to tumescence
 31261	conducive or eases issue in the high sunbright wellbuilt fair home of
 31262	mothers when, ostensibly far gone and reproductitive, it is come by her
 31263	thereto to lie in, her term up.
 31264	
 31265	Some man that wayfaring was stood by housedoor at night's oncoming. Of
 31266	Israel's folk was that man that on earth wandering far had fared. Stark
 31267	ruth of man his errand that him lone led till that house.
 31268	
 31269	Of that house A. Horne is lord. Seventy beds keeps he there teeming
 31270	mothers are wont that they lie for to thole and bring forth bairns hale
 31271	so God's angel to Mary quoth. Watchers tway there walk, white sisters
 31272	in ward sleepless. Smarts they still, sickness soothing: in twelve moons
 31273	thrice an hundred. Truest bedthanes they twain are, for Horne holding
 31274	wariest ward.
 31275	
 31276	In ward wary the watcher hearing come that man mildhearted eft rising
 31277	with swire ywimpled to him her gate wide undid. Lo, levin leaping
 31278	lightens in eyeblink Ireland's westward welkin. Full she drad that
 31279	God the Wreaker all mankind would fordo with water for his evil sins.
 31280	Christ's rood made she on breastbone and him drew that he would rathe
 31281	infare under her thatch. That man her will wotting worthful went in
 31282	Horne's house.
 31283	
 31284	Loth to irk in Horne's hall hat holding the seeker stood. On her stow he
 31285	ere was living with dear wife and lovesome daughter that then over land
 31286	and seafloor nine years had long outwandered. Once her in townhithe
 31287	meeting he to her bow had not doffed. Her to forgive now he craved with
 31288	good ground of her allowed that that of him swiftseen face, hers, so
 31289	young then had looked. Light swift her eyes kindled, bloom of blushes
 31290	his word winning.
 31291	
 31292	As her eyes then ongot his weeds swart therefor sorrow she feared. Glad
 31293	after she was that ere adread was. Her he asked if O'Hare Doctor tidings
 31294	sent from far coast and she with grameful sigh him answered that O'Hare
 31295	Doctor in heaven was. Sad was the man that word to hear that him so
 31296	heavied in bowels ruthful. All she there told him, ruing death for
 31297	friend so young, algate sore unwilling God's rightwiseness to withsay.
 31298	She said that he had a fair sweet death through God His goodness with
 31299	masspriest to be shriven, holy housel and sick men's oil to his limbs.
 31300	The man then right earnest asked the nun of which death the dead man was
 31301	died and the nun answered him and said that he was died in Mona Island
 31302	through bellycrab three year agone come Childermas and she prayed to God
 31303	the Allruthful to have his dear soul in his undeathliness. He heard her
 31304	sad words, in held hat sad staring. So stood they there both awhile in
 31305	wanhope sorrowing one with other.
 31306	
 31307	Therefore, everyman, look to that last end that is thy death and the
 31308	dust that gripeth on every man that is born of woman for as he came
 31309	naked forth from his mother's womb so naked shall he wend him at the
 31310	last for to go as he came.
 31311	
 31312	The man that was come in to the house then spoke to the nursingwoman and
 31313	he asked her how it fared with the woman that lay there in childbed.
 31314	The nursingwoman answered him and said that that woman was in throes
 31315	now full three days and that it would be a hard birth unneth to bear
 31316	but that now in a little it would be. She said thereto that she had
 31317	seen many births of women but never was none so hard as was that woman's
 31318	birth. Then she set it all forth to him for because she knew the man
 31319	that time was had lived nigh that house. The man hearkened to her words
 31320	for he felt with wonder women's woe in the travail that they have of
 31321	motherhood and he wondered to look on her face that was a fair face for
 31322	any man to see but yet was she left after long years a handmaid. Nine
 31323	twelve bloodflows chiding her childless.
 31324	
 31325	And whiles they spake the door of the castle was opened and there nighed
 31326	them a mickle noise as of many that sat there at meat. And there came
 31327	against the place as they stood a young learningknight yclept Dixon. And
 31328	the traveller Leopold was couth to him sithen it had happed that they
 31329	had had ado each with other in the house of misericord where this
 31330	learningknight lay by cause the traveller Leopold came there to be
 31331	healed for he was sore wounded in his breast by a spear wherewith a
 31332	horrible and dreadful dragon was smitten him for which he did do make
 31333	a salve of volatile salt and chrism as much as he might suffice. And he
 31334	said now that he should go in to that castle for to make merry with
 31335	them that were there. And the traveller Leopold said that he should go
 31336	otherwhither for he was a man of cautels and a subtile. Also the lady
 31337	was of his avis and repreved the learningknight though she trowed well
 31338	that the traveller had said thing that was false for his subtility. But
 31339	the learningknight would not hear say nay nor do her mandement ne have
 31340	him in aught contrarious to his list and he said how it was a marvellous
 31341	castle. And the traveller Leopold went into the castle for to rest him
 31342	for a space being sore of limb after many marches environing in divers
 31343	lands and sometime venery.
 31344	
 31345	And in the castle was set a board that was of the birchwood of Finlandy
 31346	and it was upheld by four dwarfmen of that country but they durst not
 31347	move more for enchantment. And on this board were frightful swords and
 31348	knives that are made in a great cavern by swinking demons out of white
 31349	flames that they fix then in the horns of buffalos and stags that there
 31350	abound marvellously. And there were vessels that are wrought by magic of
 31351	Mahound out of seasand and the air by a warlock with his breath that he
 31352	blases in to them like to bubbles. And full fair cheer and rich was on
 31353	the board that no wight could devise a fuller ne richer. And there was
 31354	a vat of silver that was moved by craft to open in the which lay strange
 31355	fishes withouten heads though misbelieving men nie that this be possible
 31356	thing without they see it natheless they are so. And these fishes lie
 31357	in an oily water brought there from Portugal land because of the fatness
 31358	that therein is like to the juices of the olivepress. And also it was
 31359	a marvel to see in that castle how by magic they make a compost out of
 31360	fecund wheatkidneys out of Chaldee that by aid of certain angry spirits
 31361	that they do in to it swells up wondrously like to a vast mountain. And
 31362	they teach the serpents there to entwine themselves up on long sticks
 31363	out of the ground and of the scales of these serpents they brew out a
 31364	brewage like to mead.
 31365	
 31366	And the learning knight let pour for childe Leopold a draught and halp
 31367	thereto the while all they that were there drank every each. And childe
 31368	Leopold did up his beaver for to pleasure him and took apertly somewhat
 31369	in amity for he never drank no manner of mead which he then put by and
 31370	anon full privily he voided the more part in his neighbour glass and
 31371	his neighbour nist not of this wile. And he sat down in that castle with
 31372	them for to rest him there awhile. Thanked be Almighty God.
 31373	
 31374	This meanwhile this good sister stood by the door and begged them at the
 31375	reverence of Jesu our alther liege Lord to leave their wassailing for
 31376	there was above one quick with child, a gentle dame, whose time hied
 31377	fast. Sir Leopold heard on the upfloor cry on high and he wondered what
 31378	cry that it was whether of child or woman and I marvel, said he, that it
 31379	be not come or now. Meseems it dureth overlong. And he was ware and saw
 31380	a franklin that hight Lenehan on that side the table that was older than
 31381	any of the tother and for that they both were knights virtuous in the
 31382	one emprise and eke by cause that he was elder he spoke to him full
 31383	gently. But, said he, or it be long too she will bring forth by God His
 31384	bounty and have joy of her childing for she hath waited marvellous long.
 31385	And the franklin that had drunken said, Expecting each moment to be her
 31386	next. Also he took the cup that stood tofore him for him needed never
 31387	none asking nor desiring of him to drink and, Now drink, said he, fully
 31388	delectably, and he quaffed as far as he might to their both's health for
 31389	he was a passing good man of his lustiness. And sir Leopold that was the
 31390	goodliest guest that ever sat in scholars' hall and that was the meekest
 31391	man and the kindest that ever laid husbandly hand under hen and that was
 31392	the very truest knight of the world one that ever did minion service
 31393	to lady gentle pledged him courtly in the cup. Woman's woe with wonder
 31394	pondering.
 31395	
 31396	Now let us speak of that fellowship that was there to the intent to be
 31397	drunken an they might. There was a sort of scholars along either side
 31398	the board, that is to wit, Dixon yclept junior of saint Mary Merciable's
 31399	with other his fellows Lynch and Madden, scholars of medicine, and the
 31400	franklin that hight Lenehan and one from Alba Longa, one Crotthers, and
 31401	young Stephen that had mien of a frere that was at head of the board
 31402	and Costello that men clepen Punch Costello all long of a mastery of
 31403	him erewhile gested (and of all them, reserved young Stephen, he was the
 31404	most drunken that demanded still of more mead) and beside the meek sir
 31405	Leopold. But on young Malachi they waited for that he promised to have
 31406	come and such as intended to no goodness said how he had broke his avow.
 31407	And sir Leopold sat with them for he bore fast friendship to sir Simon
 31408	and to this his son young Stephen and for that his languor becalmed him
 31409	there after longest wanderings insomuch as they feasted him for that
 31410	time in the honourablest manner. Ruth red him, love led on with will to
 31411	wander, loth to leave.
 31412	
 31413	For they were right witty scholars. And he heard their aresouns each gen
 31414	other as touching birth and righteousness, young Madden maintaining that
 31415	put such case it were hard the wife to die (for so it had fallen out a
 31416	matter of some year agone with a woman of Eblana in Horne's house that
 31417	now was trespassed out of this world and the self night next before her
 31418	death all leeches and pothecaries had taken counsel of her case). And
 31419	they said farther she should live because in the beginning, they said,
 31420	the woman should bring forth in pain and wherefore they that were of
 31421	this imagination affirmed how young Madden had said truth for he had
 31422	conscience to let her die. And not few and of these was young Lynch
 31423	were in doubt that the world was now right evil governed as it was never
 31424	other howbeit the mean people believed it otherwise but the law nor his
 31425	judges did provide no remedy. A redress God grant. This was scant said
 31426	but all cried with one acclaim nay, by our Virgin Mother, the wife
 31427	should live and the babe to die. In colour whereof they waxed hot
 31428	upon that head what with argument and what for their drinking but the
 31429	franklin Lenehan was prompt each when to pour them ale so that at the
 31430	least way mirth might not lack. Then young Madden showed all the whole
 31431	affair and said how that she was dead and how for holy religion sake by
 31432	rede of palmer and bedesman and for a vow he had made to Saint Ultan of
 31433	Arbraccan her goodman husband would not let her death whereby they were
 31434	all wondrous grieved. To whom young Stephen had these words following:
 31435	Murmur, sirs, is eke oft among lay folk. Both babe and parent now
 31436	glorify their Maker, the one in limbo gloom, the other in purgefire.
 31437	But, gramercy, what of those Godpossibled souls that we nightly
 31438	impossibilise, which is the sin against the Holy Ghost, Very God, Lord
 31439	and Giver of Life? For, sirs, he said, our lust is brief. We are means
 31440	to those small creatures within us and nature has other ends than we.
 31441	Then said Dixon junior to Punch Costello wist he what ends. But he had
 31442	overmuch drunken and the best word he could have of him was that he
 31443	would ever dishonest a woman whoso she were or wife or maid or leman if
 31444	it so fortuned him to be delivered of his spleen of lustihead. Whereat
 31445	Crotthers of Alba Longa sang young Malachi's praise of that beast the
 31446	unicorn how once in the millennium he cometh by his horn, the other all
 31447	this while, pricked forward with their jibes wherewith they did malice
 31448	him, witnessing all and several by saint Foutinus his engines that
 31449	he was able to do any manner of thing that lay in man to do. Thereat
 31450	laughed they all right jocundly only young Stephen and sir Leopold which
 31451	never durst laugh too open by reason of a strange humour which he would
 31452	not bewray and also for that he rued for her that bare whoso she might
 31453	be or wheresoever. Then spake young Stephen orgulous of mother Church
 31454	that would cast him out of her bosom, of law of canons, of Lilith,
 31455	patron of abortions, of bigness wrought by wind of seeds of brightness
 31456	or by potency of vampires mouth to mouth or, as Virgilius saith, by the
 31457	influence of the occident or by the reek of moonflower or an she lie
 31458	with a woman which her man has but lain with, _effectu secuto_, or
 31459	peradventure in her bath according to the opinions of Averroes and Moses
 31460	Maimonides. He said also how at the end of the second month a human soul
 31461	was infused and how in all our holy mother foldeth ever souls for God's
 31462	greater glory whereas that earthly mother which was but a dam to bear
 31463	beastly should die by canon for so saith he that holdeth the fisherman's
 31464	seal, even that blessed Peter on which rock was holy church for all ages
 31465	founded. All they bachelors then asked of sir Leopold would he in like
 31466	case so jeopard her person as risk life to save life. A wariness of
 31467	mind he would answer as fitted all and, laying hand to jaw, he said
 31468	dissembling, as his wont was, that as it was informed him, who had ever
 31469	loved the art of physic as might a layman, and agreeing also with his
 31470	experience of so seldomseen an accident it was good for that mother
 31471	Church belike at one blow had birth and death pence and in such sort
 31472	deliverly he scaped their questions. That is truth, pardy, said Dixon,
 31473	and, or I err, a pregnant word. Which hearing young Stephen was a
 31474	marvellous glad man and he averred that he who stealeth from the poor
 31475	lendeth to the Lord for he was of a wild manner when he was drunken and
 31476	that he was now in that taking it appeared eftsoons.
 31477	
 31478	But sir Leopold was passing grave maugre his word by cause he still had
 31479	pity of the terrorcausing shrieking of shrill women in their labour
 31480	and as he was minded of his good lady Marion that had borne him an only
 31481	manchild which on his eleventh day on live had died and no man of art
 31482	could save so dark is destiny. And she was wondrous stricken of heart
 31483	for that evil hap and for his burial did him on a fair corselet of
 31484	lamb's wool, the flower of the flock, lest he might perish utterly and
 31485	lie akeled (for it was then about the midst of the winter) and now Sir
 31486	Leopold that had of his body no manchild for an heir looked upon him his
 31487	friend's son and was shut up in sorrow for his forepassed happiness and
 31488	as sad as he was that him failed a son of such gentle courage (for all
 31489	accounted him of real parts) so grieved he also in no less measure
 31490	for young Stephen for that he lived riotously with those wastrels and
 31491	murdered his goods with whores.
 31492	
 31493	About that present time young Stephen filled all cups that stood empty
 31494	so as there remained but little mo if the prudenter had not shadowed
 31495	their approach from him that still plied it very busily who, praying for
 31496	the intentions of the sovereign pontiff, he gave them for a pledge the
 31497	vicar of Christ which also as he said is vicar of Bray. Now drink we,
 31498	quod he, of this mazer and quaff ye this mead which is not indeed parcel
 31499	of my body but my soul's bodiment. Leave ye fraction of bread to them
 31500	that live by bread alone. Be not afeard neither for any want for this
 31501	will comfort more than the other will dismay. See ye here. And he showed
 31502	them glistering coins of the tribute and goldsmith notes the worth of
 31503	two pound nineteen shilling that he had, he said, for a song which he
 31504	writ. They all admired to see the foresaid riches in such dearth of
 31505	money as was herebefore. His words were then these as followeth: Know
 31506	all men, he said, time's ruins build eternity's mansions. What means
 31507	this? Desire's wind blasts the thorntree but after it becomes from a
 31508	bramblebush to be a rose upon the rood of time. Mark me now. In woman's
 31509	womb word is made flesh but in the spirit of the maker all flesh
 31510	that passes becomes the word that shall not pass away. This is the
 31511	postcreation. _Omnis caro ad te veniet_. No question but her name is
 31512	puissant who aventried the dear corse of our Agenbuyer, Healer and Herd,
 31513	our mighty mother and mother most venerable and Bernardus saith aptly
 31514	that She hath an _omnipotentiam deiparae supplicem_, that is to wit, an
 31515	almightiness of petition because she is the second Eve and she won
 31516	us, saith Augustine too, whereas that other, our grandam, which we are
 31517	linked up with by successive anastomosis of navelcords sold us all,
 31518	seed, breed and generation, for a penny pippin. But here is the matter
 31519	now. Or she knew him, that second I say, and was but creature of her
 31520	creature, _vergine madre, figlia di tuo figlio_, or she knew him not and
 31521	then stands she in the one denial or ignorancy with Peter Piscator who
 31522	lives in the house that Jack built and with Joseph the joiner patron of
 31523	the happy demise of all unhappy marriages, _parceque M. LÃ©o Taxil nous
 31524	a dit que qui l'avait mise dans cette fichue position c'Ã©tait le
 31525	sacre pigeon, ventre de Dieu! Entweder_ transubstantiality ODER
 31526	consubstantiality but in no case subsubstantiality. And all cried out
 31527	upon it for a very scurvy word. A pregnancy without joy, he said, a
 31528	birth without pangs, a body without blemish, a belly without bigness.
 31529	Let the lewd with faith and fervour worship. With will will we
 31530	withstand, withsay.
 31531	
 31532	Hereupon Punch Costello dinged with his fist upon the board and would
 31533	sing a bawdy catch _Staboo Stabella_ about a wench that was put in pod
 31534	of a jolly swashbuckler in Almany which he did straightways now attack:
 31535	_The first three months she was not well, Staboo,_ when here nurse
 31536	Quigley from the door angerly bid them hist ye should shame you nor
 31537	was it not meet as she remembered them being her mind was to have all
 31538	orderly against lord Andrew came for because she was jealous that
 31539	no gasteful turmoil might shorten the honour of her guard. It was an
 31540	ancient and a sad matron of a sedate look and christian walking,
 31541	in habit dun beseeming her megrims and wrinkled visage, nor did her
 31542	hortative want of it effect for incontinently Punch Costello was of them
 31543	all embraided and they reclaimed the churl with civil rudeness some and
 31544	shaked him with menace of blandishments others whiles they all chode
 31545	with him, a murrain seize the dolt, what a devil he would be at, thou
 31546	chuff, thou puny, thou got in peasestraw, thou losel, thou chitterling,
 31547	thou spawn of a rebel, thou dykedropt, thou abortion thou, to shut up
 31548	his drunken drool out of that like a curse of God ape, the good sir
 31549	Leopold that had for his cognisance the flower of quiet, margerain
 31550	gentle, advising also the time's occasion as most sacred and most worthy
 31551	to be most sacred. In Horne's house rest should reign.
 31552	
 31553	To be short this passage was scarce by when Master Dixon of Mary in
 31554	Eccles, goodly grinning, asked young Stephen what was the reason why he
 31555	had not cided to take friar's vows and he answered him obedience in the
 31556	womb, chastity in the tomb but involuntary poverty all his days. Master
 31557	Lenehan at this made return that he had heard of those nefarious deeds
 31558	and how, as he heard hereof counted, he had besmirched the lily virtue
 31559	of a confiding female which was corruption of minors and they all
 31560	intershowed it too, waxing merry and toasting to his fathership. But he
 31561	said very entirely it was clean contrary to their suppose for he was
 31562	the eternal son and ever virgin. Thereat mirth grew in them the more and
 31563	they rehearsed to him his curious rite of wedlock for the disrobing and
 31564	deflowering of spouses, as the priests use in Madagascar island, she
 31565	to be in guise of white and saffron, her groom in white and grain, with
 31566	burning of nard and tapers, on a bridebed while clerks sung kyries and
 31567	the anthem _Ut novetur sexus omnis corporis mysterium_ till she was
 31568	there unmaided. He gave them then a much admirable hymen minim by those
 31569	delicate poets Master John Fletcher and Master Francis Beaumont that is
 31570	in their _Maid's Tragedy_ that was writ for a like twining of lovers:
 31571	_To bed, to bed_ was the burden of it to be played with accompanable
 31572	concent upon the virginals. An exquisite dulcet epithalame of most
 31573	mollificative suadency for juveniles amatory whom the odoriferous
 31574	flambeaus of the paranymphs have escorted to the quadrupedal proscenium
 31575	of connubial communion. Well met they were, said Master Dixon, joyed,
 31576	but, harkee, young sir, better were they named Beau Mount and Lecher
 31577	for, by my troth, of such a mingling much might come. Young Stephen said
 31578	indeed to his best remembrance they had but the one doxy between them
 31579	and she of the stews to make shift with in delights amorous for life ran
 31580	very high in those days and the custom of the country approved with it.
 31581	Greater love than this, he said, no man hath that a man lay down his
 31582	wife for his friend. Go thou and do likewise. Thus, or words to that
 31583	effect, saith Zarathustra, sometime regius professor of French letters
 31584	to the university of Oxtail nor breathed there ever that man to whom
 31585	mankind was more beholden. Bring a stranger within thy tower it will
 31586	go hard but thou wilt have the secondbest bed. _Orate, fratres, pro
 31587	memetipso_. And all the people shall say, Amen. Remember, Erin, thy
 31588	generations and thy days of old, how thou settedst little by me and by
 31589	my word and broughtedst in a stranger to my gates to commit fornication
 31590	in my sight and to wax fat and kick like Jeshurum. Therefore hast thou
 31591	sinned against my light and hast made me, thy lord, to be the slave of
 31592	servants. Return, return, Clan Milly: forget me not, O Milesian. Why
 31593	hast thou done this abomination before me that thou didst spurn me for
 31594	a merchant of jalaps and didst deny me to the Roman and to the Indian of
 31595	dark speech with whom thy daughters did lie luxuriously? Look forth now,
 31596	my people, upon the land of behest, even from Horeb and from Nebo and
 31597	from Pisgah and from the Horns of Hatten unto a land flowing with milk
 31598	and money. But thou hast suckled me with a bitter milk: my moon and my
 31599	sun thou hast quenched for ever. And thou hast left me alone for ever
 31600	in the dark ways of my bitterness: and with a kiss of ashes hast thou
 31601	kissed my mouth. This tenebrosity of the interior, he proceeded to say,
 31602	hath not been illumined by the wit of the septuagint nor so much as
 31603	mentioned for the Orient from on high Which brake hell's gates visited a
 31604	darkness that was foraneous. Assuefaction minorates atrocities (as Tully
 31605	saith of his darling Stoics) and Hamlet his father showeth the prince no
 31606	blister of combustion. The adiaphane in the noon of life is an Egypt's
 31607	plague which in the nights of prenativity and postmortemity is their
 31608	most proper _ubi_ and _quomodo_. And as the ends and ultimates of
 31609	all things accord in some mean and measure with their inceptions and
 31610	originals, that same multiplicit concordance which leads forth growth
 31611	from birth accomplishing by a retrogressive metamorphosis that minishing
 31612	and ablation towards the final which is agreeable unto nature so is it
 31613	with our subsolar being. The aged sisters draw us into life: we wail,
 31614	batten, sport, clip, clasp, sunder, dwindle, die: over us dead they
 31615	bend. First, saved from waters of old Nile, among bulrushes, a bed
 31616	of fasciated wattles: at last the cavity of a mountain, an occulted
 31617	sepulchre amid the conclamation of the hillcat and the ossifrage. And as
 31618	no man knows the ubicity of his tumulus nor to what processes we shall
 31619	thereby be ushered nor whether to Tophet or to Edenville in the like way
 31620	is all hidden when we would backward see from what region of remoteness
 31621	the whatness of our whoness hath fetched his whenceness.
 31622	
 31623	Thereto Punch Costello roared out mainly _Etienne chanson_ but he loudly
 31624	bid them, lo, wisdom hath built herself a house, this vast majestic
 31625	longstablished vault, the crystal palace of the Creator, all in applepie
 31626	order, a penny for him who finds the pea.
 31627	
 31628	     _Behold the mansion reared by dedal Jack
 31629	     See the malt stored in many a refluent sack,
 31630	     In the proud cirque of Jackjohn's bivouac._
 31631	
 31632	A black crack of noise in the street here, alack, bawled back. Loud on
 31633	left Thor thundered: in anger awful the hammerhurler. Came now the storm
 31634	that hist his heart. And Master Lynch bade him have a care to flout and
 31635	witwanton as the god self was angered for his hellprate and paganry. And
 31636	he that had erst challenged to be so doughty waxed wan as they might all
 31637	mark and shrank together and his pitch that was before so haught uplift
 31638	was now of a sudden quite plucked down and his heart shook within the
 31639	cage of his breast as he tasted the rumour of that storm. Then did some
 31640	mock and some jeer and Punch Costello fell hard again to his yale which
 31641	Master Lenehan vowed he would do after and he was indeed but a word and
 31642	a blow on any the least colour. But the braggart boaster cried that an
 31643	old Nobodaddy was in his cups it was muchwhat indifferent and he would
 31644	not lag behind his lead. But this was only to dye his desperation as
 31645	cowed he crouched in Horne's hall. He drank indeed at one draught to
 31646	pluck up a heart of any grace for it thundered long rumblingly over all
 31647	the heavens so that Master Madden, being godly certain whiles, knocked
 31648	him on his ribs upon that crack of doom and Master Bloom, at the
 31649	braggart's side, spoke to him calming words to slumber his great fear,
 31650	advertising how it was no other thing but a hubbub noise that he heard,
 31651	the discharge of fluid from the thunderhead, look you, having taken
 31652	place, and all of the order of a natural phenomenon.
 31653	
 31654	But was young Boasthard's fear vanquished by Calmer's words? No, for he
 31655	had in his bosom a spike named Bitterness which could not by words be
 31656	done away. And was he then neither calm like the one nor godly like the
 31657	other? He was neither as much as he would have liked to be either. But
 31658	could he not have endeavoured to have found again as in his youth the
 31659	bottle Holiness that then he lived withal? Indeed no for Grace was not
 31660	there to find that bottle. Heard he then in that clap the voice of the
 31661	god Bringforth or, what Calmer said, a hubbub of Phenomenon? Heard?
 31662	Why, he could not but hear unless he had plugged him up the tube
 31663	Understanding (which he had not done). For through that tube he saw that
 31664	he was in the land of Phenomenon where he must for a certain one day die
 31665	as he was like the rest too a passing show. And would he not accept to
 31666	die like the rest and pass away? By no means would he though he must nor
 31667	would he make more shows according as men do with wives which Phenomenon
 31668	has commanded them to do by the book Law. Then wotted he nought of that
 31669	other land which is called Believe-on-Me, that is the land of promise
 31670	which behoves to the king Delightful and shall be for ever where there
 31671	is no death and no birth neither wiving nor mothering at which all shall
 31672	come as many as believe on it? Yes, Pious had told him of that land and
 31673	Chaste had pointed him to the way but the reason was that in the way he
 31674	fell in with a certain whore of an eyepleasing exterior whose name, she
 31675	said, is Bird-in-the-Hand and she beguiled him wrongways from the true
 31676	path by her flatteries that she said to him as, Ho, you pretty man, turn
 31677	aside hither and I will show you a brave place, and she lay at him so
 31678	flatteringly that she had him in her grot which is named Two-in-the-Bush
 31679	or, by some learned, Carnal Concupiscence.
 31680	
 31681	This was it what all that company that sat there at commons in Manse
 31682	of Mothers the most lusted after and if they met with this whore
 31683	Bird-in-the-Hand (which was within all foul plagues, monsters and a
 31684	wicked devil) they would strain the last but they would make at her and
 31685	know her. For regarding Believe-on-Me they said it was nought else
 31686	but notion and they could conceive no thought of it for, first,
 31687	Two-in-the-Bush whither she ticed them was the very goodliest grot and
 31688	in it were four pillows on which were four tickets with these words
 31689	printed on them, Pickaback and Topsyturvy and Shameface and Cheek by
 31690	Jowl and, second, for that foul plague Allpox and the monsters they
 31691	cared not for them for Preservative had given them a stout shield of
 31692	oxengut and, third, that they might take no hurt neither from Offspring
 31693	that was that wicked devil by virtue of this same shield which was
 31694	named Killchild. So were they all in their blind fancy, Mr Cavil and Mr
 31695	Sometimes Godly, Mr Ape Swillale, Mr False Franklin, Mr Dainty Dixon,
 31696	Young Boasthard and Mr Cautious Calmer. Wherein, O wretched company,
 31697	were ye all deceived for that was the voice of the god that was in a
 31698	very grievous rage that he would presently lift his arm up and
 31699	spill their souls for their abuses and their spillings done by them
 31700	contrariwise to his word which forth to bring brenningly biddeth.
 31701	
 31702	So Thursday sixteenth June Patk. Dignam laid in clay of an apoplexy and
 31703	after hard drought, please God, rained, a bargeman coming in by water a
 31704	fifty mile or thereabout with turf saying the seed won't sprout, fields
 31705	athirst, very sadcoloured and stunk mightily, the quags and tofts too.
 31706	Hard to breathe and all the young quicks clean consumed without sprinkle
 31707	this long while back as no man remembered to be without. The rosy buds
 31708	all gone brown and spread out blobs and on the hills nought but dry flag
 31709	and faggots that would catch at first fire. All the world saying, for
 31710	aught they knew, the big wind of last February a year that did havoc the
 31711	land so pitifully a small thing beside this barrenness. But by and
 31712	by, as said, this evening after sundown, the wind sitting in the
 31713	west, biggish swollen clouds to be seen as the night increased and the
 31714	weatherwise poring up at them and some sheet lightnings at first and
 31715	after, past ten of the clock, one great stroke with a long thunder and
 31716	in a brace of shakes all scamper pellmell within door for the smoking
 31717	shower, the men making shelter for their straws with a clout or
 31718	kerchief, womenfolk skipping off with kirtles catched up soon as the
 31719	pour came. In Ely place, Baggot street, Duke's lawn, thence through
 31720	Merrion green up to Holles street a swash of water flowing that was
 31721	before bonedry and not one chair or coach or fiacre seen about but
 31722	no more crack after that first. Over against the Rt. Hon. Mr Justice
 31723	Fitzgibbon's door (that is to sit with Mr Healy the lawyer upon the
 31724	college lands) Mal. Mulligan a gentleman's gentleman that had but come
 31725	from Mr Moore's the writer's (that was a papish but is now, folk say,
 31726	a good Williamite) chanced against Alec. Bannon in a cut bob (which are
 31727	now in with dance cloaks of Kendal green) that was new got to town from
 31728	Mullingar with the stage where his coz and Mal M's brother will stay a
 31729	month yet till Saint Swithin and asks what in the earth he does there,
 31730	he bound home and he to Andrew Horne's being stayed for to crush a cup
 31731	of wine, so he said, but would tell him of a skittish heifer, big of
 31732	her age and beef to the heel, and all this while poured with rain and
 31733	so both together on to Horne's. There Leop. Bloom of Crawford's journal
 31734	sitting snug with a covey of wags, likely brangling fellows, Dixon jun.,
 31735	scholar of my lady of Mercy's, Vin. Lynch, a Scots fellow, Will. Madden,
 31736	T. Lenehan, very sad about a racer he fancied and Stephen D. Leop. Bloom
 31737	there for a languor he had but was now better, be having dreamed tonight
 31738	a strange fancy of his dame Mrs Moll with red slippers on in a pair of
 31739	Turkey trunks which is thought by those in ken to be for a change and
 31740	Mistress Purefoy there, that got in through pleading her belly, and now
 31741	on the stools, poor body, two days past her term, the midwives sore put
 31742	to it and can't deliver, she queasy for a bowl of riceslop that is a
 31743	shrewd drier up of the insides and her breath very heavy more than good
 31744	and should be a bullyboy from the knocks, they say, but God give her
 31745	soon issue. 'Tis her ninth chick to live, I hear, and Lady day bit off
 31746	her last chick's nails that was then a twelvemonth and with other three
 31747	all breastfed that died written out in a fair hand in the king's bible.
 31748	Her hub fifty odd and a methodist but takes the sacrament and is to
 31749	be seen any fair sabbath with a pair of his boys off Bullock harbour
 31750	dapping on the sound with a heavybraked reel or in a punt he has
 31751	trailing for flounder and pollock and catches a fine bag, I hear. In sum
 31752	an infinite great fall of rain and all refreshed and will much increase
 31753	the harvest yet those in ken say after wind and water fire shall come
 31754	for a prognostication of Malachi's almanac (and I hear that Mr Russell
 31755	has done a prophetical charm of the same gist out of the Hindustanish
 31756	for his farmer's gazette) to have three things in all but this a mere
 31757	fetch without bottom of reason for old crones and bairns yet sometimes
 31758	they are found in the right guess with their queerities no telling how.
 31759	
 31760	With this came up Lenehan to the feet of the table to say how the letter
 31761	was in that night's gazette and he made a show to find it about him
 31762	(for he swore with an oath that he had been at pains about it) but on
 31763	Stephen's persuasion he gave over the search and was bidden to sit near
 31764	by which he did mighty brisk. He was a kind of sport gentleman that
 31765	went for a merryandrew or honest pickle and what belonged of women,
 31766	horseflesh or hot scandal he had it pat. To tell the truth he was mean
 31767	in fortunes and for the most part hankered about the coffeehouses
 31768	and low taverns with crimps, ostlers, bookies, Paul's men, runners,
 31769	flatcaps, waistcoateers, ladies of the bagnio and other rogues of the
 31770	game or with a chanceable catchpole or a tipstaff often at nights
 31771	till broad day of whom he picked up between his sackpossets much loose
 31772	gossip. He took his ordinary at a boilingcook's and if he had but gotten
 31773	into him a mess of broken victuals or a platter of tripes with a bare
 31774	tester in his purse he could always bring himself off with his tongue,
 31775	some randy quip he had from a punk or whatnot that every mother's son of
 31776	them would burst their sides. The other, Costello that is, hearing this
 31777	talk asked was it poetry or a tale. Faith, no, he says, Frank (that was
 31778	his name), 'tis all about Kerry cows that are to be butchered along of
 31779	the plague. But they can go hang, says he with a wink, for me with their
 31780	bully beef, a pox on it. There's as good fish in this tin as ever came
 31781	out of it and very friendly he offered to take of some salty sprats that
 31782	stood by which he had eyed wishly in the meantime and found the place
 31783	which was indeed the chief design of his embassy as he was sharpset.
 31784	_Mort aux vaches_, says Frank then in the French language that had been
 31785	indentured to a brandyshipper that has a winelodge in Bordeaux and he
 31786	spoke French like a gentleman too. From a child this Frank had been
 31787	a donought that his father, a headborough, who could ill keep him to
 31788	school to learn his letters and the use of the globes, matriculated at
 31789	the university to study the mechanics but he took the bit between his
 31790	teeth like a raw colt and was more familiar with the justiciary and the
 31791	parish beadle than with his volumes. One time he would be a playactor,
 31792	then a sutler or a welsher, then nought would keep him from the bearpit
 31793	and the cocking main, then he was for the ocean sea or to hoof it on
 31794	the roads with the romany folk, kidnapping a squire's heir by favour of
 31795	moonlight or fecking maids' linen or choking chicken behind a hedge. He
 31796	had been off as many times as a cat has lives and back again with naked
 31797	pockets as many more to his father the headborough who shed a pint
 31798	of tears as often as he saw him. What, says Mr Leopold with his hands
 31799	across, that was earnest to know the drift of it, will they slaughter
 31800	all? I protest I saw them but this day morning going to the Liverpool
 31801	boats, says he. I can scarce believe 'tis so bad, says he. And he had
 31802	experience of the like brood beasts and of springers, greasy hoggets and
 31803	wether wool, having been some years before actuary for Mr Joseph Cuffe,
 31804	a worthy salesmaster that drove his trade for live stock and meadow
 31805	auctions hard by Mr Gavin Low's yard in Prussia street. I question with
 31806	you there, says he. More like 'tis the hoose or the timber tongue. Mr
 31807	Stephen, a little moved but very handsomely told him no such matter and
 31808	that he had dispatches from the emperor's chief tailtickler thanking
 31809	him for the hospitality, that was sending over Doctor Rinderpest, the
 31810	bestquoted cowcatcher in all Muscovy, with a bolus or two of physic to
 31811	take the bull by the horns. Come, come, says Mr Vincent, plain dealing.
 31812	He'll find himself on the horns of a dilemma if he meddles with a
 31813	bull that's Irish, says he. Irish by name and irish by nature, says Mr
 31814	Stephen, and he sent the ale purling about, an Irish bull in an English
 31815	chinashop. I conceive you, says Mr Dixon. It is that same bull that was
 31816	sent to our island by farmer Nicholas, the bravest cattlebreeder of them
 31817	all, with an emerald ring in his nose. True for you, says Mr Vincent
 31818	cross the table, and a bullseye into the bargain, says he, and a plumper
 31819	and a portlier bull, says he, never shit on shamrock. He had horns
 31820	galore, a coat of cloth of gold and a sweet smoky breath coming out of
 31821	his nostrils so that the women of our island, leaving doughballs and
 31822	rollingpins, followed after him hanging his bulliness in daisychains.
 31823	What for that, says Mr Dixon, but before he came over farmer Nicholas
 31824	that was a eunuch had him properly gelded by a college of doctors who
 31825	were no better off than himself. So be off now, says he, and do all my
 31826	cousin german the lord Harry tells you and take a farmer's blessing, and
 31827	with that he slapped his posteriors very soundly. But the slap and the
 31828	blessing stood him friend, says Mr Vincent, for to make up he taught him
 31829	a trick worth two of the other so that maid, wife, abbess and widow to
 31830	this day affirm that they would rather any time of the month whisper
 31831	in his ear in the dark of a cowhouse or get a lick on the nape from his
 31832	long holy tongue than lie with the finest strapping young ravisher in
 31833	the four fields of all Ireland. Another then put in his word: And they
 31834	dressed him, says he, in a point shift and petticoat with a tippet and
 31835	girdle and ruffles on his wrists and clipped his forelock and rubbed him
 31836	all over with spermacetic oil and built stables for him at every turn of
 31837	the road with a gold manger in each full of the best hay in the market
 31838	so that he could doss and dung to his heart's content. By this time the
 31839	father of the faithful (for so they called him) was grown so heavy that
 31840	he could scarce walk to pasture. To remedy which our cozening dames and
 31841	damsels brought him his fodder in their apronlaps and as soon as his
 31842	belly was full he would rear up on his hind uarters to show their
 31843	ladyships a mystery and roar and bellow out of him in bulls' language
 31844	and they all after him. Ay, says another, and so pampered was he that he
 31845	would suffer nought to grow in all the land but green grass for himself
 31846	(for that was the only colour to his mind) and there was a board put up
 31847	on a hillock in the middle of the island with a printed notice, saying:
 31848	By the Lord Harry, Green is the grass that grows on the ground. And,
 31849	says Mr Dixon, if ever he got scent of a cattleraider in Roscommon or
 31850	the wilds of Connemara or a husbandman in Sligo that was sowing as much
 31851	as a handful of mustard or a bag of rapeseed out he'd run amok over half
 31852	the countryside rooting up with his horns whatever was planted and all
 31853	by lord Harry's orders. There was bad blood between them at first, says
 31854	Mr Vincent, and the lord Harry called farmer Nicholas all the old Nicks
 31855	in the world and an old whoremaster that kept seven trulls in his house
 31856	and I'll meddle in his matters, says he. I'll make that animal smell
 31857	hell, says he, with the help of that good pizzle my father left me. But
 31858	one evening, says Mr Dixon, when the lord Harry was cleaning his royal
 31859	pelt to go to dinner after winning a boatrace (he had spade oars for
 31860	himself but the first rule of the course was that the others were to row
 31861	with pitchforks) he discovered in himself a wonderful likeness to a bull
 31862	and on picking up a blackthumbed chapbook that he kept in the pantry
 31863	he found sure enough that he was a lefthanded descendant of the famous
 31864	champion bull of the Romans, _Bos Bovum_, which is good bog Latin for
 31865	boss of the show. After that, says Mr Vincent, the lord Harry put his
 31866	head into a cow's drinkingtrough in the presence of all his courtiers
 31867	and pulling it out again told them all his new name. Then, with the
 31868	water running off him, he got into an old smock and skirt that had
 31869	belonged to his grandmother and bought a grammar of the bulls' language
 31870	to study but he could never learn a word of it except the first personal
 31871	pronoun which he copied out big and got off by heart and if ever he went
 31872	out for a walk he filled his pockets with chalk to write it upon what
 31873	took his fancy, the side of a rock or a teahouse table or a bale of
 31874	cotton or a corkfloat. In short, he and the bull of Ireland were soon as
 31875	fast friends as an arse and a shirt. They were, says Mr Stephen, and
 31876	the end was that the men of the island seeing no help was toward, as
 31877	the ungrate women were all of one mind, made a wherry raft, loaded
 31878	themselves and their bundles of chattels on shipboard, set all masts
 31879	erect, manned the yards, sprang their luff, heaved to, spread three
 31880	sheets in the wind, put her head between wind and water, weighed anchor,
 31881	ported her helm, ran up the jolly Roger, gave three times three, let the
 31882	bullgine run, pushed off in their bumboat and put to sea to recover
 31883	the main of America. Which was the occasion, says Mr Vincent, of the
 31884	composing by a boatswain of that rollicking chanty:
 31885	
 31886	     _--Pope Peter's but a pissabed.
 31887	     A man's a man for a' that._
 31888	
 31889	Our worthy acquaintance Mr Malachi Mulligan now appeared in the doorway
 31890	as the students were finishing their apologue accompanied with a friend
 31891	whom he had just rencountered, a young gentleman, his name Alec Bannon,
 31892	who had late come to town, it being his intention to buy a colour or a
 31893	cornetcy in the fencibles and list for the wars. Mr Mulligan was civil
 31894	enough to express some relish of it all the more as it jumped with a
 31895	project of his own for the cure of the very evil that had been touched
 31896	on. Whereat he handed round to the company a set of pasteboard cards
 31897	which he had had printed that day at Mr Quinnell's bearing a legend
 31898	printed in fair italics: _Mr Malachi Mulligan. Fertiliser and Incubator.
 31899	Lambay Island_. His project, as he went on to expound, was to withdraw
 31900	from the round of idle pleasures such as form the chief business of sir
 31901	Fopling Popinjay and sir Milksop Quidnunc in town and to devote himself
 31902	to the noblest task for which our bodily organism has been framed. Well,
 31903	let us hear of it, good my friend, said Mr Dixon. I make no doubt it
 31904	smacks of wenching. Come, be seated, both. 'Tis as cheap sitting as
 31905	standing. Mr Mulligan accepted of the invitation and, expatiating upon
 31906	his design, told his hearers that he had been led into this thought by
 31907	a consideration of the causes of sterility, both the inhibitory and the
 31908	prohibitory, whether the inhibition in its turn were due to conjugal
 31909	vexations or to a parsimony of the balance as well as whether the
 31910	prohibition proceeded from defects congenital or from proclivities
 31911	acquired. It grieved him plaguily, he said, to see the nuptial couch
 31912	defrauded of its dearest pledges: and to reflect upon so many agreeable
 31913	females with rich jointures, a prey to the vilest bonzes, who hide their
 31914	flambeau under a bushel in an uncongenial cloister or lose their womanly
 31915	bloom in the embraces of some unaccountable muskin when they might
 31916	multiply the inlets of happiness, sacrificing the inestimable jewel of
 31917	their sex when a hundred pretty fellows were at hand to caress, this, he
 31918	assured them, made his heart weep. To curb this inconvenient (which
 31919	he concluded due to a suppression of latent heat), having advised with
 31920	certain counsellors of worth and inspected into this matter, he had
 31921	resolved to purchase in fee simple for ever the freehold of Lambay
 31922	island from its holder, lord Talbot de Malahide, a Tory gentleman of
 31923	note much in favour with our ascendancy party. He proposed to set up
 31924	there a national fertilising farm to be named _Omphalos_ with an obelisk
 31925	hewn and erected after the fashion of Egypt and to offer his dutiful
 31926	yeoman services for the fecundation of any female of what grade of life
 31927	soever who should there direct to him with the desire of fulfilling the
 31928	functions of her natural. Money was no object, he said, nor would he
 31929	take a penny for his pains. The poorest kitchenwench no less than the
 31930	opulent lady of fashion, if so be their constructions and their tempers
 31931	were warm persuaders for their petitions, would find in him their man.
 31932	For his nutriment he shewed how he would feed himself exclusively upon a
 31933	diet of savoury tubercles and fish and coneys there, the flesh of these
 31934	latter prolific rodents being highly recommended for his purpose, both
 31935	broiled and stewed with a blade of mace and a pod or two of capsicum
 31936	chillies. After this homily which he delivered with much warmth of
 31937	asseveration Mr Mulligan in a trice put off from his hat a kerchief with
 31938	which he had shielded it. They both, it seems, had been overtaken by the
 31939	rain and for all their mending their pace had taken water, as might be
 31940	observed by Mr Mulligan's smallclothes of a hodden grey which was now
 31941	somewhat piebald. His project meanwhile was very favourably entertained
 31942	by his auditors and won hearty eulogies from all though Mr Dixon of
 31943	Mary's excepted to it, asking with a finicking air did he purpose also
 31944	to carry coals to Newcastle. Mr Mulligan however made court to the
 31945	scholarly by an apt quotation from the classics which, as it dwelt
 31946	upon his memory, seemed to him a sound and tasteful support of his
 31947	contention: _Talis ac tanta depravatio hujus seculi, O quirites,
 31948	ut matresfamiliarum nostrae lascivas cujuslibet semiviri libici
 31949	titillationes testibus ponderosis atque excelsis erectionibus
 31950	centurionum Romanorum magnopere anteponunt_, while for those of ruder
 31951	wit he drove home his point by analogies of the animal kingdom more
 31952	suitable to their stomach, the buck and doe of the forest glade, the
 31953	farmyard drake and duck.
 31954	
 31955	Valuing himself not a little upon his elegance, being indeed a proper
 31956	man of person, this talkative now applied himself to his dress with
 31957	animadversions of some heat upon the sudden whimsy of the atmospherics
 31958	while the company lavished their encomiums upon the project he had
 31959	advanced. The young gentleman, his friend, overjoyed as he was at a
 31960	passage that had late befallen him, could not forbear to tell it his
 31961	nearest neighbour. Mr Mulligan, now perceiving the table, asked for whom
 31962	were those loaves and fishes and, seeing the stranger, he made him
 31963	a civil bow and said, Pray, sir, was you in need of any professional
 31964	assistance we could give? Who, upon his offer, thanked him very
 31965	heartily, though preserving his proper distance, and replied that he was
 31966	come there about a lady, now an inmate of Horne's house, that was in an
 31967	interesting condition, poor body, from woman's woe (and here he fetched
 31968	a deep sigh) to know if her happiness had yet taken place. Mr Dixon,
 31969	to turn the table, took on to ask of Mr Mulligan himself whether
 31970	his incipient ventripotence, upon which he rallied him, betokened an
 31971	ovoblastic gestation in the prostatic utricle or male womb or was due,
 31972	as with the noted physician, Mr Austin Meldon, to a wolf in the stomach.
 31973	For answer Mr Mulligan, in a gale of laughter at his smalls, smote
 31974	himself bravely below the diaphragm, exclaiming with an admirable droll
 31975	mimic of Mother Grogan (the most excellent creature of her sex though
 31976	'tis pity she's a trollop): There's a belly that never bore a bastard.
 31977	This was so happy a conceit that it renewed the storm of mirth and threw
 31978	the whole room into the most violent agitations of delight. The spry
 31979	rattle had run on in the same vein of mimicry but for some larum in the
 31980	antechamber.
 31981	
 31982	Here the listener who was none other than the Scotch student, a little
 31983	fume of a fellow, blond as tow, congratulated in the liveliest fashion
 31984	with the young gentleman and, interrupting the narrative at a salient
 31985	point, having desired his visavis with a polite beck to have the
 31986	obligingness to pass him a flagon of cordial waters at the same time by
 31987	a questioning poise of the head (a whole century of polite breeding had
 31988	not achieved so nice a gesture) to which was united an equivalent but
 31989	contrary balance of the bottle asked the narrator as plainly as was ever
 31990	done in words if he might treat him with a cup of it. _Mais bien sÃ»r_,
 31991	noble stranger, said he cheerily, _et mille compliments_. That you may
 31992	and very opportunely. There wanted nothing but this cup to crown my
 31993	felicity. But, gracious heaven, was I left with but a crust in my wallet
 31994	and a cupful of water from the well, my God, I would accept of them and
 31995	find it in my heart to kneel down upon the ground and give thanks to
 31996	the powers above for the happiness vouchsafed me by the Giver of good
 31997	things. With these words he approached the goblet to his lips, took a
 31998	complacent draught of the cordial, slicked his hair and, opening his
 31999	bosom, out popped a locket that hung from a silk riband, that very
 32000	picture which he had cherished ever since her hand had wrote therein.
 32001	Gazing upon those features with a world of tenderness, Ah, Monsieur, he
 32002	said, had you but beheld her as I did with these eyes at that affecting
 32003	instant with her dainty tucker and her new coquette cap (a gift for her
 32004	feastday as she told me prettily) in such an artless disorder, of so
