 32005	melting a tenderness, 'pon my conscience, even you, Monsieur, had been
 32006	impelled by generous nature to deliver yourself wholly into the hands of
 32007	such an enemy or to quit the field for ever. I declare, I was never so
 32008	touched in all my life. God, I thank thee, as the Author of my days!
 32009	Thrice happy will he be whom so amiable a creature will bless with her
 32010	favours. A sigh of affection gave eloquence to these words and, having
 32011	replaced the locket in his bosom, he wiped his eye and sighed again.
 32012	Beneficent Disseminator of blessings to all Thy creatures, how great
 32013	and universal must be that sweetest of Thy tyrannies which can hold in
 32014	thrall the free and the bond, the simple swain and the polished coxcomb,
 32015	the lover in the heyday of reckless passion and the husband of maturer
 32016	years. But indeed, sir, I wander from the point. How mingled and
 32017	imperfect are all our sublunary joys. Maledicity! he exclaimed in
 32018	anguish. Would to God that foresight had but remembered me to take my
 32019	cloak along! I could weep to think of it. Then, though it had poured
 32020	seven showers, we were neither of us a penny the worse. But beshrew me,
 32021	he cried, clapping hand to his forehead, tomorrow will be a new day and,
 32022	thousand thunders, I know of a _marchand de capotes_, Monsieur Poyntz,
 32023	from whom I can have for a livre as snug a cloak of the French fashion
 32024	as ever kept a lady from wetting. Tut, tut! cries Le Fecondateur,
 32025	tripping in, my friend Monsieur Moore, that most accomplished traveller
 32026	(I have just cracked a half bottle AVEC LUI in a circle of the best wits
 32027	of the town), is my authority that in Cape Horn, _ventre biche_, they
 32028	have a rain that will wet through any, even the stoutest cloak. A
 32029	drenching of that violence, he tells me, _sans blague_, has sent more
 32030	than one luckless fellow in good earnest posthaste to another world.
 32031	Pooh! A _livre!_ cries Monsieur Lynch. The clumsy things are dear at a
 32032	sou. One umbrella, were it no bigger than a fairy mushroom, is worth ten
 32033	such stopgaps. No woman of any wit would wear one. My dear Kitty told me
 32034	today that she would dance in a deluge before ever she would starve in
 32035	such an ark of salvation for, as she reminded me (blushing piquantly and
 32036	whispering in my ear though there was none to snap her words but giddy
 32037	butterflies), dame Nature, by the divine blessing, has implanted it in
 32038	our hearts and it has become a household word that _il y a deux choses_
 32039	for which the innocence of our original garb, in other circumstances a
 32040	breach of the proprieties, is the fittest, nay, the only garment. The
 32041	first, said she (and here my pretty philosopher, as I handed her to her
 32042	tilbury, to fix my attention, gently tipped with her tongue the outer
 32043	chamber of my ear), the first is a bath... But at this point a bell
 32044	tinkling in the hall cut short a discourse which promised so bravely for
 32045	the enrichment of our store of knowledge.
 32046	
 32047	Amid the general vacant hilarity of the assembly a bell rang and, while
 32048	all were conjecturing what might be the cause, Miss Callan entered and,
 32049	having spoken a few words in a low tone to young Mr Dixon, retired with
 32050	a profound bow to the company. The presence even for a moment among a
 32051	party of debauchees of a woman endued with every quality of modesty and
 32052	not less severe than beautiful refrained the humourous sallies even of
 32053	the most licentious but her departure was the signal for an outbreak of
 32054	ribaldry. Strike me silly, said Costello, a low fellow who was fuddled.
 32055	A monstrous fine bit of cowflesh! I'll be sworn she has rendezvoused
 32056	you. What, you dog? Have you a way with them? Gad's bud, immensely
 32057	so, said Mr Lynch. The bedside manner it is that they use in the Mater
 32058	hospice. Demme, does not Doctor O'Gargle chuck the nuns there under the
 32059	chin. As I look to be saved I had it from my Kitty who has been wardmaid
 32060	there any time these seven months. Lawksamercy, doctor, cried the young
 32061	blood in the primrose vest, feigning a womanish simper and with immodest
 32062	squirmings of his body, how you do tease a body! Drat the man! Bless
 32063	me, I'm all of a wibbly wobbly. Why, you're as bad as dear little Father
 32064	Cantekissem, that you are! May this pot of four half choke me, cried
 32065	Costello, if she aint in the family way. I knows a lady what's got a
 32066	white swelling quick as I claps eyes on her. The young surgeon, however,
 32067	rose and begged the company to excuse his retreat as the nurse had just
 32068	then informed him that he was needed in the ward. Merciful providence
 32069	had been pleased to put a period to the sufferings of the lady who was
 32070	_enceinte_ which she had borne with a laudable fortitude and she had
 32071	given birth to a bouncing boy. I want patience, said he, with those
 32072	who, without wit to enliven or learning to instruct, revile an ennobling
 32073	profession which, saving the reverence due to the Deity, is the greatest
 32074	power for happiness upon the earth. I am positive when I say that if
 32075	need were I could produce a cloud of witnesses to the excellence of
 32076	her noble exercitations which, so far from being a byword, should be a
 32077	glorious incentive in the human breast. I cannot away with them. What?
 32078	Malign such an one, the amiable Miss Callan, who is the lustre of
 32079	her own sex and the astonishment of ours? And at an instant the most
 32080	momentous that can befall a puny child of clay? Perish the thought! I
 32081	shudder to think of the future of a race where the seeds of such malice
 32082	have been sown and where no right reverence is rendered to mother and
 32083	maid in house of Horne. Having delivered himself of this rebuke he
 32084	saluted those present on the by and repaired to the door. A murmur
 32085	of approval arose from all and some were for ejecting the low soaker
 32086	without more ado, a design which would have been effected nor would
 32087	he have received more than his bare deserts had he not abridged his
 32088	transgression by affirming with a horrid imprecation (for he swore a
 32089	round hand) that he was as good a son of the true fold as ever drew
 32090	breath. Stap my vitals, said he, them was always the sentiments of
 32091	honest Frank Costello which I was bred up most particular to honour thy
 32092	father and thy mother that had the best hand to a rolypoly or a hasty
 32093	pudding as you ever see what I always looks back on with a loving heart.
 32094	
 32095	To revert to Mr Bloom who, after his first entry, had been conscious of
 32096	some impudent mocks which he however had borne with as being the fruits
 32097	of that age upon which it is commonly charged that it knows not
 32098	pity. The young sparks, it is true, were as full of extravagancies
 32099	as overgrown children: the words of their tumultuary discussions
 32100	were difficultly understood and not often nice: their testiness and
 32101	outrageous _mots_ were such that his intellects resiled from: nor were
 32102	they scrupulously sensible of the proprieties though their fund of
 32103	strong animal spirits spoke in their behalf. But the word of Mr Costello
 32104	was an unwelcome language for him for he nauseated the wretch that
 32105	seemed to him a cropeared creature of a misshapen gibbosity, born out
 32106	of wedlock and thrust like a crookback toothed and feet first into the
 32107	world, which the dint of the surgeon's pliers in his skull lent indeed
 32108	a colour to, so as to put him in thought of that missing link of
 32109	creation's chain desiderated by the late ingenious Mr Darwin. It was now
 32110	for more than the middle span of our allotted years that he had passed
 32111	through the thousand vicissitudes of existence and, being of a wary
 32112	ascendancy and self a man of rare forecast, he had enjoined his heart
 32113	to repress all motions of a rising choler and, by intercepting them
 32114	with the readiest precaution, foster within his breast that plenitude
 32115	of sufferance which base minds jeer at, rash judgers scorn and all find
 32116	tolerable and but tolerable. To those who create themselves wits at the
 32117	cost of feminine delicacy (a habit of mind which he never did hold
 32118	with) to them he would concede neither to bear the name nor to herit
 32119	the tradition of a proper breeding: while for such that, having lost
 32120	all forbearance, can lose no more, there remained the sharp antidote of
 32121	experience to cause their insolency to beat a precipitate and inglorious
 32122	retreat. Not but what he could feel with mettlesome youth which, caring
 32123	nought for the mows of dotards or the gruntlings of the severe, is ever
 32124	(as the chaste fancy of the Holy Writer expresses it) for eating of the
 32125	tree forbid it yet not so far forth as to pretermit humanity upon any
 32126	condition soever towards a gentlewoman when she was about her lawful
 32127	occasions. To conclude, while from the sister's words he had reckoned
 32128	upon a speedy delivery he was, however, it must be owned, not a little
 32129	alleviated by the intelligence that the issue so auspicated after an
 32130	ordeal of such duress now testified once more to the mercy as well as to
 32131	the bounty of the Supreme Being.
 32132	
 32133	Accordingly he broke his mind to his neighbour, saying that, to express
 32134	his notion of the thing, his opinion (who ought not perchance to express
 32135	one) was that one must have a cold constitution and a frigid genius not
 32136	to be rejoiced by this freshest news of the fruition of her confinement
 32137	since she had been in such pain through no fault of hers. The dressy
 32138	young blade said it was her husband's that put her in that expectation
 32139	or at least it ought to be unless she were another Ephesian matron. I
 32140	must acquaint you, said Mr Crotthers, clapping on the table so as to
 32141	evoke a resonant comment of emphasis, old Glory Allelujurum was round
 32142	again today, an elderly man with dundrearies, preferring through his
 32143	nose a request to have word of Wilhelmina, my life, as he calls her. I
 32144	bade him hold himself in readiness for that the event would burst anon.
 32145	'Slife, I'll be round with you. I cannot but extol the virile potency of
 32146	the old bucko that could still knock another child out of her. All fell
 32147	to praising of it, each after his own fashion, though the same young
 32148	blade held with his former view that another than her conjugial had
 32149	been the man in the gap, a clerk in orders, a linkboy (virtuous) or
 32150	an itinerant vendor of articles needed in every household. Singular,
 32151	communed the guest with himself, the wonderfully unequal faculty of
 32152	metempsychosis possessed by them, that the puerperal dormitory and the
 32153	dissecting theatre should be the seminaries of such frivolity, that the
 32154	mere acquisition of academic titles should suffice to transform in a
 32155	pinch of time these votaries of levity into exemplary practitioners of
 32156	an art which most men anywise eminent have esteemed the noblest. But,
 32157	he further added, it is mayhap to relieve the pentup feelings that in
 32158	common oppress them for I have more than once observed that birds of a
 32159	feather laugh together.
 32160	
 32161	But with what fitness, let it be asked of the noble lord, his patron,
 32162	has this alien, whom the concession of a gracious prince has admitted
 32163	to civic rights, constituted himself the lord paramount of our
 32164	internal polity? Where is now that gratitude which loyalty should have
 32165	counselled? During the recent war whenever the enemy had a temporary
 32166	advantage with his granados did this traitor to his kind not seize that
 32167	moment to discharge his piece against the empire of which he is a tenant
 32168	at will while he trembled for the security of his four per cents? Has he
 32169	forgotten this as he forgets all benefits received? Or is it that from
 32170	being a deluder of others he has become at last his own dupe as he is,
 32171	if report belie him not, his own and his only enjoyer? Far be it from
 32172	candour to violate the bedchamber of a respectable lady, the daughter of
 32173	a gallant major, or to cast the most distant reflections upon her
 32174	virtue but if he challenges attention there (as it was indeed highly his
 32175	interest not to have done) then be it so. Unhappy woman, she has been
 32176	too long and too persistently denied her legitimate prerogative to
 32177	listen to his objurgations with any other feeling than the derision of
 32178	the desperate. He says this, a censor of morals, a very pelican in his
 32179	piety, who did not scruple, oblivious of the ties of nature, to attempt
 32180	illicit intercourse with a female domestic drawn from the lowest strata
 32181	of society! Nay, had the hussy's scouringbrush not been her tutelary
 32182	angel, it had gone with her as hard as with Hagar, the Egyptian! In the
 32183	question of the grazing lands his peevish asperity is notorious and in
 32184	Mr Cuffe's hearing brought upon him from an indignant rancher a scathing
 32185	retort couched in terms as straightforward as they were bucolic. It ill
 32186	becomes him to preach that gospel. Has he not nearer home a seedfield
 32187	that lies fallow for the want of the ploughshare? A habit reprehensible
 32188	at puberty is second nature and an opprobrium in middle life. If he must
 32189	dispense his balm of Gilead in nostrums and apothegms of dubious taste
 32190	to restore to health a generation of unfledged profligates let his
 32191	practice consist better with the doctrines that now engross him. His
 32192	marital breast is the repository of secrets which decorum is reluctant
 32193	to adduce. The lewd suggestions of some faded beauty may console him for
 32194	a consort neglected and debauched but this new exponent of morals and
 32195	healer of ills is at his best an exotic tree which, when rooted in
 32196	its native orient, throve and flourished and was abundant in balm
 32197	but, transplanted to a clime more temperate, its roots have lost their
 32198	quondam vigour while the stuff that comes away from it is stagnant, acid
 32199	and inoperative.
 32200	
 32201	The news was imparted with a circumspection recalling the ceremonial
 32202	usage of the Sublime Porte by the second female infirmarian to the
 32203	junior medical officer in residence, who in his turn announced to the
 32204	delegation that an heir had been born, When he had betaken himself
 32205	to the women's apartment to assist at the prescribed ceremony of the
 32206	afterbirth in the presence of the secretary of state for domestic
 32207	affairs and the members of the privy council, silent in unanimous
 32208	exhaustion and approbation the delegates, chafing under the length and
 32209	solemnity of their vigil and hoping that the joyful occurrence would
 32210	palliate a licence which the simultaneous absence of abigail and
 32211	obstetrician rendered the easier, broke out at once into a strife of
 32212	tongues. In vain the voice of Mr Canvasser Bloom was heard endeavouring
 32213	to urge, to mollify, to refrain. The moment was too propitious for the
 32214	display of that discursiveness which seemed the only bond of union among
 32215	tempers so divergent. Every phase of the situation was successively
 32216	eviscerated: the prenatal repugnance of uterine brothers, the Caesarean
 32217	section, posthumity with respect to the father and, that rarer form,
 32218	with respect to the mother, the fratricidal case known as the Childs
 32219	Murder and rendered memorable by the impassioned plea of Mr Advocate
 32220	Bushe which secured the acquittal of the wrongfully accused, the
 32221	rights of primogeniture and king's bounty touching twins and triplets,
 32222	miscarriages and infanticides, simulated or dissimulated, the acardiac
 32223	_foetus in foetu_ and aprosopia due to a congestion, the agnathia
 32224	of certain chinless Chinamen (cited by Mr Candidate Mulligan) in
 32225	consequence of defective reunion of the maxillary knobs along the medial
 32226	line so that (as he said) one ear could hear what the other spoke, the
 32227	benefits of anesthesia or twilight sleep, the prolongation of labour
 32228	pains in advanced gravidancy by reason of pressure on the vein, the
 32229	premature relentment of the amniotic fluid (as exemplified in the
 32230	actual case) with consequent peril of sepsis to the matrix, artificial
 32231	insemination by means of syringes, involution of the womb consequent
 32232	upon the menopause, the problem of the perpetration of the species in
 32233	the case of females impregnated by delinquent rape, that distressing
 32234	manner of delivery called by the Brandenburghers _Sturzgeburt,_ the
 32235	recorded instances of multiseminal, twikindled and monstrous births
 32236	conceived during the catamenic period or of consanguineous parents--in
 32237	a word all the cases of human nativity which Aristotle has classified
 32238	in his masterpiece with chromolithographic illustrations. The gravest
 32239	problems of obstetrics and forensic medicine were examined with as much
 32240	animation as the most popular beliefs on the state of pregnancy such as
 32241	the forbidding to a gravid woman to step over a countrystile lest,
 32242	by her movement, the navelcord should strangle her creature and
 32243	the injunction upon her in the event of a yearning, ardently and
 32244	ineffectually entertained, to place her hand against that part of her
 32245	person which long usage has consecrated as the seat of castigation.
 32246	The abnormalities of harelip, breastmole, supernumerary digits, negro's
 32247	inkle, strawberry mark and portwine stain were alleged by one as a
 32248	_prima facie_ and natural hypothetical explanation of those swineheaded
 32249	(the case of Madame Grissel Steevens was not forgotten) or doghaired
 32250	infants occasionally born. The hypothesis of a plasmic memory, advanced
 32251	by the Caledonian envoy and worthy of the metaphysical traditions of
 32252	the land he stood for, envisaged in such cases an arrest of embryonic
 32253	development at some stage antecedent to the human. An outlandish
 32254	delegate sustained against both these views, with such heat as almost
 32255	carried conviction, the theory of copulation between women and the males
 32256	of brutes, his authority being his own avouchment in support of fables
 32257	such as that of the Minotaur which the genius of the elegant Latin poet
 32258	has handed down to us in the pages of his Metamorphoses. The impression
 32259	made by his words was immediate but shortlived. It was effaced as easily
 32260	as it had been evoked by an allocution from Mr Candidate Mulligan in
 32261	that vein of pleasantry which none better than he knew how to affect,
 32262	postulating as the supremest object of desire a nice clean old man.
 32263	Contemporaneously, a heated argument having arisen between Mr Delegate
 32264	Madden and Mr Candidate Lynch regarding the juridical and theological
 32265	dilemma created in the event of one Siamese twin predeceasing the other,
 32266	the difficulty by mutual consent was referred to Mr Canvasser Bloom
 32267	for instant submittal to Mr Coadjutor Deacon Dedalus. Hitherto silent,
 32268	whether the better to show by preternatural gravity that curious dignity
 32269	of the garb with which he was invested or in obedience to an inward
 32270	voice, he delivered briefly and, as some thought, perfunctorily the
 32271	ecclesiastical ordinance forbidding man to put asunder what God has
 32272	joined.
 32273	
 32274	But Malachias' tale began to freeze them with horror. He conjured up the
 32275	scene before them. The secret panel beside the chimney slid back and
 32276	in the recess appeared... Haines! Which of us did not feel his flesh
 32277	creep! He had a portfolio full of Celtic literature in one hand, in the
 32278	other a phial marked _Poison._ Surprise, horror, loathing were depicted
 32279	on all faces while he eyed them with a ghostly grin. I anticipated some
 32280	such reception, he began with an eldritch laugh, for which, it seems,
 32281	history is to blame. Yes, it is true. I am the murderer of Samuel
 32282	Childs. And how I am punished! The inferno has no terrors for me. This
 32283	is the appearance is on me. Tare and ages, what way would I be resting
 32284	at all, he muttered thickly, and I tramping Dublin this while back
 32285	with my share of songs and himself after me the like of a soulth or a
 32286	bullawurrus? My hell, and Ireland's, is in this life. It is what I tried
 32287	to obliterate my crime. Distractions, rookshooting, the Erse language
 32288	(he recited some), laudanum (he raised the phial to his lips), camping
 32289	out. In vain! His spectre stalks me. Dope is my only hope... Ah!
 32290	Destruction! The black panther! With a cry he suddenly vanished and the
 32291	panel slid back. An instant later his head appeared in the door opposite
 32292	and said: Meet me at Westland Row station at ten past eleven. He was
 32293	gone. Tears gushed from the eyes of the dissipated host. The seer
 32294	raised his hand to heaven, murmuring: The vendetta of Mananaun! The
 32295	sage repeated: _Lex talionis_. The sentimentalist is he who would enjoy
 32296	without incurring the immense debtorship for a thing done. Malachias,
 32297	overcome by emotion, ceased. The mystery was unveiled. Haines was the
 32298	third brother. His real name was Childs. The black panther was himself
 32299	the ghost of his own father. He drank drugs to obliterate. For this
 32300	relief much thanks. The lonely house by the graveyard is uninhabited.
 32301	No soul will live there. The spider pitches her web in the solitude.
 32302	The nocturnal rat peers from his hole. A curse is on it. It is haunted.
 32303	Murderer's ground.
 32304	
 32305	What is the age of the soul of man? As she hath the virtue of the
 32306	chameleon to change her hue at every new approach, to be gay with the
 32307	merry and mournful with the downcast, so too is her age changeable as
 32308	her mood. No longer is Leopold, as he sits there, ruminating, chewing
 32309	the cud of reminiscence, that staid agent of publicity and holder of a
 32310	modest substance in the funds. A score of years are blown away. He is
 32311	young Leopold. There, as in a retrospective arrangement, a mirror within
 32312	a mirror (hey, presto!), he beholdeth himself. That young figure of then
 32313	is seen, precociously manly, walking on a nipping morning from the old
 32314	house in Clanbrassil street to the high school, his booksatchel on
 32315	him bandolierwise, and in it a goodly hunk of wheaten loaf, a mother's
 32316	thought. Or it is the same figure, a year or so gone over, in his first
 32317	hard hat (ah, that was a day!), already on the road, a fullfledged
 32318	traveller for the family firm, equipped with an orderbook, a scented
 32319	handkerchief (not for show only), his case of bright trinketware (alas!
 32320	a thing now of the past!) and a quiverful of compliant smiles for this
 32321	or that halfwon housewife reckoning it out upon her fingertips or for
 32322	a budding virgin, shyly acknowledging (but the heart? tell me!) his
 32323	studied baisemoins. The scent, the smile, but, more than these, the dark
 32324	eyes and oleaginous address, brought home at duskfall many a commission
 32325	to the head of the firm, seated with Jacob's pipe after like labours in
 32326	the paternal ingle (a meal of noodles, you may be sure, is aheating),
 32327	reading through round horned spectacles some paper from the Europe of a
 32328	month before. But hey, presto, the mirror is breathed on and the young
 32329	knighterrant recedes, shrivels, dwindles to a tiny speck within the
 32330	mist. Now he is himself paternal and these about him might be his
 32331	sons. Who can say? The wise father knows his own child. He thinks of a
 32332	drizzling night in Hatch street, hard by the bonded stores there, the
 32333	first. Together (she is a poor waif, a child of shame, yours and mine
 32334	and of all for a bare shilling and her luckpenny), together they hear
 32335	the heavy tread of the watch as two raincaped shadows pass the new royal
 32336	university. Bridie! Bridie Kelly! He will never forget the name, ever
 32337	remember the night: first night, the bridenight. They are entwined
 32338	in nethermost darkness, the willer with the willed, and in an instant
 32339	(_fiat_!) light shall flood the world. Did heart leap to heart? Nay,
 32340	fair reader. In a breath 'twas done but--hold! Back! It must not be! In
 32341	terror the poor girl flees away through the murk. She is the bride of
 32342	darkness, a daughter of night. She dare not bear the sunnygolden babe
 32343	of day. No, Leopold. Name and memory solace thee not. That youthful
 32344	illusion of thy strength was taken from thee--and in vain. No son of thy
 32345	loins is by thee. There is none now to be for Leopold, what Leopold was
 32346	for Rudolph.
 32347	
 32348	The voices blend and fuse in clouded silence: silence that is the
 32349	infinite of space: and swiftly, silently the soul is wafted over regions
 32350	of cycles of generations that have lived. A region where grey twilight
 32351	ever descends, never falls on wide sagegreen pasturefields, shedding her
 32352	dusk, scattering a perennial dew of stars. She follows her mother with
 32353	ungainly steps, a mare leading her fillyfoal. Twilight phantoms
 32354	are they, yet moulded in prophetic grace of structure, slim shapely
 32355	haunches, a supple tendonous neck, the meek apprehensive skull. They
 32356	fade, sad phantoms: all is gone. Agendath is a waste land, a home of
 32357	screechowls and the sandblind upupa. Netaim, the golden, is no more. And
 32358	on the highway of the clouds they come, muttering thunder of rebellion,
 32359	the ghosts of beasts. Huuh! Hark! Huuh! Parallax stalks behind and goads
 32360	them, the lancinating lightnings of whose brow are scorpions. Elk and
 32361	yak, the bulls of Bashan and of Babylon, mammoth and mastodon, they come
 32362	trooping to the sunken sea, _Lacus Mortis_. Ominous revengeful zodiacal
 32363	host! They moan, passing upon the clouds, horned and capricorned, the
 32364	trumpeted with the tusked, the lionmaned, the giantantlered, snouter
 32365	and crawler, rodent, ruminant and pachyderm, all their moving moaning
 32366	multitude, murderers of the sun.
 32367	
 32368	Onward to the dead sea they tramp to drink, unslaked and with horrible
 32369	gulpings, the salt somnolent inexhaustible flood. And the equine portent
 32370	grows again, magnified in the deserted heavens, nay to heaven's own
 32371	magnitude, till it looms, vast, over the house of Virgo. And lo, wonder
 32372	of metempsychosis, it is she, the everlasting bride, harbinger of the
 32373	daystar, the bride, ever virgin. It is she, Martha, thou lost one,
 32374	Millicent, the young, the dear, the radiant. How serene does she now
 32375	arise, a queen among the Pleiades, in the penultimate antelucan hour,
 32376	shod in sandals of bright gold, coifed with a veil of what do you call
 32377	it gossamer. It floats, it flows about her starborn flesh and loose it
 32378	streams, emerald, sapphire, mauve and heliotrope, sustained on currents
 32379	of the cold interstellar wind, winding, coiling, simply swirling,
 32380	writhing in the skies a mysterious writing till, after a myriad
 32381	metamorphoses of symbol, it blazes, Alpha, a ruby and triangled sign
 32382	upon the forehead of Taurus.
 32383	
 32384	Francis was reminding Stephen of years before when they had been at
 32385	school together in Conmee's time. He asked about Glaucon, Alcibiades,
 32386	Pisistratus. Where were they now? Neither knew. You have spoken of the
 32387	past and its phantoms, Stephen said. Why think of them? If I call them
 32388	into life across the waters of Lethe will not the poor ghosts troop to
 32389	my call? Who supposes it? I, Bous Stephanoumenos, bullockbefriending
 32390	bard, am lord and giver of their life. He encircled his gadding hair
 32391	with a coronal of vineleaves, smiling at Vincent. That answer and those
 32392	leaves, Vincent said to him, will adorn you more fitly when something
 32393	more, and greatly more, than a capful of light odes can call your genius
 32394	father. All who wish you well hope this for you. All desire to see
 32395	you bring forth the work you meditate, to acclaim you Stephaneforos. I
 32396	heartily wish you may not fail them. O no, Vincent Lenehan said, laying
 32397	a hand on the shoulder near him. Have no fear. He could not leave his
 32398	mother an orphan. The young man's face grew dark. All could see how hard
 32399	it was for him to be reminded of his promise and of his recent loss. He
 32400	would have withdrawn from the feast had not the noise of voices allayed
 32401	the smart. Madden had lost five drachmas on Sceptre for a whim of the
 32402	rider's name: Lenehan as much more. He told them of the race. The flag
 32403	fell and, huuh! off, scamper, the mare ran out freshly with 0. Madden
 32404	up. She was leading the field. All hearts were beating. Even Phyllis
 32405	could not contain herself. She waved her scarf and cried: Huzzah!
 32406	Sceptre wins! But in the straight on the run home when all were in close
 32407	order the dark horse Throwaway drew level, reached, outstripped her. All
 32408	was lost now. Phyllis was silent: her eyes were sad anemones. Juno, she
 32409	cried, I am undone. But her lover consoled her and brought her a bright
 32410	casket of gold in which lay some oval sugarplums which she partook. A
 32411	tear fell: one only. A whacking fine whip, said Lenehan, is W. Lane.
 32412	Four winners yesterday and three today. What rider is like him? Mount
 32413	him on the camel or the boisterous buffalo the victory in a hack canter
 32414	is still his. But let us bear it as was the ancient wont. Mercy on the
 32415	luckless! Poor Sceptre! he said with a light sigh. She is not the filly
 32416	that she was. Never, by this hand, shall we behold such another. By gad,
 32417	sir, a queen of them. Do you remember her, Vincent? I wish you could
 32418	have seen my queen today, Vincent said. How young she was and radiant
 32419	(Lalage were scarce fair beside her) in her yellow shoes and frock of
 32420	muslin, I do not know the right name of it. The chestnuts that shaded
 32421	us were in bloom: the air drooped with their persuasive odour and with
 32422	pollen floating by us. In the sunny patches one might easily have
 32423	cooked on a stone a batch of those buns with Corinth fruit in them that
 32424	Periplipomenes sells in his booth near the bridge. But she had nought
 32425	for her teeth but the arm with which I held her and in that she nibbled
 32426	mischievously when I pressed too close. A week ago she lay ill, four
 32427	days on the couch, but today she was free, blithe, mocked at peril.
 32428	She is more taking then. Her posies tool Mad romp that she is, she had
 32429	pulled her fill as we reclined together. And in your ear, my friend, you
 32430	will not think who met us as we left the field. Conmee himself! He was
 32431	walking by the hedge, reading, I think a brevier book with, I doubt not,
 32432	a witty letter in it from Glycera or Chloe to keep the page. The sweet
 32433	creature turned all colours in her confusion, feigning to reprove a
 32434	slight disorder in her dress: a slip of underwood clung there for the
 32435	very trees adore her. When Conmee had passed she glanced at her lovely
 32436	echo in that little mirror she carries. But he had been kind. In going
 32437	by he had blessed us. The gods too are ever kind, Lenehan said. If I had
 32438	poor luck with Bass's mare perhaps this draught of his may serve me more
 32439	propensely. He was laying his hand upon a winejar: Malachi saw it and
 32440	withheld his act, pointing to the stranger and to the scarlet label.
 32441	Warily, Malachi whispered, preserve a druid silence. His soul is far
 32442	away. It is as painful perhaps to be awakened from a vision as to be
 32443	born. Any object, intensely regarded, may be a gate of access to the
 32444	incorruptible eon of the gods. Do you not think it, Stephen? Theosophos
 32445	told me so, Stephen answered, whom in a previous existence Egyptian
 32446	priests initiated into the mysteries of karmic law. The lords of the
 32447	moon, Theosophos told me, an orangefiery shipload from planet Alpha
 32448	of the lunar chain would not assume the etheric doubles and these
 32449	were therefore incarnated by the rubycoloured egos from the second
 32450	constellation.
 32451	
 32452	However, as a matter of fact though, the preposterous surmise about him
 32453	being in some description of a doldrums or other or mesmerised which
 32454	was entirely due to a misconception of the shallowest character, was
 32455	not the case at all. The individual whose visual organs while the above
 32456	was going on were at this juncture commencing to exhibit symptoms of
 32457	animation was as astute if not astuter than any man living and anybody
 32458	that conjectured the contrary would have found themselves pretty
 32459	speedily in the wrong shop. During the past four minutes or thereabouts
 32460	he had been staring hard at a certain amount of number one Bass bottled
 32461	by Messrs Bass and Co at Burton-on-Trent which happened to be situated
 32462	amongst a lot of others right opposite to where he was and which was
 32463	certainly calculated to attract anyone's remark on account of its
 32464	scarlet appearance. He was simply and solely, as it subsequently
 32465	transpired for reasons best known to himself, which put quite an
 32466	altogether different complexion on the proceedings, after the moment
 32467	before's observations about boyhood days and the turf, recollecting two
 32468	or three private transactions of his own which the other two were as
 32469	mutually innocent of as the babe unborn. Eventually, however, both
 32470	their eyes met and as soon as it began to dawn on him that the other was
 32471	endeavouring to help himself to the thing he involuntarily determined
 32472	to help him himself and so he accordingly took hold of the neck of the
 32473	mediumsized glass recipient which contained the fluid sought after and
 32474	made a capacious hole in it by pouring a lot of it out with, also at the
 32475	same time, however, a considerable degree of attentiveness in order not
 32476	to upset any of the beer that was in it about the place.
 32477	
 32478	The debate which ensued was in its scope and progress an epitome of the
 32479	course of life. Neither place nor council was lacking in dignity. The
 32480	debaters were the keenest in the land, the theme they were engaged on
 32481	the loftiest and most vital. The high hall of Horne's house had never
 32482	beheld an assembly so representative and so varied nor had the
 32483	old rafters of that establishment ever listened to a language so
 32484	encyclopaedic. A gallant scene in truth it made. Crotthers was there at
 32485	the foot of the table in his striking Highland garb, his face glowing
 32486	from the briny airs of the Mull of Galloway. There too, opposite to him,
 32487	was Lynch whose countenance bore already the stigmata of early depravity
 32488	and premature wisdom. Next the Scotchman was the place assigned to
 32489	Costello, the eccentric, while at his side was seated in stolid repose
 32490	the squat form of Madden. The chair of the resident indeed stood vacant
 32491	before the hearth but on either flank of it the figure of Bannon in
 32492	explorer's kit of tweed shorts and salted cowhide brogues contrasted
 32493	sharply with the primrose elegance and townbred manners of Malachi
 32494	Roland St John Mulligan. Lastly at the head of the board was the young
 32495	poet who found a refuge from his labours of pedagogy and metaphysical
 32496	inquisition in the convivial atmosphere of Socratic discussion, while
 32497	to right and left of him were accommodated the flippant prognosticator,
 32498	fresh from the hippodrome, and that vigilant wanderer, soiled by the
 32499	dust of travel and combat and stained by the mire of an indelible
 32500	dishonour, but from whose steadfast and constant heart no lure or peril
 32501	or threat or degradation could ever efface the image of that voluptuous
 32502	loveliness which the inspired pencil of Lafayette has limned for ages
 32503	yet to come.
 32504	
 32505	It had better be stated here and now at the outset that the perverted
 32506	transcendentalism to which Mr S. Dedalus' (Div. Scep.) contentions
 32507	would appear to prove him pretty badly addicted runs directly counter to
 32508	accepted scientific methods. Science, it cannot be too often repeated,
 32509	deals with tangible phenomena. The man of science like the man in the
 32510	street has to face hardheaded facts that cannot be blinked and explain
 32511	them as best he can. There may be, it is true, some questions which
 32512	science cannot answer--at present--such as the first problem submitted
 32513	by Mr L. Bloom (Pubb. Canv.) regarding the future determination of sex.
 32514	Must we accept the view of Empedocles of Trinacria that the right ovary
 32515	(the postmenstrual period, assert others) is responsible for the birth
 32516	of males or are the too long neglected spermatozoa or nemasperms the
 32517	differentiating factors or is it, as most embryologists incline to
 32518	opine, such as Culpepper, Spallanzani, Blumenbach, Lusk, Hertwig,
 32519	Leopold and Valenti, a mixture of both? This would be tantamount to
 32520	a cooperation (one of nature's favourite devices) between the _nisus
 32521	formativus_ of the nemasperm on the one hand and on the other a happily
 32522	chosen position, _succubitus felix_ of the passive element. The other
 32523	problem raised by the same inquirer is scarcely less vital: infant
 32524	mortality. It is interesting because, as he pertinently remarks, we
 32525	are all born in the same way but we all die in different ways. Mr M.
 32526	Mulligan (Hyg. et Eug. Doc.) blames the sanitary conditions in which
 32527	our greylunged citizens contract adenoids, pulmonary complaints etc. by
 32528	inhaling the bacteria which lurk in dust. These factors, he alleged,
 32529	and the revolting spectacles offered by our streets, hideous publicity
 32530	posters, religious ministers of all denominations, mutilated soldiers
 32531	and sailors, exposed scorbutic cardrivers, the suspended carcases of
 32532	dead animals, paranoic bachelors and unfructified duennas--these, he
 32533	said, were accountable for any and every fallingoff in the calibre of
 32534	the race. Kalipedia, he prophesied, would soon be generally adopted
 32535	and all the graces of life, genuinely good music, agreeable literature,
 32536	light philosophy, instructive pictures, plastercast reproductions of
 32537	the classical statues such as Venus and Apollo, artistic coloured
 32538	photographs of prize babies, all these little attentions would enable
 32539	ladies who were in a particular condition to pass the intervening months
 32540	in a most enjoyable manner. Mr J. Crotthers (Disc. Bacc.) attributes
 32541	some of these demises to abdominal trauma in the case of women workers
 32542	subjected to heavy labours in the workshop and to marital discipline in
 32543	the home but by far the vast majority to neglect, private or official,
 32544	culminating in the exposure of newborn infants, the practice of criminal
 32545	abortion or in the atrocious crime of infanticide. Although the former
 32546	(we are thinking of neglect) is undoubtedly only too true the case he
 32547	cites of nurses forgetting to count the sponges in the peritoneal cavity
 32548	is too rare to be normative. In fact when one comes to look into it the
 32549	wonder is that so many pregnancies and deliveries go off so well as they
 32550	do, all things considered and in spite of our human shortcomings which
 32551	often baulk nature in her intentions. An ingenious suggestion is
 32552	that thrown out by Mr V. Lynch (Bacc. Arith.) that both natality and
 32553	mortality, as well as all other phenomena of evolution, tidal movements,
 32554	lunar phases, blood temperatures, diseases in general, everything, in
 32555	fine, in nature's vast workshop from the extinction of some remote sun
 32556	to the blossoming of one of the countless flowers which beautify our
 32557	public parks is subject to a law of numeration as yet unascertained.
 32558	Still the plain straightforward question why a child of normally healthy
 32559	parents and seemingly a healthy child and properly looked after succumbs
 32560	unaccountably in early childhood (though other children of the same
 32561	marriage do not) must certainly, in the poet's words, give us pause.
 32562	Nature, we may rest assured, has her own good and cogent reasons for
 32563	whatever she does and in all probability such deaths are due to some law
 32564	of anticipation by which organisms in which morbous germs have taken
 32565	up their residence (modern science has conclusively shown that only the
 32566	plasmic substance can be said to be immortal) tend to disappear at an
 32567	increasingly earlier stage of development, an arrangement which, though
 32568	productive of pain to some of our feelings (notably the maternal), is
 32569	nevertheless, some of us think, in the long run beneficial to the
 32570	race in general in securing thereby the survival of the fittest. Mr S.
 32571	Dedalus' (Div. Scep.) remark (or should it be called an interruption?)
 32572	that an omnivorous being which can masticate, deglute, digest and
 32573	apparently pass through the ordinary channel with pluterperfect
 32574	imperturbability such multifarious aliments as cancrenous females
 32575	emaciated by parturition, corpulent professional gentlemen, not to speak
 32576	of jaundiced politicians and chlorotic nuns, might possibly find gastric
 32577	relief in an innocent collation of staggering bob, reveals as nought
 32578	else could and in a very unsavoury light the tendency above alluded to.
 32579	For the enlightenment of those who are not so intimately acquainted with
 32580	the minutiae of the municipal abattoir as this morbidminded esthete and
 32581	embryo philosopher who for all his overweening bumptiousness in things
 32582	scientific can scarcely distinguish an acid from an alkali prides
 32583	himself on being, it should perhaps be stated that staggering bob in
 32584	the vile parlance of our lowerclass licensed victuallers signifies the
 32585	cookable and eatable flesh of a calf newly dropped from its mother. In
 32586	a recent public controversy with Mr L. Bloom (Pubb. Canv.) which took
 32587	place in the commons' hall of the National Maternity Hospital, 29, 30
 32588	and 31 Holles street, of which, as is well known, Dr A. Horne (Lic. in
 32589	Midw., F. K. Q. C. P. I.) is the able and popular master, he is reported
 32590	by eyewitnesses as having stated that once a woman has let the cat
 32591	into the bag (an esthete's allusion, presumably, to one of the most
 32592	complicated and marvellous of all nature's processes--the act of sexual
 32593	congress) she must let it out again or give it life, as he phrased it,
 32594	to save her own. At the risk of her own, was the telling rejoinder of
 32595	his interlocutor, none the less effective for the moderate and measured
 32596	tone in which it was delivered.
 32597	
 32598	Meanwhile the skill and patience of the physician had brought about a
 32599	happy _accouchement._ It had been a weary weary while both for patient
 32600	and doctor. All that surgical skill could do was done and the brave
 32601	woman had manfully helped. She had. She had fought the good fight and
 32602	now she was very very happy. Those who have passed on, who have gone
 32603	before, are happy too as they gaze down and smile upon the touching
 32604	scene. Reverently look at her as she reclines there with the motherlight
 32605	in her eyes, that longing hunger for baby fingers (a pretty sight it is
 32606	to see), in the first bloom of her new motherhood, breathing a silent
 32607	prayer of thanksgiving to One above, the Universal Husband. And as her
 32608	loving eyes behold her babe she wishes only one blessing more, to have
 32609	her dear Doady there with her to share her joy, to lay in his arms that
 32610	mite of God's clay, the fruit of their lawful embraces. He is older now
 32611	(you and I may whisper it) and a trifle stooped in the shoulders yet
 32612	in the whirligig of years a grave dignity has come to the conscientious
 32613	second accountant of the Ulster bank, College Green branch. O Doady,
 32614	loved one of old, faithful lifemate now, it may never be again, that
 32615	faroff time of the roses! With the old shake of her pretty head she
 32616	recalls those days. God! How beautiful now across the mist of years! But
 32617	their children are grouped in her imagination about the bedside, hers
 32618	and his, Charley, Mary Alice, Frederick Albert (if he had lived), Mamy,
 32619	Budgy (Victoria Frances), Tom, Violet Constance Louisa, darling little
 32620	Bobsy (called after our famous hero of the South African war, lord Bobs
 32621	of Waterford and Candahar) and now this last pledge of their union, a
 32622	Purefoy if ever there was one, with the true Purefoy nose. Young hopeful
 32623	will be christened Mortimer Edward after the influential third cousin of
 32624	Mr Purefoy in the Treasury Remembrancer's office, Dublin Castle. And so
 32625	time wags on: but father Cronion has dealt lightly here. No, let no sigh
 32626	break from that bosom, dear gentle Mina. And Doady, knock the ashes from
 32627	your pipe, the seasoned briar you still fancy when the curfew rings for
 32628	you (may it be the distant day!) and dout the light whereby you read
 32629	in the Sacred Book for the oil too has run low, and so with a tranquil
 32630	heart to bed, to rest. He knows and will call in His own good time. You
 32631	too have fought the good fight and played loyally your man's part. Sir,
 32632	to you my hand. Well done, thou good and faithful servant!
 32633	
 32634	There are sins or (let us call them as the world calls them) evil
 32635	memories which are hidden away by man in the darkest places of the heart
 32636	but they abide there and wait. He may suffer their memory to grow dim,
 32637	let them be as though they had not been and all but persuade himself
 32638	that they were not or at least were otherwise. Yet a chance word will
 32639	call them forth suddenly and they will rise up to confront him in the
 32640	most various circumstances, a vision or a dream, or while timbrel
 32641	and harp soothe his senses or amid the cool silver tranquility of the
 32642	evening or at the feast, at midnight, when he is now filled with wine.
 32643	Not to insult over him will the vision come as over one that lies under
 32644	her wrath, not for vengeance to cut him off from the living but shrouded
 32645	in the piteous vesture of the past, silent, remote, reproachful.
 32646	
 32647	The stranger still regarded on the face before him a slow recession of
 32648	that false calm there, imposed, as it seemed, by habit or some studied
 32649	trick, upon words so embittered as to accuse in their speaker an
 32650	unhealthiness, a _flair,_ for the cruder things of life. A scene
 32651	disengages itself in the observer's memory, evoked, it would seem, by
 32652	a word of so natural a homeliness as if those days were really present
 32653	there (as some thought) with their immediate pleasures. A shaven space
 32654	of lawn one soft May evening, the wellremembered grove of lilacs at
 32655	Roundtown, purple and white, fragrant slender spectators of the game but
 32656	with much real interest in the pellets as they run slowly forward over
 32657	the sward or collide and stop, one by its fellow, with a brief alert
 32658	shock. And yonder about that grey urn where the water moves at times
 32659	in thoughtful irrigation you saw another as fragrant sisterhood, Floey,
 32660	Atty, Tiny and their darker friend with I know not what of arresting in
 32661	her pose then, Our Lady of the Cherries, a comely brace of them pendent
 32662	from an ear, bringing out the foreign warmth of the skin so daintily
 32663	against the cool ardent fruit. A lad of four or five in linseywoolsey
 32664	(blossomtime but there will be cheer in the kindly hearth when ere long
 32665	the bowls are gathered and hutched) is standing on the urn secured by
 32666	that circle of girlish fond hands. He frowns a little just as this young
 32667	man does now with a perhaps too conscious enjoyment of the danger but
 32668	must needs glance at whiles towards where his mother watches from the
 32669	PIAZZETTA giving upon the flowerclose with a faint shadow of remoteness
 32670	or of reproach (_alles Vergangliche_) in her glad look.
 32671	
 32672	Mark this farther and remember. The end comes suddenly. Enter that
 32673	antechamber of birth where the studious are assembled and note their
 32674	faces. Nothing, as it seems, there of rash or violent. Quietude of
 32675	custody, rather, befitting their station in that house, the vigilant
 32676	watch of shepherds and of angels about a crib in Bethlehem of Juda long
 32677	ago. But as before the lightning the serried stormclouds, heavy with
 32678	preponderant excess of moisture, in swollen masses turgidly distended,
 32679	compass earth and sky in one vast slumber, impending above parched field
 32680	and drowsy oxen and blighted growth of shrub and verdure till in an
 32681	instant a flash rives their centres and with the reverberation of the
 32682	thunder the cloudburst pours its torrent, so and not otherwise was the
 32683	transformation, violent and instantaneous, upon the utterance of the
 32684	word.
 32685	
 32686	Burke's! outflings my lord Stephen, giving the cry, and a tag and
 32687	bobtail of all them after, cockerel, jackanapes, welsher, pilldoctor,
 32688	punctual Bloom at heels with a universal grabbing at headgear,
 32689	ashplants, bilbos, Panama hats and scabbards, Zermatt alpenstocks and
 32690	what not. A dedale of lusty youth, noble every student there. Nurse
 32691	Callan taken aback in the hallway cannot stay them nor smiling surgeon
 32692	coming downstairs with news of placentation ended, a full pound if a
 32693	milligramme. They hark him on. The door! It is open? Ha! They are out,
 32694	tumultuously, off for a minute's race, all bravely legging it, Burke's
 32695	of Denzille and Holles their ulterior goal. Dixon follows giving them
 32696	sharp language but raps out an oath, he too, and on. Bloom stays with
 32697	nurse a thought to send a kind word to happy mother and nurseling up
 32698	there. Doctor Diet and Doctor Quiet. Looks she too not other now? Ward
 32699	of watching in Horne's house has told its tale in that washedout pallor.
 32700	Then all being gone, a glance of motherwit helping, he whispers close in
 32701	going: Madam, when comes the storkbird for thee?
 32702	
 32703	The air without is impregnated with raindew moisture, life essence
 32704	celestial, glistening on Dublin stone there under starshiny _coelum._
 32705	God's air, the Allfather's air, scintillant circumambient cessile air.
 32706	Breathe it deep into thee. By heaven, Theodore Purefoy, thou hast done a
 32707	doughty deed and no botch! Thou art, I vow, the remarkablest progenitor
 32708	barring none in this chaffering allincluding most farraginous chronicle.
 32709	Astounding! In her lay a Godframed Godgiven preformed possibility which
 32710	thou hast fructified with thy modicum of man's work. Cleave to her!
 32711	Serve! Toil on, labour like a very bandog and let scholarment and all
 32712	Malthusiasts go hang. Thou art all their daddies, Theodore. Art drooping
 32713	under thy load, bemoiled with butcher's bills at home and ingots (not
 32714	thine!) in the countinghouse? Head up! For every newbegotten thou shalt
 32715	gather thy homer of ripe wheat. See, thy fleece is drenched. Dost envy
 32716	Darby Dullman there with his Joan? A canting jay and a rheumeyed
 32717	curdog is all their progeny. Pshaw, I tell thee! He is a mule, a dead
 32718	gasteropod, without vim or stamina, not worth a cracked kreutzer.
 32719	Copulation without population! No, say I! Herod's slaughter of the
 32720	innocents were the truer name. Vegetables, forsooth, and sterile
 32721	cohabitation! Give her beefsteaks, red, raw, bleeding! She is a hoary
 32722	pandemonium of ills, enlarged glands, mumps, quinsy, bunions, hayfever,
 32723	bedsores, ringworm, floating kidney, Derbyshire neck, warts, bilious
 32724	attacks, gallstones, cold feet, varicose veins. A truce to threnes and
 32725	trentals and jeremies and all such congenital defunctive music! Twenty
 32726	years of it, regret them not. With thee it was not as with many that
 32727	will and would and wait and never--do. Thou sawest thy America, thy
 32728	lifetask, and didst charge to cover like the transpontine bison. How
 32729	saith Zarathustra? _Deine Kuh TrÃ¼bsal melkest Du. Nun Trinkst Du die
 32730	sÃ¼sse Milch des Euters_. See! it displodes for thee in abundance. Drink,
 32731	man, an udderful! Mother's milk, Purefoy, the milk of human kin, milk
 32732	too of those burgeoning stars overhead rutilant in thin rainvapour,
 32733	punch milk, such as those rioters will quaff in their guzzling den, milk
 32734	of madness, the honeymilk of Canaan's land. Thy cow's dug was tough,
 32735	what? Ay, but her milk is hot and sweet and fattening. No dollop this
 32736	but thick rich bonnyclaber. To her, old patriarch! Pap! _Per deam
 32737	Partulam et Pertundam nunc est bibendum_!
 32738	
 32739	All off for a buster, armstrong, hollering down the street. Bonafides.
 32740	Where you slep las nigh? Timothy of the battered naggin. Like ole
 32741	Billyo. Any brollies or gumboots in the fambly? Where the Henry Nevil's
 32742	sawbones and ole clo? Sorra one o' me knows. Hurrah there, Dix! Forward
 32743	to the ribbon counter. Where's Punch? All serene. Jay, look at the
 32744	drunken minister coming out of the maternity hospal! _Benedicat vos
 32745	omnipotens Deus, Pater et Filius_. A make, mister. The Denzille lane
 32746	boys. Hell, blast ye! Scoot. Righto, Isaacs, shove em out of the
 32747	bleeding limelight. Yous join uz, dear sir? No hentrusion in life. Lou
 32748	heap good man. Allee samee dis bunch. _En avant, mes enfants_! Fire
 32749	away number one on the gun. Burke's! Burke's! Thence they advanced five
 32750	parasangs. Slattery's mounted foot. Where's that bleeding awfur? Parson
 32751	Steve, apostates' creed! No, no, Mulligan! Abaft there! Shove ahead.
 32752	Keep a watch on the clock. Chuckingout time. Mullee! What's on you? _Ma
 32753	mÃ¨re m'a mariÃ©e._ British Beatitudes! _Retamplatan Digidi Boumboum_.
 32754	Ayes have it. To be printed and bound at the Druiddrum press by two
 32755	designing females. Calf covers of pissedon green. Last word in art
 32756	shades. Most beautiful book come out of Ireland my time. _Silentium!_
 32757	Get a spurt on. Tention. Proceed to nearest canteen and there annex
 32758	liquor stores. March! Tramp, tramp, tramp, the boys are (atitudes!)
 32759	parching. Beer, beef, business, bibles, bulldogs battleships, buggery
 32760	and bishops. Whether on the scaffold high. Beer, beef, trample the
 32761	bibles. When for Irelandear. Trample the trampellers. Thunderation! Keep
 32762	the durned millingtary step. We fall. Bishops boosebox. Halt! Heave to.
 32763	Rugger. Scrum in. No touch kicking. Wow, my tootsies! You hurt? Most
 32764	amazingly sorry!
 32765	
 32766	Query. Who's astanding this here do? Proud possessor of damnall. Declare
 32767	misery. Bet to the ropes. Me nantee saltee. Not a red at me this week
 32768	gone. Yours? Mead of our fathers for the _Ãbermensch._ Dittoh. Five
 32769	number ones. You, sir? Ginger cordial. Chase me, the cabby's caudle.
 32770	Stimulate the caloric. Winding of his ticker. Stopped short never to go
 32771	again when the old. Absinthe for me, savvy? _Caramba!_ Have an eggnog or
 32772	a prairie oyster. Enemy? Avuncular's got my timepiece. Ten to. Obligated
 32773	awful. Don't mention it. Got a pectoral trauma, eh, Dix? Pos fact. Got
 32774	bet be a boomblebee whenever he wus settin sleepin in hes bit garten.
 32775	Digs up near the Mater. Buckled he is. Know his dona? Yup, sartin I do.
 32776	Full of a dure. See her in her dishybilly. Peels off a credit. Lovey
 32777	lovekin. None of your lean kine, not much. Pull down the blind, love.
 32778	Two Ardilauns. Same here. Look slippery. If you fall don't wait to get
 32779	up. Five, seven, nine. Fine! Got a prime pair of mincepies, no kid. And
 32780	her take me to rests and her anker of rum. Must be seen to be believed.
 32781	Your starving eyes and allbeplastered neck you stole my heart, O
 32782	gluepot. Sir? Spud again the rheumatiz? All poppycock, you'll scuse me
 32783	saying. For the hoi polloi. I vear thee beest a gert vool. Well, doc?
 32784	Back fro Lapland? Your corporosity sagaciating O K? How's the squaws
 32785	and papooses? Womanbody after going on the straw? Stand and deliver.
 32786	Password. There's hair. Ours the white death and the ruddy birth. Hi!
 32787	Spit in your own eye, boss! Mummer's wire. Cribbed out of Meredith.
 32788	Jesified, orchidised, polycimical jesuit! Aunty mine's writing Pa Kinch.
 32789	Baddybad Stephen lead astray goodygood Malachi.
 32790	
 32791	Hurroo! Collar the leather, youngun. Roun wi the nappy. Here, Jock braw
 32792	Hielentman's your barleybree. Lang may your lum reek and your kailpot
 32793	boil! My tipple. _Merci._ Here's to us. How's that? Leg before wicket.
 32794	Don't stain my brandnew sitinems. Give's a shake of peppe, you there.
 32795	Catch aholt. Caraway seed to carry away. Twig? Shrieks of silence. Every
 32796	cove to his gentry mort. Venus Pandemos. _Les petites femmes_. Bold bad
 32797	girl from the town of Mullingar. Tell her I was axing at her. Hauding
 32798	Sara by the wame. On the road to Malahide. Me? If she who seduced me had
 32799	left but the name. What do you want for ninepence? Machree, macruiskeen.
 32800	Smutty Moll for a mattress jig. And a pull all together. _Ex!_
 32801	
 32802	Waiting, guvnor? Most deciduously. Bet your boots on. Stunned like,
 32803	seeing as how no shiners is acoming. Underconstumble? He've got the
 32804	chink _ad lib_. Seed near free poun on un a spell ago a said war hisn.
 32805	Us come right in on your invite, see? Up to you, matey. Out with the
 32806	oof. Two bar and a wing. You larn that go off of they there Frenchy
 32807	bilks? Won't wash here for nuts nohow. Lil chile velly solly. Ise de
 32808	cutest colour coon down our side. Gawds teruth, Chawley. We are nae fou.
 32809	We're nae tha fou. Au reservoir, mossoo. Tanks you.
 32810	
 32811	'Tis, sure. What say? In the speakeasy. Tight. I shee you, shir. Bantam,
 32812	two days teetee. Bowsing nowt but claretwine. Garn! Have a glint, do.
 32813	Gum, I'm jiggered. And been to barber he have. Too full for words. With
 32814	a railway bloke. How come you so? Opera he'd like? Rose of Castile. Rows
 32815	of cast. Police! Some H2O for a gent fainted. Look at Bantam's flowers.
 32816	Gemini. He's going to holler. The colleen bawn. My colleen bawn. O,
 32817	cheese it! Shut his blurry Dutch oven with a firm hand. Had the winner
 32818	today till I tipped him a dead cert. The ruffin cly the nab of Stephen
 32819	Hand as give me the jady coppaleen. He strike a telegramboy paddock wire
 32820	big bug Bass to the depot. Shove him a joey and grahamise. Mare on form
 32821	hot order. Guinea to a goosegog. Tell a cram, that. Gospeltrue. Criminal
 32822	diversion? I think that yes. Sure thing. Land him in chokeechokee if the
 32823	harman beck copped the game. Madden back Madden's a maddening back. O
 32824	lust our refuge and our strength. Decamping. Must you go? Off to mammy.
 32825	Stand by. Hide my blushes someone. All in if he spots me. Come ahome,
 32826	our Bantam. Horryvar, mong vioo. Dinna forget the cowslips for hersel.

 32830	I ses, if that aint a sheeny nachez, vel, I vil get misha mishinnah.

 32903	
 32904	_The Mabbot street entrance of nighttown, before which stretches
 32905	an uncobbled tramsiding set with skeleton tracks, red and green
 32906	will-o'-the-wisps and danger signals. Rows of grimy houses with gaping
 32907	doors. Rare lamps with faint rainbow fins. Round Rabaiotti's halted ice
 32908	gondola stunted men and women squabble. They grab wafers between which
 32909	are wedged lumps of coral and copper snow. Sucking, they scatter slowly.
 32910	Children. The swancomb of the gondola, highreared, forges on through the
 32911	murk, white and blue under a lighthouse. Whistles call and answer._
 32912	
 32913	THE CALLS: Wait, my love, and I'll be with you.
 32914	
 32915	THE ANSWERS: Round behind the stable.
 32916	
 32917	_(A deafmute idiot with goggle eyes, his shapeless mouth dribbling,
 32918	jerks past, shaken in Saint Vitus' dance. A chain of children 's hands
 32919	imprisons him.)_
 32920	
 32921	THE CHILDREN: Kithogue! Salute!
 32922	
 32923	THE IDIOT: _(Lifts a palsied left arm and gurgles)_ Grhahute!
 32924	
 32925	THE CHILDREN: Where's the great light?
 32926	
 32927	THE IDIOT: _(Gobbing)_ Ghaghahest.
 32928	
 32929	_(They release him. He jerks on. A pigmy woman swings on a rope slung
 32930	between two railings, counting. A form sprawled against a dustbin and
 32931	muffled by its arm and hat snores, groans, grinding growling teeth, and
 32932	snores again. On a step a gnome totting among a rubbishtip crouches
 32933	to shoulder a sack of rags and bones. A crone standing by with a smoky
 32934	oillamp rams her last bottle in the maw of his sack. He heaves his
 32935	booty, tugs askew his peaked cap and hobbles off mutely. The crone
 32936	makes back for her lair, swaying her lamp. A bandy child, asquat on the
 32937	doorstep with a paper shuttlecock, crawls sidling after her in spurts,
 32938	clutches her skirt, scrambles up. A drunken navvy grips with both hands
 32939	the railings of an area, lurching heavily. At a comer two night watch in
 32940	shouldercapes, their hands upon their staffholsters, loom tall. A plate
 32941	crashes: a woman screams: a child wails. Oaths of a man roar, mutter,
 32942	cease. Figures wander, lurk, peer from warrens. In a room lit by a
 32943	candle stuck in a bottleneck a slut combs out the tatts from the hair
 32944	of a scrofulous child. Cissy Caffrey's voice, still young, sings shrill
 32945	from a lane.)_

 33000

 33003	
 33004	EDY BOARDMAN: _(Bickering)_ And says the one: I seen you up Faithful
 33005	place with your squarepusher, the greaser off the railway, in his
 33006	cometobed hat. Did you, says I. That's not for you to say, says I. You
 33007	never seen me in the mantrap with a married highlander, says I. The
 33008	likes of her! Stag that one is! Stubborn as a mule! And her walking with
 33009	two fellows the one time, Kilbride, the enginedriver, and lancecorporal
 33010	Oliphant.

 33015	over the world. A liver and white spaniel on the prowl slinks after him,
 33016	growling. Lynch scares it with a kick.)_

 33018	LYNCH: So that?
 33019	
 33020	STEPHEN: (_Looks behind_) So that gesture, not music not odour, would be
 33021	a universal language, the gift of tongues rendering visible not the lay
 33022	sense but the first entelechy, the structural rhythm.
 33023

 33025

 33027	the allwisest Stagyrite was bitted, bridled and mounted by a light of
 33028	love.

 33031

 33043	turned, in planes intersecting, the fingers about to part, the left
 33044	being higher.)_

 33048	
 33049	_(They pass. Tommy Caffrey scrambles to a gaslamp and, clasping, climbs
 33050	in spasms. From the top spur he slides down. Jacky Caffrey clasps to
 33051	climb. The navvy lurches against the lamp. The twins scuttle off in the
 33052	dark. The navvy, swaying, presses a forefinger against a wing of his
 33053	nose and ejects from the farther nostril a long liquid jet of snot.
 33054	Shouldering the lamp he staggers away through the crowd with his flaring
 33055	cresset._
 33056	
 33057	_Snakes of river fog creep slowly. From drains, clefts, cesspools,
 33058	middens arise on all sides stagnant fumes. A glow leaps in the south
 33059	beyond the seaward reaches of the river. The navvy, staggering forward,
 33060	cleaves the crowd and lurches towards the tramsiding on the farther side
 33061	under the railway bridge bloom appears, flushed, panting, cramming bread
 33062	and chocolate into a sidepocket. From Gillen's hairdresser's window a
 33063	composite portrait shows him gallant Nelson's image. A concave mirror
 33064	at the side presents to him lovelorn longlost lugubru Booloohoom. Grave
 33065	Gladstone sees him level, Bloom for Bloom. he passes, struck by the
 33066	stare of truculent Wellington, but in the convex mirror grin unstruck
 33067	the bonham eyes and fatchuck cheekchops of Jollypoldy the rixdix doldy._
 33068	
 33069	_At Antonio Pabaiotti's door Bloom halts, sweated under the bright
 33070	arclamp. He disappears. In a moment he reappears and hurries on.)_
 33071	
 33072	BLOOM: Fish and taters. N. g. Ah!
 33073	
 33074	_(He disappears into Olhausen's, the porkbutcher's, under the downcoming
 33075	rollshutter. A few moments later he emerges from under the shutter,
 33076	puffing Poldy, blowing Bloohoom. In each hand he holds a parcel, one
 33077	containing a lukewarm pig's crubeen, the other a cold sheep's trotter,
 33078	sprinkled with wholepepper. He gasps, standing upright. Then bending to
 33079	one side he presses a parcel against his ribs and groans.)_
 33080	
 33081	BLOOM: Stitch in my side. Why did I run?
 33082	
 33083	_(He takes breath with care and goes forward slowly towards the lampset
 33084	siding. The glow leaps again.)_
 33085	
 33086	BLOOM: What is that? A flasher? Searchlight.
 33087	
 33088	_(He stands at Cormack's corner, watching)_
 33089	
 33090	BLOOM: _Aurora borealis_ or a steel foundry? Ah, the brigade, of course.
 33091	South side anyhow. Big blaze. Might be his house. Beggar's bush. We're
 33092	safe. _(He hums cheerfully)_ London's burning, London's burning! On
 33093	fire, on fire! (_He catches sight of the navvy lurching through the
 33094	crowd at the farther side of Talbot street_) I'll miss him. Run. Quick.
 33095	Better cross here.
 33096	
 33097	_(He darts to cross the road. Urchins shout.)_

 33100	lanterns aswing, swim by him, grazing him, their bells rattling_)
 33101

 33103

 33105	
 33106	_(He looks round, darts forward suddenly. Through rising fog a dragon
 33107	sandstrewer, travelling at caution, slews heavily down upon him,

 33109	motorman bangs his footgong.)_

 33113	_(The brake cracks violently. Bloom, raising a policeman's whitegloved

 33115	forward, pugnosed, on the guidewheel, yells as he slides past over
 33116	chains and keys.)_

 33119	
 33120	BLOOM: _(Bloom trickleaps to the curbstone and halts again. He brushes a
 33121	mudflake from his cheek with a parcelled hand.)_ No thoroughfare. Close
 33122	shave that but cured the stitch. Must take up Sandow's exercises again.
 33123	On the hands down. Insure against street accident too. The Providential.
 33124	_(He feels his trouser pocket)_ Poor mamma's panacea. Heel easily catch
 33125	in track or bootlace in a cog. Day the wheel of the black Maria peeled
 33126	off my shoe at Leonard's corner. Third time is the charm. Shoe trick.
 33127	Insolent driver. I ought to report him. Tension makes them nervous.
 33128	Might be the fellow balked me this morning with that horsey woman. Same
 33129	style of beauty. Quick of him all the same. The stiff walk. True word
 33130	spoken in jest. That awful cramp in Lad lane. Something poisonous I
 33131	ate. Emblem of luck. Why? Probably lost cattle. Mark of the beast. _(He
 33132	closes his eyes an instant)_ Bit light in the head. Monthly or effect of
 33133	the other. Brainfogfag. That tired feeling. Too much for me now. Ow!

 33154	letter headed _In darkest Stepaside_. Keep, keep, keep to the right.
 33155	Rags and bones at midnight. A fence more likely. First place murderer
 33156	makes for. Wash off his sins of the world.

 33162

 33167	BLOOM: Beware of pickpockets. Old thieves' dodge. Collide. Then snatch
 33168	your purse.
 33169	
 33170	_(The retriever approaches sniffing, nose to the ground. A sprawled form
 33171	sneezes. A stooped bearded figure appears garbed in the long caftan
 33172	of an elder in Zion and a smokingcap with magenta tassels. Horned
 33173	spectacles hang down at the wings of the nose. Yellow poison streaks are
 33174	on the drawn face.)_
 33175	
 33176	RUDOLPH: Second halfcrown waste money today. I told you not go with
 33177	drunken goy ever. So you catch no money.
 33178	
 33179	BLOOM: _(Hides the crubeen and trotter behind his back and, crestfallen,
 33180	feels warm and cold feetmeat) Ja, ich weiss, papachi._
 33181	
 33182	RUDOLPH: What you making down this place? Have you no soul? _(with
 33183	feeble vulture talons he feels the silent face of Bloom)_ Are you not
 33184	my son Leopold, the grandson of Leopold? Are you not my dear son Leopold
 33185	who left the house of his father and left the god of his fathers Abraham
 33186	and Jacob?
 33187	
 33188	BLOOM: _(With precaution)_ I suppose so, father. Mosenthal. All that's
 33189	left of him.
 33190	
 33191	RUDOLPH: _(Severely)_ One night they bring you home drunk as dog after
 33192	spend your good money. What you call them running chaps?
 33193	
 33194	BLOOM: _(In youth's smart blue Oxford suit with white vestslips,
 33195	narrowshouldered, in brown Alpine hat, wearing gent's sterling silver
 33196	waterbury keyless watch and double curb Albert with seal attached, one
 33197	side of him coated with stiffening mud)_ Harriers, father. Only that
 33198	once.
 33199	
 33200	RUDOLPH: Once! Mud head to foot. Cut your hand open. Lockjaw. They make
 33201	you kaputt, Leopoldleben. You watch them chaps.
 33202	
 33203	BLOOM: _(Weakly)_ They challenged me to a sprint. It was muddy. I
 33204	slipped.
 33205	
 33206	RUDOLPH: _(With contempt) Goim nachez_! Nice spectacles for your poor
 33207	mother!
 33208	
 33209	BLOOM: Mamma!
 33210	
 33211	ELLEN BLOOM: _(In pantomime dame's stringed mobcap, widow Twankey's
 33212	crinoline and bustle, blouse with muttonleg sleeves buttoned behind,
 33213	grey mittens and cameo brooch, her plaited hair in a crispine net,
 33214	appears over the staircase banisters, a slanted candlestick in her hand,
 33215	and cries out in shrill alarm)_ O blessed Redeemer, what have they done
 33216	to him! My smelling salts! _(She hauls up a reef of skirt and ransacks
 33217	the pouch of her striped blay petticoat. A phial, an Agnus Dei, a
 33218	shrivelled potato and a celluloid doll fall out)_ Sacred Heart of Mary,
 33219	where were you at all at all?
 33220	
 33221	_(Bloom, mumbling, his eyes downcast, begins to bestow his parcels in
 33222	his filled pockets but desists, muttering.)_
 33223	
 33224	A VOICE: _(Sharply)_ Poldy!
 33225	
 33226	BLOOM: Who? _(He ducks and wards off a blow clumsily)_ At your service.
 33227	
 33228	_(He looks up. Beside her mirage of datepalms a handsome woman in
 33229	Turkish costume stands before him. Opulent curves fill out her scarlet
 33230	trousers and jacket, slashed with gold. A wide yellow cummerbund girdles
 33231	her. A white yashmak, violet in the night, covers her face, leaving free
 33232	only her large dark eyes and raven hair.)_
 33233	
 33234	BLOOM: Molly!
 33235	
 33236	MARION: Welly? Mrs Marion from this out, my dear man, when you speak to
 33237	me. _(Satirically)_ Has poor little hubby cold feet waiting so long?
 33238	
 33239	BLOOM: _(Shifts from foot to foot)_ No, no. Not the least little bit.
 33240	
 33241	_(He breathes in deep agitation, swallowing gulps of air, questions,
 33242	hopes, crubeens for her supper, things to tell her, excuse, desire,
 33243	spellbound. A coin gleams on her forehead. On her feet are jewelled
 33244	toerings. Her ankles are linked by a slender fetterchain. Beside her
 33245	a camel, hooded with a turreting turban, waits. A silk ladder of
 33246	innumerable rungs climbs to his bobbing howdah. He ambles near with
 33247	disgruntled hindquarters. Fiercely she slaps his haunch, her goldcurb
 33248	wristbangles angriling, scolding him in Moorish.)_
 33249	
 33250	MARION: Nebrakada! Femininum!
 33251	
 33252	_(The camel, lifting a foreleg, plucks from a tree a large mango fruit,
 33253	offers it to his mistress, blinking, in his cloven hoof, then droops his
 33254	head and, grunting, with uplifted neck, fumbles to kneel. Bloom stoops
 33255	his back for leapfrog.)_
 33256	
 33257	BLOOM: I can give you... I mean as your business menagerer... Mrs
 33258	Marion... if you...
 33259	
 33260	MARION: So you notice some change? _(Her hands passing slowly over her
 33261	trinketed stomacher, a slow friendly mockery in her eyes)_ O Poldy,
 33262	Poldy, you are a poor old stick in the mud! Go and see life. See the
 33263	wide world.
 33264	
 33265	BLOOM: I was just going back for that lotion whitewax, orangeflower
 33266	water. Shop closes early on Thursday. But the first thing in the
 33267	morning. _(He pats divers pockets)_ This moving kidney. Ah!
 33268	
 33269	_(He points to the south, then to the east. A cake of new clean lemon
 33270	soap arises, diffusing light and perfume.)_
 33271	
 33272	THE SOAP: We're a capital couple are Bloom and I. He brightens the
 33273	earth. I polish the sky.
 33274	
 33275	
 33276	_(The freckled face of Sweny, the druggist, appears in the disc of the
 33277	soapsun.)_
 33278	
 33279	SWENY: Three and a penny, please.
 33280	
 33281	BLOOM: Yes. For my wife. Mrs Marion. Special recipe.
 33282	
 33283	MARION: _(Softly)_ Poldy!
 33284	
 33285	BLOOM: Yes, ma'am?
 33286	
 33287	MARION: _ti trema un poco il cuore?_
 33288	
 33289	_(In disdain she saunters away, plump as a pampered pouter pigeon,
 33290	humming the duet from_ Don Giovanni.)
 33291	
 33292	BLOOM: Are you sure about that _voglio_? I mean the pronunciati...
 33293	
 33294	_(He follows, followed by the sniffing terrier. The elderly bawd seizes
 33295	his sleeve, the bristles of her chinmole glittering.)_
 33296	
 33297	THE BAWD: Ten shillings a maidenhead. Fresh thing was never touched.
 33298	Fifteen. There's no-one in it only her old father that's dead drunk.
 33299	
 33300	_(She points. In the gap of her dark den furtive, rainbedraggled, Bridie
 33301	Kelly stands.)_
 33302	
 33303	BRIDIE: Hatch street. Any good in your mind?
 33304	
 33305	_(With a squeak she flaps her bat shawl and runs. A burly rough pursues
 33306	with booted strides. He stumbles on the steps, recovers, plunges into
 33307	gloom. Weak squeaks of laughter are heard, weaker.)_
 33308	
 33309	THE BAWD: _(Her wolfeyes shining)_ He's getting his pleasure. You won't
 33310	get a virgin in the flash houses. Ten shillings. Don't be all night
 33311	before the polis in plain clothes sees us. Sixtyseven is a bitch.
 33312	
 33313	_(Leering, Gerty Macdowell limps forward. She draws from behind, ogling,
 33314	and shows coyly her bloodied clout.)_
 33315	
 33316	GERTY: With all my worldly goods I thee and thou. _(She murmurs)_ You
 33317	did that. I hate you.
 33318	
 33319	BLOOM: I? When? You're dreaming. I never saw you.
 33320	
 33321	THE BAWD: Leave the gentleman alone, you cheat. Writing the gentleman
 33322	false letters. Streetwalking and soliciting. Better for your mother take
 33323	the strap to you at the bedpost, hussy like you.
 33324	
 33325	GERTY: _(To Bloom)_ When you saw all the secrets of my bottom drawer.
 33326	_(She paws his sleeve, slobbering)_ Dirty married man! I love you for
 33327	doing that to me.
 33328	
 33329	_(She glides away crookedly. Mrs Breen in man's frieze overcoat
 33330	with loose bellows pockets, stands in the causeway, her roguish eyes
 33331	wideopen, smiling in all her herbivorous buckteeth.)_
 33332	
 33333	MRS BREEN: Mr...
 33334	
 33335	BLOOM: _(Coughs gravely)_ Madam, when we last had this pleasure by
 33336	letter dated the sixteenth instant...
 33337	
 33338	MRS BREEN: Mr Bloom! You down here in the haunts of sin! I caught you
 33339	nicely! Scamp!
 33340	
 33341	BLOOM: _(Hurriedly)_ Not so loud my name. Whatever do you think of me?
 33342	Don't give me away. Walls have ears. How do you do? It's ages since I.
 33343	You're looking splendid. Absolutely it. Seasonable weather we are having
 33344	this time of year. Black refracts heat. Short cut home here. Interesting
 33345	quarter. Rescue of fallen women. Magdalen asylum. I am the secretary...
 33346	
 33347	MRS BREEN: _(Holds up a finger)_ Now, don't tell a big fib! I know
 33348	somebody won't like that. O just wait till I see Molly! _(Slily)_
 33349	Account for yourself this very sminute or woe betide you!
 33350	
 33351	BLOOM: _(Looks behind)_ She often said she'd like to visit. Slumming.
 33352	The exotic, you see. Negro servants in livery too if she had money.
 33353	Othello black brute. Eugene Stratton. Even the bones and cornerman at
 33354	the Livermore christies. Bohee brothers. Sweep for that matter.
 33355	
 33356	_(Tom and Sam Bohee, coloured coons in white duck suits, scarlet socks,
 33357	upstarched Sambo chokers and large scarlet asters in their buttonholes,
 33358	leap out. Each has his banjo slung. Their paler smaller negroid hands
 33359	jingle the twingtwang wires. Flashing white Kaffir eyes and tusks they
 33360	rattle through a breakdown in clumsy clogs, twinging, singing, back to
 33361	back, toe heel, heel toe, with smackfatclacking nigger lips.)_
 33362	
 33363	TOM AND SAM:
 33364	
 33365	     There's someone in the house with Dina
 33366	     There's someone in the house, I know,
 33367	     There's someone in the house with Dina
 33368	     Playing on the old banjo.
 33369	
 33370	_(They whisk black masks from raw babby faces: then, chuckling,
