 34887	states that he was a very posthumous child. I appeal for clemency in the
 34888	name of the most sacred word our vocal organs have ever been called upon
 34889	to speak. He is about to have a baby.
 34890	
 34891	_(General commotion and compassion. Women faint. A wealthy American
 34892	makes a street collection for Bloom. Gold and silver coins, blank
 34893	cheques, banknotes, jewels, treasury bonds, maturing bills of exchange,
 34894	I. O. U's, wedding rings, watchchains, lockets, necklaces and bracelets
 34895	are rapidly collected.)_
 34896	
 34897	BLOOM: O, I so want to be a mother.
 34898	
 34899	MRS THORNTON: _(In nursetender's gown)_ Embrace me tight, dear. You'll
 34900	be soon over it. Tight, dear.
 34901	
 34902	_(Bloom embraces her tightly and bears eight male yellow and white
 34903	children. They appear on a redcarpeted staircase adorned with expensive
 34904	plants. All the octuplets are handsome, with valuable metallic faces,
 34905	wellmade, respectably dressed and wellconducted, speaking five modern
 34906	languages fluently and interested in various arts and sciences. Each
 34907	has his name printed in legible letters on his shirtfront: Nasodoro,
 34908	Goldfinger, Chrysostomos, Maindoree, Silversmile, Silberselber,
 34909	Vifargent, Panargyros. They are immediately appointed to positions of
 34910	high public trust in several different countries as managing directors
 34911	of banks, traffic managers of railways, chairmen of limited liability
 34912	companies, vicechairmen of hotel syndicates.)_
 34913	
 34914	A VOICE: Bloom, are you the Messiah ben Joseph or ben David?
 34915	
 34916	BLOOM: _(Darkly)_ You have said it.
 34917	
 34918	BROTHER BUZZ: Then perform a miracle like Father Charles.
 34919	
 34920	BANTAM LYONS: Prophesy who will win the Saint Leger.
 34921	
 34922	_(Bloom walks on a net, covers his left eye with his left ear, passes
 34923	through several walls, climbs Nelson's Pillar, hangs from the top ledge
 34924	by his eyelids, eats twelve dozen oysters (shells included), heals
 34925	several sufferers from king's evil, contracts his face so as to resemble
 34926	many historical personages, Lord Beaconsfield, Lord Byron, Wat Tyler,
 34927	Moses of Egypt, Moses Maimonides, Moses Mendelssohn, Henry Irving, Rip
 34928	van Winkle, Kossuth, Jean Jacques Rousseau, Baron Leopold Rothschild,
 34929	Robinson Crusoe, Sherlock Holmes, Pasteur, turns each foot
 34930	simultaneously in different directions, bids the tide turn back,
 34931	eclipses the sun by extending his little finger.)_
 34932	
 34933	BRINI, PAPAL NUNCIO: _(In papal zouave's uniform, steel cuirasses as
 34934	breastplate, armplates, thighplates, legplates, large profane moustaches
 34935	and brown paper mitre) Leopoldi autem generatio._ Moses begat Noah
 34936	and Noah begat Eunuch and Eunuch begat O'Halloran and O'Halloran begat
 34937	Guggenheim and Guggenheim begat Agendath and Agendath begat Netaim and
 34938	Netaim begat Le Hirsch and Le Hirsch begat Jesurum and Jesurum begat
 34939	MacKay and MacKay begat Ostrolopsky and Ostrolopsky begat Smerdoz
 34940	and Smerdoz begat Weiss and Weiss begat Schwarz and Schwarz begat
 34941	Adrianopoli and Adrianopoli begat Aranjuez and Aranjuez begat Lewy
 34942	Lawson and Lewy Lawson begat Ichabudonosor and Ichabudonosor begat
 34943	O'Donnell Magnus and O'Donnell Magnus begat Christbaum and Christbaum
 34944	begat ben Maimun and ben Maimun begat Dusty Rhodes and Dusty Rhodes
 34945	begat Benamor and Benamor begat Jones-Smith and Jones-Smith begat
 34946	Savorgnanovich and Savorgnanovich begat Jasperstone and Jasperstone
 34947	begat Vingtetunieme and Vingtetunieme begat Szombathely and Szombathely
 34948	begat Virag and Virag begat Bloom _et vocabitur nomen eius Emmanuel._
 34949	
 34950	A DEADHAND: _(Writes on the wall)_ Bloom is a cod.
 34951	
 34952	CRAB: _(In bushranger's kit)_ What did you do in the cattlecreep behind
 34953	Kilbarrack?
 34954	
 34955	A FEMALE INFANT: _(Shakes a rattle)_ And under Ballybough bridge?
 34956	
 34957	A HOLLYBUSH: And in the devil's glen?
 34958	
 34959	BLOOM: _(Blushes furiously all over from frons to nates, three tears
 34960	filling from his left eye)_ Spare my past.
 34961	
 34962	THE IRISH EVICTED TENANTS: _(In bodycoats, kneebreeches, with Donnybrook
 34963	fair shillelaghs)_ Sjambok him!
 34964	
 34965	_(Bloom with asses' ears seats himself in the pillory with crossed arms,
 34966	his feet protruding. He whistles_ Don Giovanni, a cenar teco. _Artane
 34967	orphans, joining hands, caper round him. Girls of the Prison Gate
 34968	Mission, joining hands, caper round in the opposite direction.)_
 34969	
 34970	THE ARTANE ORPHANS:
 34971	
 34972	     You hig, you hog, you dirty dog!
 34973	     You think the ladies love you!
 34974	     THE PRISON GATE GIRLS:
 34975	
 34976	
 34977	     If you see Kay
 34978	     Tell him he may
 34979	     See you in tea
 34980	     Tell him from me.
 34981	
 34982	HORNBLOWER: _(In ephod and huntingcap, announces)_ And he shall carry
 34983	the sins of the people to Azazel, the spirit which is in the wilderness,
 34984	and to Lilith, the nighthag. And they shall stone him and defile him,
 34985	yea, all from Agendath Netaim and from Mizraim, the land of Ham.
 34986	
 34987	_(All the people cast soft pantomime stones at Bloom. Many bonafide
 34988	travellers and ownerless dogs come near him and defile him. Mastiansky
 34989	and Citron approach in gaberdines, wearing long earlocks. They wag their
 34990	beards at Bloom.)_
 34991	
 34992	MASTIANSKY AND CITRON: Belial! Laemlein of Istria, the false Messiah!
 34993	Abulafia! Recant!
 34994	
 34995	_(George R Mesias, Bloom's tailor, appears, a tailor's goose under his
 34996	arm, presenting a bill)_
 34997	
 34998	MESIAS: To alteration one pair trousers eleven shillings.
 34999	
 35000	BLOOM: _(Rubs his hands cheerfully)_ Just like old times. Poor Bloom!
 35001	
 35002	_(Reuben J Dodd, blackbearded iscariot, bad shepherd, bearing on his
 35003	shoulders the drowned corpse of his son, approaches the pillory.)_
 35004	
 35005	REUBEN J: _(Whispers hoarsely)_ The squeak is out. A split is gone for
 35006	the flatties. Nip the first rattler.
 35007	
 35008	THE FIRE BRIGADE: Pflaap!
 35009	
 35010	BROTHER BUZZ: _(Invests Bloom in a yellow habit with embroidery of
 35011	painted flames and high pointed hat. He places a bag of gunpowder round
 35012	his neck and hands him over to the civil power, saying)_ Forgive him his
 35013	trespasses.
 35014	
 35015	_(Lieutenant Myers of the Dublin Fire Brigade by general request sets
 35016	fire to Bloom. Lamentations.)_
 35017	
 35018	THE CITIZEN: Thank heaven!
 35019	
 35020	BLOOM: _(In a seamless garment marked I. H. S. stands upright amid
 35021	phoenix flames)_ Weep not for me, O daughters of Erin.
 35022	
 35023	_(He exhibits to Dublin reporters traces of burning. The daughters of
 35024	Erin, in black garments, with large prayerbooks and long lighted candles
 35025	in their hands, kneel down and pray.)_
 35026	
 35027	THE DAUGHTERS OF ERIN:
 35028	
 35029	     Kidney of Bloom, pray for us
 35030	     Flower of the Bath, pray for us
 35031	     Mentor of Menton, pray for us
 35032	     Canvasser for the Freeman, pray for us
 35033	     Charitable Mason, pray for us
 35034	     Wandering Soap, pray for us
 35035	     Sweets of Sin, pray for us
 35036	     Music without Words, pray for us
 35037	     Reprover of the Citizen, pray for us
 35038	     Friend of all Frillies, pray for us
 35039	     Midwife Most Merciful, pray for us
 35040	     Potato Preservative against Plague and Pestilence, pray for us.
 35041	
 35042	_(A choir of six hundred voices, conducted by Vincent O'brien, sings
 35043	the chorus from Handel's Messiah alleluia for the lord god omnipotent
 35044	reigneth, accompanied on the organ by Joseph Glynn. Bloom becomes mute,
 35045	shrunken, carbonised.)_
 35046	
 35047	
 35048	ZOE: Talk away till you're black in the face.
 35049	
 35050	BLOOM: _(In caubeen with clay pipe stuck in the band, dusty brogues, an
 35051	emigrant's red handkerchief bundle in his hand, leading a black bogoak
 35052	pig by a sugaun, with a smile in his eye)_ Let me be going now, woman of
 35053	the house, for by all the goats in Connemara I'm after having the
 35054	father and mother of a bating. _(With a tear in his eye)_ All insanity.
 35055	Patriotism, sorrow for the dead, music, future of the race. To be or not
 35056	to be. Life's dream is o'er. End it peacefully. They can live on. _(He
 35057	gazes far away mournfully)_ I am ruined. A few pastilles of aconite. The
 35058	blinds drawn. A letter. Then lie back to rest. _(He breathes softly)_ No
 35059	more. I have lived. Fare. Farewell.
 35060	
 35061	ZOE: _(Stiffly, her finger in her neckfillet)_ Honest? Till the next
 35062	time. _(She sneers)_ Suppose you got up the wrong side of the bed or
 35063	came too quick with your best girl. O, I can read your thoughts!
 35064	
 35065	BLOOM: _(Bitterly)_ Man and woman, love, what is it? A cork and bottle.
 35066	I'm sick of it. Let everything rip.
 35067	
 35068	ZOE: _(In sudden sulks)_ I hate a rotter that's insincere. Give a
 35069	bleeding whore a chance.
 35070	
 35071	BLOOM: _(Repentantly)_ I am very disagreeable. You are a necessary evil.
 35072	Where are you from? London?
 35073	
 35074	ZOE: _(Glibly)_ Hog's Norton where the pigs plays the organs. I'm
 35075	Yorkshire born. _(She holds his hand which is feeling for her nipple)_
 35076	I say, Tommy Tittlemouse. Stop that and begin worse. Have you cash for a
 35077	short time? Ten shillings?
 35078	
 35079	BLOOM: _(Smiles, nods slowly)_ More, houri, more.
 35080	
 35081	ZOE: And more's mother? _(She pats him offhandedly with velvet paws)_
 35082	Are you coming into the musicroom to see our new pianola? Come and I'll
 35083	peel off.
 35084	
 35085	BLOOM: _(Feeling his occiput dubiously with the unparalleled
 35086	embarrassment of a harassed pedlar gauging the symmetry of her peeled
 35087	pears)_ Somebody would be dreadfully jealous if she knew. The greeneyed
 35088	monster. _(Earnestly)_ You know how difficult it is. I needn't tell you.
 35089	
 35090	ZOE: _(Flattered)_ What the eye can't see the heart can't grieve for.
 35091	_(She pats him)_ Come.
 35092	
 35093	BLOOM: Laughing witch! The hand that rocks the cradle.
 35094	
 35095	ZOE: Babby!
 35096	
 35097	BLOOM: _(In babylinen and pelisse, bigheaded, with a caul of dark hair,
 35098	fixes big eyes on her fluid slip and counts its bronze buckles with a
 35099	chubby finger, his moist tongue lolling and lisping)_ One two tlee: tlee
 35100	tlwo tlone.
 35101	
 35102	THE BUCKLES: Love me. Love me not. Love me.
 35103	
 35104	ZOE: Silent means consent. _(With little parted talons she captures his
 35105	hand, her forefinger giving to his palm the passtouch of secret monitor,
 35106	luring him to doom.)_ Hot hands cold gizzard.
 35107	
 35108	_(He hesitates amid scents, music, temptations. She leads him towards
 35109	the steps, drawing him by the odour of her armpits, the vice of her
 35110	painted eyes, the rustle of her slip in whose sinuous folds lurks the
 35111	lion reek of all the male brutes that have possessed her.)_
 35112	
 35113	THE MALE BRUTES: _(Exhaling sulphur of rut and dung and ramping in their
 35114	loosebox, faintly roaring, their drugged heads swaying to and fro)_
 35115	Good!
 35116	
 35117	_(Zoe and Bloom reach the doorway where two sister whores are seated.
 35118	They examine him curiously from under their pencilled brows and smile to
 35119	his hasty bow. He trips awkwardly.)_
 35120	
 35121	ZOE: _(Her lucky hand instantly saving him)_ Hoopsa! Don't fall
 35122	upstairs.
 35123	
 35124	BLOOM: The just man falls seven times. _(He stands aside at the
 35125	threshold)_ After you is good manners.
 35126	
 35127	ZOE: Ladies first, gentlemen after.
 35128	
 35129	_(She crosses the threshold. He hesitates. She turns and, holding out
 35130	her hands, draws him over. He hops. On the antlered rack of the hall
 35131	hang a man 's hat and waterproof. Bloom uncovers himself but, seeing
 35132	them, frowns, then smiles, preoccupied. A door on the return landing is
 35133	flung open. A man in purple shirt and grey trousers, brownsocked, passes
 35134	with an ape's gait, his bald head and goatee beard upheld, hugging a
 35135	full waterjugjar, his twotailed black braces dangling at heels. Averting
 35136	his face quickly Bloom bends to examine on the halltable the spaniel
 35137	eyes of a running fox: then, his lifted head sniffing, follows Zoe
 35138	into the musicroom. A shade of mauve tissuepaper dims the light of the
 35139	chandelier. Round and round a moth flies, colliding, escaping. The
 35140	floor is covered with an oilcloth mosaic of jade and azure and cinnabar
 35141	rhomboids. Footmarks are stamped over it in all senses, heel to heel,
 35142	heel to hollow, toe to toe, feet locked, a morris of shuffling feet
 35143	without body phantoms, all in a scrimmage higgledypiggledy. The walls
 35144	are tapestried with a paper of yewfronds and clear glades. In the grate
 35145	is spread a screen of peacock feathers. Lynch squats crosslegged on
 35146	the hearthrug of matted hair, his cap back to the front. With a wand he
 35147	beats time slowly. Kitty Ricketts, a bony pallid whore in navy costume,
 35148	doeskin gloves rolled back from a coral wristlet, a chain purse in
 35149	her hand, sits perched on the edge of the table swinging her leg and
 35150	glancing at herself in the gilt mirror over the mantelpiece. A tag
 35151	of her corsetlace hangs slightly below her jacket. Lynch indicates
 35152	mockingly the couple at the piano.)_
 35153	
 35154	KITTY: _(Coughs behind her hand)_ She's a bit imbecillic. _(She signs
 35155	with a waggling forefinger)_ Blemblem. _(Lynch lifts up her skirt and
 35156	white petticoat with his wand she settles them down quickly.)_ Respect
 35157	yourself. _(She hiccups, then bends quickly her sailor hat under which
 35158	her hair glows, red with henna)_ O, excuse!
 35159	
 35160	ZOE: More limelight, Charley. _(She goes to the chandelier and turns the
 35161	gas full cock)_
 35162	
 35163	KITTY: _(Peers at the gasjet)_ What ails it tonight?
 35164	
 35165	LYNCH: _(Deeply)_ Enter a ghost and hobgoblins.
 35166	
 35167	ZOE: Clap on the back for Zoe.
 35168	
 35169	_(The wand in Lynch's hand flashes: a brass poker. Stephen stands at
 35170	the pianola on which sprawl his hat and ashplant. With two fingers he
 35171	repeats once more the series of empty fifths. Florry Talbot, a blond
 35172	feeble goosefat whore in a tatterdemalion gown of mildewed strawberry,
 35173	lolls spreadeagle in the sofacorner, her limp forearm pendent over the
 35174	bolster, listening. A heavy stye droops over her sleepy eyelid.)_
 35175	
 35176	KITTY: _(Hiccups again with a kick of her horsed foot)_ O, excuse!
 35177	
 35178	ZOE: _(Promptly)_ Your boy's thinking of you. Tie a knot on your shift.
 35179	
 35180	_(Kitty Ricketts bends her head. Her boa uncoils, slides, glides over
 35181	her shoulder, back, arm, chair to the ground. Lynch lifts the curled
 35182	caterpillar on his wand. She snakes her neck, nestling. Stephen glances
 35183	behind at the squatted figure with its cap back to the front.)_
 35184	
 35185	STEPHEN: As a matter of fact it is of no importance whether Benedetto
 35186	Marcello found it or made it. The rite is the poet's rest. It may be an
 35187	old hymn to Demeter or also illustrate _Coela enarrant gloriam Domini._
 35188	It is susceptible of nodes or modes as far apart as hyperphrygian and
 35189	mixolydian and of texts so divergent as priests haihooping round David's
 35190	that is Circe's or what am I saying Ceres' altar and David's tip
 35191	from the stable to his chief bassoonist about the alrightness of his
 35192	almightiness. _Mais nom de nom,_ that is another pair of trousers.
 35193	_Jetez la gourme. Faut que jeunesse se passe. (He stops, points at
 35194	Lynch's cap, smiles, laughs)_ Which side is your knowledge bump?
 35195	
 35196	THE CAP: _(With saturnine spleen)_ Bah! It is because it is. Woman's
 35197	reason. Jewgreek is greekjew. Extremes meet. Death is the highest form
 35198	of life. Bah!
 35199	
 35200	STEPHEN: You remember fairly accurately all my errors, boasts, mistakes.
 35201	How long shall I continue to close my eyes to disloyalty? Whetstone!
 35202	
 35203	THE CAP: Bah!
 35204	
 35205	STEPHEN: Here's another for you. _(He frowns)_ The reason is because
 35206	the fundamental and the dominant are separated by the greatest possible
 35207	interval which...
 35208	
 35209	THE CAP: Which? Finish. You can't.
 35210	
 35211	STEPHEN: _(With an effort)_ Interval which. Is the greatest possible
 35212	ellipse. Consistent with. The ultimate return. The octave. Which.
 35213	
 35214	THE CAP: Which?
 35215	
 35216	_(Outside the gramophone begins to blare_ The Holy City.)
 35217	
 35218	STEPHEN: _(Abruptly)_ What went forth to the ends of the world to
 35219	traverse not itself, God, the sun, Shakespeare, a commercial traveller,
 35220	having itself traversed in reality itself becomes that self. Wait a
 35221	moment. Wait a second. Damn that fellow's noise in the street. Self
 35222	which it itself was ineluctably preconditioned to become. _Ecco!_
 35223	
 35224	LYNCH: _(With a mocking whinny of laughter grins at Bloom and Zoe
 35225	Higgins)_ What a learned speech, eh?
 35226	
 35227	ZOE: _(Briskly)_ God help your head, he knows more than you have
 35228	forgotten.
 35229	
 35230	_(With obese stupidity Florry Talbot regards Stephen.)_
 35231	
 35232	FLORRY: They say the last day is coming this summer.
 35233	
 35234	KITTY: No!
 35235	
 35236	ZOE: _(Explodes in laughter)_ Great unjust God!
 35237	
 35238	FLORRY: _(Offended)_ Well, it was in the papers about Antichrist. O, my
 35239	foot's tickling.
 35240	
 35241	_(Ragged barefoot newsboys, jogging a wagtail kite, patter past,
 35242	yelling.)_
 35243	
 35244	THE NEWSBOYS: Stop press edition. Result of the rockinghorse races. Sea
 35245	serpent in the royal canal. Safe arrival of Antichrist.
 35246	
 35247	_(Stephen turns and sees Bloom.)_
 35248	
 35249	STEPHEN: A time, times and half a time.
 35250	
 35251	_(Reuben I Antichrist, wandering jew, a clutching hand open on his
 35252	spine, stumps forward. Across his loins is slung a pilgrim's wallet from
 35253	which protrude promissory notes and dishonoured bills. Aloft over his
 35254	shoulder he bears a long boatpole from the hook of which the sodden
 35255	huddled mass of his only son, saved from Liffey waters, hangs from
 35256	the slack of its breeches. A hobgoblin in the image of Punch Costello,
 35257	hipshot, crookbacked, hydrocephalic, prognathic with receding forehead
 35258	and Ally Sloper nose, tumbles in somersaults through the gathering
 35259	darkness.)_
 35260	
 35261	ALL: What?
 35262	
 35263	THE HOBGOBLIN: _(His jaws chattering, capers to and fro, goggling his
 35264	eyes, squeaking, kangaroohopping with outstretched clutching arms, then
 35265	all at once thrusts his lipless face through the fork of his thighs) Il
 35266	vient! C'est moi! L'homme qui rit! L'homme primigene! (He whirls round
 35267	and round with dervish howls) Sieurs et dames, faites vos jeux! (He
 35268	crouches juggling. Tiny roulette planets fly from his hands.) Les jeux
 35269	sont faits! (The planets rush together, uttering crepitant cracks) Rien
 35270	va plus! (The planets, buoyant balloons, sail swollen up and away. He
 35271	springs off into vacuum.)_
 35272	
 35273	FLORRY: _(Sinking into torpor, crossing herself secretly)_ The end of
 35274	the world!
 35275	
 35276	_(A female tepid effluvium leaks out from her. Nebulous obscurity
 35277	occupies space. Through the drifting fog without the gramophone blares
 35278	over coughs and feetshuffling.)_
 35279	
 35280	THE GRAMOPHONE: Jerusalem!
 35281	
 35282	Open your gates and sing
 35283	
 35284	Hosanna...
 35285	
 35286	_(A rocket rushes up the sky and bursts. A white star fills from it,
 35287	proclaiming the consummation of all things and second coming of Elijah.
 35288	Along an infinite invisible tightrope taut from zenith to nadir the End
 35289	of the World, a twoheaded octopus in gillie's kilts, busby and tartan
 35290	filibegs, whirls through the murk, head over heels, in the form of the
 35291	Three Legs of Man.)_
 35292	
 35293	THE END OF THE WORLD: _(with a Scotch accent)_ Wha'll dance the keel
 35294	row, the keel row, the keel row?
 35295	
 35296	_(Over the possing drift and choking breathcoughs, Elijah's voice, harsh
 35297	as a corncrake's, jars on high. Perspiring in a loose lawn surplice with
 35298	funnel sleeves he is seen, vergerfaced, above a rostrum about which the
 35299	banner of old glory is draped. He thumps the parapet.)_
 35300	
 35301	ELIJAH: No yapping, if you please, in this booth. Jake Crane, Creole
 35302	Sue, Dove Campbell, Abe Kirschner, do your coughing with your mouths
 35303	shut. Say, I am operating all this trunk line. Boys, do it now. God's
 35304	time is 12.25. Tell mother you'll be there. Rush your order and you play
 35305	a slick ace. Join on right here. Book through to eternity junction, the
 35306	nonstop run. Just one word more. Are you a god or a doggone clod? If the
 35307	second advent came to Coney Island are we ready? Florry Christ, Stephen
 35308	Christ, Zoe Christ, Bloom Christ, Kitty Christ, Lynch Christ, it's up to
 35309	you to sense that cosmic force. Have we cold feet about the cosmos?
 35310	No. Be on the side of the angels. Be a prism. You have that something
 35311	within, the higher self. You can rub shoulders with a Jesus, a Gautama,
 35312	an Ingersoll. Are you all in this vibration? I say you are. You once
 35313	nobble that, congregation, and a buck joyride to heaven becomes a back
 35314	number. You got me? It's a lifebrightener, sure. The hottest stuff ever
 35315	was. It's the whole pie with jam in. It's just the cutest snappiest line
 35316	out. It is immense, supersumptuous. It restores. It vibrates. I know
 35317	and I am some vibrator. Joking apart and, getting down to bedrock, A.
 35318	J. Christ Dowie and the harmonial philosophy, have you got that? O. K.
 35319	Seventyseven west sixtyninth street. Got me? That's it. You call me up
 35320	by sunphone any old time. Bumboosers, save your stamps. _(He shouts)_
 35321	Now then our glory song. All join heartily in the singing. Encore! _(He
 35322	sings)_ Jeru...
 35323	
 35324	THE GRAMOPHONE: _(Drowning his voice)_ Whorusalaminyourhighhohhhh...
 35325	_(The disc rasps gratingly against the needle)_
 35326	
 35327	THE THREE WHORES: _(Covering their ears, squawk)_ Ahhkkk!
 35328	
 35329	ELIJAH: _(In rolledup shirtsleeves, black in the face, shouts at the top
 35330	of his voice, his arms uplifted)_ Big Brother up there, Mr President,
 35331	you hear what I done just been saying to you. Certainly, I sort of
 35332	believe strong in you, Mr President. I certainly am thinking now Miss
 35333	Higgins and Miss Ricketts got religion way inside them. Certainly seems
 35334	to me I don't never see no wusser scared female than the way you been,
 35335	Miss Florry, just now as I done seed you. Mr President, you come long
 35336	and help me save our sisters dear. _(He winks at his audience)_ Our Mr
 35337	President, he twig the whole lot and he aint saying nothing.
 35338	
 35339	KITTY-KATE: I forgot myself. In a weak moment I erred and did what I did
 35340	on Constitution hill. I was confirmed by the bishop and enrolled in
 35341	the brown scapular. My mother's sister married a Montmorency. It was a
 35342	working plumber was my ruination when I was pure.
 35343	
 35344	ZOE-FANNY: I let him larrup it into me for the fun of it.
 35345	
 35346	FLORRY-TERESA: It was in consequence of a portwine beverage on top of
 35347	Hennessy's three star. I was guilty with Whelan when he slipped into the
 35348	bed.
 35349	
 35350	STEPHEN: In the beginning was the word, in the end the world without
 35351	end. Blessed be the eight beatitudes.
 35352	
 35353	_(The beatitudes, Dixon, Madden, Crotthers, Costello, Lenehan, Bannon,
 35354	Mulligan and Lynch in white surgical students' gowns, four abreast,
 35355	goosestepping, tramp fist past in noisy marching)_
 35356	
 35357	THE BEATITUDES: _(Incoherently)_ Beer beef battledog buybull businum
 35358	barnum buggerum bishop.
 35359	
 35360	LYSTER: _(In quakergrey kneebreeches and broadbrimmed hat, says
 35361	discreetly)_ He is our friend. I need not mention names. Seek thou the
 35362	light.
 35363	
 35364	_(He corantos by. Best enters in hairdresser's attire, shinily
 35365	laundered, his locks in curlpapers. He leads John Eglinton who wears a
 35366	mandarin's kimono of Nankeen yellow, lizardlettered, and a high pagoda
 35367	hat.)_
 35368	
 35369	BEST: _(Smiling, lifts the hat and displays a shaven poll from the crown
 35370	of which bristles a pigtail toupee tied with an orange topknot)_ I was
 35371	just beautifying him, don't you know. A thing of beauty, don't you know,
 35372	Yeats says, or I mean, Keats says.
 35373	
 35374	JOHN EGLINTON: _(Produces a greencapped dark lantern and flashes it
 35375	towards a corner: with carping accent)_ Esthetics and cosmetics are for
 35376	the boudoir. I am out for truth. Plain truth for a plain man. Tanderagee
 35377	wants the facts and means to get them.
 35378	
 35379	_(In the cone of the searchlight behind the coalscuttle, ollave,
 35380	holyeyed, the bearded figure of Mananaun Maclir broods, chin on knees.
 35381	He rises slowly. A cold seawind blows from his druid mouth. About his
 35382	head writhe eels and elvers. He is encrusted with weeds and shells. His
 35383	right hand holds a bicycle pump. His left hand grasps a huge crayfish by
 35384	its two talons.)_
 35385	
 35386	MANANAUN MACLIR: _(With a voice of waves)_ Aum! Hek! Wal! Ak! Lub! Mor!
 35387	Ma! White yoghin of the gods. Occult pimander of Hermes Trismegistos.
 35388	_(With a voice of whistling seawind)_ Punarjanam patsypunjaub! I won't
 35389	have my leg pulled. It has been said by one: beware the left, the cult
 35390	of Shakti. _(With a cry of stormbirds)_ Shakti Shiva, darkhidden Father!
 35391	_(He smites with his bicycle pump the crayfish in his left hand. On its
 35392	cooperative dial glow the twelve signs of the zodiac. He wails with
 35393	the vehemence of the ocean.)_ Aum! Baum! Pyjaum! I am the light of the
 35394	homestead! I am the dreamery creamery butter.
 35395	
 35396	_(A skeleton judashand strangles the light. The green light wanes to
 35397	mauve. The gasjet wails whistling.)_
 35398	
 35399	THE GASJET: Pooah! Pfuiiiiiii!
 35400	
 35401	_(Zoe runs to the chandelier and, crooking her leg, adjusts the
 35402	mantle.)_
 35403	
 35404	ZOE: Who has a fag as I'm here?
 35405	
 35406	LYNCH: _(Tossing a cigarette on to the table)_ Here.
 35407	
 35408	ZOE: _(Her head perched aside in mock pride)_ Is that the way to hand
 35409	the _pot_ to a lady? _(She stretches up to light the cigarette over the
 35410	flame, twirling it slowly, showing the brown tufts of her armpits. Lynch
 35411	with his poker lifts boldly a side of her slip. Bare from her garters up
 35412	her flesh appears under the sapphire a nixie's green. She puffs calmly
 35413	at her cigarette.)_ Can you see the beautyspot of my behind?
 35414	
 35415	LYNCH: I'm not looking
 35416	
 35417	ZOE: _(Makes sheep's eyes)_ No? You wouldn't do a less thing. Would you
 35418	suck a lemon?
 35419	
 35420	_(Squinting in mock shame she glances with sidelong meaning at Bloom,
 35421	then twists round towards him, pulling her slip free of the poker. Blue
 35422	fluid again flows over her flesh. Bloom stands, smiling desirously,
 35423	twirling his thumbs. Kitty Ricketts licks her middle finger with her
 35424	spittle and, gazing in the mirror, smooths both eyebrows. Lipoti Virag,
 35425	basilicogrammate, chutes rapidly down through the chimneyflue and struts
 35426	two steps to the left on gawky pink stilts. He is sausaged into several
 35427	overcoats and wears a brown macintosh under which he holds a roll of
 35428	parchment. In his left eye flashes the monocle of Cashel Boyle O'connor
 35429	Fitzmaurice Tisdall Farrell. On his head is perched an Egyptian pshent.
 35430	Two quills project over his ears.)_
 35431	
 35432	VIRAG: _(Heels together, bows)_ My name is Virag Lipoti, of Szombathely.
 35433	_(He coughs thoughtfully, drily)_ Promiscuous nakedness is much in
 35434	evidence hereabouts, eh? Inadvertently her backview revealed the fact
 35435	that she is not wearing those rather intimate garments of which you
 35436	are a particular devotee. The injection mark on the thigh I hope you
 35437	perceived? Good.
 35438	
 35439	BLOOM: Granpapachi. But...
 35440	
 35441	VIRAG: Number two on the other hand, she of the cherry rouge and
 35442	coiffeuse white, whose hair owes not a little to our tribal elixir of
 35443	gopherwood, is in walking costume and tightly staysed by her sit, I
 35444	should opine. Backbone in front, so to say. Correct me but I always
 35445	understood that the act so performed by skittish humans with glimpses of
 35446	lingerie appealed to you in virtue of its exhibitionististicicity. In a
 35447	word. Hippogriff. Am I right?
 35448	
 35449	BLOOM: She is rather lean.
 35450	
 35451	VIRAG: _(Not unpleasantly)_ Absolutely! Well observed and those pannier
 35452	pockets of the skirt and slightly pegtop effect are devised to suggest
 35453	bunchiness of hip. A new purchase at some monster sale for which a gull
 35454	has been mulcted. Meretricious finery to deceive the eye. Observe the
 35455	attention to details of dustspecks. Never put on you tomorrow what you
 35456	can wear today. Parallax! _(With a nervous twitch of his head)_ Did you
 35457	hear my brain go snap? Pollysyllabax!
 35458	
 35459	BLOOM: _(An elbow resting in a hand, a forefinger against his cheek)_
 35460	She seems sad.
 35461	
 35462	VIRAG: _(Cynically, his weasel teeth bared yellow, draws down his left
 35463	eye with a finger and barks hoarsely)_ Hoax! Beware of the flapper
 35464	and bogus mournful. Lily of the alley. All possess bachelor's button
 35465	discovered by Rualdus Columbus. Tumble her. Columble her. Chameleon.
 35466	_(More genially)_ Well then, permit me to draw your attention to item
 35467	number three. There is plenty of her visible to the naked eye. Observe
 35468	the mass of oxygenated vegetable matter on her skull. What ho, she
 35469	bumps! The ugly duckling of the party, longcasted and deep in keel.
 35470	
 35471	BLOOM: _(Regretfully)_ When you come out without your gun.
 35472	
 35473	VIRAG: We can do you all brands, mild, medium and strong. Pay your
 35474	money, take your choice. How happy could you be with either...
 35475	
 35476	BLOOM: With...?
 35477	
 35478	VIRAG: _(His tongue upcurling)_ Lyum! Look. Her beam is broad. She
 35479	is coated with quite a considerable layer of fat. Obviously mammal in
 35480	weight of bosom you remark that she has in front well to the fore two
 35481	protuberances of very respectable dimensions, inclined to fall in the
 35482	noonday soupplate, while on her rere lower down are two additional
 35483	protuberances, suggestive of potent rectum and tumescent for palpation,
 35484	which leave nothing to be desired save compactness. Such fleshy parts
 35485	are the product of careful nurture. When coopfattened their livers
 35486	reach an elephantine size. Pellets of new bread with fennygreek and
 35487	gumbenjamin swamped down by potions of green tea endow them during their
 35488	brief existence with natural pincushions of quite colossal blubber. That
 35489	suits your book, eh? Fleshhotpots of Egypt to hanker after. Wallow in
 35490	it. Lycopodium. _(His throat twitches)_ Slapbang! There he goes again.
 35491	
 35492	BLOOM: The stye I dislike.
 35493	
 35494	VIRAG: _(Arches his eyebrows)_ Contact with a goldring, they say.
 35495	_Argumentum ad feminam_, as we said in old Rome and ancient Greece
 35496	in the consulship of Diplodocus and Ichthyosauros. For the rest Eve's
 35497	sovereign remedy. Not for sale. Hire only. Huguenot. _(He twitches)_ It
 35498	is a funny sound. _(He coughs encouragingly)_ But possibly it is only a
 35499	wart. I presume you shall have remembered what I will have taught you on
 35500	that head? Wheatenmeal with honey and nutmeg.
 35501	
 35502	BLOOM: _(Reflecting)_ Wheatenmeal with lycopodium and syllabax. This
 35503	searching ordeal. It has been an unusually fatiguing day, a chapter of
 35504	accidents. Wait. I mean, wartsblood spreads warts, you said...
 35505	
 35506	VIRAG: _(Severely, his nose hardhumped, his side eye winking)_ Stop
 35507	twirling your thumbs and have a good old thunk. See, you have forgotten.
 35508	Exercise your mnemotechnic. _La causa Ã¨ santa_. Tara. Tara. _(Aside)_ He
 35509	will surely remember.
 35510	
 35511	BLOOM: Rosemary also did I understand you to say or willpower over
 35512	parasitic tissues. Then nay no I have an inkling. The touch of a
 35513	deadhand cures. Mnemo?
 35514	
 35515	VIRAG: _(Excitedly)_ I say so. I say so. E'en so. Technic. _(He taps his
 35516	parchmentroll energetically)_ This book tells you how to act with all
 35517	descriptive particulars. Consult index for agitated fear of aconite,
 35518	melancholy of muriatic, priapic pulsatilla. Virag is going to talk about
 35519	amputation. Our old friend caustic. They must be starved. Snip off with
 35520	horsehair under the denned neck. But, to change the venue to the Bulgar
 35521	and the Basque, have you made up your mind whether you like or dislike
 35522	women in male habiliments? _(With a dry snigger)_ You intended to devote
 35523	an entire year to the study of the religious problem and the summer
 35524	months of 1886 to square the circle and win that million. Pomegranate!
 35525	From the sublime to the ridiculous is but a step. Pyjamas, let us say?
 35526	Or stockingette gussetted knickers, closed? Or, put we the case,
 35527	those complicated combinations, camiknickers? _(He crows derisively)_
 35528	Keekeereekee!
 35529	
 35530	_(Bloom surveys uncertainly the three whores then gazes at the veiled
 35531	mauve light, hearing the everflying moth.)_
 35532	
 35533	BLOOM: I wanted then to have now concluded. Nightdress was never. Hence
 35534	this. But tomorrow is a new day will be. Past was is today. What now is
 35535	will then morrow as now was be past yester.
 35536	
 35537	VIRAG: _(Prompts in a pig's whisper)_ Insects of the day spend their
 35538	brief existence in reiterated coition, lured by the smell of the
 35539	inferiorly pulchritudinous fumale possessing extendified pudendal nerve
 35540	in dorsal region. Pretty Poll! _(His yellow parrotbeak gabbles nasally)_
 35541	They had a proverb in the Carpathians in or about the year five thousand
 35542	five hundred and fifty of our era. One tablespoonful of honey will
 35543	attract friend Bruin more than half a dozen barrels of first choice malt
 35544	vinegar. Bear's buzz bothers bees. But of this apart. At another time
 35545	we may resume. We were very pleased, we others. _(He coughs and, bending
 35546	his brow, rubs his nose thoughtfully with a scooping hand)_ You shall
 35547	find that these night insects follow the light. An illusion for remember
 35548	their complex unadjustable eye. For all these knotty points see the
 35549	seventeenth book of my Fundamentals of Sexology or the Love Passion
 35550	which Doctor L.B. says is the book sensation of the year. Some, to
 35551	example, there are again whose movements are automatic. Perceive. That
 35552	is his appropriate sun. Nightbird nightsun nighttown. Chase me, Charley!
 35553	_(He blows into bloom's ear)_ Buzz!
 35554	
 35555	BLOOM: Bee or bluebottle too other day butting shadow on wall dazed self
 35556	then me wandered dazed down shirt good job I...
 35557	
 35558	VIRAG: _(His face impassive, laughs in a rich feminine key)_ Splendid!
 35559	Spanish fly in his fly or mustard plaster on his dibble. _(He gobbles
 35560	gluttonously with turkey wattles)_ Bubbly jock! Bubbly jock! Where are
 35561	we? Open Sesame! Cometh forth! _(He unrolls his parchment rapidly and
 35562	reads, his glowworm's nose running backwards over the letters which he
 35563	claws)_ Stay, good friend. I bring thee thy answer. Redbank oysters will
 35564	shortly be upon us. I'm the best o'cook. Those succulent bivalves may
 35565	help us and the truffles of Perigord, tubers dislodged through mister
 35566	omnivorous porker, were unsurpassed in cases of nervous debility or
 35567	viragitis. Though they stink yet they sting. _(He wags his head with
 35568	cackling raillery)_ Jocular. With my eyeglass in my ocular. _(He
 35569	sneezes)_ Amen!
 35570	
 35571	BLOOM: _(Absently)_ Ocularly woman's bivalve case is worse. Always open
 35572	sesame. The cloven sex. Why they fear vermin, creeping things. Yet Eve
 35573	and the serpent contradicts. Not a historical fact. Obvious analogy
 35574	to my idea. Serpents too are gluttons for woman's milk. Wind their way
 35575	through miles of omnivorous forest to sucksucculent her breast dry. Like
 35576	those bubblyjocular Roman matrons one reads of in Elephantuliasis.
 35577	
 35578	VIRAG: _(His mouth projected in hard wrinkles, eyes stonily forlornly
 35579	closed, psalms in outlandish monotone)_ That the cows with their those
 35580	distended udders that they have been the the known...
 35581	
 35582	BLOOM: I am going to scream. I beg your pardon. Ah? So. _(He repeats)_
 35583	Spontaneously to seek out the saurian's lair in order to entrust their
 35584	teats to his avid suction. Ant milks aphis. _(Profoundly)_ Instinct
 35585	rules the world. In life. In death.
 35586	
 35587	VIRAG: _(Head askew, arches his back and hunched wingshoulders, peers
 35588	at the moth out of blear bulged eyes, points a horning claw and cries)_
 35589	Who's moth moth? Who's dear Gerald? Dear Ger, that you? O dear, he is
 35590	Gerald. O, I much fear he shall be most badly burned. Will some pleashe
 35591	pershon not now impediment so catastrophics mit agitation of firstclass
 35592	tablenumpkin? _(He mews)_ Puss puss puss puss! _(He sighs, draws back
 35593	and stares sideways down with dropping underjaw)_ Well, well. He doth
 35594	rest anon. (He snaps his jaws suddenly on the air)
 35595	
 35596	THE MOTH:
 35597	
 35598	     I'm a tiny tiny thing
 35599	     Ever flying in the spring
 35600	     Round and round a ringaring.
 35601	     Long ago I was a king
 35602	     Now I do this kind of thing
 35603	     On the wing, on the wing!
 35604	     Bing!
 35605	
 35606	_(He rushes against the mauve shade, flapping noisily)_ Pretty pretty
 35607	pretty pretty pretty pretty petticoats.
 35608	
 35609	_(From left upper entrance with two gliding steps Henry Flower comes
 35610	forward to left front centre. He wears a dark mantle and drooping plumed
 35611	sombrero. He carries a silverstringed inlaid dulcimer and a longstemmed
 35612	bamboo Jacob's pipe, its clay bowl fashioned as a female head. He wears
 35613	dark velvet hose and silverbuckled pumps. He has the romantic Saviour's
 35614	face with flowing locks, thin beard and moustache. His spindlelegs and
 35615	sparrow feet are those of the tenor Mario, prince of Candia. He settles
 35616	down his goffered ruffs and moistens his lips with a passage of his
 35617	amorous tongue.)_
 35618	
 35619	HENRY: _(In a low dulcet voice, touching the strings of his guitar)_
 35620	There is a flower that bloometh.
 35621	
 35622	_(Virag truculent, his jowl set, stares at the lamp. Grave Bloom regards
 35623	Zoe's neck. Henry gallant turns with pendant dewlap to the piano.)_
 35624	
 35625	STEPHEN: _(To himself)_ Play with your eyes shut. Imitate pa. Filling my
 35626	belly with husks of swine. Too much of this. I will arise and go to my.
 35627	Expect this is the. Steve, thou art in a parlous way. Must visit old
 35628	Deasy or telegraph. Our interview of this morning has left on me a deep
 35629	impression. Though our ages. Will write fully tomorrow. I'm partially
 35630	drunk, by the way. _(He touches the keys again)_ Minor chord comes now.
 35631	Yes. Not much however.
 35632	
 35633	_(Almidano Artifoni holds out a batonroll of music with vigorous
 35634	moustachework.)_
 35635	
 35636	ARTIFONI: _Ci rifletta. Lei rovina tutto._
 35637	
 35638	FLORRY: Sing us something. Love's old sweet song.
 35639	
 35640	STEPHEN: No voice. I am a most finished artist. Lynch, did I show you
 35641	the letter about the lute?
 35642	
 35643	FLORRY: _(Smirking)_ The bird that can sing and won't sing.
 35644	
 35645	_(The Siamese twins, Philip Drunk and Philip Sober, two Oxford dons with
 35646	lawnmowers, appear in the window embrasure. Both are masked with Matthew
 35647	Arnold's face.)_
 35648	
 35649	PHILIP SOBER: Take a fool's advice. All is not well. Work it out with
 35650	the buttend of a pencil, like a good young idiot. Three pounds twelve
 35651	you got, two notes, one sovereign, two crowns, if youth but knew.
 35652	Mooney's en ville, Mooney's sur mer, the Moira, Larchet's, Holles street
 35653	hospital, Burke's. Eh? I am watching you.
 35654	
 35655	PHILIP DRUNK: _(Impatiently)_ Ah, bosh, man. Go to hell! I paid my way.
 35656	If I could only find out about octaves. Reduplication of personality.
 35657	Who was it told me his name? _(His lawnmower begins to purr)_ Aha, yes.
 35658	_Zoe mou sas agapo_. Have a notion I was here before. When was it not
 35659	Atkinson his card I have somewhere. Mac Somebody. Unmack I have it. He
 35660	told me about, hold on, Swinburne, was it, no?
 35661	
 35662	FLORRY: And the song?
 35663	
 35664	STEPHEN: Spirit is willing but the flesh is weak.
 35665	
 35666	FLORRY: Are you out of Maynooth? You're like someone I knew once.
 35667	
 35668	STEPHEN: Out of it now. _(To himself)_ Clever.
 35669	
 35670	PHILIP DRUNK AND PHILIP SOBER: _(Their lawnmowers purring with a
 35671	rigadoon of grasshalms)_ Clever ever. Out of it out of it. By the
 35672	bye have you the book, the thing, the ashplant? Yes, there it, yes.
 35673	Cleverever outofitnow. Keep in condition. Do like us.
 35674	
 35675	ZOE: There was a priest down here two nights ago to do his bit of
 35676	business with his coat buttoned up. You needn't try to hide, I says to
 35677	him. I know you've a Roman collar.
 35678	
 35679	VIRAG: Perfectly logical from his standpoint. Fall of man. _(Harshly,
 35680	his pupils waxing)_ To hell with the pope! Nothing new under the sun. I
 35681	am the Virag who disclosed the Sex Secrets of Monks and Maidens. Why
 35682	I left the church of Rome. Read the Priest, the Woman and the
 35683	Confessional. Penrose. Flipperty Jippert. _(He wriggles)_ Woman, undoing
 35684	with sweet pudor her belt of rushrope, offers her allmoist yoni to man's
 35685	lingam. Short time after man presents woman with pieces of jungle meat.
 35686	Woman shows joy and covers herself with featherskins. Man loves her yoni
 35687	fiercely with big lingam, the stiff one. _(He cries) Coactus volui._
 35688	Then giddy woman will run about. Strong man grapses woman's wrist.
 35689	Woman squeals, bites, spucks. Man, now fierce angry, strikes woman's fat
 35690	yadgana. _(He chases his tail)_ Piffpaff! Popo! _(He stops, sneezes)_
 35691	Pchp! _(He worries his butt)_ Prrrrrht!
 35692	
 35693	LYNCH: I hope you gave the good father a penance. Nine glorias for
 35694	shooting a bishop.
 35695	
 35696	ZOE: _(Spouts walrus smoke through her nostrils)_ He couldn't get a
 35697	connection. Only, you know, sensation. A dry rush.
 35698	
 35699	BLOOM: Poor man!
 35700	
 35701	ZOE: _(Lightly)_ Only for what happened him.
 35702	
 35703	BLOOM: How?
 35704	
 35705	VIRAG: _(A diabolic rictus of black luminosity contracting his visage,
 35706	cranes his scraggy neck forward. He lifts a mooncalf nozzle and howls.)
 35707	Verfluchte Goim!_ He had a father, forty fathers. He never existed. Pig
 35708	God! He had two left feet. He was Judas Iacchia, a Libyan eunuch, the
 35709	pope's bastard. _(He leans out on tortured forepaws, elbows bent rigid,
 35710	his eye agonising in his flat skullneck and yelps over the mute world)_
 35711	A son of a whore. Apocalypse.
 35712	
 35713	KITTY: And Mary Shortall that was in the lock with the pox she got from
 35714	Jimmy Pidgeon in the blue caps had a child off him that couldn't swallow
 35715	and was smothered with the convulsions in the mattress and we all
 35716	subscribed for the funeral.
 35717	
 35718	PHILIP DRUNK: _(Gravely) Qui vous a mis dans cette fichue position,
 35719	Philippe?_
 35720	
 35721	PHILIP SOBER: _(Gaily) c'Ã©tait le sacrÃ© pigeon, Philippe._
 35722	
 35723	_(Kitty unpins her hat and sets it down calmly, patting her henna hair.
 35724	And a prettier, a daintier head of winsome curls was never seen on a
 35725	whore's shoulders. Lynch puts on her hat. She whips it off.)_
 35726	
 35727	LYNCH: _(Laughs)_ And to such delights has Metchnikoff inoculated
 35728	anthropoid apes.
 35729	
 35730	FLORRY: _(Nods)_ Locomotor ataxy.
 35731	
 35732	ZOE: _(Gaily)_ O, my dictionary.
 35733	
 35734	LYNCH: Three wise virgins.
 35735	
 35736	VIRAG: _(Agueshaken, profuse yellow spawn foaming over his bony
 35737	epileptic lips)_ She sold lovephiltres, whitewax, orangeflower. Panther,
 35738	the Roman centurion, polluted her with his genitories. _(He sticks out
 35739	a flickering phosphorescent scorpion tongue, his hand on his fork)_
 35740	Messiah! He burst her tympanum. _(With gibbering baboon's cries he jerks
 35741	his hips in the cynical spasm)_ Hik! Hek! Hak! Hok! Huk! Kok! Kuk!
 35742	
 35743	_(Ben Jumbo Dollard, Rubicund, musclebound, hairynostrilled,
 35744	hugebearded, cabbageeared, shaggychested, shockmaned, fat-papped, stands
 35745	forth, his loins and genitals tightened into a pair of black bathing
 35746	bagslops.)_
 35747	
 35748	BEN DOLLARD: _(Nakkering castanet bones in his huge padded paws, yodels
 35749	jovially in base barreltone)_ When love absorbs my ardent soul.
 35750	
 35751	_(The virgins Nurse Callan and Nurse Quigley burst through the
 35752	ringkeepers and the ropes and mob him with open arms.)_
 35753	
 35754	THE VIRGINS: _(Gushingly)_ Big Ben! Ben my Chree!
 35755	
 35756	A VOICE: Hold that fellow with the bad breeches.
 35757	
 35758	BEN DOLLARD: _(Smites his thigh in abundant laughter)_ Hold him now.
 35759	
 35760	HENRY: _(Caressing on his breast a severed female head, murmurs)_ Thine
 35761	heart, mine love. _(He plucks his lutestrings)_ When first I saw...
 35762	
 35763	VIRAG: _(Sloughing his skins, his multitudinous plumage moulting)_ Rats!
 35764	_(He yawns, showing a coalblack throat, and closes his jaws by an upward
 35765	push of his parchmentroll)_ After having said which I took my departure.
 35766	Farewell. Fare thee well. _Dreck!_
 35767	
 35768	_(Henry Flower combs his moustache and beard rapidly with a pocketcomb
 35769	and gives a cow's lick to his hair. Steered by his rapier, he glides to
 35770	the door, his wild harp slung behind him. Virag reaches the door in two
 35771	ungainly stilthops, his tail cocked, and deftly claps sideways on the
 35772	wall a pusyellow flybill, butting it with his head.)_
 35773	
 35774	THE FLYBILL: K. II. Post No Bills. Strictly confidential. Dr Hy Franks.
 35775	
 35776	HENRY: All is lost now.
 35777	
 35778	_(Virag unscrews his head in a trice and holds it under his arm.)_
 35779	
 35780	VIRAG'S HEAD: Quack!
 35781	
 35782	_(Exeunt severally.)_
 35783	
 35784	STEPHEN: _(Over his shoulder to zoe)_ You would have preferred
 35785	the fighting parson who founded the protestant error. But beware
 35786	Antisthenes, the dog sage, and the last end of Arius Heresiarchus. The
 35787	agony in the closet.
 35788	
 35789	LYNCH: All one and the same God to her.
 35790	
 35791	STEPHEN: _(Devoutly)_ And sovereign Lord of all things.
 35792	
 35793	FLORRY: _(To Stephen)_ I'm sure you're a spoiled priest. Or a monk.
 35794	
 35795	LYNCH: He is. A cardinal's son.
 35796	
 35797	STEPHEN: Cardinal sin. Monks of the screw.
 35798	
 35799	_(His Eminence Simon Stephen Cardinal Dedalus, Primate of all Ireland,
 35800	appears in the doorway, dressed in red soutane, sandals and socks. Seven
 35801	dwarf simian acolytes, also in red, cardinal sins, uphold his train,
 35802	peeping under it. He wears a battered silk hat sideways on his head. His
 35803	thumbs are stuck in his armpits and his palms outspread. Round his
 35804	neck hangs a rosary of corks ending on his breast in a corkscrew cross.
 35805	Releasing his thumbs, he invokes grace from on high with large wave
 35806	gestures and proclaims with bloated pomp:)_
 35807	
 35808	THE CARDINAL:
 35809	
 35810	     Conservio lies captured
 35811	     He lies in the lowest dungeon
 35812	     With manacles and chains around his limbs
 35813	     Weighing upwards of three tons.
 35814	
 35815	_(He looks at all for a moment, his right eye closed tight, his left
 35816	cheek puffed out. Then, unable to repress his merriment, he rocks to and
 35817	fro, arms akimbo, and sings with broad rollicking humour:)_
 35818	
 35819	     O, the poor little fellow
 35820	     Hihihihihis legs they were yellow
 35821	     He was plump, fat and heavy and brisk as a snake
 35822	     But some bloody savage
 35823	     To graize his white cabbage
 35824	     He murdered Nell Flaherty's duckloving drake.
 35825	
 35826	_(A multitude of midges swarms white over his robe. He scratches himself
 35827	with crossed arms at his ribs, grimacing, and exclaims:)_
 35828	
 35829	I'm suffering the agony of the damned. By the hoky fiddle, thanks be to
 35830	Jesus those funny little chaps are not unanimous. If they were they'd
 35831	walk me off the face of the bloody globe.
 35832	
 35833	_(His head aslant he blesses curtly with fore and middle fingers,
 35834	imparts the Easter kiss and doubleshuffles off comically, swaying
 35835	his hat from side to side, shrinking quickly to the size of his
 35836	trainbearers. The dwarf acolytes, giggling, peeping, nudging, ogling,
 35837	Easterkissing, zigzag behind him. His voice is heard mellow from afar,
 35838	merciful male, melodious:)_
 35839	
 35840	     Shall carry my heart to thee,
 35841	     Shall carry my heart to thee,
 35842	     And the breath of the balmy night
 35843	     Shall carry my heart to thee!
 35844	     _(The trick doorhandle turns.)_
 35845	
 35846	
 35847	THE DOORHANDLE: Theeee!
 35848	
 35849	ZOE: The devil is in that door.
 35850	
 35851	_(A male form passes down the creaking staircase and is heard taking
 35852	the waterproof and hat from the rack. Bloom starts forward involuntarily
 35853	and, half closing the door as he passes, takes the chocolate from his
 35854	pocket and offers it nervously to Zoe.)_
 35855	
 35856	ZOE: _(Sniffs his hair briskly)_ Hmmm! Thank your mother for the
 35857	rabbits. I'm very fond of what I like.
 35858	
 35859	BLOOM: _(Hearing a male voice in talk with the whores on the doorstep,
 35860	pricks his ears)_ If it were he? After? Or because not? Or the double
 35861	event?
 35862	
 35863	ZOE: _(Tears open the silverfoil)_ Fingers was made before forks. _(She
 35864	breaks off and nibbles a piece gives a piece to Kitty Ricketts and then
 35865	turns kittenishly to Lynch)_ No objection to French lozenges? _(He nods.
 35866	She taunts him.)_ Have it now or wait till you get it? _(He opens his
 35867	mouth, his head cocked. She whirls the prize in left circle. His head
 35868	follows. She whirls it back in right circle. He eyes her.)_ Catch!
 35869	
 35870	_(She tosses a piece. With an adroit snap he catches it and bites it
 35871	through with a crack.)_
 35872	
 35873	KITTY: _(Chewing)_ The engineer I was with at the bazaar does have
 35874	lovely ones. Full of the best liqueurs. And the viceroy was there with
 35875	his lady. The gas we had on the Toft's hobbyhorses. I'm giddy still.
 35876	
 35877	BLOOM: _(In Svengali's fur overcoat, with folded arms and Napoleonic
 35878	forelock, frowns in ventriloquial exorcism with piercing eagle glance
 35879	towards the door. Then rigid with left foot advanced he makes a swift
 35880	pass with impelling fingers and gives the sign of past master, drawing
 35881	his right arm downwards from his left shoulder.)_ Go, go, go, I conjure
 35882	you, whoever you are!
 35883	
 35884	_(A male cough and tread are heard passing through the mist outside.
 35885	Bloom's features relax. He places a hand in his waistcoat, posing
 35886	calmly. Zoe offers him chocolate.)_
 35887	
 35888	BLOOM: _(Solemnly)_ Thanks.
 35889	
 35890	ZOE: Do as you're bid. Here!
 35891	
 35892	_(A firm heelclacking tread is heard on the stairs.)_
 35893	
 35894	BLOOM: _(Takes the chocolate)_ Aphrodisiac? Tansy and pennyroyal. But I
 35895	bought it. Vanilla calms or? Mnemo. Confused light confuses memory. Red
 35896	influences lupus. Colours affect women's characters, any they have. This
 35897	black makes me sad. Eat and be merry for tomorrow. _(He eats)_ Influence
 35898	taste too, mauve. But it is so long since I. Seems new. Aphro. That
 35899	priest. Must come. Better late than never. Try truffles at Andrews.
 35900	
 35901	_(The door opens. Bella Cohen, a massive whoremistress, enters. She
 35902	is dressed in a threequarter ivory gown, fringed round the hem with
 35903	tasselled selvedge, and cools herself flirting a black horn fan like
 35904	Minnie Hauck in_ Carmen. _On her left hand are wedding and keeper rings.
 35905	Her eyes are deeply carboned. She has a sprouting moustache. Her
 35906	olive face is heavy, slightly sweated and fullnosed with orangetainted
 35907	nostrils. She has large pendant beryl eardrops.)_
 35908	
 35909	BELLA: My word! I'm all of a mucksweat.
 35910	
 35911	_(She glances round her at the couples. Then her eyes rest on Bloom with
 35912	hard insistence. Her large fan winnows wind towards her heated faceneck
 35913	and embonpoint. Her falcon eyes glitter.)_
 35914	
 35915	THE FAN: _(Flirting quickly, then slowly)_ Married, I see.
 35916	
 35917	BLOOM: Yes. Partly, I have mislaid...
 35918	
 35919	THE FAN: _(Half opening, then closing)_ And the missus is master.
 35920	Petticoat government.
 35921	
 35922	BLOOM: _(Looks down with a sheepish grin)_ That is so.
 35923	
 35924	THE FAN: _(Folding together, rests against her left eardrop)_ Have you
 35925	forgotten me?
 35926	
 35927	BLOOM: Yes. Yo.
 35928	
 35929	THE FAN: _(Folded akimbo against her waist)_ Is me her was you dreamed
 35930	before? Was then she him you us since knew? Am all them and the same now
 35931	we?
 35932	
 35933	_(Bella approaches, gently tapping with the fan.)_
 35934	
 35935	BLOOM: _(Wincing)_ Powerful being. In my eyes read that slumber which
 35936	women love.
 35937	
 35938	THE FAN: _(Tapping)_ We have met. You are mine. It is fate.
 35939	
 35940	BLOOM: _(Cowed)_ Exuberant female. Enormously I desiderate your
 35941	domination. I am exhausted, abandoned, no more young. I stand, so to
 35942	speak, with an unposted letter bearing the extra regulation fee before
 35943	the too late box of the general postoffice of human life. The door
 35944	and window open at a right angle cause a draught of thirtytwo feet per
 35945	second according to the law of falling bodies. I have felt this instant
 35946	a twinge of sciatica in my left glutear muscle. It runs in our family.
 35947	Poor dear papa, a widower, was a regular barometer from it. He believed
 35948	in animal heat. A skin of tabby lined his winter waistcoat. Near the
 35949	end, remembering king David and the Sunamite, he shared his bed with
 35950	Athos, faithful after death. A dog's spittle as you probably... _(He
 35951	winces)_ Ah!
 35952	
 35953	RICHIE GOULDING: _(Bagweighted, passes the door)_ Mocking is catch. Best
 35954	value in Dub. Fit for a prince's. Liver and kidney.
 35955	
 35956	THE FAN: _(Tapping)_ All things end. Be mine. Now.
 35957	
 35958	BLOOM: _(Undecided)_ All now? I should not have parted with my talisman.
 35959	Rain, exposure at dewfall on the searocks, a peccadillo at my time of
 35960	life. Every phenomenon has a natural cause.
 35961	
 35962	THE FAN: _(Points downwards slowly)_ You may.
 35963	
 35964	BLOOM: _(Looks downwards and perceives her unfastened bootlace)_ We are
 35965	observed.
 35966	
 35967	THE FAN: _(Points downwards quickly)_ You must.
 35968	
 35969	BLOOM: _(With desire, with reluctance)_ I can make a true black knot.
 35970	Learned when I served my time and worked the mail order line for
 35971	Kellett's. Experienced hand. Every knot says a lot. Let me. In courtesy.
 35972	I knelt once before today. Ah!
 35973	
 35974	_(Bella raises her gown slightly and, steadying her pose, lifts to the
 35975	edge of a chair a plump buskined hoof and a full pastern, silksocked.
 35976	Bloom, stifflegged, aging, bends over her hoof and with gentle fingers
 35977	draws out and in her laces.)_
 35978	
 35979	BLOOM: _(Murmurs lovingly)_ To be a shoefitter in Manfield's was my
 35980	love's young dream, the darling joys of sweet buttonhooking, to lace
 35981	up crisscrossed to kneelength the dressy kid footwear satinlined, so
 35982	incredibly impossibly small, of Clyde Road ladies. Even their wax model
 35983	Raymonde I visited daily to admire her cobweb hose and stick of rhubarb
 35984	toe, as worn in Paris.
 35985	
 35986	THE HOOF: Smell my hot goathide. Feel my royal weight.
 35987	
 35988	BLOOM: _(Crosslacing)_ Too tight?
 35989	
 35990	THE HOOF: If you bungle, Handy Andy, I'll kick your football for you.
 35991	
 35992	BLOOM: Not to lace the wrong eyelet as I did the night of the bazaar
 35993	dance. Bad luck. Hook in wrong tache of her... person you mentioned.
 35994	That night she met... Now!
 35995	
 35996	_(He knots the lace. Bella places her foot on the floor. Bloom raises
 35997	his head. Her heavy face, her eyes strike him in midbrow. His eyes grow
 35998	dull, darker and pouched, his nose thickens.)_
 35999	
 36000	BLOOM: _(Mumbles)_ Awaiting your further orders we remain, gentlemen,...
 36001	
 36002	BELLO: _(With a hard basilisk stare, in a baritone voice)_ Hound of
 36003	dishonour!
 36004	
 36005	BLOOM: _(Infatuated)_ Empress!
 36006	
 36007	BELLO: _(His heavy cheekchops sagging)_ Adorer of the adulterous rump!
 36008	
 36009	BLOOM: _(Plaintively)_ Hugeness!
 36010	
 36011	BELLO: Dungdevourer!
 36012	
 36013	BLOOM: _(With sinews semiflexed)_ Magmagnificence!
 36014	
 36015	BELLO: Down! _(He taps her on the shoulder with his fan)_ Incline feet
 36016	forward! Slide left foot one pace back! You will fall. You are falling.
 36017	On the hands down!
 36018	
 36019	BLOOM: _(Her eyes upturned in the sign of admiration, closing, yaps)_
 36020	Truffles!
 36021	
 36022	_(With a piercing epileptic cry she sinks on all fours, grunting,
 36023	snuffling, rooting at his feet: then lies, shamming dead, with eyes shut
 36024	tight, trembling eyelids, bowed upon the ground in the attitude of most
 36025	excellent master.)_
 36026	
 36027	BELLO: _(With bobbed hair, purple gills, fit moustache rings round his
 36028	shaven mouth, in mountaineer's puttees, green silverbuttoned coat, sport
 36029	skirt and alpine hat with moorcock's feather, his hands stuck deep in
 36030	his breeches pockets, places his heel on her neck and grinds it in)_
 36031	Footstool! Feel my entire weight. Bow, bondslave, before the throne of
 36032	your despot's glorious heels so glistening in their proud erectness.
 36033	
 36034	BLOOM: _(Enthralled, bleats)_ I promise never to disobey.
 36035	
 36036	BELLO: _(Laughs loudly)_ Holy smoke! You little know what's in store for
 36037	you. I'm the Tartar to settle your little lot and break you in! I'll bet
 36038	Kentucky cocktails all round I shame it out of you, old son. Cheek me,
 36039	I dare you. If you do tremble in anticipation of heel discipline to be
 36040	inflicted in gym costume.
 36041	
 36042	_(Bloom creeps under the sofa and peers out through the fringe.)_
 36043	
 36044	ZOE: _(Widening her slip to screen her)_ She's not here.
 36045	
 36046	BLOOM: _(Closing her eyes)_ She's not here.
 36047	
 36048	FLORRY: _(Hiding her with her gown)_ She didn't mean it, Mr Bello.
 36049	She'll be good, sir.
 36050	
 36051	KITTY: Don't be too hard on her, Mr Bello. Sure you won't, ma'amsir.
 36052	
 36053	BELLO: _(Coaxingly)_ Come, ducky dear, I want a word with you, darling,
 36054	just to administer correction. Just a little heart to heart talk,
 36055	sweety. _(Bloom puts out her timid head)_ There's a good girly now.
 36056	_(Bello grabs her hair violently and drags her forward)_ I only want
 36057	to correct you for your own good on a soft safe spot. How's that tender
 36058	behind? O, ever so gently, pet. Begin to get ready.
 36059	
 36060	BLOOM: _(Fainting)_ Don't tear my...
 36061	
 36062	BELLO: _(Savagely)_ The nosering, the pliers, the bastinado, the hanging
 36063	hook, the knout I'll make you kiss while the flutes play like the Nubian
 36064	slave of old. You're in for it this time! I'll make you remember me for
 36065	the balance of your natural life. _(His forehead veins swollen, his face
 36066	congested)_ I shall sit on your ottoman saddleback every morning after
 36067	my thumping good breakfast of Matterson's fat hamrashers and a bottle
 36068	of Guinness's porter. _(He belches)_ And suck my thumping good Stock
 36069	Exchange cigar while I read the _Licensed Victualler's Gazette_. Very
 36070	possibly I shall have you slaughtered and skewered in my stables and
 36071	enjoy a slice of you with crisp crackling from the baking tin basted
 36072	and baked like sucking pig with rice and lemon or currant sauce. It will
 36073	hurt you. _(He twists her arm. Bloom squeals, turning turtle.)_
 36074	
 36075	BLOOM: Don't be cruel, nurse! Don't!
 36076	
 36077	BELLO: _(Twisting)_ Another!
 36078	
 36079	BLOOM: _(Screams)_ O, it's hell itself! Every nerve in my body aches
 36080	like mad!
 36081	
 36082	BELLO: _(Shouts)_ Good, by the rumping jumping general! That's the best
 36083	bit of news I heard these six weeks. Here, don't keep me waiting, damn
 36084	you! _(He slaps her face)_
 36085	
 36086	BLOOM: _(Whimpers)_ You're after hitting me. I'll tell...
 36087	
 36088	BELLO: Hold him down, girls, till I squat on him.
 36089	
 36090	ZOE: Yes. Walk on him! I will.
 36091	
 36092	FLORRY: I will. Don't be greedy.
 36093	
 36094	KITTY: No, me. Lend him to me.
 36095	
 36096	_(The brothel cook, mrs keogh, wrinkled, greybearded, in a greasy bib,
 36097	men's grey and green socks and brogues, floursmeared, a rollingpin stuck
 36098	with raw pastry in her bare red arm and hand, appears at the door.)_
 36099	
 36100	MRS KEOGH: _(Ferociously)_ Can I help? _(They hold and pinion Bloom.)_
 36101	
 36102	BELLO: _(Squats with a grunt on Bloom's upturned face, puffing
 36103	cigarsmoke, nursing a fat leg)_ I see Keating Clay is elected
 36104	vicechairman of the Richmond asylum and by the by Guinness's preference
 36105	shares are at sixteen three quaffers. Curse me for a fool that didn't
 36106	buy that lot Craig and Gardner told me about. Just my infernal luck,
 36107	curse it. And that Goddamned outsider _Throwaway_ at twenty to one.
 36108	_(He quenches his cigar angrily on Bloom's ear)_ Where's that Goddamned
 36109	cursed ashtray?
 36110	
 36111	BLOOM: _(Goaded, buttocksmothered)_ O! O! Monsters! Cruel one!
 36112	
 36113	BELLO: Ask for that every ten minutes. Beg. Pray for it as you never
 36114	prayed before. _(He thrusts out a figged fist and foul cigar)_ Here,
 36115	kiss that. Both. Kiss. _(He throws a leg astride and, pressing with
 36116	horseman's knees, calls in a hard voice)_ Gee up! A cockhorse to Banbury
 36117	cross. I'll ride him for the Eclipse stakes. _(He bends sideways and
 36118	squeezes his mount's testicles roughly, shouting)_ Ho! Off we pop! I'll
 36119	nurse you in proper fashion. _(He horserides cockhorse, leaping in the
 36120	saddle)_ The lady goes a pace a pace and the coachman goes a trot a trot
 36121	and the gentleman goes a gallop a gallop a gallop a gallop.
 36122	
 36123	FLORRY: _(Pulls at Bello)_ Let me on him now. You had enough. I asked
 36124	before you.
 36125	
 36126	ZOE: _(Pulling at florry)_ Me. Me. Are you not finished with him yet,
 36127	suckeress?
 36128	
 36129	BLOOM: _(Stifling)_ Can't.
 36130	
 36131	BELLO: Well, I'm not. Wait. _(He holds in his breath)_ Curse it. Here.
 36132	This bung's about burst. _(He uncorks himself behind: then, contorting
 36133	his features, farts loudly)_ Take that! _(He recorks himself)_ Yes, by
 36134	Jingo, sixteen three quarters.
 36135	
 36136	BLOOM: _(A sweat breaking out over him)_ Not man. _(He sniffs)_ Woman.
 36137	
 36138	BELLO: _(Stands up)_ No more blow hot and cold. What you longed for has
 36139	come to pass. Henceforth you are unmanned and mine in earnest, a thing
 36140	under the yoke. Now for your punishment frock. You will shed your male
 36141	garments, you understand, Ruby Cohen? and don the shot silk luxuriously
 36142	rustling over head and shoulders. And quickly too!
 36143	
 36144	BLOOM: _(Shrinks)_ Silk, mistress said! O crinkly! scrapy! Must I
 36145	tiptouch it with my nails?
 36146	
 36147	BELLO: _(Points to his whores)_ As they are now so will you be, wigged,
 36148	singed, perfumesprayed, ricepowdered, with smoothshaven armpits. Tape
 36149	measurements will be taken next your skin. You will be laced with cruel
 36150	force into vicelike corsets of soft dove coutille with whalebone busk to
 36151	the diamondtrimmed pelvis, the absolute outside edge, while your figure,
 36152	plumper than when at large, will be restrained in nettight frocks,
 36153	pretty two ounce petticoats and fringes and things stamped, of course,
 36154	with my houseflag, creations of lovely lingerie for Alice and nice
 36155	scent for Alice. Alice will feel the pullpull. Martha and Mary will be
 36156	a little chilly at first in such delicate thighcasing but the frilly
 36157	flimsiness of lace round your bare knees will remind you...
 36158	
 36159	BLOOM: _(A charming soubrette with dauby cheeks, mustard hair and large
 36160	male hands and nose, leering mouth)_ I tried her things on only twice,
 36161	a small prank, in Holles street. When we were hard up I washed them to
 36162	save the laundry bill. My own shirts I turned. It was the purest thrift.
 36163	
 36164	BELLO: _(Jeers)_ Little jobs that make mother pleased, eh? And showed
 36165	off coquettishly in your domino at the mirror behind closedrawn blinds
 36166	your unskirted thighs and hegoat's udders in various poses of surrender,
 36167	eh? Ho! ho! I have to laugh! That secondhand black operatop shift and
 36168	short trunkleg naughties all split up the stitches at her last rape that
 36169	Mrs Miriam Dandrade sold you from the Shelbourne hotel, eh?
 36170	
 36171	BLOOM: Miriam. Black. Demimondaine.
 36172	
 36173	BELLO: _(Guffaws)_ Christ Almighty it's too tickling, this! You were
 36174	a nicelooking Miriam when you clipped off your backgate hairs and
 36175	lay swooning in the thing across the bed as Mrs Dandrade about to be
 36176	violated by lieutenant Smythe-Smythe, Mr Philip Augustus Blockwell M.
 36177	P., signor Laci Daremo, the robust tenor, blueeyed Bert, the liftboy,
 36178	Henri Fleury of Gordon Bennett fame, Sheridan, the quadroon Croesus, the
 36179	varsity wetbob eight from old Trinity, Ponto, her splendid Newfoundland
 36180	and Bobs, dowager duchess of Manorhamilton. _(He guffaws again)_ Christ,
 36181	wouldn't it make a Siamese cat laugh?
 36182	
 36183	BLOOM: _(Her hands and features working)_ It was Gerald converted me to
 36184	be a true corsetlover when I was female impersonator in the High School
 36185	play _Vice Versa_. It was dear Gerald. He got that kink, fascinated by
 36186	sister's stays. Now dearest Gerald uses pinky greasepaint and gilds his
 36187	eyelids. Cult of the beautiful.
 36188	
 36189	BELLO: _(With wicked glee)_ Beautiful! Give us a breather! When you
 36190	took your seat with womanish care, lifting your billowy flounces, on the
 36191	smoothworn throne.
 36192	
 36193	BLOOM: Science. To compare the various joys we each enjoy. _(Earnestly)_
 36194	And really it's better the position... because often I used to wet...
 36195	
 36196	BELLO: _(Sternly)_ No insubordination! The sawdust is there in the
 36197	corner for you. I gave you strict instructions, didn't I? Do it
 36198	standing, sir! I'll teach you to behave like a jinkleman! If I catch a
 36199	trace on your swaddles. Aha! By the ass of the Dorans you'll find I'm a
 36200	martinet. The sins of your past are rising against you. Many. Hundreds.
 36201	
 36202	THE SINS OF THE PAST: _(In a medley of voices)_ He went through a form
 36203	of clandestine marriage with at least one woman in the shadow of the
 36204	Black church. Unspeakable messages he telephoned mentally to Miss Dunn
 36205	at an address in D'Olier street while he presented himself indecently to
 36206	the instrument in the callbox. By word and deed he frankly encouraged
 36207	a nocturnal strumpet to deposit fecal and other matter in an unsanitary
 36208	outhouse attached to empty premises. In five public conveniences
 36209	he wrote pencilled messages offering his nuptial partner to all
 36210	strongmembered males. And by the offensively smelling vitriol works did
 36211	he not pass night after night by loving courting couples to see if and
 36212	what and how much he could see? Did he not lie in bed, the gross boar,
 36213	gloating over a nauseous fragment of wellused toilet paper presented to
 36214	him by a nasty harlot, stimulated by gingerbread and a postal order?
 36215	
 36216	BELLO: _(Whistles loudly)_ Say! What was the most revolting piece of
 36217	obscenity in all your career of crime? Go the whole hog. Puke it out! Be
 36218	candid for once.
 36219	
 36220	_(Mute inhuman faces throng forward, leering, vanishing, gibbering,
 36221	Booloohoom. Poldy Kock, Bootlaces a penny Cassidy's hag, blind
 36222	stripling, Larry Rhinoceros, the girl, the woman, the whore, the other,
 36223	the...)_
 36224	
 36225	BLOOM: Don't ask me! Our mutual faith. Pleasants street. I only thought
 36226	the half of the... I swear on my sacred oath...
 36227	
 36228	BELLO: _(Peremptorily)_ Answer. Repugnant wretch! I insist on knowing.
 36229	Tell me something to amuse me, smut or a bloody good ghoststory or a
 36230	line of poetry, quick, quick, quick! Where? How? What time? With how
 36231	many? I give you just three seconds. One! Two! Thr...
 36232	
 36233	BLOOM: _(Docile, gurgles)_ I rererepugnosed in rerererepugnant
 36234	
 36235	BELLO: _(Imperiously)_ O, get out, you skunk! Hold your tongue! Speak
 36236	when you're spoken to.
 36237	
 36238	BLOOM: _(Bows)_ Master! Mistress! Mantamer!
 36239	
 36240	_(He lifts his arms. His bangle bracelets fill.)_
 36241	
 36242	BELLO: _(Satirically)_ By day you will souse and bat our smelling
 36243	underclothes also when we ladies are unwell, and swab out our latrines
 36244	with dress pinned up and a dishclout tied to your tail. Won't that be
 36245	nice? _(He places a ruby ring on her finger)_ And there now! With this
 36246	ring I thee own. Say, thank you, mistress.
 36247	
 36248	BLOOM: Thank you, mistress.
 36249	
 36250	BELLO: You will make the beds, get my tub ready, empty the pisspots in
 36251	the different rooms, including old Mrs Keogh's the cook's, a sandy one.
 36252	Ay, and rinse the seven of them well, mind, or lap it up like champagne.
 36253	Drink me piping hot. Hop! You will dance attendance or I'll lecture you
 36254	on your misdeeds, Miss Ruby, and spank your bare bot right well, miss,
 36255	with the hairbrush. You'll be taught the error of your ways. At night
 36256	your wellcreamed braceletted hands will wear fortythreebutton gloves
 36257	newpowdered with talc and having delicately scented fingertips. For such
 36258	favours knights of old laid down their lives. _(He chuckles)_ My boys
 36259	will be no end charmed to see you so ladylike, the colonel, above
 36260	all, when they come here the night before the wedding to fondle my new
 36261	attraction in gilded heels. First I'll have a go at you myself. A man I
 36262	know on the turf named Charles Alberta Marsh (I was in bed with him just
 36263	now and another gentleman out of the Hanaper and Petty Bag office) is
 36264	on the lookout for a maid of all work at a short knock. Swell the bust.
 36265	Smile. Droop shoulders. What offers? _(He points)_ For that lot. Trained
 36266	by owner to fetch and carry, basket in mouth. _(He bares his arm and
 36267	plunges it elbowdeep in Bloom's vulva)_ There's fine depth for you!
 36268	What, boys? That give you a hardon? _(He shoves his arm in a bidder's
 36269	face)_ Here wet the deck and wipe it round!
 36270	
 36271	A BIDDER: A florin.
 36272	
 36273	_(Dillon's lacquey rings his handbell.)_
 36274	
 36275	THE LACQUEY: Barang!
 36276	
 36277	A VOICE: One and eightpence too much.
 36278	
 36279	CHARLES ALBERTA MARSH: Must be virgin. Good breath. Clean.
 36280	
 36281	BELLO: _(Gives a rap with his gavel)_ Two bar. Rockbottom figure and
 36282	cheap at the price. Fourteen hands high. Touch and examine his points.
 36283	Handle him. This downy skin, these soft muscles, this tender flesh. If
 36284	I had only my gold piercer here! And quite easy to milk. Three newlaid
 36285	gallons a day. A pure stockgetter, due to lay within the hour. His
 36286	sire's milk record was a thousand gallons of whole milk in forty weeks.
 36287	Whoa my jewel! Beg up! Whoa! _(He brands his initial C on Bloom's
 36288	croup)_ So! Warranted Cohen! What advance on two bob, gentlemen?
 36289	
 36290	A DARKVISAGED MAN: _(In disguised accent)_ Hoondert punt sterlink.
 36291	
 36292	VOICES: _(Subdued)_ For the Caliph. Haroun Al Raschid.
 36293	
 36294	BELLO: _(Gaily)_ Right. Let them all come. The scanty, daringly short
 36295	skirt, riding up at the knee to show a peep of white pantalette, is a
 36296	potent weapon and transparent stockings, emeraldgartered, with the
 36297	long straight seam trailing up beyond the knee, appeal to the better
 36298	instincts of the _blasÃ©_ man about town. Learn the smooth mincing walk
 36299	on four inch Louis Quinze heels, the Grecian bend with provoking croup,
 36300	the thighs fluescent, knees modestly kissing. Bring all your powers of
 36301	fascination to bear on them. Pander to their Gomorrahan vices.
 36302	
 36303	BLOOM: _(Bends his blushing face into his armpit and simpers with
 36304	forefinger in mouth)_ O, I know what you're hinting at now!
 36305	
 36306	BELLO: What else are you good for, an impotent thing like you? _(He
 36307	stoops and, peering, pokes with his fan rudely under the fat suet folds
 36308	of Bloom's haunches)_ Up! Up! Manx cat! What have we here? Where's your
 36309	curly teapot gone to or who docked it on you, cockyolly? Sing, birdy,
 36310	sing. It's as limp as a boy of six's doing his pooly behind a cart. Buy
 36311	a bucket or sell your pump. _(Loudly)_ Can you do a man's job?
 36312	
 36313	BLOOM: Eccles street...
 36314	
 36315	BELLO: _(Sarcastically)_ I wouldn't hurt your feelings for the world but
 36316	there's a man of brawn in possession there. The tables are turned, my
 36317	gay young fellow! He is something like a fullgrown outdoor man. Well for
 36318	you, you muff, if you had that weapon with knobs and lumps and warts all
 36319	over it. He shot his bolt, I can tell you! Foot to foot, knee to knee,
 36320	belly to belly, bubs to breast! He's no eunuch. A shock of red hair he
 36321	has sticking out of him behind like a furzebush! Wait for nine months,
 36322	my lad! Holy ginger, it's kicking and coughing up and down in her guts
 36323	already! That makes you wild, don't it? Touches the spot? _(He spits in
 36324	contempt)_ Spittoon!
 36325	
 36326	BLOOM: I was indecently treated, I... Inform the police. Hundred
 36327	pounds. Unmentionable. I...
 36328	
 36329	BELLO: Would if you could, lame duck. A downpour we want not your
 36330	drizzle.
 36331	
 36332	BLOOM: To drive me mad! Moll! I forgot! Forgive! Moll... We... Still...
 36333	
 36334	BELLO: _(Ruthlessly)_ No, Leopold Bloom, all is changed by woman's will
 36335	since you slept horizontal in Sleepy Hollow your night of twenty years.
 36336	Return and see.
 36337	
 36338	_(Old Sleepy Hollow calls over the wold.)_
 36339	
 36340	SLEEPY HOLLOW: Rip van Wink! Rip van Winkle!
 36341	
 36342	BLOOM: _(In tattered mocassins with a rusty fowlingpiece, tiptoeing,
 36343	fingertipping, his haggard bony bearded face peering through the diamond
 36344	panes, cries out)_ I see her! It's she! The first night at Mat Dillon's!
 36345	But that dress, the green! And her hair is dyed gold and he...
 36346	
 36347	BELLO: _(Laughs mockingly)_ That's your daughter, you owl, with a
 36348	Mullingar student.
 36349	
 36350	_(Milly Bloom, fairhaired, greenvested, slimsandalled, her blue scarf
 36351	in the seawind simply swirling, breaks from the arms of her lover and
 36352	calls, her young eyes wonderwide.)_
 36353	
 36354	MILLY: My! It's Papli! But, O Papli, how old you've grown!
 36355	
 36356	BELLO: Changed, eh? Our whatnot, our writingtable where we never wrote,
 36357	aunt Hegarty's armchair, our classic reprints of old masters. A man and
 36358	his menfriends are living there in clover. The _Cuckoos' Rest!_ Why not?
 36359	How many women had you, eh, following them up dark streets, flatfoot,
 36360	exciting them by your smothered grunts, what, you male prostitute?
 36361	Blameless dames with parcels of groceries. Turn about. Sauce for the
 36362	goose, my gander O.
 36363	
 36364	BLOOM: They... I...
 36365	
 36366	BELLO: _(Cuttingly)_ Their heelmarks will stamp the Brusselette carpet
 36367	you bought at Wren's auction. In their horseplay with Moll the romp to
 36368	find the buck flea in her breeches they will deface the little statue
 36369	you carried home in the rain for art for art' sake. They will violate
 36370	the secrets of your bottom drawer. Pages will be torn from your handbook
 36371	of astronomy to make them pipespills. And they will spit in your ten
 36372	shilling brass fender from Hampton Leedom's.
 36373	
 36374	BLOOM: Ten and six. The act of low scoundrels. Let me go. I will return.
 36375	I will prove...
 36376	
 36377	A VOICE: Swear!
 36378	
 36379	_(Bloom clenches his fists and crawls forward, a bowieknife between his
 36380	teeth.)_
