 36381	
 36382	BELLO: As a paying guest or a kept man? Too late. You have made your
 36383	secondbest bed and others must lie in it. Your epitaph is written. You
 36384	are down and out and don't you forget it, old bean.
 36385	
 36386	BLOOM: Justice! All Ireland versus one! Has nobody...? _(He bites his
 36387	thumb)_
 36388	
 36389	BELLO: Die and be damned to you if you have any sense of decency
 36390	or grace about you. I can give you a rare old wine that'll send you
 36391	skipping to hell and back. Sign a will and leave us any coin you have!
 36392	If you have none see you damn well get it, steal it, rob it! We'll bury
 36393	you in our shrubbery jakes where you'll be dead and dirty with old Cuck
 36394	Cohen, my stepnephew I married, the bloody old gouty procurator and
 36395	sodomite with a crick in his neck, and my other ten or eleven husbands,
 36396	whatever the buggers' names were, suffocated in the one cesspool. _(He
 36397	explodes in a loud phlegmy laugh)_ We'll manure you, Mr Flower! _(He
 36398	pipes scoffingly)_ Byby, Poldy! Byby, Papli!
 36399	
 36400	BLOOM: _(Clasps his head)_ My willpower! Memory! I have sinned! I have
 36401	suff...
 36402	
 36403	_(He weeps tearlessly)_

 36406	
 36407	_(Bloom, broken, closely veiled for the sacrifice, sobs, his face to
 36408	the earth. The passing bell is heard. Darkshawled figures of the
 36409	circumcised, in sackcloth and ashes, stand by the wailing wall. M.
 36410	Shulomowitz, Joseph Goldwater, Moses Herzog, Harris Rosenberg, M.

 36414	
 36415	THE CIRCUMCISED: _(In dark guttural chant as they cast dead sea fruit
 36416	upon him, no flowers) Shema Israel Adonai Elohenu Adonai Echad._
 36417	
 36418	VOICES: _(Sighing)_ So he's gone. Ah yes. Yes, indeed. Bloom? Never
 36419	heard of him. No? Queer kind of chap. There's the widow. That so? Ah,
 36420	yes.
 36421	
 36422	_(From the suttee pyre the flame of gum camphire ascends. The pall of
 36423	incense smoke screens and disperses. Out of her oakframe a nymph with
 36424	hair unbound, lightly clad in teabrown artcolours, descends from her
 36425	grotto and passing under interlacing yews stands over Bloom.)_
 36426	
 36427	THE YEWS: _(Their leaves whispering)_ Sister. Our sister. Ssh!
 36428	
 36429	THE NYMPH: _(Softly)_ Mortal! _(Kindly)_ Nay, dost not weepest!
 36430	
 36431	BLOOM: _(Crawls jellily forward under the boughs, streaked by sunlight,
 36432	with dignity)_ This position. I felt it was expected of me. Force of
 36433	habit.
 36434	
 36435	THE NYMPH: Mortal! You found me in evil company, highkickers, coster
 36436	picnicmakers, pugilists, popular generals, immoral panto boys in
 36437	fleshtights and the nifty shimmy dancers, La Aurora and Karini, musical
 36438	act, the hit of the century. I was hidden in cheap pink paper that smelt
 36439	of rock oil. I was surrounded by the stale smut of clubmen, stories to
 36440	disturb callow youth, ads for transparencies, truedup dice and bustpads,
 36441	proprietary articles and why wear a truss with testimonial from ruptured
 36442	gentleman. Useful hints to the married.
 36443	
 36444	BLOOM: _(Lifts a turtle head towards her lap)_ We have met before. On
 36445	another star.
 36446	
 36447	THE NYMPH: _(Sadly)_ Rubber goods. Neverrip brand as supplied to the
 36448	aristocracy. Corsets for men. I cure fits or money refunded. Unsolicited
 36449	testimonials for Professor Waldmann's wonderful chest exuber. My bust
 36450	developed four inches in three weeks, reports Mrs Gus Rublin with photo.
 36451	
 36452	BLOOM: You mean _Photo Bits?_
 36453	
 36454	THE NYMPH: I do. You bore me away, framed me in oak and tinsel, set me
 36455	above your marriage couch. Unseen, one summer eve, you kissed me in
 36456	four places. And with loving pencil you shaded my eyes, my bosom and my
 36457	shame.
 36458	
 36459	BLOOM: _(Humbly kisses her long hair)_ Your classic curves, beautiful
 36460	immortal, I was glad to look on you, to praise you, a thing of beauty,
 36461	almost to pray.
 36462	
 36463	THE NYMPH: During dark nights I heard your praise.
 36464	
 36465	BLOOM: _(Quickly)_ Yes, yes. You mean that I... Sleep reveals the worst
 36466	side of everyone, children perhaps excepted. I know I fell out of bed
 36467	or rather was pushed. Steel wine is said to cure snoring. For the rest
 36468	there is that English invention, pamphlet of which I received some days
 36469	ago, incorrectly addressed. It claims to afford a noiseless, inoffensive
 36470	vent. _(He sighs)_ 'Twas ever thus. Frailty, thy name is marriage.
 36471	
 36472	THE NYMPH: _(Her fingers in her ears)_ And words. They are not in my
 36473	dictionary.
 36474	
 36475	BLOOM: You understood them?
 36476	
 36477	THE YEWS: Ssh!
 36478	
 36479	THE NYMPH: _(Covers her face with her hands)_ What have I not seen in
 36480	that chamber? What must my eyes look down on?
 36481	
 36482	BLOOM: _(Apologetically)_ I know. Soiled personal linen, wrong side up
 36483	with care. The quoits are loose. From Gibraltar by long sea long ago.
 36484	
 36485	THE NYMPH: _(Bends her head)_ Worse, worse!
 36486	
 36487	BLOOM: _(Reflects precautiously)_ That antiquated commode. It wasn't her
 36488	weight. She scaled just eleven stone nine. She put on nine pounds
 36489	after weaning. It was a crack and want of glue. Eh? And that absurd
 36490	orangekeyed utensil which has only one handle.

 36492	_(The sound of a waterfall is heard in bright cascade.)_
 36493

 36495	
 36496	     Poulaphouca Poulaphouca
 36497	     Poulaphouca Poulaphouca.
 36498	
 36499	THE YEWS: _(Mingling their boughs)_ Listen. Whisper. She is right, our
 36500	sister. We grew by Poulaphouca waterfall. We gave shade on languorous
 36501	summer days.
 36502	
 36503	
 36504	JOHN WYSE NOLAN: _(In the background, in Irish National Forester's
 36505	uniform, doffs his plumed hat)_ Prosper! Give shade on languorous days,
 36506	trees of Ireland!
 36507	
 36508	THE YEWS: _(Murmuring)_ Who came to Poulaphouca with the High School
 36509	excursion? Who left his nutquesting classmates to seek our shade?

 36512	faculties. Concussion. Run over by tram.

 36514	THE ECHO: Sham!
 36515	
 36516	BLOOM: _(Pigeonbreasted, bottleshouldered, padded, in nondescript
 36517	juvenile grey and black striped suit, too small for him, white tennis
 36518	shoes, bordered stockings with turnover tops and a red schoolcap with
 36519	badge)_ I was in my teens, a growing boy. A little then sufficed, a
 36520	jolting car, the mingling odours of the ladies' cloakroom and lavatory,
 36521	the throng penned tight on the old Royal stairs (for they love crushes,
 36522	instinct of the herd, and the dark sexsmelling theatre unbridles
 36523	vice), even a pricelist of their hosiery. And then the heat. There were
 36524	sunspots that summer. End of school. And tipsycake. Halcyon days.
 36525	
 36526	_(Halcyon days, high school boys in blue and white football jerseys and

 36528	Goldberg, Master Jack Meredith, Master Percy Apjohn, stand in a clearing

 36531	THE HALCYON DAYS: Mackerel! Live us again. Hurray! _(They cheer)_
 36532	
 36533	BLOOM: _(Hobbledehoy, warmgloved, mammamufflered, starred with spent
 36534	snowballs, struggles to rise)_ Again! I feel sixteen! What a lark! Let's
 36535	ring all the bells in Montague street. _(He cheers feebly)_ Hurray for

 36537	
 36538	THE ECHO: Fool!
 36539	
 36540	THE YEWS: _(Rustling)_ She is right, our sister. Whisper. _(Whispered
 36541	kisses are heard in all the wood. Faces of hamadryads peep out from
 36542	the boles and among the leaves and break, blossoming into bloom.)_ Who
 36543	profaned our silent shade?
 36544	
 36545	THE NYMPH: _(Coyly, through parting fingers)_ There? In the open air?
 36546	
 36547	THE YEWS: _(Sweeping downward)_ Sister, yes. And on our virgin sward.
 36548	
 36549	THE WATERFALL:
 36550	
 36551	     Poulaphouca Poulaphouca
 36552	     Phoucaphouca Phoucaphouca.
 36553	
 36554	THE NYMPH: _(With wide fingers)_ O, infamy!
 36555	
 36556	BLOOM: I was precocious. Youth. The fauna. I sacrificed to the god of
 36557	the forest. The flowers that bloom in the spring. It was pairing
 36558	time. Capillary attraction is a natural phenomenon. Lotty Clarke,
 36559	flaxenhaired, I saw at her night toilette through illclosed curtains
 36560	with poor papa's operaglasses: The wanton ate grass wildly. She rolled
 36561	downhill at Rialto bridge to tempt me with her flow of animal spirits.
 36562	She climbed their crooked tree and I... A saint couldn't resist it. The
 36563	demon possessed me. Besides, who saw?
 36564	
 36565	_(Staggering Bob, a whitepolled calf, thrusts a ruminating head with
 36566	humid nostrils through the foliage.)_
 36567	
 36568	STAGGERING BOB: (LARGE TEARDROPS ROLLING FROM HIS PROMINENT EYES,
 36569	SNIVELS) Me. Me see.
 36570	
 36571	BLOOM: Simply satisfying a need I... _(With pathos)_ No girl would when
 36572	I went girling. Too ugly. They wouldn't play...
 36573	
 36574	_(High on Ben Howth through rhododendrons a nannygoat passes,
 36575	plumpuddered, buttytailed, dropping currants.)_
 36576	
 36577	THE NANNYGOAT: _(Bleats)_ Megeggaggegg! Nannannanny!
 36578	
 36579	BLOOM: _(Hatless, flushed, covered with burrs of thistledown and
 36580	gorsespine)_ Regularly engaged. Circumstances alter cases. _(He gazes
 36581	intently downwards on the water)_ Thirtytwo head over heels per second.
 36582	Press nightmare. Giddy Elijah. Fall from cliff. Sad end of government
 36583	printer's clerk. _(Through silversilent summer air the dummy of Bloom,
 36584	rolled in a mummy, rolls roteatingly from the Lion's Head cliff into the
 36585	purple waiting waters.)_
 36586	
 36587	THE DUMMYMUMMY: Bbbbblllllblblblblobschbg!
 36588	
 36589	_(Far out in the bay between bailey and kish lights the_ Erin's King
 36590	_sails, sending a broadening plume of coalsmoke from her funnel towards
 36591	the land.)_
 36592	
 36593	COUNCILLOR NANNETII: _(Alone on deck, in dark alpaca, yellowkitefaced,
 36594	his hand in his waistcoat opening, declaims)_ When my country takes her
 36595	place among the nations of the earth, then, and not till then, let my
 36596	epitaph be written. I have...
 36597	
 36598	BLOOM: Done. Prff!
 36599	
 36600	THE NYMPH: _(Loftily)_ We immortals, as you saw today, have not such
 36601	a place and no hair there either. We are stonecold and pure. We eat
 36602	electric light. _(She arches her body in lascivious crispation, placing
 36603	her forefinger in her mouth)_ Spoke to me. Heard from behind. How then
 36604	could you...?
 36605	
 36606	BLOOM: _(Pawing the heather abjectly)_ O, I have been a perfect pig.
 36607	Enemas too I have administered. One third of a pint of quassia to which
 36608	add a tablespoonful of rocksalt. Up the fundament. With Hamilton Long's
 36609	syringe, the ladies' friend.
 36610	
 36611	THE NYMPH: In my presence. The powderpuff. _(She blushes and makes a
 36612	knee)_ And the rest!
 36613	
 36614	BLOOM: _(Dejected)_ Yes. _Peccavi!_ I have paid homage on that living
 36615	altar where the back changes name. _(With sudden fervour)_ For why
 36616	should the dainty scented jewelled hand, the hand that rules...?
 36617	
 36618	_(Figures wind serpenting in slow woodland pattern around the treestems,
 36619	cooeeing)_
 36620	
 36621	THE VOICE OF KITTY: _(In the thicket)_ Show us one of them cushions.
 36622	
 36623	THE VOICE OF FLORRY: Here.
 36624	
 36625	_(A grouse wings clumsily through the underwood.)_
 36626	
 36627	THE VOICE OF LYNCH: _(In the thicket)_ Whew! Piping hot!
 36628	
 36629	THE VOICE OF ZOE: _(From the thicket)_ Came from a hot place.
 36630	
 36631	THE VOICE OF VIRAG: _(A birdchief, bluestreaked and feathered in war
 36632	panoply with his assegai, striding through a crackling canebrake over
 36633	beechmast and acorns)_ Hot! Hot! Ware Sitting Bull!
 36634	
 36635	BLOOM: It overpowers me. The warm impress of her warm form. Even to sit
 36636	where a woman has sat, especially with divaricated thighs, as though to
 36637	grant the last favours, most especially with previously well uplifted
 36638	white sateen coatpans. So womanly, full. It fills me full.
 36639	
 36640	THE WATERFALL:
 36641	
 36642	     _Phillaphulla Poulaphouca
 36643	     Poulaphouca Poulaphouca._
 36644	
 36645	THE YEWS: Ssh! Sister, speak!
 36646	
 36647	THE NYMPH: _(Eyeless, in nun's white habit, coif and hugewinged wimple,
 36648	softly, with remote eyes)_ Tranquilla convent. Sister Agatha. Mount
 36649	Carmel. The apparitions of Knock and Lourdes. No more desire. _(She
 36650	reclines her head, sighing)_ Only the ethereal. Where dreamy creamy gull
 36651	waves o'er the waters dull.
 36652	
 36653	_(Bloom half rises. His back trouserbutton snaps.)_
 36654	
 36655	THE BUTTON: Bip!
 36656	
 36657	_(Two sluts of the coombe dance rainily by, shawled, yelling flatly.)_
 36658	
 36659	THE SLUTS:
 36660	
 36661	     O, Leopold lost the pin of his drawers
 36662	     He didn't know what to do,
 36663	     To keep it up,
 36664	     To keep it up.
 36665	
 36666	BLOOM: _(Coldly)_ You have broken the spell. The last straw. If there
 36667	were only ethereal where would you all be, postulants and novices? Shy
 36668	but willing like an ass pissing.
 36669	
 36670	THE YEWS: _(Their silverfoil of leaves precipitating, their skinny arms
 36671	aging and swaying)_ Deciduously!
 36672	
 36673	THE NYMPH: _(Her features hardening, gropes in the folds of her habit)_
 36674	Sacrilege! To attempt my virtue! _(A large moist stain appears on her
 36675	robe)_ Sully my innocence! You are not fit to touch the garment of a
 36676	pure woman. _(She clutches again in her robe)_ Wait. Satan, you'll sing
 36677	no more lovesongs. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen. _(She draws a poniard and,
 36678	clad in the sheathmail of an elected knight of nine, strikes at his
 36679	loins)_ Nekum!
 36680	
 36681	BLOOM: _(Starts up, seizes her hand)_ Hoy! Nebrakada! Cat o' nine lives!
 36682	Fair play, madam. No pruningknife. The fox and the grapes, is it? What
 36683	do you lack with your barbed wire? Crucifix not thick enough? _(He
 36684	clutches her veil)_ A holy abbot you want or Brophy, the lame gardener,
 36685	or the spoutless statue of the watercarrier, or good mother Alphonsus,
 36686	eh Reynard?
 36687	
 36688	THE NYMPH: _(With a cry flees from him unveiled, her plaster cast
 36689	cracking, a cloud of stench escaping from the cracks)_ Poli...!
 36690	
 36691	BLOOM: _(Calls after her)_ As if you didn't get it on the double
 36692	yourselves. No jerks and multiple mucosities all over you. I tried it.
 36693	Your strength our weakness. What's our studfee? What will you pay on
 36694	the nail? You fee mendancers on the Riviera, I read. _(The fleeing nymph
 36695	raises a keen)_ Eh? I have sixteen years of black slave labour behind
 36696	me. And would a jury give me five shillings alimony tomorrow, eh? Fool
 36697	someone else, not me. _(He sniffs)_ Rut. Onions. Stale. Sulphur. Grease.
 36698	
 36699	_(The figure of Bella Cohen stands before him.)_
 36700	
 36701	BELLA: You'll know me the next time.
 36702	
 36703	BLOOM: _(Composed, regards her) PassÃ©e._ Mutton dressed as lamb. Long
 36704	in the tooth and superfluous hair. A raw onion the last thing at night
 36705	would benefit your complexion. And take some double chin drill. Your
 36706	eyes are as vapid as the glasseyes of your stuffed fox. They have the
 36707	dimensions of your other features, that's all. I'm not a triple screw
 36708	propeller.
 36709	
 36710	BELLA: _(Contemptuously)_ You're not game, in fact. _(Her sowcunt
 36711	barks)_ Fbhracht!
 36712	
 36713	BLOOM: _(Contemptuously)_ Clean your nailless middle finger first, your
 36714	bully's cold spunk is dripping from your cockscomb. Take a handful of
 36715	hay and wipe yourself.
 36716	
 36717	BELLA: I know you, canvasser! Dead cod!
 36718	
 36719	BLOOM: I saw him, kipkeeper! Pox and gleet vendor!
 36720	
 36721	BELLA: _(Turns to the piano)_ Which of you was playing the dead march
 36722	from _Saul?_
 36723	
 36724	ZOE: Me. Mind your cornflowers. _(She darts to the piano and bangs
 36725	chords on it with crossed arms)_ The cat's ramble through the slag.
 36726	_(She glances back)_ Eh? Who's making love to my sweeties? _(She darts
 36727	back to the table)_ What's yours is mine and what's mine is my own.
 36728	
 36729	_(Kitty, disconcerted, coats her teeth with the silver paper. Bloom
 36730	approaches Zoe.)_
 36731	
 36732	BLOOM: _(Gently)_ Give me back that potato, will you?
 36733	
 36734	ZOE: Forfeits, a fine thing and a superfine thing.
 36735	
 36736	BLOOM: _(With feeling)_ It is nothing, but still, a relic of poor mamma.
 36737	
 36738	ZOE:
 36739	
 36740	     Give a thing and take it back
 36741	     God'll ask you where is that
 36742	     You'll say you don't know
 36743	     God'll send you down below.
 36744	
 36745	BLOOM: There is a memory attached to it. I should like to have it.
 36746	
 36747	STEPHEN: To have or not to have that is the question.
 36748	
 36749	ZOE: Here. _(She hauls up a reef of her slip, revealing her bare thigh,
 36750	and unrolls the potato from the top of her stocking)_ Those that hides
 36751	knows where to find.
 36752	
 36753	BELLA: _(Frowns)_ Here. This isn't a musical peepshow. And don't you
 36754	smash that piano. Who's paying here?
 36755	
 36756	_(She goes to the pianola. Stephen fumbles in his pocket and, taking out
 36757	a banknote by its corner, hands it to her.)_
 36758	
 36759	STEPHEN: _(With exaggerated politeness)_ This silken purse I made out
 36760	of the sow's ear of the public. Madam, excuse me. If you allow me. _(He
 36761	indicates vaguely Lynch and Bloom)_ We are all in the same sweepstake,
 36762	Kinch and Lynch. _Dans ce bordel ou tenons nostre Ã©tat_.
 36763	
 36764	LYNCH: _(Calls from the hearth)_ Dedalus! Give her your blessing for me.
 36765	
 36766	STEPHEN: _(Hands Bella a coin)_ Gold. She has it.
 36767	
 36768	BELLA: _(Looks at the money, then at Stephen, then at Zoe, Florry and
 36769	Kitty)_ Do you want three girls? It's ten shillings here.
 36770	
 36771	STEPHEN: _(Delightedly)_ A hundred thousand apologies. _(He fumbles
 36772	again and takes out and hands her two crowns)_ Permit, _brevi manu_, my
 36773	sight is somewhat troubled.
 36774	
 36775	_(Bella goes to the table to count the money while Stephen talks to
 36776	himself in monosyllables. Zoe bends over the table. Kitty leans over
 36777	Zoe's neck. Lynch gets up, rights his cap and, clasping Kitty's waist,
 36778	adds his head to the group.)_
 36779	
 36780	FLORRY: _(Strives heavily to rise)_ Ow! My foot's asleep. _(She limps
 36781	over to the table. Bloom approaches.)_
 36782	
 36783	BELLA, ZOE, KITTY, LYNCH, BLOOM: _(Chattering and squabbling)_ The
 36784	gentleman... ten shillings... paying for the three... allow me a
 36785	moment... this gentleman pays separate... who's touching it?... ow!
 36786	... mind who you're pinching... are you staying the night or a short
 36787	time?... who did?... you're a liar, excuse me... the gentleman paid
 36788	down like a gentleman... drink... it's long after eleven.
 36789	
 36790	STEPHEN: _(At the pianola, making a gesture of abhorrence)_ No bottles!
 36791	What, eleven? A riddle!
 36792	
 36793	ZOE: _(Lifting up her pettigown and folding a half sovereign into the
 36794	top of her stocking)_ Hard earned on the flat of my back.
 36795	
 36796	LYNCH: _(Lifting Kitty from the table)_ Come!
 36797	
 36798	KITTY: Wait. _(She clutches the two crowns)_
 36799	
 36800	FLORRY: And me?
 36801	
 36802	LYNCH: Hoopla! _(He lifts her, carries her and bumps her down on the
 36803	sofa.)_
 36804	
 36805	STEPHEN:
 36806	
 36807	     The fox crew, the cocks flew,
 36808	     The bells in heaven
 36809	     Were striking eleven.
 36810	     'Tis time for her poor soul
 36811	     To get out of heaven.
 36812	
 36813	BLOOM: _(Quietly lays a half sovereign on the table between bella and
 36814	florry)_ So. Allow me. _(He takes up the poundnote)_ Three times ten.
 36815	We're square.
 36816	
 36817	BELLA: _(Admiringly)_ You're such a slyboots, old cocky. I could kiss
 36818	you.
 36819	
 36820	ZOE: _(Points)_ Him? Deep as a drawwell. _(Lynch bends Kitty back over
 36821	the sofa and kisses her. Bloom goes with the poundnote to Stephen.)_
 36822	
 36823	BLOOM: This is yours.
 36824	
 36825	STEPHEN: How is that? _Les distrait_ or absentminded beggar. _(He
 36826	fumbles again in his pocket and draws out a handful of coins. An object
 36827	fills.)_ That fell.
 36828	
 36829	BLOOM: _(Stooping, picks up and hands a box of matches)_ This.
 36830	
 36831	STEPHEN: Lucifer. Thanks.
 36832	
 36833	BLOOM: _(Quietly)_ You had better hand over that cash to me to take care
 36834	of. Why pay more?
 36835	
 36836	STEPHEN: _(Hands him all his coins)_ Be just before you are generous.
 36837	
 36838	BLOOM: I will but is it wise? _(He counts)_ One, seven, eleven, and
 36839	five. Six. Eleven. I don't answer for what you may have lost.
 36840	
 36841	STEPHEN: Why striking eleven? Proparoxyton. Moment before the next
 36842	Lessing says. Thirsty fox. _(He laughs loudly)_ Burying his grandmother.
 36843	Probably he killed her.
 36844	
 36845	BLOOM: That is one pound six and eleven. One pound seven, say.
 36846	
 36847	STEPHEN: Doesn't matter a rambling damn.
 36848	
 36849	BLOOM: No, but...
 36850	
 36851	STEPHEN: _(Comes to the table)_ Cigarette, please. _(Lynch tosses a
 36852	cigarette from the sofa to the table)_ And so Georgina Johnson is dead
 36853	and married. _(A cigarette appears on the table. Stephen looks at it)_
 36854	Wonder. Parlour magic. Married. Hm. _(He strikes a match and proceeds to
 36855	light the cigarette with enigmatic melancholy)_
 36856	
 36857	LYNCH: _(Watching him)_ You would have a better chance of lighting it if
 36858	you held the match nearer.
 36859	
 36860	STEPHEN: _(Brings the match near his eye)_ Lynx eye. Must get glasses.
 36861	Broke them yesterday. Sixteen years ago. Distance. The eye sees all
 36862	flat. _(He draws the match away. It goes out.)_ Brain thinks. Near:
 36863	far. Ineluctable modality of the visible. _(He frowns mysteriously)_ Hm.
 36864	Sphinx. The beast that has twobacks at midnight. Married.
 36865	
 36866	ZOE: It was a commercial traveller married her and took her away with
 36867	him.
 36868	
 36869	FLORRY: _(Nods)_ Mr Lambe from London.
 36870	
 36871	STEPHEN: Lamb of London, who takest away the sins of our world.
 36872	
 36873	LYNCH: _(Embracing Kitty on the sofa, chants deeply) Dona nobis pacem._
 36874	
 36875	_(The cigarette slips from Stephen 's fingers. Bloom picks it up and
 36876	throws it in the grate.)_
 36877	
 36878	BLOOM: Don't smoke. You ought to eat. Cursed dog I met. _(To Zoe)_ You
 36879	have nothing?
 36880	
 36881	ZOE: Is he hungry?
 36882	
 36883	STEPHEN: _(Extends his hand to her smiling and chants to the air of the
 36884	bloodoath in the_ Dusk of the Gods)
 36885	
 36886	     Hangende Hunger,
 36887	     Fragende Frau,
 36888	     Macht uns alle kaputt.
 36889	
 36890	
 36891	ZOE: _(Tragically)_ Hamlet, I am thy father's gimlet! _(She takes
 36892	his hand)_ Blue eyes beauty I'll read your hand. _(She points to his
 36893	forehead)_ No wit, no wrinkles. _(She counts)_ Two, three, Mars, that's
 36894	courage. _(Stephen shakes his head)_ No kid.
 36895	
 36896	LYNCH: Sheet lightning courage. The youth who could not shiver and
 36897	shake. _(To Zoe)_ Who taught you palmistry?
 36898	
 36899	ZOE: _(Turns)_ Ask my ballocks that I haven't got. _(To Stephen)_ I see
 36900	it in your face. The eye, like that. _(She frowns with lowered head)_
 36901	
 36902	LYNCH: _(Laughing, slaps Kitty behind twice)_ Like that. Pandybat.
 36903	
 36904	_(Twice loudly a pandybat cracks, the coffin of the pianola flies open,
 36905	the bald little round jack-in-the-box head of Father Dolan springs up.)_
 36906	
 36907	FATHER DOLAN: Any boy want flogging? Broke his glasses? Lazy idle little
 36908	schemer. See it in your eye.
 36909	
 36910	_(Mild, benign, rectorial, reproving, the head of Don John Conmee rises
 36911	from the pianola coffin.)_
 36912	
 36913	DON JOHN CONMEE: Now, Father Dolan! Now. I'm sure that Stephen is a very
 36914	good little boy!
 36915	
 36916	ZOE: _(Examining Stephen's palm)_ Woman's hand.
 36917	
 36918	STEPHEN: _(Murmurs)_ Continue. Lie. Hold me. Caress. I never could read
 36919	His handwriting except His criminal thumbprint on the haddock.
 36920	
 36921	ZOE: What day were you born?
 36922	
 36923	STEPHEN: Thursday. Today.
 36924	
 36925	ZOE: Thursday's child has far to go. _(She traces lines on his hand)_
 36926	Line of fate. Influential friends.
 36927	
 36928	FLORRY: _(Pointing)_ Imagination.
 36929	
 36930	ZOE: Mount of the moon. You'll meet with a... _(She peers at his hands
 36931	abruptly)_ I won't tell you what's not good for you. Or do you want to
 36932	know?
 36933	
 36934	BLOOM: _(Detaches her fingers and offers his palm)_ More harm than good.
 36935	Here. Read mine.
 36936	
 36937	BELLA: Show. _(She turns up bloom's hand)_ I thought so. Knobby knuckles
 36938	for the women.
 36939	
 36940	ZOE: _(Peering at bloom's palm)_ Gridiron. Travels beyond the sea and
 36941	marry money.
 36942	
 36943	BLOOM: Wrong.
 36944	
 36945	ZOE: _(Quickly)_ O, I see. Short little finger. Henpecked husband. That
 36946	wrong?
 36947	
 36948	_(Black Liz, a huge rooster hatching in a chalked circle, rises,
 36949	stretches her wings and clucks.)_
 36950	
 36951	BLACK LIZ: Gara. Klook. Klook. Klook.
 36952	
 36953	_(She sidles from her newlaid egg and waddles off)_
 36954	
 36955	BLOOM: _(Points to his hand)_ That weal there is an accident. Fell and
 36956	cut it twentytwo years ago. I was sixteen.
 36957	
 36958	ZOE: I see, says the blind man. Tell us news.
 36959	
 36960	STEPHEN: See? Moves to one great goal. I am twentytwo. Sixteen years ago
 36961	he was twentytwo too. Sixteen years ago I twentytwo tumbled. Twentytwo
 36962	years ago he sixteen fell off his hobbyhorse. _(He winces)_ Hurt my hand
 36963	somewhere. Must see a dentist. Money?
 36964	
 36965	_(Zoe whispers to Florry. They giggle. Bloom releases his hand and
 36966	writes idly on the table in backhand, pencilling slow curves.)_
 36967	
 36968	FLORRY: What?
 36969	
 36970	_(A hackneycar, number three hundred and twentyfour, with a
 36971	gallantbuttocked mare, driven by James Barton, Harmony Avenue,
 36972	Donnybrook, trots past. Blazes Boylan and Lenehan sprawl swaying on the
 36973	sideseats. The Ormond boots crouches behind on the axle. Sadly over the
 36974	crossblind Lydia Douce and Mina Kennedy gaze.)_
 36975	
 36976	THE BOOTS: _(Jogging, mocks them with thumb and wriggling wormfingers)_
 36977	Haw haw have you the horn?
 36978	
 36979	_(Bronze by gold they whisper.)_
 36980	
 36981	ZOE: _(To Florry)_ Whisper.
 36982	
 36983	_(They whisper again)_
 36984	
 36985	_(Over the well of the car Blazes Boylan leans, his boater straw set
 36986	sideways, a red flower in his mouth. Lenehan in yachtsman's cap and
 36987	white shoes officiously detaches a long hair from Blazes Boylan's coat
 36988	shoulder.)_
 36989	
 36990	LENEHAN: Ho! What do I here behold? Were you brushing the cobwebs off a
 36991	few quims?
 36992	
 36993	BOYLAN: _(Seated, smiles)_ Plucking a turkey.
 36994	
 36995	LENEHAN: A good night's work.
 36996	
 36997	BOYLAN: _(Holding up four thick bluntungulated fingers, winks)_ Blazes
 36998	Kate! Up to sample or your money back. _(He holds out a forefinger)_
 36999	Smell that.
 37000	
 37001	LENEHAN: _(Smells gleefully)_ Ah! Lobster and mayonnaise. Ah!
 37002	
 37003	ZOE AND FLORRY: _(Laugh together)_ Ha ha ha ha.
 37004	
 37005	BOYLAN: _(Jumps surely from the car and calls loudly for all to hear)_
 37006	Hello, Bloom! Mrs Bloom dressed yet?
 37007	
 37008	BLOOM: _(In flunkey's prune plush coat and kneebreeches, buff stockings
 37009	and powdered wig)_ I'm afraid not, sir. The last articles...
 37010	
 37011	BOYLAN: _(Tosses him sixpence)_ Here, to buy yourself a gin and splash.
 37012	_(He hangs his hat smartly on a peg of Bloom's antlered head)_ Show me
 37013	in. I have a little private business with your wife, you understand?
 37014	
 37015	BLOOM: Thank you, sir. Yes, sir. Madam Tweedy is in her bath, sir.
 37016	
 37017	MARION: He ought to feel himself highly honoured. _(She plops splashing
 37018	out of the water)_ Raoul darling, come and dry me. I'm in my pelt. Only
 37019	my new hat and a carriage sponge.
 37020	
 37021	BOYLAN: _(A merry twinkle in his eye)_ Topping!
 37022	
 37023	BELLA: What? What is it?
 37024	
 37025	_(Zoe whispers to her.)_
 37026	
 37027	MARION: Let him look, the pishogue! Pimp! And scourge himself! I'll
 37028	write to a powerful prostitute or Bartholomona, the bearded woman, to
 37029	raise weals out on him an inch thick and make him bring me back a signed
 37030	and stamped receipt.
 37031	
 37032	BOYLAN: (clasps himself) Here, I can't hold this little lot much longer.
 37033	(he strides off on stiff cavalry legs)
 37034	
 37035	BELLA: _(Laughing)_ Ho ho ho ho.
 37036	
 37037	BOYLAN: _(To Bloom, over his shoulder)_ You can apply your eye to the
 37038	keyhole and play with yourself while I just go through her a few times.
 37039	
 37040	BLOOM: Thank you, sir. I will, sir. May I bring two men chums to witness
 37041	the deed and take a snapshot? _(He holds out an ointment jar)_ Vaseline,
 37042	sir? Orangeflower...? Lukewarm water...?
 37043	
 37044	KITTY: _(From the sofa)_ Tell us, Florry. Tell us. What.
 37045	
 37046	_(Florry whispers to her. Whispering lovewords murmur, liplapping
 37047	loudly, poppysmic plopslop.)_
 37048	
 37049	MINA KENNEDY: _(Her eyes upturned)_ O, it must be like the scent of
 37050	geraniums and lovely peaches! O, he simply idolises every bit of her!
 37051	Stuck together! Covered with kisses!
 37052	
 37053	LYDIA DOUCE: _(Her mouth opening)_ Yumyum. O, he's carrying her round
 37054	the room doing it! Ride a cockhorse. You could hear them in Paris and
 37055	New York. Like mouthfuls of strawberries and cream.
 37056	
 37057	KITTY: _(Laughing)_ Hee hee hee.
 37058	
 37059	BOYLAN'S VOICE: _(Sweetly, hoarsely, in the pit of his stomach)_ Ah!
 37060	Gooblazqruk brukarchkrasht!
 37061	
 37062	MARION'S VOICE: _(Hoarsely, sweetly, rising to her throat)_ O!
 37063	Weeshwashtkissinapooisthnapoohuck?
 37064	
 37065	BLOOM: _(His eyes wildly dilated, clasps himself)_ Show! Hide! Show!
 37066	Plough her! More! Shoot!
 37067	
 37068	BELLA, ZOE, FLORRY, KITTY: Ho ho! Ha ha! Hee hee!
 37069	
 37070	LYNCH: _(Points)_ The mirror up to nature. _(He laughs)_ Hu hu hu hu hu!
 37071	
 37072	_(Stephen and Bloom gaze in the mirror. The face of William Shakespeare,
 37073	beardless, appears there, rigid in facial paralysis, crowned by the
 37074	reflection of the reindeer antlered hatrack in the hall.)_
 37075	
 37076	SHAKESPEARE: _(In dignified ventriloquy)_ 'Tis the loud laugh bespeaks
 37077	the vacant mind. _(To Bloom)_ Thou thoughtest as how thou wastest
 37078	invisible. Gaze. _(He crows with a black capon's laugh)_ Iagogo! How my
 37079	Oldfellow chokit his Thursdaymornun. Iagogogo!
 37080	
 37081	BLOOM: _(Smiles yellowly at the three whores)_ When will I hear the
 37082	joke?
 37083	
 37084	ZOE: Before you're twice married and once a widower.
 37085	
 37086	BLOOM: Lapses are condoned. Even the great Napoleon when measurements
 37087	were taken next the skin after his death...
 37088	
 37089	_(Mrs Dignam, widow woman, her snubnose and cheeks flushed with
 37090	deathtalk, tears and Tunney's tawny sherry, hurries by in her weeds,
 37091	her bonnet awry, rouging and powdering her cheeks, lips and nose, a
 37092	pen chivvying her brood of cygnets. Beneath her skirt appear her late
 37093	husband's everyday trousers and turnedup boots, large eights. She holds
 37094	a Scottish widows' insurance policy and a large marquee umbrella under
 37095	which her brood run with her, Patsy hopping on one shod foot, his collar
 37096	loose, a hank of porksteaks dangling, freddy whimpering, Susy with a
 37097	crying cod's mouth, Alice struggling with the baby. She cuffs them on,
 37098	her streamers flaunting aloft.)_
 37099	
 37100	FREDDY: Ah, ma, you're dragging me along!
 37101	
 37102	SUSY: Mamma, the beeftea is fizzing over!
 37103	
 37104	SHAKESPEARE: _(With paralytic rage)_ Weda seca whokilla farst.
 37105	
 37106	_(The face of Martin Cunningham, bearded, refeatures Shakespeare's
 37107	beardless face. The marquee umbrella sways drunkenly, the children run
 37108	aside. Under the umbrella appears Mrs Cunningham in Merry Widow hat and
 37109	kimono gown. She glides sidling and bowing, twirling japanesily.)_
 37110	
 37111	MRS CUNNINGHAM: _(Sings)_
 37112	
 37113	And they call me the jewel of Asia!
 37114	
 37115	MARTIN CUNNINGHAM: _(Gazes on her, impassive)_ Immense! Most bloody
 37116	awful demirep!
 37117	
 37118	STEPHEN: _Et exaltabuntur cornua iusti._ Queens lay with prize bulls.
 37119	Remember Pasiphae for whose lust my grandoldgrossfather made the first
 37120	confessionbox. Forget not Madam Grissel Steevens nor the suine scions
 37121	of the house of Lambert. And Noah was drunk with wine. And his ark was
 37122	open.
 37123	
 37124	BELLA: None of that here. Come to the wrong shop.
 37125	
 37126	LYNCH: Let him alone. He's back from Paris.
 37127	
 37128	ZOE: _(Runs to stephen and links him)_ O go on! Give us some parleyvoo.
 37129	
 37130	_(Stephen claps hat on head and leaps over to the fireplace where he
 37131	stands with shrugged shoulders, finny hands outspread, a painted smile
 37132	on his face.)_
 37133	
 37134	LYNCH: _(Oommelling on the sofa)_ Rmm Rmm Rmm Rrrrrrmmmm.
 37135	
 37136	STEPHEN: _(Gabbles with marionette jerks)_ Thousand places of
 37137	entertainment to expense your evenings with lovely ladies saling gloves
 37138	and other things perhaps hers heart beerchops perfect fashionable
 37139	house very eccentric where lots cocottes beautiful dressed much about
 37140	princesses like are dancing cancan and walking there parisian clowneries
 37141	extra foolish for bachelors foreigns the same if talking a poor english
 37142	how much smart they are on things love and sensations voluptuous.
 37143	Misters very selects for is pleasure must to visit heaven and hell show
 37144	with mortuary candles and they tears silver which occur every night.
 37145	Perfectly shocking terrific of religion's things mockery seen in
 37146	universal world. All chic womans which arrive full of modesty then
 37147	disrobe and squeal loud to see vampire man debauch nun very fresh young
 37148	with _dessous troublants_. _(He clacks his tongue loudly)_ _Ho, la la!
 37149	Ce pif qu'il a!_
 37150	
 37151	LYNCH: _Vive le vampire!_
 37152	
 37153	THE WHORES: Bravo! Parleyvoo!
 37154	
 37155	STEPHEN: _(Grimacing with head back, laughs loudly, clapping himself)_
 37156	Great success of laughing. Angels much prostitutes like and holy
 37157	apostles big damn ruffians. _Demimondaines_ nicely handsome sparkling of
 37158	diamonds very amiable costumed. Or do you are fond better what belongs
 37159	they moderns pleasure turpitude of old mans? _(He points about him with
 37160	grotesque gestures which Lynch and the whores reply to)_ Caoutchouc
 37161	statue woman reversible or lifesize tompeeptom of virgins nudities very
 37162	lesbic the kiss five ten times. Enter, gentleman, to see in mirror every
 37163	positions trapezes all that machine there besides also if desire act
 37164	awfully bestial butcher's boy pollutes in warm veal liver or omlet on
 37165	the belly _piÃ¨ce de Shakespeare._
 37166	
 37167	BELLA: _(Clapping her belly sinks back on the sofa, with a shout of
 37168	laughter)_ An omelette on the... Ho! ho! ho! ho!... omelette on the...
 37169	
 37170	STEPHEN: _(Mincingly)_ I love you, sir darling. Speak you englishman
 37171	tongue for _double entente cordiale._ O yes, _mon loup_. How much cost?
 37172	Waterloo. Watercloset. _(He ceases suddenly and holds up a forefinger)_
 37173	
 37174	BELLA: _(Laughing)_ Omelette...
 37175	
 37176	THE WHORES: _(Laughing)_ Encore! Encore!
 37177	
 37178	STEPHEN: Mark me. I dreamt of a watermelon.
 37179	
 37180	ZOE: Go abroad and love a foreign lady.
 37181	
 37182	LYNCH: Across the world for a wife.
 37183	
 37184	FLORRY: Dreams goes by contraries.
 37185	
 37186	STEPHEN: _(Extends his arms)_ It was here. Street of harlots. In
 37187	Serpentine avenue Beelzebub showed me her, a fubsy widow. Where's the
 37188	red carpet spread?
 37189	
 37190	BLOOM: _(Approaching Stephen)_ Look...
 37191	
 37192	STEPHEN: No, I flew. My foes beneath me. And ever shall be. World
 37193	without end. _(He cries) P_ater! Free!
 37194	
 37195	BLOOM: I say, look...
 37196	
 37197	STEPHEN: Break my spirit, will he? _O merde alors! (He cries, his
 37198	vulture talons sharpened)_ Hola! Hillyho!
 37199	
 37200	_(Simon Dedalus' voice hilloes in answer, somewhat sleepy but ready.)_
 37201	
 37202	SIMON: That's all right. _(He swoops uncertainly through the air,
 37203	wheeling, uttering cries of heartening, on strong ponderous buzzard
 37204	wings)_ Ho, boy! Are you going to win? Hoop! Pschatt! Stable with those
 37205	halfcastes. Wouldn't let them within the bawl of an ass. Head up! Keep
 37206	our flag flying! An eagle gules volant in a field argent displayed.
 37207	Ulster king at arms! Haihoop! _(He makes the beagle's call, giving
 37208	tongue)_ Bulbul! Burblblburblbl! Hai, boy!
 37209	
 37210	_(The fronds and spaces of the wallpaper file rapidly across country.
 37211	A stout fox, drawn from covert, brush pointed, having buried his
 37212	grandmother, runs swift for the open, brighteyed, seeking badger earth,
 37213	under the leaves. The pack of staghounds follows, nose to the ground,
 37214	sniffing their quarry, beaglebaying, burblbrbling to be blooded. Ward
 37215	Union huntsmen and huntswomen live with them, hot for a kill. From Six
 37216	Mile Point, Flathouse, Nine Mile Stone follow the footpeople with knotty
 37217	sticks, hayforks, salmongaffs, lassos, flockmasters with stockwhips,
 37218	bearbaiters with tomtoms, toreadors with bullswords, greynegroes
 37219	waving torches. The crowd bawls of dicers, crown and anchor players,
 37220	thimbleriggers, broadsmen. Crows and touts, hoarse bookies in high
 37221	wizard hats clamour deafeningly.)_
 37222	
 37223	THE CROWD:
 37224	
 37225	     Card of the races. Racing card!
 37226	     Ten to one the field!
 37227	     Tommy on the clay here! Tommy on the clay!
 37228	     Ten to one bar one! Ten to one bar one!
 37229	     Try your luck on Spinning Jenny!
 37230	     Ten to one bar one!
 37231	     Sell the monkey, boys! Sell the monkey!
 37232	     I'll give ten to one!
 37233	     Ten to one bar one!
 37234	
 37235	_(A dark horse, riderless, bolts like a phantom past the winningpost,
 37236	his mane moonfoaming, his eyeballs stars. The field follows, a bunch of
 37237	bucking mounts. Skeleton horses, Sceptre, Maximum the Second, Zinfandel,
 37238	the Duke of Westminster's Shotover, Repulse, the Duke of Beaufort's
 37239	Ceylon, prix de Paris. Dwarfs ride them, rustyarmoured, leaping, leaping
 37240	in their, in their saddles. Last in a drizzle of rain on a brokenwinded
 37241	isabelle nag, Cock of the North, the favourite, honey cap, green jacket,
 37242	orange sleeves, Garrett Deasy up, gripping the reins, a hockeystick at
 37243	the ready. His nag on spavined whitegaitered feet jogs along the rocky
 37244	road.)_
 37245	
 37246	THE ORANGE LODGES: _(Jeering)_ Get down and push, mister. Last lap!
 37247	You'll be home the night!
 37248	
 37249	GARRETT DEASY: _(Bolt upright, his nailscraped face plastered with
 37250	postagestamps, brandishes his hockeystick, his blue eyes flashing in the
 37251	prism of the chandelier as his mount lopes by at schooling gallop)_
 37252	
 37253	_Per vias rectas!_
 37254	
 37255	_(A yoke of buckets leopards all over him and his rearing nag a torrent
 37256	of mutton broth with dancing coins of carrots, barley, onions, turnips,
 37257	potatoes.)_
 37258	
 37259	THE GREEN LODGES: Soft day, sir John! Soft day, your honour!
 37260	
 37261	_(Private Carr, Private Compton and Cissy Caffrey pass beneath the
 37262	windows, singing in discord.)_
 37263	
 37264	STEPHEN: Hark! Our friend noise in the street.
 37265	
 37266	ZOE: _(Holds up her hand)_ Stop!
 37267	
 37268	PRIVATE CARR, PRIVATE COMPTON AND CISSY CAFFREY:
 37269	
 37270	Yet I've a sort a Yorkshire relish for...
 37271	
 37272	ZOE: That's me. _(She claps her hands)_ Dance! Dance! _(She runs to the
 37273	pianola)_ Who has twopence?
 37274	
 37275	BLOOM: Who'll...?
 37276	
 37277	LYNCH: _(Handing her coins)_ Here.
 37278	
 37279	STEPHEN: _(Cracking his fingers impatiently)_ Quick! Quick! Where's my
 37280	augur's rod? _(He runs to the piano and takes his ashplant, beating his
 37281	foot in tripudium)_
 37282	
 37283	ZOE: _(Turns the drumhandle)_ There.
 37284	
 37285	_(She drops two pennies in the slot. Gold, pink and violet lights
 37286	start forth. The drum turns purring in low hesitation waltz. Professor
 37287	Goodwin, in a bowknotted periwig, in court dress, wearing a stained
 37288	inverness cape, bent in two from incredible age, totters across the
 37289	room, his hands fluttering. He sits tinily on the pianostool and lifts
 37290	and beats handless sticks of arms on the keyboard, nodding with damsel's
 37291	grace, his bowknot bobbing)_
 37292	
 37293	ZOE: _(Twirls round herself, heeltapping)_ Dance. Anybody here for
 37294	there? Who'll dance? Clear the table.
 37295	
 37296	_(The pianola with changing lights plays in waltz time the prelude of_
 37297	My Girl's a Yorkshire Girl. _Stephen throws his ashplant on the table
 37298	and seizes Zoe round the waist. Florry and Bella push the table towards
 37299	the fireplace. Stephen, arming Zoe with exaggerated grace, begins to
 37300	waltz her round the room. Bloom stands aside. Her sleeve filling from
 37301	gracing arms reveals a white fleshflower of vaccination. Between the
 37302	curtains Professor Maginni inserts a leg on the toepoint of which spins
 37303	a silk hat. With a deft kick he sends it spinning to his crown and
 37304	jauntyhatted skates in. He wears a slate frockcoat with claret silk
 37305	lapels, a gorget of cream tulle, a green lowcut waistcoat, stock collar
 37306	with white kerchief, tight lavender trousers, patent pumps and canary
 37307	gloves. In his buttonhole is an immense dahlia. He twirls in reversed
 37308	directions a clouded cane, then wedges it tight in his oxter. He places
 37309	a hand lightly on his breastbone, bows, and fondles his flower and
 37310	buttons.)_
 37311	
 37312	MAGINNI: The poetry of motion, art of calisthenics. No connection
 37313	with Madam Legget Byrne's or Levenston's. Fancy dress balls arranged.
 37314	Deportment. The Katty Lanner step. So. Watch me! My terpsichorean
 37315	abilities. _(He minuets forward three paces on tripping bee's feet) Tout
 37316	le monde en avant! RÃ©vÃ©rence! Tout le monde en place!_
 37317	
 37318	_(The prelude ceases. Professor Goodwin, beating vague arms shrivels,
 37319	sinks, his live cape filling about the stool. The air in firmer waltz
 37320	time sounds. Stephen and Zoe circle freely. The lights change, glow,
 37321	fide gold rosy violet.)_
 37322	
 37323	THE PIANOLA:
 37324	
 37325	Two young fellows were talking about their girls, girls, girls,
 37326	Sweethearts they'd left behind...
 37327	
 37328	_(From a corner the morning hours run out, goldhaired, slimsandalled,
 37329	in girlish blue, waspwaisted, with innocent hands. Nimbly they dance,
 37330	twirling their skipping ropes. The hours of noon follow in amber gold.
 37331	Laughing, linked, high haircombs flashing, they catch the sun in mocking
 37332	mirrors, lifting their arms.)_
 37333	
 37334	MAGINNI: _(Clipclaps glovesilent hands) CarrÃ©! Avant deux!_ Breathe
 37335	evenly! _Balance!_
 37336	
 37337	_(The morning and noon hours waltz in their places, turning, advancing
 37338	to each other, shaping their curves, bowing visavis. Cavaliers behind

 37340	rising from their shoulders.)_
 37341

 37347

 37349

 37351	
 37352	My little shy little lass has a waist.
 37353

 37357	gauze with dark bat sleeves that flutter in the land breeze.)_
 37358	
 37359	MAGINNI: _Avant huit! TraversÃ©! Salut! Cours de mains! CroisÃ©!_
 37360

 37433

 37435	
 37436	STEPHEN: Dance of death.
 37437	
 37438	_(Bang fresh barang bang of lacquey's bell, horse, nag, steer, piglings,
 37439	Conmee on Christass, lame crutch and leg sailor in cockboat armfolded
 37440	ropepulling hitching stamp hornpipe through and through. Baraabum! On
 37441	nags hogs bellhorses Gadarene swine Corny in coffin Steel shark stone

 37443	filling bawling gum he's a champion. Fuseblue peer from barrel rev.

 37446	and down bump mashtub sort of viceroy and reine relish for tublumber
 37447	bumpshire rose. Baraabum!)_
 37448	
 37449	_(The couples fall aside. Stephen whirls giddily. Room whirls back. Eyes
 37450	closed he totters. Red rails fly spacewards. Stars all around suns turn
 37451	roundabout. Bright midges dance on walls. He stops dead.)_
 37452	
 37453	STEPHEN: Ho!
 37454	
 37455	_(Stephen's mother, emaciated, rises stark through the floor, in leper
 37456	grey with a wreath of faded orangeblossoms and a torn bridal veil, her
 37457	face worn and noseless, green with gravemould. Her hair is scant and
 37458	lank. She fixes her bluecircled hollow eyesockets on Stephen and opens
 37459	her toothless mouth uttering a silent word. A choir of virgins and
 37460	confessors sing voicelessly.)_
 37461	
 37462	THE CHOIR:
 37463	
 37464	     Liliata rutilantium te confessorum...
 37465	     Iubilantium te virginum...
 37466	
 37467	_(from the top of a tower Buck Mulligan, in particoloured jester's dress
 37468	of puce and yellow and clown's cap with curling bell, stands gaping at
 37469	her, a smoking buttered split scone in his hand.)_
 37470	
 37471	BUCK MULLIGAN: She's beastly dead. The pity of it! Mulligan meets the
 37472	afflicted mother. _(He upturns his eyes)_ Mercurial Malachi!
 37473	
 37474	THE MOTHER: _(With the subtle smile of death's madness)_ I was once the
 37475	beautiful May Goulding. I am dead.
 37476	
 37477	STEPHEN: _(Horrorstruck)_ Lemur, who are you? No. What bogeyman's trick
 37478	is this?
 37479	
 37480	BUCK MULLIGAN: _(Shakes his curling capbell)_ The mockery of it! Kinch
 37481	dogsbody killed her bitchbody. She kicked the bucket. _(Tears of molten
 37482	butter fall from his eyes on to the scone)_ Our great sweet mother! _Epi
 37483	oinopa ponton._
 37484	
 37485	THE MOTHER: _(Comes nearer, breathing upon him softly her breath of
 37486	wetted ashes)_ All must go through it, Stephen. More women than men in
 37487	the world. You too. Time will come.
 37488	
 37489	STEPHEN: _(Choking with fright, remorse and horror)_ They say I killed
 37490	you, mother. He offended your memory. Cancer did it, not I. Destiny.
 37491	
 37492	THE MOTHER: _(A green rill of bile trickling from a side of her mouth)_
 37493	You sang that song to me. _Love's bitter mystery._
 37494	
 37495	STEPHEN: _(Eagerly)_ Tell me the word, mother, if you know now. The word
 37496	known to all men.
 37497	
 37498	THE MOTHER: Who saved you the night you jumped into the train at
 37499	Dalkey with Paddy Lee? Who had pity for you when you were sad among the
 37500	strangers? Prayer is allpowerful. Prayer for the suffering souls in the
 37501	Ursuline manual and forty days' indulgence. Repent, Stephen.
 37502	
 37503	STEPHEN: The ghoul! Hyena!
 37504	
 37505	THE MOTHER: I pray for you in my other world. Get Dilly to make you that
 37506	boiled rice every night after your brainwork. Years and years I loved
 37507	you, O, my son, my firstborn, when you lay in my womb.
 37508	
 37509	ZOE: _(Fanning herself with the grate fan)_ I'm melting!
 37510	
 37511	FLORRY: _(Points to Stephen)_ Look! He's white.
 37512	
 37513	BLOOM: _(Goes to the window to open it more)_ Giddy.
 37514	
 37515	THE MOTHER: _(With smouldering eyes)_ Repent! O, the fire of hell!
 37516	
 37517	STEPHEN: _(Panting)_ His noncorrosive sublimate! The corpsechewer! Raw
 37518	head and bloody bones.
 37519	
 37520	THE MOTHER: _(Her face drawing near and nearer, sending out an ashen
 37521	breath)_ Beware! _(She raises her blackened withered right arm slowly
 37522	towards Stephen's breast with outstretched finger)_ Beware God's hand!
 37523	_(A green crab with malignant red eyes sticks deep its grinning claws in
 37524	Stephen's heart.)_
 37525	
 37526	STEPHEN: _(Strangled with rage)_ Shite! _(His features grow drawn grey
 37527	and old)_
 37528	
 37529	BLOOM: _(At the window)_ What?
 37530	
 37531	STEPHEN: _Ah non, par exemple!_ The intellectual imagination! With me
 37532	all or not at all. _Non serviam!_
 37533	
 37534	FLORRY: Give him some cold water. Wait. _(She rushes out)_
 37535	
 37536	THE MOTHER: _(Wrings her hands slowly, moaning desperately)_ O Sacred
 37537	Heart of Jesus, have mercy on him! Save him from hell, O Divine Sacred
 37538	Heart!
 37539	
 37540	STEPHEN: No! No! No! Break my spirit, all of you, if you can! I'll bring
 37541	you all to heel!
 37542	
 37543	THE MOTHER: _(In the agony of her deathrattle)_ Have mercy on Stephen,
 37544	Lord, for my sake! Inexpressible was my anguish when expiring with love,
 37545	grief and agony on Mount Calvary.
 37546	
 37547	STEPHEN: _Nothung_!
 37548	
 37549	_(He lifts his ashplant high with both hands and smashes the chandelier.
 37550	Time's livid final flame leaps and, in the following darkness, ruin of
 37551	all space, shattered glass and toppling masonry.)_
 37552	
 37553	THE GASJET: Pwfungg!
 37554	
 37555	BLOOM: Stop!
 37556	
 37557	LYNCH: _(Rushes forward and seizes Stephen's hand)_ Here! Hold on! Don't
 37558	run amok!
 37559	
 37560	BELLA: Police!
 37561	
 37562	_(Stephen, abandoning his ashplant, his head and arms thrown back stark,
 37563	beats the ground and flies from the room, past the whores at the door.)_
 37564	
 37565	BELLA: _(Screams)_ After him!
 37566	
 37567	_(The two whores rush to the halldoor. Lynch and Kitty and Zoe stampede
 37568	from the room. They talk excitedly. Bloom follows, returns.)_
 37569	
 37570	THE WHORES: _(Jammed in the doorway, pointing)_ Down there.
 37571	
 37572	ZOE: _(Pointing)_ There. There's something up.
 37573	
 37574	BELLA: Who pays for the lamp? _(She seizes Bloom's coattail)_ Here, you
 37575	were with him. The lamp's broken.
 37576	
 37577	BLOOM: _(Rushes to the hall, rushes back)_ What lamp, woman?
 37578	
 37579	A WHORE: He tore his coat.
 37580	
 37581	BELLA: _(Her eyes hard with anger and cupidity, points)_ Who's to pay
 37582	for that? Ten shillings. You're a witness.
 37583	
 37584	BLOOM: _(Snatches up Stephen's ashplant)_ Me? Ten shillings? Haven't you
 37585	lifted enough off him? Didn't he...?
 37586	
 37587	BELLA: _(Loudly)_ Here, none of your tall talk. This isn't a brothel. A
 37588	ten shilling house.
 37589	
 37590	BLOOM: _(His head under the lamp, pulls the chain. Puling, the gasjet
 37591	lights up a crushed mauve purple shade. He raises the ashplant.)_ Only
 37592	the chimney's broken. Here is all he...
 37593	
 37594	BELLA: _(Shrinks back and screams)_ Jesus! Don't!
 37595	
 37596	BLOOM: _(Warding off a blow)_ To show you how he hit the paper. There's
 37597	not sixpenceworth of damage done. Ten shillings!
 37598	
 37599	FLORRY: _(With a glass of water, enters)_ Where is he?
 37600	
 37601	BELLA: Do you want me to call the police?
 37602	
 37603	BLOOM: O, I know. Bulldog on the premises. But he's a Trinity student.
 37604	Patrons of your establishment. Gentlemen that pay the rent. _(He makes
 37605	a masonic sign)_ Know what I mean? Nephew of the vice-chancellor. You
 37606	don't want a scandal.
 37607	
 37608	BELLA: _(Angrily)_ Trinity. Coming down here ragging after the boatraces
 37609	and paying nothing. Are you my commander here or? Where is he? I'll
 37610	charge him! Disgrace him, I will! (She Shouts) Zoe! Zoe!
 37611	
 37612	BLOOM: _(Urgently)_ And if it were your own son in Oxford? _(Warningly)_
 37613	I know.
 37614	
 37615	BELLA: _(Almost speechless)_ Who are. Incog!
 37616	
 37617	ZOE: _(In the doorway)_ There's a row on.
 37618	
 37619	BLOOM: What? Where? _(He throws a shilling on the table and starts)_
 37620	That's for the chimney. Where? I need mountain air.
 37621	
 37622	_(He hurries out through the hall. The whores point. Florry follows,
 37623	spilling water from her tilted tumbler. On the doorstep all the whores
 37624	clustered talk volubly, pointing to the right where the fog has cleared
 37625	off. From the left arrives a jingling hackney car. It slows to in front
 37626	of the house. Bloom at the halldoor perceives Corny Kelleher who is
 37627	about to dismount from the car with two silent lechers. He averts
 37628	his face. Bella from within the hall urges on her whores. They blow
 37629	ickylickysticky yumyum kisses. Corny Kelleher replies with a ghastly
 37630	lewd smile. The silent lechers turn to pay the jarvey. Zoe and Kitty
 37631	still point right. Bloom, parting them swiftly, draws his caliph's hood
 37632	and poncho and hurries down the steps with sideways face. Incog Haroun
 37633	al Raschid he flits behind the silent lechers and hastens on by the
 37634	railings with fleet step of a pard strewing the drag behind him, torn
 37635	envelopes drenched in aniseed. The ashplant marks his stride. A pack
 37636	of bloodhounds, led by Hornblower of Trinity brandishing a dogwhip in
 37637	tallyho cap and an old pair of grey trousers, follow from fir, picking
 37638	up the scent, nearer, baying, panting, at fault, breaking away, throwing
 37639	their tongues, biting his heels, leaping at his tail. He walks,
 37640	runs, zigzags, gallops, lugs laid back. He is pelted with gravel,
 37641	cabbagestumps, biscuitboxes, eggs, potatoes, dead codfish, woman's
 37642	slipperslappers. After him freshfound the hue and cry zigzag gallops
 37643	in hot pursuit of follow my leader: 65 C, 66 C, night watch, John Henry
 37644	Menton, Wisdom Hely, V. B. Dillon, Councillor Nannetti, Alexander Keyes,
 37645	Larry O'rourke, Joe Cuffe Mrs O'dowd, Pisser Burke, The Nameless One,
 37646	Mrs Riordan, The Citizen, Garryowen, Whodoyoucallhim, Strangeface,
 37647	Fellowthatsolike, Sawhimbefore, Chapwithawen, Chris Callinan, Sir
 37648	Charles Cameron, Benjamin Dollard, Lenehan, Bartell d'Arcy, Joe Hynes,
 37649	red Murray, editor Brayden, T. M. Healy, Mr Justice Fitzgibbon, John
 37650	Howard Parnell, the reverend Tinned Salmon, Professor Joly, Mrs
 37651	Breen, Denis Breen, Theodore Purefoy, Mina Purefoy, the Westland
 37652	Row postmistress, C. P. M'Coy, friend of Lyons, Hoppy Holohan,
 37653	maninthestreet, othermaninthestreet, Footballboots, pugnosed driver,
 37654	rich protestant lady, Davy Byrne, Mrs Ellen M'Guinness, Mrs Joe
 37655	Gallaher, George Lidwell, Jimmy Henry on corns, Superintendent Laracy,
 37656	Father Cowley, Crofton out of the Collector-general's, Dan Dawson,
 37657	dental surgeon Bloom with tweezers, Mrs Bob Doran, Mrs Kennefick, Mrs
 37658	Wyse Nolan, John Wyse Nolan, handsomemarriedwomanrubbedagainstwide
 37659	behindinClonskeatram, the bookseller of_ Sweets of Sin, _Miss
 37660	Dubedatandshedidbedad, Mesdames Gerald and Stanislaus Moran of Roebuck,
 37661	the managing clerk of Drimmie's, Wetherup, colonel Hayes, Mastiansky,
 37662	Citron, Penrose, Aaron Figatner, Moses Herzog, Michael E Geraghty,
 37663	Inspector Troy, Mrs Galbraith, the constable off Eccles Street corner,
 37664	old doctor Brady with stethoscope, the mystery man on the beach, a
 37665	retriever, Mrs Miriam Dandrade and all her lovers.)_
 37666	
 37667	THE HUE AND CRY: _(Helterskelterpelterwelter)_ He's Bloom! Stop Bloom!
 37668	Stopabloom! Stopperrobber! Hi! Hi! Stophim on the corner!
 37669	
 37670	_(At the corner of Beaver Street beneath the scaffolding Bloom panting
 37671	stops on the fringe of the noisy quarrelling knot, a lot not knowing a
 37672	jot what hi! hi! row and wrangle round the whowhat brawlaltogether.)_
 37673	
 37674	STEPHEN: _(With elaborate gestures, breathing deeply and slowly)_ You
 37675	are my guests. Uninvited. By virtue of the fifth of George and seventh
 37676	of Edward. History to blame. Fabled by mothers of memory.
 37677	
 37678	PRIVATE CARR: _(To Cissy Caffrey)_ Was he insulting you?
 37679	
 37680	STEPHEN: Addressed her in vocative feminine. Probably neuter.
 37681	Ungenitive.
 37682	
 37683	VOICES: No, he didn't. I seen him. The girl there. He was in Mrs
 37684	Cohen's. What's up? Soldier and civilian.
 37685	
 37686	CISSY CAFFREY: I was in company with the soldiers and they left me to
 37687	do--you know, and the young man run up behind me. But I'm faithful to
 37688	the man that's treating me though I'm only a shilling whore.
 37689	
 37690	STEPHEN: _(Catches sight of Lynch's and Kitty's heads)_ Hail, Sisyphus.
 37691	_(He points to himself and the others)_ Poetic. Uropoetic.
 37692	
 37693	VOICES: Shes faithfultheman.
 37694	
 37695	CISSY CAFFREY: Yes, to go with him. And me with a soldier friend.
 37696	
 37697	PRIVATE COMPTON: He doesn't half want a thick ear, the blighter. Biff
 37698	him one, Harry.
 37699	
 37700	PRIVATE CARR: _(To Cissy)_ Was he insulting you while me and him was
 37701	having a piss?
 37702	
 37703	LORD TENNYSON: _(Gentleman poet in Union Jack blazer and cricket
 37704	flannels, bareheaded, flowingbearded)_ Theirs not to reason why.
 37705	
 37706	PRIVATE COMPTON: Biff him, Harry.
 37707	
 37708	STEPHEN: _(To Private Compton)_ I don't know your name but you are quite
 37709	right. Doctor Swift says one man in armour will beat ten men in their
 37710	shirts. Shirt is synechdoche. Part for the whole.
 37711	
 37712	CISSY CAFFREY: _(To The Crowd)_ No, I was with the privates.
 37713	
 37714	STEPHEN: _(Amiably)_ Why not? The bold soldier boy. In my opinion every
 37715	lady for example...
 37716	
 37717	PRIVATE CARR: _(His cap awry, advances to Stephen)_ Say, how would it
 37718	be, governor, if I was to bash in your jaw?
 37719	
 37720	STEPHEN: _(Looks up to the sky)_ How? Very unpleasant. Noble art of
 37721	selfpretence. Personally, I detest action. _(He waves his hand)_ Hand
 37722	hurts me slightly. _Enfin ce sont vos oignons._ _(To Cissy Caffrey)_
 37723	Some trouble is on here. What is it precisely?
 37724	
 37725	DOLLY GRAY: _(From her balcony waves her handkerchief, giving the sign
 37726	of the heroine of Jericho)_ Rahab. Cook's son, goodbye. Safe home to
 37727	Dolly. Dream of the girl you left behind and she will dream of you.
 37728	
 37729	_(The soldiers turn their swimming eyes.)_
 37730	
 37731	BLOOM: _(Elbowing through the crowd, plucks Stephen's sleeve
 37732	vigorously)_ Come now, professor, that carman is waiting.
 37733	
 37734	STEPHEN: _(Turns)_ Eh? _(He disengages himself)_ Why should I not speak
 37735	to him or to any human being who walks upright upon this oblate orange?
 37736	_(He points his finger)_ I'm not afraid of what I can talk to if I see
 37737	his eye. Retaining the perpendicular.
 37738	
 37739	_(He staggers a pace back)_
 37740	
 37741	BLOOM: _(Propping him)_ Retain your own.
 37742	
 37743	STEPHEN: _(Laughs emptily)_ My centre of gravity is displaced. I have
 37744	forgotten the trick. Let us sit down somewhere and discuss. Struggle
 37745	for life is the law of existence but but human philirenists, notably the
 37746	tsar and the king of England, have invented arbitration. _(He taps his
 37747	brow)_ But in here it is I must kill the priest and the king.
 37748	
 37749	BIDDY THE CLAP: Did you hear what the professor said? He's a professor
 37750	out of the college.
 37751	
 37752	CUNTY KATE: I did. I heard that.
 37753	
 37754	BIDDY THE CLAP: He expresses himself with such marked refinement of
 37755	phraseology.
 37756	
 37757	CUNTY KATE: Indeed, yes. And at the same time with such apposite
 37758	trenchancy.
 37759	
 37760	PRIVATE CARR: _(Pulls himself free and comes forward)_ What's that
 37761	you're saying about my king?
 37762	
 37763	_(Edward the Seventh appears in an archway. He wars a white jersey on
 37764	which an image of the Sacred Heart is stitched with the insignia of
 37765	Garter and Thistle, Golden Fleece, Elephant of Denmark, Skinner's
 37766	and Probyn's horse, Lincoln's Inn bencher and ancient and honourable
 37767	artillery company of Massachusetts. He sucks a red jujube. He is robed
 37768	as a grand elect perfect and sublime mason with trowel and apron,
 37769	marked_ made in Germany. _In his left hand he holds a plasterer's bucket
 37770	on which is printed_ DÃ©fense d'uriner. _A roar of welcome greets him.)_
 37771	
 37772	EDWARD THE SEVENTH: _(Slowly, solemnly but indistinctly)_ Peace, perfect
 37773	peace. For identification, bucket in my hand. Cheerio, boys. _(He turns
 37774	to his subjects)_ We have come here to witness a clean straight fight
 37775	and we heartily wish both men the best of good luck. Mahak makar a bak.
 37776	
 37777	_(He shakes hands with Private Carr, Private Compton, Stephen, Bloom and
 37778	Lynch. General applause. Edward the Seventh lifts his bucket graciously
 37779	in acknowledgment.)_
 37780	
 37781	PRIVATE CARR: _(To Stephen)_ Say it again.
 37782	
 37783	STEPHEN: _(Nervous, friendly, pulls himself up)_ I understand your point
 37784	of view though I have no king myself for the moment. This is the age of
 37785	patent medicines. A discussion is difficult down here. But this is the
 37786	point. You die for your country. Suppose. _(He places his arm on Private
 37787	Carr's sleeve)_ Not that I wish it for you. But I say: Let my country
 37788	die for me. Up to the present it has done so. I didn't want it to die.
 37789	Damn death. Long live life!
 37790	
 37791	EDWARD THE SEVENTH: _(Levitates over heaps of slain, in the garb and
 37792	with the halo of Joking Jesus, a white jujube in his phosphorescent
 37793	face)_
 37794	
 37795	My methods are new and are causing surprise. To make the blind see I
 37796	throw dust in their eyes.
 37797	
 37798	STEPHEN: Kings and unicorns! _(He fills back a pace)_ Come somewhere and
 37799	we'll... What was that girl saying?...
 37800	
 37801	PRIVATE COMPTON: Eh, Harry, give him a kick in the knackers. Stick one
 37802	into Jerry.
 37803	
 37804	BLOOM: _(To the privates, softly)_ He doesn't know what he's saying.
 37805	Taken a little more than is good for him. Absinthe. Greeneyed monster. I
 37806	know him. He's a gentleman, a poet. It's all right.
 37807	
 37808	STEPHEN: _(Nods, smiling and laughing)_ Gentleman, patriot, scholar and
 37809	judge of impostors.
 37810	
 37811	PRIVATE CARR: I don't give a bugger who he is.
 37812	
 37813	PRIVATE COMPTON: We don't give a bugger who he is.
 37814	
 37815	STEPHEN: I seem to annoy them. Green rag to a bull.
 37816	
 37817	_(Kevin Egan of Paris in black Spanish tasselled shirt and peep-o'-day
 37818	boy's hat signs to Stephen.)_
 37819	
 37820	KEVIN EGAN: H'lo! _Bonjour!_ The _vieille ogresse_ with the _dents
 37821	jaunes_.
 37822	
 37823	_(Patrice Egan peeps from behind, his rabbitface nibbling a quince
 37824	leaf.)_
 37825	
 37826	PATRICE: _Socialiste!_
 37827	
 37828	DON EMILE PATRIZIO FRANZ RUPERT POPE HENNESSY: _(In medieval hauberk,
 37829	two wild geese volant on his helm, with noble indignation points a
 37830	mailed hand against the privates)_ Werf those eykes to footboden, big
 37831	grand porcos of johnyellows todos covered of gravy!
 37832	
 37833	BLOOM: _(To Stephen)_ Come home. You'll get into trouble.
 37834	
 37835	STEPHEN: _(Swaying)_ I don't avoid it. He provokes my intelligence.
 37836	
 37837	BIDDY THE CLAP: One immediately observes that he is of patrician
 37838	lineage.
 37839	
 37840	THE VIRAGO: Green above the red, says he. Wolfe Tone.
 37841	
 37842	THE BAWD: The red's as good as the green. And better. Up the soldiers!
 37843	Up King Edward!
 37844	
 37845	A ROUGH: _(Laughs)_ Ay! Hands up to De Wet.
 37846	
 37847	THE CITIZEN: _(With a huge emerald muffler and shillelagh, calls)_
 37848	
 37849	     May the God above
 37850	     Send down a dove
 37851	     With teeth as sharp as razors
 37852	     To slit the throats
 37853	     Of the English dogs
 37854	     That hanged our Irish leaders.
 37855	
 37856	THE CROPPY BOY: _(The ropenoose round his neck, gripes in his issuing
 37857	bowels with both hands)_
 37858	
 37859	I bear no hate to a living thing, But I love my country beyond the king.
 37860	
 37861	RUMBOLD, DEMON BARBER: _(Accompanied by two blackmasked assistants,
 37862	advances with gladstone bag which he opens)_ Ladies and gents,
 37863	cleaver purchased by Mrs Pearcy to slay Mogg. Knife with which Voisin
 37864	dismembered the wife of a compatriot and hid remains in a sheet in the
 37865	cellar, the unfortunate female's throat being cut from ear to ear. Phial
 37866	containing arsenic retrieved from body of Miss Barron which sent Seddon
 37867	to the gallows.
 37868	
 37869	_(He jerks the rope. The assistants leap at the victim's legs and drag
 37870	him downward, grunting the croppy boy's tongue protrudes violently.)_
 37871	
 37872	THE CROPPY BOY:
 37873	
 37874	Horhot ho hray hor hother's hest.
 37875	
 37876	_(He gives up the ghost. A violent erection of the hanged sends gouts
 37877	of sperm spouting through his deathclothes on to the cobblestones. Mrs
 37878	Bellingham, Mrs Yelverton Barry and the Honourable Mrs Mervyn Talboys
 37879	rush forward with their handkerchiefs to sop it up.)_
 37880	
 37881	RUMBOLD: I'm near it myself. _(He undoes the noose)_ Rope which hanged
 37882	the awful rebel. Ten shillings a time. As applied to Her Royal Highness.
 37883	_(He plunges his head into the gaping belly of the hanged and draws out
 37884	his head again clotted with coiled and smoking entrails)_ My painful
 37885	duty has now been done. God save the king!
 37886	
 37887	EDWARD THE SEVENTH: _(Dances slowly, solemnly, rattling his bucket, and
 37888	sings with soft contentment)_
 37889	
 37890	On coronation day, on coronation day, O, won't we have a merry time,
 37891	Drinking whisky, beer and wine!
 37892	
 37893	PRIVATE CARR: Here. What are you saying about my king?
 37894	
 37895	STEPHEN: _(Throws up his hands)_ O, this is too monotonous! Nothing.
 37896	He wants my money and my life, though want must be his master, for
 37897	some brutish empire of his. Money I haven't. _(He searches his pockets
 37898	vaguely)_ GAVE IT TO SOMEONE.
 37899	
 37900	PRIVATE CARR: Who wants your bleeding money?
 37901	
 37902	STEPHEN: _(Tries to move off)_ Will someone tell me where I am least
 37903	likely to meet these necessary evils? _Ãa se voit aussi Ã  paris._ Not
 37904	that I... But, by Saint Patrick...!
 37905	
 37906	_(The women's heads coalesce. Old Gummy Granny in sugarloaf hat appears
 37907	seated on a toadstool, the deathflower of the potato blight on her
 37908	breast.)_
 37909	
 37910	STEPHEN: Aha! I know you, gammer! Hamlet, revenge! The old sow that eats
 37911	her farrow!
 37912	
 37913	OLD GUMMY GRANNY: _(Rocking to and fro)_ Ireland's sweetheart, the king
 37914	of Spain's daughter, alanna. Strangers in my house, bad manners to them!
 37915	_(She keens with banshee woe)_ Ochone! Ochone! Silk of the kine! _(She
 37916	wails)_ You met with poor old Ireland and how does she stand?
 37917	
 37918	STEPHEN: How do I stand you? The hat trick! Where's the third person of
 37919	the Blessed Trinity? Soggarth Aroon? The reverend Carrion Crow.
 37920	
 37921	CISSY CAFFREY: _(Shrill)_ Stop them from fighting!
 37922	
 37923	A ROUGH: Our men retreated.
 37924	
 37925	PRIVATE CARR: _(Tugging at his belt)_ I'll wring the neck of any fucker
 37926	says a word against my fucking king.
 37927	
 37928	BLOOM: _(Terrified)_ He said nothing. Not a word. A pure
 37929	misunderstanding.
 37930	
 37931	THE CITIZEN: _Erin go bragh!_
 37932	
 37933	_(Major Tweedy and the Citizen exhibit to each other medals,
 37934	decorations, trophies of war, wounds. Both salute with fierce
 37935	hostility.)_
 37936	
 37937	PRIVATE COMPTON: Go it, Harry. Do him one in the eye. He's a proboer.
 37938	
 37939	STEPHEN: Did I? When?
 37940	
 37941	BLOOM: _(To the redcoats)_ We fought for you in South Africa, Irish
 37942	missile troops. Isn't that history? Royal Dublin Fusiliers. Honoured by
 37943	our monarch.
 37944	
 37945	THE NAVVY: _(Staggering past)_ O, yes! O God, yes! O, make the kwawr a
 37946	krowawr! O! Bo!
 37947	
 37948	_(Casqued halberdiers in armour thrust forward a pentice of gutted
 37949	spearpoints. Major Tweedy, moustached like Turko the terrible, in
 37950	bearskin cap with hackleplume and accoutrements, with epaulettes, gilt
 37951	chevrons and sabretaches, his breast bright with medals, toes the line.
 37952	He gives the pilgrim warrior's sign of the knights templars.)_
 37953	
 37954	MAJOR TWEEDY: _(Growls gruffly)_ Rorke's Drift! Up, guards, and at them!
 37955	Mahar shalal hashbaz.
 37956	
 37957	PRIVATE CARR: I'll do him in.
 37958	
 37959	PRIVATE COMPTON: _(Waves the crowd back)_ Fair play, here. Make a
 37960	bleeding butcher's shop of the bugger.
 37961	
 37962	_(Massed bands blare_ Garryowen _and_ God save the King.)
 37963	
 37964	CISSY CAFFREY: They're going to fight. For me!
 37965	
 37966	CUNTY KATE: The brave and the fair.
 37967	
 37968	BIDDY THE CLAP: Methinks yon sable knight will joust it with the best.
 37969	
 37970	CUNTY KATE: _(Blushing deeply)_ Nay, madam. The gules doublet and merry
 37971	saint George for me!
 37972	
 37973	STEPHEN:
 37974	
 37975	The harlot's cry from street to street Shall weave Old Ireland's
 37976	windingsheet.
 37977	
 37978	PRIVATE CARR: _(Loosening his belt, shouts)_ I'll wring the neck of any
 37979	fucking bastard says a word against my bleeding fucking king.
 37980	
 37981	BLOOM: _(Shakes Cissy Caffrey's shoulders)_ Speak, you! Are you struck
 37982	dumb? You are the link between nations and generations. Speak, woman,
 37983	sacred lifegiver!
 37984	
 37985	CISSY CAFFREY: _(Alarmed, seizes Private Carr's sleeve)_ Amn't I with
 37986	you? Amn't I your girl? Cissy's your girl. _(She cries)_ Police!
 37987	
 37988	STEPHEN: _(Ecstatically, to Cissy Caffrey)_
 37989	
 37990	     White thy fambles, red thy gan
 37991	     And thy quarrons dainty is.
 37992	
 37993	
 37994	VOICES: Police!
 37995	
 37996	DISTANT VOICES: Dublin's burning! Dublin's burning! On fire, on fire!
 37997	
 37998	_(Brimstone fires spring up. Dense clouds roll past. Heavy Gatling guns
 37999	boom. Pandemonium. Troops deploy. Gallop of hoofs. Artillery. Hoarse
 38000	commands. Bells clang. Backers shout. Drunkards bawl. Whores screech.
 38001	Foghorns hoot. Cries of valour. Shrieks of dying. Pikes clash on
 38002	cuirasses. Thieves rob the slain. Birds of prey, winging from the sea,
 38003	rising from marshlands, swooping from eyries, hover screaming, gannets,
 38004	cormorants, vultures, goshawks, climbing woodcocks, peregrines, merlins,
 38005	blackgrouse, sea eagles, gulls, albatrosses, barnacle geese. The
 38006	midnight sun is darkened. The earth trembles. The dead of Dublin
 38007	from Prospect and Mount Jerome in white sheepskin overcoats and black
 38008	goatfell cloaks arise and appear to many. A chasm opens with a noiseless
 38009	yawn. Tom Rochford, winner, in athlete's singlet and breeches, arrives
 38010	at the head of the national hurdle handicap and leaps into the void.
 38011	He is followed by a race of runners and leapers. In wild attitudes they
 38012	spring from the brink. Their bodies plunge. Factory lasses with fancy
 38013	clothes toss redhot Yorkshire baraabombs. Society ladies lift their
 38014	skirts above their heads to protect themselves. Laughing witches in red
 38015	cutty sarks ride through the air on broomsticks. Quakerlyster plasters
 38016	blisters. It rains dragons' teeth. Armed heroes spring up from furrows.
 38017	They exchange in amity the pass of knights of the red cross and fight
 38018	duels with cavalry sabres: Wolfe Tone against Henry Grattan, Smith
 38019	O'Brien against Daniel O'Connell, Michael Davitt against Isaac Butt,
 38020	Justin M'Carthy against Parnell, Arthur Griffith against John Redmond,
 38021	John O'Leary against Lear O'Johnny, Lord Edward Fitzgerald against Lord
 38022	Gerald Fitzedward, The O'Donoghue of the Glens against The Glens of The
 38023	O'Donoghue. On an eminence, the centre of the earth, rises the feldaltar
 38024	of Saint Barbara. Black candles rise from its gospel and epistle horns.
 38025	From the high barbacans of the tower two shafts of light fall on the
 38026	smokepalled altarstone. On the altarstone Mrs Mina Purefoy, goddess of
 38027	unreason, lies, naked, fettered, a chalice resting on her swollen belly.
 38028	Father Malachi O'Flynn in a lace petticoat and reversed chasuble, his
 38029	two left feet back to the front, celebrates camp mass. The Reverend Mr
 38030	Hugh C Haines Love M. A. in a plain cassock and mortarboard, his head
 38031	and collar back to the front, holds over the celebrant's head an open
 38032	umbrella.)_
 38033	
 38034	FATHER MALACHI O'FLYNN: _Introibo ad altare diaboli._
 38035	
 38036	THE REVEREND MR HAINES LOVE: To the devil which hath made glad my young
 38037	days.
 38038	
 38039	FATHER MALACHI O'FLYNN: _(Takes from the chalice and elevates a
 38040	blooddripping host) Corpus meum._
 38041	
 38042	THE REVEREND MR HAINES LOVE: _(Raises high behind the celebrant's
 38043	petticoat, revealing his grey bare hairy buttocks between which a carrot
 38044	is stuck)_ My body.
 38045	
 38046	THE VOICE OF ALL THE DAMNED: Htengier Tnetopinmo Dog Drol eht rof,
 38047	Aiulella!
 38048	
 38049	_(From on high the voice of Adonai calls.)_
 38050	
 38051	ADONAI: Dooooooooooog!
 38052	
 38053	THE VOICE OF ALL THE BLESSED: Alleluia, for the Lord God Omnipotent
 38054	reigneth!
 38055	
 38056	_(From on high the voice of Adonai calls.)_
 38057	
 38058	ADONAI: Goooooooooood!
 38059	
 38060	_(In strident discord peasants and townsmen of Orange and Green factions
 38061	sing_ Kick the Pope _and_ Daily, daily sing to Mary.)
 38062	
 38063	PRIVATE CARR: _(With ferocious articulation)_ I'll do him in, so help me
 38064	fucking Christ! I'll wring the bastard fucker's bleeding blasted fucking
 38065	windpipe!
 38066	
 38067	OLD GUMMY GRANNY: _(Thrusts a dagger towards Stephen's hand)_ Remove
 38068	him, acushla. At 8.35 a.m. you will be in heaven and Ireland will be
 38069	free. _(She prays)_ O good God, take him!
 38070	
 38071	(THE RETRIEVER, NOSING ON THE FRINGE OF THE CROWD, BARKS NOISILY.)
 38072	
 38073	BLOOM: _(Runs to lynch)_ Can't you get him away?
 38074	
 38075	LYNCH: He likes dialectic, the universal language. Kitty! _(To Bloom)_
 38076	Get him away, you. He won't listen to me.
 38077	
 38078	_(He drags Kitty away.)_
 38079	
 38080	STEPHEN: _(Points) exit Judas. Et laqueo se suspendit._
 38081	
 38082	BLOOM: _(Runs to Stephen)_ Come along with me now before worse happens.
 38083	Here's your stick.
 38084	
 38085	STEPHEN: Stick, no. Reason. This feast of pure reason.
 38086	
 38087	CISSY CAFFREY: _(Pulling Private Carr)_ Come on, you're boosed. He
 38088	insulted me but I forgive him. _(Shouting in his ear)_ I forgive him for
 38089	insulting me.
 38090	
 38091	BLOOM: _(Over Stephen's shoulder)_ Yes, go. You see he's incapable.
 38092	
 38093	PRIVATE CARR: _(Breaks loose)_ I'll insult him.
 38094	
 38095	_(He rushes towards Stephen, fist outstretched, and strikes him in the
 38096	face. Stephen totters, collapses, falls, stunned. He lies prone, his
 38097	face to the sky, his hat rolling to the wall. Bloom follows and picks it
 38098	up.)_
 38099	
 38100	MAJOR TWEEDY: _(Loudly)_ Carbine in bucket! Cease fire! Salute!
 38101	
 38102	THE RETRIEVER: _(Barking furiously)_ Ute ute ute ute ute ute ute ute.
 38103	
 38104	THE CROWD: Let him up! Don't strike him when he's down! Air! Who? The
 38105	soldier hit him. He's a professor. Is he hurted? Don't manhandle him!
 38106	He's fainted!
 38107	
 38108	A HAG: What call had the redcoat to strike the gentleman and he under
 38109	the influence. Let them go and fight the Boers!
 38110	
 38111	THE BAWD: Listen to who's talking! Hasn't the soldier a right to go with
 38112	his girl? He gave him the coward's blow.
 38113	
 38114	_(They grab at each other's hair, claw at each other and spit)_
 38115	
 38116	THE RETRIEVER: _(Barking)_ Wow wow wow.
 38117	
 38118	BLOOM: _(Shoves them back, loudly)_ Get back, stand back!
 38119	
 38120	PRIVATE COMPTON: _(Tugging his comrade)_ Here. Bugger off, Harry. Here's
 38121	the cops! _(Two raincaped watch, tall, stand in the group.)_
 38122	
 38123	FIRST WATCH: What's wrong here?
 38124	
 38125	PRIVATE COMPTON: We were with this lady. And he insulted us. And
 38126	assaulted my chum. _(The retriever barks)_ Who owns the bleeding tyke?
 38127	
 38128	CISSY CAFFREY: _(With expectation)_ Is he bleeding!
 38129	
 38130	A MAN: _(Rising from his knees)_ No. Gone off. He'll come to all right.
 38131	
 38132	BLOOM: _(Glances sharply at the man)_ Leave him to me. I can easily...
 38133	
 38134	SECOND WATCH: Who are you? Do you know him?
 38135	
 38136	PRIVATE CARR: _(Lurches towards the watch)_ He insulted my lady friend.
 38137	
 38138	BLOOM: _(Angrily)_ You hit him without provocation. I'm a witness.
 38139	Constable, take his regimental number.
 38140	
 38141	SECOND WATCH: I don't want your instructions in the discharge of my
 38142	duty.
 38143	
 38144	PRIVATE COMPTON: _(Pulling his comrade)_ Here, bugger off Harry. Or
 38145	Bennett'll shove you in the lockup.
 38146	
 38147	PRIVATE CARR: _(Staggering as he is pulled away)_ God fuck old Bennett.
 38148	He's a whitearsed bugger. I don't give a shit for him.
 38149	
 38150	FIRST WATCH: _(Takes out his notebook)_ What's his name?
 38151	
 38152	BLOOM: _(Peering over the crowd)_ I just see a car there. If you give me
 38153	a hand a second, sergeant...
 38154	
 38155	FIRST WATCH: Name and address.
 38156	
 38157	_(Corny Kelleker, weepers round his hat, a death wreath in his hand,
 38158	appears among the bystanders.)_
 38159	
 38160	BLOOM: _(Quickly)_ O, the very man! _(He whispers)_ Simon Dedalus' son.
 38161	A bit sprung. Get those policemen to move those loafers back.
 38162	
 38163	SECOND WATCH: Night, Mr Kelleher.
 38164
