 39497	cleansing committee all over the place for the purpose but after a brief
 39498	space of time during which silence reigned supreme the sailor, evidently
 39499	giving it a wide berth, eased himself closer at hand, the noise of his
 39500	bilgewater some little time subsequently splashing on the ground where
 39501	it apparently awoke a horse of the cabrank. A hoof scooped anyway for
 39502	new foothold after sleep and harness jingled. Slightly disturbed in his
 39503	sentrybox by the brazier of live coke the watcher of the corporation
 39504	stones who, though now broken down and fast breaking up, was none other
 39505	in stern reality than the Gumley aforesaid, now practically on the
 39506	parish rates, given the temporary job by Pat Tobin in all human
 39507	probability from dictates of humanity knowing him before shifted about
 39508	and shuffled in his box before composing his limbs again in to the arms
 39509	of Morpheus, a truly amazing piece of hard lines in its most virulent
 39510	form on a fellow most respectably connected and familiarised with decent
 39511	home comforts all his life who came in for a cool 100 pounds a year
 39512	at one time which of course the doublebarrelled ass proceeded to make
 39513	general ducks and drakes of. And there he was at the end of his tether
 39514	after having often painted the town tolerably pink without a beggarly
 39515	stiver. He drank needless to be told and it pointed only once more a
 39516	moral when he might quite easily be in a large way of business if--a
 39517	big if, however--he had contrived to cure himself of his particular
 39518	partiality.
 39519	
 39520	All meantime were loudly lamenting the falling off in Irish shipping,
 39521	coastwise and foreign as well, which was all part and parcel of the same
 39522	thing. A Palgrave Murphy boat was put off the ways at Alexandra basin,
 39523	the only launch that year. Right enough the harbours were there only no
 39524	ships ever called.
 39525	
 39526	There were wrecks and wreckers, the keeper said, who was evidently _au
 39527	fait_.
 39528	
 39529	What he wanted to ascertain was why that ship ran bang against the only
 39530	rock in Galway bay when the Galway harbour scheme was mooted by a Mr
 39531	Worthington or some name like that, eh? Ask the then captain, he advised
 39532	them, how much palmoil the British government gave him for that day's
 39533	work, Captain John Lever of the Lever Line.
 39534	
 39535	--Am I right, skipper? he queried of the sailor, now returning after his
 39536	private potation and the rest of his exertions.
 39537	
 39538	That worthy picking up the scent of the fagend of the song or words
 39539	growled in wouldbe music but with great vim some kind of chanty or other
 39540	in seconds or thirds. Mr Bloom's sharp ears heard him then expectorate
 39541	the plug probably (which it was), so that he must have lodged it for the
 39542	time being in his fist while he did the drinking and making water jobs
 39543	and found it a bit sour after the liquid fire in question. Anyhow in
 39544	he rolled after his successful libation-_cum_-potation, introducing an
 39545	atmosphere of drink into the _soirÃ©e_, boisterously trolling, like a
 39546	veritable son of a seacook:
 39547	
 39548	     _--The biscuits was as hard as brass
 39549	     And the beef as salt as Lot's wife's arse.
 39550	     O, Johnny Lever!
 39551	     Johnny Lever, O!_
 39552	
 39553	After which effusion the redoubtable specimen duly arrived on the scene
 39554	and regaining his seat he sank rather than sat heavily on the form
 39555	provided. Skin-the-Goat, assuming he was he, evidently with an axe to
 39556	grind, was airing his grievances in a forcible-feeble philippic anent
 39557	the natural resources of Ireland or something of that sort which he
 39558	described in his lengthy dissertation as the richest country bar none on
 39559	the face of God's earth, far and away superior to England, with coal in
 39560	large quantities, six million pounds worth of pork exported every year,
 39561	ten millions between butter and eggs and all the riches drained out of
 39562	it by England levying taxes on the poor people that paid through the
 39563	nose always and gobbling up the best meat in the market and a lot more
 39564	surplus steam in the same vein. Their conversation accordingly became
 39565	general and all agreed that that was a fact. You could grow any mortal
 39566	thing in Irish soil, he stated, and there was that colonel Everard down
 39567	there in Navan growing tobacco. Where would you find anywhere the like
 39568	of Irish bacon? But a day of reckoning, he stated _crescendo_ with no
 39569	uncertain voice, thoroughly monopolising all the conversation, was in
 39570	store for mighty England, despite her power of pelf on account of her
 39571	crimes. There would be a fall and the greatest fall in history.
 39572	The Germans and the Japs were going to have their little lookin, he
 39573	affirmed. The Boers were the beginning of the end. Brummagem England was
 39574	toppling already and her downfall would be Ireland, her Achilles heel,
 39575	which he explained to them about the vulnerable point of Achilles, the
 39576	Greek hero, a point his auditors at once seized as he completely gripped
 39577	their attention by showing the tendon referred to on his boot. His
 39578	advice to every Irishman was: stay in the land of your birth and work
 39579	for Ireland and live for Ireland. Ireland, Parnell said, could not spare
 39580	a single one of her sons.
 39581	
 39582	Silence all round marked the termination of his _finale_. The impervious
 39583	navigator heard these lurid tidings, undismayed.
 39584	
 39585	--Take a bit of doing, boss, retaliated that rough diamond palpably a
 39586	bit peeved in response to the foregoing truism.
 39587	
 39588	To which cold douche referring to downfall and so on the keeper
 39589	concurred but nevertheless held to his main view.
 39590	
 39591	--Who's the best troops in the army? the grizzled old veteran irately
 39592	interrogated. And the best jumpers and racers? And the best admirals and
 39593	generals we've got? Tell me that.
 39594	
 39595	--The Irish, for choice, retorted the cabby like Campbell, facial
 39596	blemishes apart.
 39597	
 39598	--That's right, the old tarpaulin corroborated. The Irish catholic
 39599	peasant. He's the backbone of our empire. You know Jem Mullins?
 39600	
 39601	While allowing him his individual opinions as everyman the keeper added
 39602	he cared nothing for any empire, ours or his, and considered no Irishman
 39603	worthy of his salt that served it. Then they began to have a few
 39604	irascible words when it waxed hotter, both, needless to say, appealing
 39605	to the listeners who followed the passage of arms with interest so long
 39606	as they didn't indulge in recriminations and come to blows.
 39607	
 39608	From inside information extending over a series of years Mr Bloom was
 39609	rather inclined to poohpooh the suggestion as egregious balderdash for,
 39610	pending that consummation devoutly to be or not to be wished for, he was
 39611	fully cognisant of the fact that their neighbours across the channel,
 39612	unless they were much bigger fools than he took them for, rather
 39613	concealed their strength than the opposite. It was quite on a par with
 39614	the quixotic idea in certain quarters that in a hundred million years
 39615	the coal seam of the sister island would be played out and if, as
 39616	time went on, that turned out to be how the cat jumped all he could
 39617	personally say on the matter was that as a host of contingencies,
 39618	equally relevant to the issue, might occur ere then it was highly
 39619	advisable in the interim to try to make the most of both countries even
 39620	though poles apart. Another little interesting point, the amours of
 39621	whores and chummies, to put it in common parlance, reminded him Irish
 39622	soldiers had as often fought for England as against her, more so, in
 39623	fact. And now, why? So the scene between the pair of them, the licensee
 39624	of the place rumoured to be or have been Fitzharris, the famous
 39625	invincible, and the other, obviously bogus, reminded him forcibly as
 39626	being on all fours with the confidence trick, supposing, that is, it was
 39627	prearranged as the lookeron, a student of the human soul if anything,
 39628	the others seeing least of the game. And as for the lessee or keeper,
 39629	who probably wasn't the other person at all, he (B.) couldn't help
 39630	feeling and most properly it was better to give people like that the
 39631	goby unless you were a blithering idiot altogether and refuse to have
 39632	anything to do with them as a golden rule in private life and their
 39633	felonsetting, there always being the offchance of a Dannyman coming
 39634	forward and turning queen's evidence or king's now like Denis or Peter
 39635	Carey, an idea he utterly repudiated. Quite apart from that he disliked
 39636	those careers of wrongdoing and crime on principle. Yet, though such
 39637	criminal propensities had never been an inmate of his bosom in any
 39638	shape or form, he certainly did feel and no denying it (while inwardly
 39639	remaining what he was) a certain kind of admiration for a man who
 39640	had actually brandished a knife, cold steel, with the courage of his
 39641	political convictions (though, personally, he would never be a party to
 39642	any such thing), off the same bat as those love vendettas of the south,
 39643	have her or swing for her, when the husband frequently, after some words
 39644	passed between the two concerning her relations with the other lucky
 39645	mortal (he having had the pair watched), inflicted fatal injuries on
 39646	his adored one as a result of an alternative postnuptial _liaison_
 39647	by plunging his knife into her, until it just struck him that
 39648	Fitz, nicknamed Skin-the-Goat, merely drove the car for the actual
 39649	perpetrators of the outrage and so was not, if he was reliably informed,
 39650	actually party to the ambush which, in point of fact, was the plea some
 39651	legal luminary saved his skin on. In any case that was very ancient
 39652	history by now and as for our friend, the pseudo Skin-the-etcetera, he
 39653	had transparently outlived his welcome. He ought to have either died
 39654	naturally or on the scaffold high. Like actresses, always farewell
 39655	positively last performance then come up smiling again. Generous to a
 39656	fault of course, temperamental, no economising or any idea of the sort,
 39657	always snapping at the bone for the shadow. So similarly he had a very
 39658	shrewd suspicion that Mr Johnny Lever got rid of some l s d. in the
 39659	course of his perambulations round the docks in the congenial atmosphere
 39660	of the _Old Ireland_ tavern, come back to Erin and so on. Then as for
 39661	the other he had heard not so long before the same identical lingo as he
 39662	told Stephen how he simply but effectually silenced the offender.
 39663	
 39664	--He took umbrage at something or other, that muchinjured but on the
 39665	whole eventempered person declared, I let slip. He called me a jew and
 39666	in a heated fashion offensively. So I without deviating from plain facts
 39667	in the least told him his God, I mean Christ, was a jew too and all his
 39668	family like me though in reality I'm not. That was one for him. A soft
 39669	answer turns away wrath. He hadn't a word to say for himself as everyone
 39670	saw. Am I not right?
 39671	
 39672	He turned a long you are wrong gaze on Stephen of timorous dark pride
 39673	at the soft impeachment with a glance also of entreaty for he seemed to
 39674	glean in a kind of a way that it wasn't all exactly.
 39675	
 39676	--_Ex quibus_, Stephen mumbled in a noncommittal accent, their two or
 39677	four eyes conversing, _Christus_ or Bloom his name is or after all any
 39678	other, _secundum carnem_.
 39679	
 39680	--Of course, Mr B. proceeded to stipulate, you must look at both sides
 39681	of the question. It is hard to lay down any hard and fast rules as to
 39682	right and wrong but room for improvement all round there certainly is
 39683	though every country, they say, our own distressful included, has the
 39684	government it deserves. But with a little goodwill all round. It's all
 39685	very fine to boast of mutual superiority but what about mutual equality.
 39686	I resent violence and intolerance in any shape or form. It never
 39687	reaches anything or stops anything. A revolution must come on the due
 39688	instalments plan. It's a patent absurdity on the face of it to hate
 39689	people because they live round the corner and speak another vernacular,
 39690	in the next house so to speak.
 39691	
 39692	--Memorable bloody bridge battle and seven minutes' war, Stephen
 39693	assented, between Skinner's alley and Ormond market.
 39694	
 39695	Yes, Mr Bloom thoroughly agreed, entirely endorsing the remark, that
 39696	was overwhelmingly right. And the whole world was full of that sort of
 39697	thing.
 39698	
 39699	--You just took the words out of my mouth, he said. A hocuspocus of
 39700	conflicting evidence that candidly you couldn't remotely...
 39701	
 39702	All those wretched quarrels, in his humble opinion, stirring up
 39703	bad blood, from some bump of combativeness or gland of some kind,
 39704	erroneously supposed to be about a punctilio of honour and a flag, were
 39705	very largely a question of the money question which was at the back of
 39706	everything greed and jealousy, people never knowing when to stop.
 39707	
 39708	--They accuse, remarked he audibly.
 39709	
 39710	He turned away from the others who probably and spoke nearer to, so as
 39711	the others in case they.
 39712	
 39713	--Jews, he softly imparted in an aside in Stephen's ear, are accused of
 39714	ruining. Not a vestige of truth in it, I can safely say. History, would
 39715	you be surprised to learn, proves up to the hilt Spain decayed when the
 39716	inquisition hounded the jews out and England prospered when Cromwell,
 39717	an uncommonly able ruffian who in other respects has much to answer for,
 39718	imported them. Why? Because they are imbued with the proper spirit. They
 39719	are practical and are proved to be so. I don't want to indulge in any
 39720	because you know the standard works on the subject and then orthodox as
 39721	you are. But in the economic, not touching religion, domain the priest
 39722	spells poverty. Spain again, you saw in the war, compared with goahead
 39723	America. Turks. It's in the dogma. Because if they didn't believe they'd
 39724	go straight to heaven when they die they'd try to live better, at least
 39725	so I think. That's the juggle on which the p.p's raise the wind on false
 39726	pretences. I'm, he resumed with dramatic force, as good an Irishman
 39727	as that rude person I told you about at the outset and I want to see
 39728	everyone, concluded he, all creeds and classes _pro rata_ having a
 39729	comfortable tidysized income, in no niggard fashion either, something
 39730	in the neighbourhood of 300 pounds per annum. That's the vital issue
 39731	at stake and it's feasible and would be provocative of friendlier
 39732	intercourse between man and man. At least that's my idea for what it's
 39733	worth. I call that patriotism. _Ubi patria_, as we learned a smattering
 39734	of in our classical days in _Alma Mater, vita bene_. Where you can live
 39735	well, the sense is, if you work.
 39736	
 39737	Over his untastable apology for a cup of coffee, listening to this
 39738	synopsis of things in general, Stephen stared at nothing in particular.
 39739	He could hear, of course, all kinds of words changing colour like those
 39740	crabs about Ringsend in the morning burrowing quickly into all colours
 39741	of different sorts of the same sand where they had a home somewhere
 39742	beneath or seemed to. Then he looked up and saw the eyes that said or
 39743	didn't say the words the voice he heard said, if you work.
 39744	
 39745	--Count me out, he managed to remark, meaning work.
 39746	
 39747	The eyes were surprised at this observation because as he, the person
 39748	who owned them pro tem. observed or rather his voice speaking did, all
 39749	must work, have to, together.
 39750	
 39751	--I mean, of course, the other hastened to affirm, work in the widest
 39752	possible sense. Also literary labour not merely for the kudos of
 39753	the thing. Writing for the newspapers which is the readiest channel
 39754	nowadays. That's work too. Important work. After all, from the little
 39755	I know of you, after all the money expended on your education you are
 39756	entitled to recoup yourself and command your price. You have every bit
 39757	as much right to live by your pen in pursuit of your philosophy as the
 39758	peasant has. What? You both belong to Ireland, the brain and the brawn.
 39759	Each is equally important.
 39760	
 39761	--You suspect, Stephen retorted with a sort of a half laugh, that I may
 39762	be important because I belong to the _faubourg Saint Patrice_ called
 39763	Ireland for short.
 39764	
 39765	--I would go a step farther, Mr Bloom insinuated.
 39766	
 39767	--But I suspect, Stephen interrupted, that Ireland must be important
 39768	because it belongs to me.
 39769	
 39770	--What belongs, queried Mr Bloom bending, fancying he was perhaps under
 39771	some misapprehension. Excuse me. Unfortunately, I didn't catch the
 39772	latter portion. What was it you...?
 39773	
 39774	Stephen, patently crosstempered, repeated and shoved aside his mug of
 39775	coffee or whatever you like to call it none too politely, adding: 1170
 39776	
 39777	--We can't change the country. Let us change the subject.
 39778	
 39779	At this pertinent suggestion Mr Bloom, to change the subject, looked
 39780	down but in a quandary, as he couldn't tell exactly what construction
 39781	to put on belongs to which sounded rather a far cry. The rebuke of some
 39782	kind was clearer than the other part. Needless to say the fumes of
 39783	his recent orgy spoke then with some asperity in a curious bitter way
 39784	foreign to his sober state. Probably the homelife to which Mr B attached
 39785	the utmost importance had not been all that was needful or he hadn't
 39786	been familiarised with the right sort of people. With a touch of fear
 39787	for the young man beside him whom he furtively scrutinised with an air
 39788	of some consternation remembering he had just come back from Paris,
 39789	the eyes more especially reminding him forcibly of father and sister,
 39790	failing to throw much light on the subject, however, he brought to mind
 39791	instances of cultured fellows that promised so brilliantly nipped in the
 39792	bud of premature decay and nobody to blame but themselves. For instance
 39793	there was the case of O'Callaghan, for one, the halfcrazy faddist,
 39794	respectably connected though of inadequate means, with his mad vagaries
 39795	among whose other gay doings when rotto and making himself a nuisance
 39796	to everybody all round he was in the habit of ostentatiously sporting in
 39797	public a suit of brown paper (a fact). And then the usual _denouement_
 39798	after the fun had gone on fast and furious he got 1190 landed into hot
 39799	water and had to be spirited away by a few friends, after a strong hint
 39800	to a blind horse from John Mallon of Lower Castle Yard, so as not to
 39801	be made amenable under section two of the criminal law amendment act,
 39802	certain names of those subpoenaed being handed in but not divulged
 39803	for reasons which will occur to anyone with a pick of brains. Briefly,
 39804	putting two and two together, six sixteen which he pointedly turned a
 39805	deaf ear to, Antonio and so forth, jockeys and esthetes and the tattoo
 39806	which was all the go in the seventies or thereabouts even in the house
 39807	of lords because early in life the occupant of the throne, then heir
 39808	apparent, the other members of the upper ten and other high personages
 39809	simply following in the footsteps of the head of the state, he reflected
 39810	about the errors of notorieties and crowned heads running counter to
 39811	morality such as the Cornwall case a number of years before under their
 39812	veneer in a way scarcely intended by nature, a thing good Mrs Grundy,
 39813	as the law stands, was terribly down on though not for the reason they
 39814	thought they were probably whatever it was except women chiefly who were
 39815	always fiddling more or less at one another it being largely a matter of
 39816	dress and all the rest of it. Ladies who like distinctive underclothing
 39817	should, and every welltailored man must, trying to make the gap wider
 39818	between them by innuendo and give more of a genuine filip to acts of
 39819	impropriety between the two, she unbuttoned his and then he untied her,
 39820	mind the pin, whereas savages in the cannibal islands, say, at ninety
 39821	degrees in the shade not caring a continental. However, reverting to the
 39822	original, there were on the other hand others who had forced their way
 39823	to the top from the lowest rung by the aid of their bootstraps. Sheer
 39824	force of natural genius, that. With brains, sir.
 39825	
 39826	For which and further reasons he felt it was his interest and duty even
 39827	to wait on and profit by the unlookedfor occasion though why he could
 39828	not exactly tell being as it was already several shillings to the
 39829	bad having in fact let himself in for it. Still to cultivate the
 39830	acquaintance of someone of no uncommon calibre who could provide food
 39831	for reflection would amply repay any small. Intellectual stimulation,
 39832	as such, was, he felt, from time to time a firstrate tonic for the mind.
 39833	Added to which was the coincidence of meeting, discussion, dance, row,
 39834	old salt of the here today and gone tomorrow type, night loafers, the
 39835	whole galaxy of events, all went to make up a miniature cameo of the
 39836	world we live in especially as the lives of the submerged tenth, viz.
 39837	coalminers, divers, scavengers etc., were very much under the microscope
 39838	lately. To improve the shining hour he wondered whether he might meet
 39839	with anything approaching the same luck as Mr Philip Beaufoy if taken
 39840	down in writing suppose he were to pen something out of the common
 39841	groove (as he fully intended doing) at the rate of one guinea per
 39842	column. _My Experiences_, let us say, _in a Cabman's Shelter_.
 39843	
 39844	The pink edition extra sporting of the _Telegraph_ tell a graphic lie
 39845	lay, as luck would have it, beside his elbow and as he was just puzzling
 39846	again, far from satisfied, over a country belonging to him and the
 39847	preceding rebus the vessel came from Bridgwater and the postcard was
 39848	addressed A. Boudin find the captain's age, his eyes went aimlessly
 39849	over the respective captions which came under his special province the
 39850	allembracing give us this day our daily press. First he got a bit of a
 39851	start but it turned out to be only something about somebody named H.
 39852	du Boyes, agent for typewriters or something like that. Great battle,
 39853	Tokio. Lovemaking in Irish, 200 pounds damages. Gordon Bennett.
 39854	Emigration Swindle. Letter from His Grace. William. Ascot meeting,
 39855	the Gold Cup. Victory of outsider _Throwaway_ recalls Derby of '92 when
 39856	Capt. Marshall's dark horse _Sir Hugo_ captured the blue ribband at long
 39857	odds. New York disaster. Thousand lives lost. Foot and Mouth. Funeral of
 39858	the late Mr Patrick Dignam.
 39859	
 39860	So to change the subject he read about Dignam R. I. P. which, he
 39861	reflected, was anything but a gay sendoff. Or a change of address
 39862	anyway.
 39863	
 39864	--_This morning_ (Hynes put it in of course) _the remains of the late Mr
 39865	Patrick Dignam were removed from his residence, no 9 Newbridge Avenue,
 39866	Sandymount, for interment in Glasnevin. The deceased gentleman was a
 39867	most popular and genial personality in city life and his demise after a
 39868	brief illness came as a great shock to citizens of all classes by whom
 39869	he is deeply regretted. The obsequies, at which many friends of the
 39870	deceased were present, were carried out_ (certainly Hynes wrote it with
 39871	a nudge from Corny) _by Messrs H. J. O'Neill and Son, 164 North Strand
 39872	Road. The mourners included: Patk. Dignam (son), Bernard Corrigan
 39873	(brother-in-law), Jno. Henry Menton, solr, Martin Cunningham, John
 39874	Power, eatondph 1/8 ador dorador douradora_ (must be where he called
 39875	Monks the dayfather about Keyes's ad) _Thomas Kernan, Simon Dedalus,
 39876	Stephen Dedalus B.,4., Edw. J. Lambert, Cornelius T. Kelleher, Joseph
 39877	M'C Hynes, L. Boom, CP M'Coy,--M'lntosh and several others_.
 39878	
 39879	Nettled not a little by L. _Boom_ (as it incorrectly stated) and the
 39880	line of bitched type but tickled to death simultaneously by C. P. M'Coy
 39881	and Stephen Dedalus B. A. who were conspicuous, needless to say, by
 39882	their total absence (to say nothing of M'Intosh) L. Boom pointed it
 39883	out to his companion B. A. engaged in stifling another yawn, half
 39884	nervousness, not forgetting the usual crop of nonsensical howlers of
 39885	misprints.
 39886	
 39887	--Is that first epistle to the Hebrews, he asked as soon as his bottom
 39888	jaw would let him, in? Text: open thy mouth and put thy foot in it.
 39889	
 39890	--It is. Really, Mr Bloom said (though first he fancied he alluded to
 39891	the archbishop till he added about foot and mouth with which there could
 39892	be no possible connection) overjoyed to set his mind at rest and a bit
 39893	flabbergasted at Myles Crawford's after all managing to. There.
 39894	
 39895	While the other was reading it on page two Boom (to give him for the
 39896	nonce his new misnomer) whiled away a few odd leisure moments in fits
 39897	and starts with the account of the third event at Ascot on page three,
 39898	his side. Value 1000 sovs with 3000 sovs in specie added. For entire
 39899	colts and fillies. Mr F. Alexander's _Throwaway_, b. h. by _Rightaway_,
 39900	5 yrs, 9 st 4 lbs (W. Lane) 1, lord Howard de Walden's _Zinfandel_ (M.
 39901	Cannon) z, Mr W. Bass's _Sceptre_ 3. Betting 5 to 4 on _Zinfandel_,
 39902	20 to 1 _Throwaway_ (off). _Sceptre_ a shade heavier, 5 to 4 on
 39903	_Zinfandel_, 20 to 1 _Throwaway_ (off). _Throwaway_ and _Zinfandel_
 39904	stood close order. It was anybody's race then the rank outsider drew to
 39905	the fore, got long lead, beating lord Howard de Walden's chestnut
 39906	colt and Mr W. Bass's bay filly Sceptre on a 2 1/2 mile course. Winner
 39907	trained by Braime so that Lenehan's version of the business was all pure
 39908	buncombe. Secured the verdict cleverly by a length. 1000 sovs with
 39909	3000 in specie. Also ran: J de Bremond's (French horse Bantam Lyons was
 39910	anxiously inquiring after not in yet but expected any minute) _Maximum
 39911	II_. Different ways of bringing off a coup. Lovemaking damages. Though
 39912	that halfbaked Lyons ran off at a tangent in his impetuosity to get
 39913	left. Of course gambling eminently lent itself to that sort of thing
 39914	though as the event turned out the poor fool hadn't much reason to
 39915	congratulate himself on his pick, the forlorn hope. Guesswork it reduced
 39916	itself to eventually.
 39917	
 39918	--There was every indication they would arrive at that, he, Bloom, said.
 39919	
 39920	--Who? the other, whose hand by the way was hurt, said.
 39921	
 39922	One morning you would open the paper, the cabman affirmed, and read:
 39923	_Return of Parnell_. He bet them what they liked. A Dublin fusilier was
 39924	in that shelter one night and said he saw him in South Africa. Pride it
 39925	was killed him. He ought to have done away with himself or lain low for
 39926	a time after committee room no 15 until he was his old self again with
 39927	no-one to point a finger at him. Then they would all to a man have gone
 39928	down on their marrowbones to him to come back when he had recovered
 39929	his senses. Dead he wasn't. Simply absconded somewhere. The coffin they
 39930	brought over was full of stones. He changed his name to De Wet, the Boer
 39931	general. He made a mistake to fight the priests. And so forth and so on.
 39932	
 39933	All the same Bloom (properly so dubbed) was rather surprised at their
 39934	memories for in nine cases out of ten it was a case of tarbarrels and
 39935	not singly but in their thousands and then complete oblivion because it
 39936	was twenty odd years. Highly unlikely of course there was even a shadow
 39937	of truth in the stones and, even supposing, he thought a return highly
 39938	inadvisable, all things considered. Something evidently riled them in
 39939	his death. Either he petered out too tamely of acute pneumonia just when
 39940	his various different political arrangements were nearing completion
 39941	or whether it transpired he owed his death to his having neglected to
 39942	change his boots and clothes-after a wetting when a cold resulted and
 39943	failing to consult a specialist he being confined to his room till he
 39944	eventually died of it amid widespread regret before a fortnight was at
 39945	an end or quite possibly they were distressed to find the job was taken
 39946	out of their hands. Of course nobody being acquainted with his movements
 39947	even before there was absolutely no clue as to his whereabouts which
 39948	were decidedly of the _Alice, where art thou_ order even prior to his
 39949	starting to go under several aliases such as Fox and Stewart so the
 39950	remark which emanated from friend cabby might be within the bounds of
 39951	possibility. Naturally then it would prey on his mind as a born leader
 39952	of men which undoubtedly he was and a commanding figure, a sixfooter
 39953	or at any rate five feet ten or eleven in his stockinged feet, whereas
 39954	Messrs So and So who, though they weren't even a patch on the former
 39955	man, ruled the roost after their redeeming features were very few and
 39956	far between. It certainly pointed a moral, the idol with feet of clay,
 39957	and then seventytwo of his trusty henchmen rounding on him with mutual
 39958	mudslinging. And the identical same with murderers. You had to come
 39959	back. That haunting sense kind of drew you. To show the understudy in
 39960	the title _rÃ´le_ how to. He saw him once on the auspicious occasion
 39961	when they broke up the type in the _Insuppressible_ or was it _United
 39962	Ireland_, a privilege he keenly appreciated, and, in point of fact,
 39963	handed him his silk hat when it was knocked off and he said _Thank you_,
 39964	excited as he undoubtedly was under his frigid exterior notwithstanding
 39965	the little misadventure mentioned between the cup and the lip: what's
 39966	bred in the bone. Still as regards return. You were a lucky dog if
 39967	they didn't set the terrier at you directly you got back. Then a lot of
 39968	shillyshally usually followed, Tom for and Dick and Harry against. And
 39969	then, number one, you came up against the man in possession and had to
 39970	produce your credentials like the claimant in the Tichborne case,
 39971	Roger Charles Tichborne, _Bella_ was the boat's name to the best of his
 39972	recollection he, the heir, went down in as the evidence went to show
 39973	and there was a tattoo mark too in Indian ink, lord Bellew was it, as he
 39974	might very easily have picked up the details from some pal on board ship
 39975	and then, when got up to tally with the description given, introduce
 39976	himself with: _Excuse me, my name is So and So_ or some such commonplace
 39977	remark. A more prudent course, as Bloom said to the not over effusive,
 39978	in fact like the distinguished personage under discussion beside him,
 39979	would have been to sound the lie of the land first.
 39980	
 39981	--That bitch, that English whore, did for him, the shebeen proprietor
 39982	commented. She put the first nail in his coffin.
 39983	
 39984	--Fine lump of a woman all the same, the _soi-disant_ townclerk Henry
 39985	Campbell remarked, and plenty of her. She loosened many a man's thighs.
 39986	I seen her picture in a barber's. The husband was a captain or an
 39987	officer.
 39988	
 39989	--Ay, Skin-the-Goat amusingly added, he was and a cottonball one.
 39990	
 39991	This gratuitous contribution of a humorous character occasioned a fair
 39992	amount of laughter among his _entourage_. As regards Bloom he, without
 39993	the faintest suspicion of a smile, merely gazed in the direction of
 39994	the door and reflected upon the historic story which had aroused
 39995	extraordinary interest at the time when the facts, to make matters
 39996	worse, were made public with the usual affectionate letters that passed
 39997	between them full of sweet nothings. First it was strictly Platonic till
 39998	nature intervened and an attachment sprang up between them till bit by
 39999	bit matters came to a climax and the matter became the talk of the town
 40000	till the staggering blow came as a welcome intelligence to not a few
 40001	evildisposed, however, who were resolved upon encompassing his downfall
 40002	though the thing was public property all along though not to anything
 40003	like the sensational extent that it subsequently blossomed into. Since
 40004	their names were coupled, though, since he was her declared favourite,
 40005	where was the particular necessity to proclaim it to the rank and file
 40006	from the housetops, the fact, namely, that he had shared her bedroom
 40007	which came out in the witnessbox on oath when a thrill went through the
 40008	packed court literally electrifying everybody in the shape of witnesses
 40009	swearing to having witnessed him on such and such a particular date in
 40010	the act of scrambling out of an upstairs apartment with the assistance
 40011	of a ladder in night apparel, having gained admittance in the same
 40012	fashion, a fact the weeklies, addicted to the lubric a little, simply
 40013	coined shoals of money out of. Whereas the simple fact of the case was
 40014	it was simply a case of the husband not being up to the scratch, with
 40015	nothing in common between them beyond the name, and then a real man
 40016	arriving on the scene, strong to the verge of weakness, falling a victim
 40017	to her siren charms and forgetting home ties, the usual sequel, to bask
 40018	in the loved one's smiles. The eternal question of the life connubial,
 40019	needless to say, cropped up. Can real love, supposing there happens to
 40020	be another chap in the case, exist between married folk? Poser.
 40021	Though it was no concern of theirs absolutely if he regarded her with
 40022	affection, carried away by a wave of folly. A magnificent specimen of
 40023	manhood he was truly augmented obviously by gifts of a high order, as
 40024	compared with the other military supernumerary that is (who was just the
 40025	usual everyday _farewell, my gallant captain_ kind of an individual in
 40026	the light dragoons, the 18th hussars to be accurate) and inflammable
 40027	doubtless (the fallen leader, that is, not the other) in his own
 40028	peculiar way which she of course, woman, quickly perceived as highly
 40029	likely to carve his way to fame which he almost bid fair to do till the
 40030	priests and ministers of the gospel as a whole, his erstwhile staunch
 40031	adherents, and his beloved evicted tenants for whom he had done yeoman
 40032	service in the rural parts of the country by taking up the cudgels on
 40033	their behalf in a way that exceeded their most sanguine expectations,
 40034	very effectually cooked his matrimonial goose, thereby heaping coals of
 40035	fire on his head much in the same way as the fabled ass's kick. Looking
 40036	back now in a retrospective kind of arrangement all seemed a kind of
 40037	dream. And then coming back was the worst thing you ever did because it
 40038	went without saying you would feel out of place as things always moved
 40039	with the times. Why, as he reflected, Irishtown strand, a locality he
 40040	had not been in for quite a number of years looked different somehow
 40041	since, as it happened, he went to reside on the north side. North or
 40042	south, however, it was just the wellknown case of hot passion, pure and
 40043	simple, upsetting the applecart with a vengeance and just bore out the
 40044	very thing he was saying as she also was Spanish or half so, types that
 40045	wouldn't do things by halves, passionate abandon of the south, casting
 40046	every shred of decency to the winds.
 40047	
 40048	--Just bears out what I was saying, he, with glowing bosom said to
 40049	Stephen, about blood and the sun. And, if I don't greatly mistake she
 40050	was Spanish too.
 40051	
 40052	--The king of Spain's daughter, Stephen answered, adding something or
 40053	other rather muddled about farewell and adieu to you Spanish onions and
 40054	the first land called the Deadman and from Ramhead to Scilly was so and
 40055	so many.
 40056	
 40057	--Was she? Bloom ejaculated, surprised though not astonished by any
 40058	means, I never heard that rumour before. Possible, especially there, it
 40059	was as she lived there. So, Spain.
 40060	
 40061	Carefully avoiding a book in his pocket _Sweets of_, which reminded him
 40062	by the by of that Cap l street library book out of date, he took out his
 40063	pocketbook and, turning over the various contents it contained rapidly
 40064	finally he.
 40065	
 40066	--Do you consider, by the by, he said, thoughtfully selecting a faded
 40067	photo which he laid on the table, that a Spanish type?
 40068	
 40069	Stephen, obviously addressed, looked down on the photo showing a large
 40070	sized lady with her fleshy charms on evidence in an open fashion as she
 40071	was in the full bloom of womanhood in evening dress cut ostentatiously
 40072	low for the occasion to give a liberal display of bosom, with more than
 40073	vision of breasts, her full lips parted and some perfect teeth, standing
 40074	near, ostensibly with gravity, a piano on the rest of which was _In Old
 40075	Madrid_, a ballad, pretty in its way, which was then all the vogue. Her
 40076	(the lady's) eyes, dark, large, looked at Stephen, about to smile about
 40077	something to be admired, Lafayette of Westmoreland street, Dublin's
 40078	premier photographic artist, being responsible for the esthetic
 40079	execution.
 40080	
 40081	--Mrs Bloom, my wife the _prima donna_ Madam Marion Tweedy, Bloom
 40082	indicated. Taken a few years since. In or about ninety six. Very like
 40083	her then.
 40084	
 40085	Beside the young man he looked also at the photo of the lady now his
 40086	1440 legal wife who, he intimated, was the accomplished daughter of
 40087	Major Brian Tweedy and displayed at an early age remarkable proficiency
 40088	as a singer having even made her bow to the public when her years
 40089	numbered barely sweet sixteen. As for the face it was a speaking
 40090	likeness in expression but it did not do justice to her figure which
 40091	came in for a lot of notice usually and which did not come out to the
 40092	best advantage in that getup. She could without difficulty, he said,
 40093	have posed for the ensemble, not to dwell on certain opulent curves of
 40094	the. He dwelt, being a bit of an artist in his spare time, on the female
 40095	form in general developmentally because, as it so happened, no later
 40096	than that afternoon he had seen those Grecian statues, 1450 perfectly
 40097	developed as works of art, in the National Museum. Marble could give
 40098	the original, shoulders, back, all the symmetry, all the rest. Yes,
 40099	puritanisme, it does though Saint Joseph's sovereign thievery alors
 40100	(Bandez!) Figne toi trop. Whereas no photo could because it simply
 40101	wasn't art in a word.
 40102	
 40103	The spirit moving him he would much have liked to follow Jack Tar's good
 40104	example and leave the likeness there for a very few minutes to speak for
 40105	itself on the plea he so that the other could drink in the beauty for
 40106	himself, her stage presence being, frankly, a treat in itself which the
 40107	camera could not at all do justice to. But it was scarcely professional
 40108	etiquette so. Though it was a warm pleasant sort of a night now yet
 40109	wonderfully cool for the season considering, for sunshine after storm.
 40110	And he did feel a kind of need there and then to follow suit like a
 40111	kind of inward voice and satisfy a possible need by moving a motion.
 40112	Nevertheless he sat tight just viewing the slightly soiled photo creased
 40113	by opulent curves, none the worse for wear however, and looked away
 40114	thoughtfully with the intention of not further increasing the
 40115	other's possible embarrassment while gauging her symmetry of heaving
 40116	_embonpoint_. In fact the slight soiling was only an added charm like
 40117	the case of linen slightly soiled, good as new, much better in fact
 40118	with the starch out. Suppose she was gone when he? I looked for the lamp
 40119	which she told me came into his mind but merely as a passing fancy of
 40120	his because he then recollected the morning littered bed etcetera and
 40121	the book about Ruby with met him pike hoses (_sic_) in it which must
 40122	have fell down sufficiently appropriately beside the domestic chamberpot
 40123	with apologies to Lindley Murray.
 40124	
 40125	The vicinity of the young man he certainly relished, educated,
 40126	_distinguÃ©_ and impulsive into the bargain, far and away the pick of the
 40127	bunch though you wouldn't think he had it in him yet you would. Besides
 40128	he said the picture was handsome which, say what you like, it was though
 40129	at the moment she was distinctly stouter. And why not? An awful lot of
 40130	makebelieve went on about that sort of thing involving a lifelong slur
 40131	with the usual splash page of gutterpress about the same old matrimonial
 40132	tangle alleging misconduct with professional golfer or the newest
 40133	stage favourite instead of being honest and aboveboard about the whole
 40134	business. How they were fated to meet and an attachment sprang up
 40135	between the two so that their names were coupled in the public eye
 40136	was told in court with letters containing the habitual mushy and
 40137	compromising expressions leaving no loophole to show that they openly
 40138	cohabited two or three times a week at some wellknown seaside hotel and
 40139	relations, when the thing ran its normal course, became in due course
 40140	intimate. Then the decree _nisi_ and the King's proctor tries to show
 40141	cause why and, he failing to quash it, _nisi_ was made absolute. But as
 40142	for that the two misdemeanants, wrapped up as they largely were in one
 40143	another, could safely afford to ignore it as they very largely did till
 40144	the matter was put in the hands of a solicitor who filed a petition for
 40145	the party wronged in due course. He, B, enjoyed the distinction of being
 40146	close to Erin's uncrowned king in the flesh when the thing occurred on
 40147	the historic _fracas_ when the fallen leader's, who notoriously stuck to
 40148	his guns to the last drop even when clothed in the mantle of adultery,
 40149	(leader's) trusty henchmen to the number of ten or a dozen or
 40150	possibly even more than that penetrated into the printing works of the
 40151	_Insuppressible_ or no it was _United Ireland_ (a by no means by the
 40152	by appropriate appellative) and broke up the typecases with hammers or
 40153	something like that all on account of some scurrilous effusions from
 40154	the facile pens of the O'Brienite scribes at the usual mudslinging
 40155	occupation reflecting on the erstwhile tribune's private morals. Though
 40156	palpably a radically altered man he was still a commanding figure though
 40157	carelessly garbed as usual with that look of settled purpose which went
 40158	a long way with the shillyshallyers till they discovered to their vast
 40159	discomfiture that their idol had feet of clay after placing him upon a
 40160	pedestal which she, however, was the first to perceive. As those were
 40161	particularly hot times in the general hullaballoo Bloom sustained a
 40162	minor injury from a nasty prod of some chap's elbow in the crowd that
 40163	of course congregated lodging some place about the pit of the stomach,
 40164	fortunately not of a grave character. His hat (Parnell's) a silk one was
 40165	inadvertently knocked off and, as a matter of strict history, Bloom was
 40166	the man who picked it up in the crush after witnessing the occurrence
 40167	meaning to return it to him (and return it to him he did with the utmost
 40168	celerity) who panting and hatless and whose thoughts were miles away
 40169	from his hat at the time all the same being a gentleman born with a
 40170	stake in the country he, as a matter of fact, having gone into it more
 40171	for the kudos of the thing than anything else, what's bred in the bone
 40172	instilled into him in infancy at his mother's knee in the shape of
 40173	knowing what good form was came out at once because he turned round to
 40174	the donor and thanked him with perfect _aplomb_, saying: _Thank you,
 40175	sir_, though in a very different tone of voice from the ornament of the
 40176	legal profession whose headgear Bloom also set to rights earlier in the
 40177	course of the day, history repeating itself with a difference, after
 40178	the burial of a mutual friend when they had left him alone in his glory
 40179	after the grim task of having committed his remains to the grave.
 40180	
 40181	On the other hand what incensed him more inwardly was the blatant jokes
 40182	of the cabman and so on who passed it all off as a jest, laughing 1530
 40183	immoderately, pretending to understand everything, the why and the
 40184	wherefore, and in reality not knowing their own minds, it being a case
 40185	for the two parties themselves unless it ensued that the legitimate
 40186	husband happened to be a party to it owing to some anonymous letter from
 40187	the usual boy Jones, who happened to come across them at the crucial
 40188	moment in a loving position locked in one another's arms, drawing
 40189	attention to their illicit proceedings and leading up to a domestic
 40190	rumpus and the erring fair one begging forgiveness of her lord and
 40191	master upon her knees and promising to sever the connection and not
 40192	receive his visits any more if only the aggrieved husband would overlook
 40193	the matter and let bygones be bygones with tears in her eyes though
 40194	possibly with her tongue in her fair cheek at the same time as quite
 40195	possibly there were several others. He personally, being of a sceptical
 40196	bias, believed and didn't make the smallest bones about saying so either
 40197	that man or men in the plural were always hanging around on the waiting
 40198	list about a lady, even supposing she was the best wife in the world
 40199	and they got on fairly well together for the sake of argument, when,
 40200	neglecting her duties, she chose to be tired of wedded life and was on
 40201	for a little flutter in polite debauchery to press their attentions on
 40202	her with improper intent, the upshot being that her affections centred
 40203	on another, the cause of many _liaisons_ between still attractive
 40204	married women getting on for fair and forty and younger men, no doubt as
 40205	several famous cases of feminine infatuation proved up to the hilt.
 40206	
 40207	It was a thousand pities a young fellow, blessed with an allowance of
 40208	brains as his neighbour obviously was, should waste his valuable time
 40209	with profligate women who might present him with a nice dose to last him
 40210	his lifetime. In the nature of single blessedness he would one day take
 40211	unto himself a wife when Miss Right came on the scene but in the interim
 40212	ladies' society was a _conditio sine qua non_ though he had the gravest
 40213	possible doubts, not that he wanted in the smallest to pump Stephen
 40214	about Miss Ferguson (who was very possibly the particular lodestar who
 40215	brought him down to Irishtown so early in the morning), as to whether he
 40216	would find much satisfaction basking in the boy and girl courtship idea
 40217	and the company of smirking misses without a penny to their names bi or
 40218	triweekly with the orthodox preliminary canter of complimentplaying and
 40219	walking out leading up to fond lovers' ways and flowers and chocs. To
 40220	think of him house and homeless, rooked by some landlady worse than any
 40221	stepmother, was really too bad at his age. The queer suddenly things
 40222	he popped out with attracted the elder man who was several years the
 40223	other's senior or like his father but something substantial he certainly
 40224	ought to eat even were it only an eggflip made on unadulterated maternal
 40225	nutriment or, failing that, the homely Humpty Dumpty boiled.
 40226	
 40227	--At what o'clock did you dine? he questioned of the slim form and tired
 40228	though unwrinkled face.
 40229	
 40230	--Some time yesterday, Stephen said.
 40231	
 40232	--Yesterday! exclaimed Bloom till he remembered it was already tomorrow
 40233	Friday. Ah, you mean it's after twelve!
 40234	
 40235	--The day before yesterday, Stephen said, improving on himself.
 40236	
 40237	Literally astounded at this piece of intelligence Bloom reflected.
 40238	Though they didn't see eye to eye in everything a certain analogy there
 40239	somehow was as if both their minds were travelling, so to speak, in the
 40240	one train of thought. At his age when dabbling in politics roughly
 40241	some score of years previously when he had been a _quasi_ aspirant to
 40242	parliamentary honours in the Buckshot Foster days he too recollected in
 40243	retrospect (which was a source of keen satisfaction in itself) he had
 40244	a sneaking regard for those same ultra ideas. For instance when the
 40245	evicted tenants question, then at its first inception, bulked largely in
 40246	people's mind though, it goes without saying, not contributing a copper
 40247	or pinning his faith absolutely to its dictums, some of which wouldn't
 40248	exactly hold water, he at the outset in principle at all events was in
 40249	thorough sympathy with peasant possession as voicing the trend of modern
 40250	opinion (a partiality, however, which, realising his mistake, he was
 40251	subsequently partially cured of) and even was twitted with going a
 40252	step farther than Michael Davitt in the striking views he at one time
 40253	inculcated as a backtothelander, which was one reason he strongly
 40254	resented the innuendo put upon him in so barefaced a fashion by our
 40255	friend at the gathering of the clans in Barney Kiernan's so that he,
 40256	though often considerably misunderstood and the least pugnacious of
 40257	mortals, be it repeated, departed from his customary habit to give
 40258	him (metaphorically) one in the gizzard though, so far as politics
 40259	themselves were concerned, he was only too conscious of the casualties
 40260	invariably resulting from propaganda and displays of mutual animosity
 40261	and the misery and suffering it entailed as a foregone conclusion on
 40262	fine young fellows, chiefly, destruction of the fittest, in a word.
 40263	
 40264	Anyhow upon weighing up the pros and cons, getting on for one, as it
 40265	was, it was high time to be retiring for the night. The crux was it
 40266	was a bit risky to bring him home as eventualities might possibly ensue
 40267	(somebody having a temper of her own sometimes) and spoil the hash
 40268	altogether as on the night he misguidedly brought home a dog (breed
 40269	unknown) with a lame paw (not that the cases were either identical or
 40270	the reverse though he had hurt his hand too) to Ontario Terrace as he
 40271	very distinctly remembered, having been there, so to speak. On the
 40272	other hand it was altogether far and away too late for the Sandymount
 40273	or Sandycove suggestion so that he was in some perplexity as to which of
 40274	the two alternatives. Everything pointed to the fact that it behoved him
 40275	to avail himself to the full of the opportunity, all things considered.
 40276	His initial impression was he was a shade standoffish or not over
 40277	effusive but it grew on him someway. For one thing he mightn't what you
 40278	call jump at the idea, if approached, and what mostly worried him was
 40279	he didn't know how to lead up to it or word it exactly, supposing he
 40280	did entertain the proposal, as it would afford him very great personal
 40281	pleasure if he would allow him to help to put coin in his way or some
 40282	wardrobe, if found suitable. At all events he wound up by concluding,
 40283	eschewing for the nonce hidebound precedent, a cup of Epps's cocoa and
 40284	a shakedown for the night plus the use of a rug or two and overcoat
 40285	doubled into a pillow at least he would be in safe hands and as warm as
 40286	a toast on a trivet he failed to perceive any very vast amount of harm
 40287	in that always with the proviso no rumpus of any sort was kicked up.
 40288	A move had to be made because that merry old soul, the grasswidower
 40289	in question who appeared to be glued to the spot, didn't appear in any
 40290	particular hurry to wend his way home to his dearly beloved Queenstown
 40291	and it was highly likely some sponger's bawdyhouse of retired beauties
 40292	where age was no bar off Sheriff street lower would be the best clue
 40293	to that equivocal character's whereabouts for a few days to come,
 40294	alternately racking their feelings (the mermaids') with sixchamber
 40295	revolver anecdotes verging on the tropical calculated to freeze
 40296	the marrow of anybody's bones and mauling their largesized charms
 40297	betweenwhiles with rough and tumble gusto to the accompaniment of large
 40298	potations of potheen and the usual blarney about himself for as to who
 40299	he in reality was let x equal my right name and address, as Mr Algebra
 40300	remarks _passim_. At the same time he inwardly chuckled over his gentle
 40301	repartee to the blood and ouns champion about his god being a jew.
 40302	People could put up with being bitten by a wolf but what properly riled
 40303	them was a bite from a sheep. The most vulnerable point too of tender
 40304	Achilles. Your god was a jew. Because mostly they appeared to imagine he
 40305	came from Carrick-on-Shannon or somewhereabouts in the county Sligo.
 40306	
 40307	--I propose, our hero eventually suggested after mature reflection while
 40308	prudently pocketing her photo, as it's rather stuffy here you just come
 40309	home with me and talk things over. My diggings are quite close in the
 40310	vicinity. You can't drink that stuff. Do you like cocoa? Wait. I'll just
 40311	pay this lot.
 40312	
 40313	The best plan clearly being to clear out, the remainder being plain
 40314	sailing, he beckoned, while prudently pocketing the photo, to the keeper
 40315	of the shanty who didn't seem to.
 40316	
 40317	--Yes, that's the best, he assured Stephen to whom for the matter of
 40318	that Brazen Head or him or anywhere else was all more or less.
 40319	
 40320	All kinds of Utopian plans were flashing through his (B's) busy brain,
 40321	education (the genuine article), literature, journalism, prize titbits,
 40322	up to date billing, concert tours in English watering resorts packed
 40323	with hydros and seaside theatres, turning money away, duets in Italian
 40324	with the accent perfectly true to nature and a quantity of other
 40325	things, no necessity, of course, to tell the world and his wife from the
 40326	housetops about it, and a slice of luck. An opening was all was wanted.
 40327	Because he more than suspected he had his father's voice to bank his
 40328	hopes on which it was quite on the cards he had so it would be just as
 40329	well, by the way no harm, to trail the conversation in the direction of
 40330	that particular red herring just to.
 40331	
 40332	The cabby read out of the paper he had got hold of that the former
 40333	viceroy, earl Cadogan, had presided at the cabdrivers' association
 40334	dinner in London somewhere. Silence with a yawn or two accompanied this
 40335	thrilling announcement. Then the old specimen in the corner who appeared
 40336	to have some spark of vitality left read out that sir Anthony MacDonnell
 40337	had left Euston for the chief secretary's lodge or words to that effect.
 40338	To which absorbing piece of intelligence echo answered why.
 40339	
 40340	--Give us a squint at that literature, grandfather, the ancient mariner
 40341	put in, manifesting some natural impatience.
 40342	
 40343	--And welcome, answered the elderly party thus addressed.
 40344	
 40345	The sailor lugged out from a case he had a pair of greenish goggles
 40346	which he very slowly hooked over his nose and both ears.
 40347	
 40348	--Are you bad in the eyes? the sympathetic personage like the townclerk
 40349	queried.
 40350	
 40351	--Why, answered the seafarer with the tartan beard, who seemingly was
 40352	a bit of a literary cove in his own small way, staring out of seagreen
 40353	portholes as you might well describe them as, I uses goggles reading.
 40354	Sand in the Red Sea done that. One time I could read a book in the dark,
 40355	manner of speaking. _The Arabian Nights Entertainment_ was my favourite
 40356	and _Red as a Rose is She._
 40357	
 40358	Hereupon he pawed the journal open and pored upon Lord only knows what,
 40359	found drowned or the exploits of King Willow, Iremonger having made a
 40360	hundred and something second wicket not out for Notts, during which
 40361	time (completely regardless of Ire) the keeper was intensely occupied
 40362	loosening an apparently new or secondhand boot which manifestly pinched
 40363	him as he muttered against whoever it was sold it, all of them who were
 40364	sufficiently awake enough to be picked out by their facial expressions,
 40365	that is to say, either simply looking on glumly or passing a trivial
 40366	remark.
 40367	
 40368	To cut a long story short Bloom, grasping the situation, was the first
 40369	to rise from his seat so as not to outstay their welcome having first
 40370	and foremost, being as good as his word that he would foot the bill for
 40371	the occasion, taken the wise precaution to unobtrusively motion to mine
 40372	host as a parting shot a scarcely perceptible sign when the others were
 40373	not looking to the effect that the amount due was forthcoming, making a
 40374	grand total of fourpence (the amount he deposited unobtrusively in
 40375	four coppers, literally the last of the Mohicans), he having previously
 40376	spotted on the printed pricelist for all who ran to read opposite him
 40377	in unmistakable figures, coffee 2d, confectionery do, and honestly well
 40378	worth twice the money once in a way, as Wetherup used to remark.
 40379	
 40380	--Come, he counselled to close the _sÃ©ance_.
 40381	
 40382	Seeing that the ruse worked and the coast was clear they left the
 40383	shelter or shanty together and the _Ã©lite_ society of oilskin and
 40384	company whom nothing short of an earthquake would move out of their
 40385	_dolce far niente_. Stephen, who confessed to still feeling poorly and
 40386	fagged out, paused at the, for a moment, the door.
 40387	
 40388	--One thing I never understood, he said to be original on the spur of
 40389	the moment. Why they put tables upside down at night, I mean chairs
 40390	upside down, on the tables in cafes. To which impromptu the neverfailing
 40391	Bloom replied without a moment's hesitation, saying straight off:
 40392	
 40393	--To sweep the floor in the morning.
 40394	
 40395	So saying he skipped around, nimbly considering, frankly at the same
 40396	time apologetic to get on his companion's right, a habit of his, by the
 40397	bye, his right side being, in classical idiom, his tender Achilles. The
 40398	night air was certainly now a treat to breathe though Stephen was a bit
 40399	weak on his pins.
 40400	
 40401	--It will (the air) do you good, Bloom said, meaning also the walk, in
 40402	a moment. The only thing is to walk then you'll feel a different man.
 40403	Come. It's not far. Lean on me.
 40404	
 40405	Accordingly he passed his left arm in Stephen's right and led him on
 40406	accordingly.
 40407	
 40408	--Yes, Stephen said uncertainly because he thought he felt a strange
 40409	kind of flesh of a different man approach him, sinewless and wobbly and
 40410	all that.
 40411	
 40412	Anyhow they passed the sentrybox with stones, brazier etc. where
 40413	the municipal supernumerary, ex Gumley, was still to all intents and
 40414	purposes wrapped in the arms of Murphy, as the adage has it, dreaming
 40415	of fresh fields and pastures new. And _apropos_ of coffin of stones the
 40416	analogy was not at all bad as it was in fact a stoning to death on the
 40417	part of seventytwo out of eighty odd constituencies that ratted at the
 40418	time of the split and chiefly the belauded peasant class, probably the
 40419	selfsame evicted tenants he had put in their holdings.
 40420	
 40421	So they turned on to chatting about music, a form of art for which
 40422	Bloom, as a pure amateur, possessed the greatest love, as they made
 40423	tracks arm in arm across Beresford place. Wagnerian music, though
 40424	confessedly grand in its way, was a bit too heavy for Bloom and hard to
 40425	follow at the first go-off but the music of Mercadante's _Huguenots_,
 40426	Meyerbeer's _Seven Last Words on the Cross_ and Mozart's _Twelfth Mass_
 40427	he simply revelled in, the _Gloria_ in that being, to his mind, the acme
 40428	of first class music as such, literally knocking everything else into
 40429	a cocked hat. He infinitely preferred the sacred music of the catholic
 40430	church to anything the opposite shop could offer in that line such as
 40431	those Moody and Sankey hymns or _Bid me to live and i will live
 40432	thy protestant to be_. He also yielded to none in his admiration of
 40433	Rossini's _Stabat Mater_, a work simply abounding in immortal numbers,
 40434	in which his wife, Madam Marion Tweedy, made a hit, a veritable
 40435	sensation, he might safely say, greatly adding to her other laureis and
 40436	putting the others totally in the shade, in the jesuit fathers' church
 40437	in upper Gardiner street, the sacred edifice being thronged to the
 40438	doors to hear her with virtuosos, or _virtuosi_ rather. There was the
 40439	unanimous opinion that there was none to come up to her and suffice it
 40440	to say in a place of worship for music of a sacred character there was
 40441	a generally voiced desire for an encore. On the whole though favouring
 40442	preferably light opera of the _Don Giovanni_ description and _Martha_,
 40443	a gem in its line, he had a _penchant_, though with only a surface
 40444	knowledge, for the severe classical school such as Mendelssohn. And
 40445	talking of that, taking it for granted he knew all about the old
 40446	favourites, he mentioned _par excellence_ Lionel's air in _Martha,
 40447	M'appari_, which, curiously enough, he had heard or overheard, to be
 40448	more accurate, on yesterday, a privilege he keenly appreciated, from the
 40449	lips of Stephen's respected father, sung to perfection, a study of the
 40450	number, in fact, which made all the others take a back seat. Stephen, in
 40451	reply to a politely put query, said he didn't sing it but launched
 40452	out into praises of Shakespeare's songs, at least of in or about that
 40453	period, the lutenist Dowland who lived in Fetter lane near Gerard the
 40454	herbalist, who _anno ludendo hausi, Doulandus_, an instrument he was
 40455	contemplating purchasing from Mr Arnold Dolmetsch, whom B. did not quite
 40456	recall though the name certainly sounded familiar, for sixtyfive guineas
 40457	and Farnaby and son with their _dux_ and _comes_ conceits and Byrd
 40458	(William) who played the virginals, he said, in the Queen's chapel or
 40459	anywhere else he found them and one Tomkins who made toys or airs and
 40460	John Bull.
 40461	
 40462	On the roadway which they were approaching whilst still speaking beyond
 40463	the swingchains a horse, dragging a sweeper, paced on the paven ground,
 40464	brushing a long swathe of mire up so that with the noise Bloom was not
 40465	perfectly certain whether he had caught aright the allusion to sixtyfive
 40466	guineas and John Bull. He inquired if it was John Bull the political
 40467	celebrity of that ilk, as it struck him, the two identical names, as a
 40468	striking coincidence.
 40469	
 40470	By the chains the horse slowly swerved to turn, which perceiving, Bloom,
 40471	who was keeping a sharp lookout as usual, plucked the other's sleeve
 40472	gently, jocosely remarking:
 40473	
 40474	--Our lives are in peril tonight. Beware of the steamroller.
 40475	
 40476	They thereupon stopped. Bloom looked at the head of a horse not worth
 40477	anything like sixtyfive guineas, suddenly in evidence in the dark quite
 40478	near so that it seemed new, a different grouping of bones and even flesh
 40479	because palpably it was a fourwalker, a hipshaker, a blackbuttocker, a
 40480	taildangler, a headhanger putting his hind foot foremost the while the
 40481	lord of his creation sat on the perch, busy with his thoughts. But such
 40482	a good poor brute he was sorry he hadn't a lump of sugar but, as he
 40483	wisely reflected, you could scarcely be prepared for every emergency
 40484	that might crop up. He was just a big nervous foolish noodly kind of a
 40485	horse, without a second care in the world. But even a dog, he reflected,
 40486	take that mongrel in Barney Kiernan's, of the same size, would be a holy
 40487	horror to face. But it was no animal's fault in particular if he was
 40488	built that way like the camel, ship of the desert, distilling grapes
 40489	into potheen in his hump. Nine tenths of them all could be caged or
 40490	trained, nothing beyond the art of man barring the bees. Whale with a
 40491	harpoon hairpin, alligator tickle the small of his back and he sees the
 40492	joke, chalk a circle for a rooster, tiger my eagle eye. These timely
 40493	reflections anent the brutes of the field occupied his mind somewhat
 40494	distracted from Stephen's words while the ship of the street was
 40495	manoeuvring and Stephen went on about the highly interesting old.
 40496	
 40497	--What's this I was saying? Ah, yes! My wife, he intimated, plunging
 40498	_in medias res_, would have the greatest of pleasure in making your
 40499	acquaintance as she is passionately attached to music of any kind.
 40500	
 40501	He looked sideways in a friendly fashion at the sideface of Stephen,
 40502	image of his mother, which was not quite the same as the usual handsome
 40503	blackguard type they unquestionably had an insatiable hankering after as
 40504	he was perhaps not that way built.
 40505	
 40506	Still, supposing he had his father's gift as he more than suspected,
 40507	it opened up new vistas in his mind such as Lady Fingall's Irish
 40508	industries, concert on the preceding Monday, and aristocracy in general.
 40509	
 40510	Exquisite variations he was now describing on an air _Youth here has
 40511	End_ by Jans Pieter Sweelinck, a Dutchman of Amsterdam where the frows
 40512	come from. Even more he liked an old German song of _Johannes Jeep_
 40513	about the clear sea and the voices of sirens, sweet murderers of men,
 40514	which boggled Bloom a bit:
 40515	
 40516	     _Von der Sirenen Listigkeit
 40517	     Tun die Poeten dichten._
 40518	
 40519	These opening bars he sang and translated _extempore_. Bloom, nodding,
 40520	said he perfectly understood and begged him to go on by all means which
 40521	he did.
 40522	
 40523	A phenomenally beautiful tenor voice like that, the rarest of boons,
 40524	which Bloom appreciated at the very first note he got out, could easily,
 40525	if properly handled by some recognised authority on voice production
 40526	such as Barraclough and being able to read music into the bargain,
 40527	command its own price where baritones were ten a penny and procure for
 40528	its fortunate possessor in the near future an _entrÃ©e_ into fashionable
 40529	houses in the best residential quarters of financial magnates in a large
 40530	way of business and titled people where with his university degree of
 40531	B. A. (a huge ad in its way) and gentlemanly bearing to all the more
 40532	influence the good impression he would infallibly score a distinct
 40533	success, being blessed with brains which also could be utilised for the
 40534	purpose and other requisites, if his clothes were properly attended
 40535	to so as to the better worm his way into their good graces as he, a
 40536	youthful tyro in--society's sartorial niceties, hardly understood how a
 40537	little thing like that could militate against you. It was in fact only a
 40538	matter of months and he could easily foresee him participating in their
 40539	musical and artistic _conversaziones_ during the festivities of the
 40540	Christmas season, for choice, causing a slight flutter in the dovecotes
 40541	of the fair sex and being made a lot of by ladies out for sensation,
 40542	cases of which, as he happened to know, were on record--in fact, without
 40543	giving the show away, he himself once upon a time, if he cared to, could
 40544	easily have. Added to which of course would be the pecuniary emolument
 40545	by no means to be sneezed at, going hand in hand with his tuition
 40546	fees. Not, he parenthesised, that for the sake of filthy lucre he need
 40547	necessarily embrace the lyric platform as a walk in life for any lengthy
 40548	space of time. But a step in the required direction it was beyond yea or
 40549	nay and both monetarily and mentally it contained no reflection on his
 40550	dignity in the smallest and it often turned in uncommonly handy to
 40551	be handed a cheque at a muchneeded moment when every little helped.
 40552	Besides, though taste latterly had deteriorated to a degree, original
 40553	music like that, different from the conventional rut, would rapidly
 40554	have a great vogue as it would be a decided novelty for Dublin's musical
 40555	world after the usual hackneyed run of catchy tenor solos foisted on a
 40556	confiding public by Ivan St Austell and Hilton St Just and their _genus
 40557	omne_. Yes, beyond a shadow of a doubt he could with all the cards in
 40558	his hand and he had a capital opening to make a name for himself and win
 40559	a high place in the city's esteem where he could command a stiff figure
 40560	and, booking ahead, give a grand concert for the patrons of the King
 40561	street house, given a backerup, if one were forthcoming to kick him
 40562	upstairs, so to speak, a big _if_, however, with some impetus of the
 40563	goahead sort to obviate the inevitable procrastination which often
 40564	tripped-up a too much fÃªted prince of good fellows. And it need not
 40565	detract from the other by one iota as, being his own master, he would
 40566	have heaps of time to practise literature in his spare moments when
 40567	desirous of so doing without its clashing with his vocal career or
 40568	containing anything derogatory whatsoever as it was a matter for himself
 40569	alone. In fact, he had the ball at his feet and that was the very reason
 40570	why the other, possessed of a remarkably sharp nose for smelling a rat
 40571	of any sort, hung on to him at all.
 40572	
 40573	The horse was just then. And later on at a propitious opportunity he
 40574	purposed (Bloom did), without anyway prying into his private affairs on
 40575	the _fools step in where angels_ principle, advising him to sever his
 40576	connection with a certain budding practitioner who, he noticed, was
 40577	prone to disparage and even to a slight extent with some hilarious
 40578	pretext when not present, deprecate him, or whatever you like to call it
 40579	which in Bloom's humble opinion threw a nasty sidelight on that side of
 40580	a person's character, no pun intended.
 40581	
 40582	The horse having reached the end of his tether, so to speak, halted and,
 40583	rearing high a proud feathering tail, added his quota by letting fall on
 40584	the floor which the brush would soon brush up and polish, three smoking
 40585	globes of turds. Slowly three times, one after another, from a full
 40586	crupper he mired. And humanely his driver waited till he (or she) had
 40587	ended, patient in his scythed car.
 40588	
 40589	Side by side Bloom, profiting by the _contretemps_, with Stephen passed
 40590	through the gap of the chains, divided by the upright, and, stepping
 40591	over a strand of mire, went across towards Gardiner street lower,
 40592	Stephen singing more boldly, but not loudly, the end of the ballad.
 40593	
 40594	_Und alle Schiffe brÃ¼cken._
 40595	
 40596	The driver never said a word, good, bad or indifferent, but merely
 40597	watched the two figures, as he sat on his lowbacked car, both black,
 40598	one full, one lean, walk towards the railway bridge, _to be married by
 40599	Father Maher_. As they walked they at times stopped and walked again
 40600	continuing their _tÃªte-Ã -tÃªte_ (which, of course, he was utterly out
 40601	of) about sirens enemies of man's reason, mingled with a number of other
 40602	topics of the same category, usurpers, historical cases of the kind
 40603	while the man in the sweeper car or you might as well call it in the
 40604	sleeper car who in any case couldn't possibly hear because they were too
 40605	far simply sat in his seat near the end of lower Gardiner street _and
 40606	looked after their lowbacked car_.
 40607	
 40608	
 40609	
 40610	What parallel courses did Bloom and Stephen follow returning?
 40611	
 40612	Starting united both at normal walking pace from Beresford place they
 40613	followed in the order named Lower and Middle Gardiner streets and
 40614	Mountjoy square, west: then, at reduced pace, each bearing left,
 40615	Gardiner's place by an inadvertence as far as the farther corner of
 40616	Temple street: then, at reduced pace with interruptions of halt, bearing
 40617	right, Temple street, north, as far as Hardwicke place. Approaching,
 40618	disparate, at relaxed walking pace they crossed both the circus before
 40619	George's church diametrically, the chord in any circle being less than
 40620	the arc which it subtends.
 40621	
 40622	
 40623	Of what did the duumvirate deliberate during their itinerary?
 40624	
 40625	Music, literature, Ireland, Dublin, Paris, friendship, woman,
 40626	prostitution, diet, the influence of gaslight or the light of arc and
 40627	glowlamps on the growth of adjoining paraheliotropic trees, exposed
 40628	corporation emergency dustbuckets, the Roman catholic church,
 40629	ecclesiastical celibacy, the Irish nation, jesuit education, careers,
 40630	the study of medicine, the past day, the maleficent influence of the
 40631	presabbath, Stephen's collapse.
 40632	
 40633	Did Bloom discover common factors of similarity between their respective
 40634	like and unlike reactions to experience?
 40635	
 40636	Both were sensitive to artistic impressions, musical in preference to
 40637	plastic or pictorial. Both preferred a continental to an insular manner
 40638	of life, a cisatlantic to a transatlantic place of residence. Both
 40639	indurated by early domestic training and an inherited tenacity of
 40640	heterodox resistance professed their disbelief in many orthodox
 40641	religious, national, social and ethical doctrines. Both admitted
 40642	the alternately stimulating and obtunding influence of heterosexual
 40643	magnetism.
 40644	
 40645	
 40646	Were their views on some points divergent?
 40647	
 40648	Stephen dissented openly from Bloom's views on the importance of dietary
 40649	and civic selfhelp while Bloom dissented tacitly from Stephen's views
 40650	on the eternal affirmation of the spirit of man in literature. Bloom
 40651	assented covertly to Stephen's rectification of the anachronism
 40652	involved in assigning the date of the conversion of the Irish nation to
 40653	christianity from druidism by Patrick son of Calpornus, son of Potitus,
 40654	son of Odyssus, sent by pope Celestine I in the year 432 in the reign of
 40655	Leary to the year 260 or thereabouts in the reign of Cormac MacArt (died
 40656	266 A.D.), suffocated by imperfect deglutition of aliment at Sletty
 40657	and interred at Rossnaree. The collapse which Bloom ascribed to
 40658	gastric inanition and certain chemical compounds of varying degrees of
 40659	adulteration and alcoholic strength, accelerated by mental exertion and
 40660	the velocity of rapid circular motion in a relaxing atmosphere, Stephen
 40661	attributed to the reapparition of a matutinal cloud (perceived by both
 40662	from two different points of observation Sandycove and Dublin) at first
 40663	no bigger than a woman's hand.
 40664	
 40665	
 40666	Was there one point on which their views were equal and negative?
 40667	
 40668	The influence of gaslight or electric light on the growth of adjoining
 40669	paraheliotropic trees.
 40670	
 40671	
 40672	Had Bloom discussed similar subjects during nocturnal perambulations in
 40673	the past?
 40674	
 40675	In 1884 with Owen Goldberg and Cecil Turnbull at night on public
 40676	thoroughfares between Longwood avenue and Leonard's corner and Leonard's
 40677	corner and Synge street and Synge street and Bloomfield avenue.
 40678	
 40679	In 1885 with Percy Apjohn in the evenings, reclined against the wall
 40680	between Gibraltar villa and Bloomfield house in Crumlin, barony
 40681	of Uppercross. In 1886 occasionally with casual acquaintances and
 40682	prospective purchasers on doorsteps, in front parlours, in third class
