 43821	influence possibly. If any, positively, connivance, introduction of
 43822	emulation (material, a prosperous rival agency of publicity: moral,
 43823	a successful rival agent of intimacy), depreciation, alienation,
 43824	humiliation, separation protecting the one separated from the other,
 43825	protecting the separator from both.
 43826	
 43827	
 43828	By what reflections did he, a conscious reactor against the void of
 43829	incertitude, justify to himself his sentiments?
 43830	
 43831	The preordained frangibility of the hymen: the presupposed intangibility
 43832	of the thing in itself: the incongruity and disproportion between
 43833	the selfprolonging tension of the thing proposed to be done and the
 43834	selfabbreviating relaxation of the thing done; the fallaciously inferred
 43835	debility of the female: the muscularity of the male: the variations of
 43836	ethical codes: the natural grammatical transition by inversion involving
 43837	no alteration of sense of an aorist preterite proposition (parsed as
 43838	masculine subject, monosyllabic onomatopoeic transitive verb with direct
 43839	feminine object) from the active voice into its correlative aorist
 43840	preterite proposition (parsed as feminine subject, auxiliary verb
 43841	and quasimonosyllabic onomatopoeic past participle with complementary
 43842	masculine agent) in the passive voice: the continued product of
 43843	seminators by generation: the continual production of semen by
 43844	distillation: the futility of triumph or protest or vindication: the
 43845	inanity of extolled virtue: the lethargy of nescient matter: the apathy
 43846	of the stars.
 43847	
 43848	
 43849	In what final satisfaction did these antagonistic sentiments and
 43850	reflections, reduced to their simplest forms, converge?
 43851	
 43852	Satisfaction at the ubiquity in eastern and western terrestrial
 43853	hemispheres, in all habitable lands and islands explored or unexplored
 43854	(the land of the midnight sun, the islands of the blessed, the isles of
 43855	Greece, the land of promise), of adipose anterior and posterior female
 43856	hemispheres, redolent of milk and honey and of excretory sanguine and
 43857	seminal warmth, reminiscent of secular families of curves of amplitude,
 43858	insusceptible of moods of impression or of contrarieties of expression,
 43859	expressive of mute immutable mature animality.
 43860	
 43861	
 43862	The visible signs of antesatisfaction?
 43863	
 43864	An approximate erection: a solicitous adversion: a gradual elevation: a
 43865	tentative revelation: a silent contemplation.
 43866	
 43867	
 43868	Then?
 43869	
 43870	He kissed the plump mellow yellow smellow melons of her rump, on each
 43871	plump melonous hemisphere, in their mellow yellow furrow, with obscure
 43872	prolonged provocative melonsmellonous osculation.
 43873	
 43874	
 43875	The visible signs of postsatisfaction?
 43876	
 43877	A silent contemplation: a tentative velation: a gradual abasement: a
 43878	solicitous aversion: a proximate erection.
 43879	
 43880	
 43881	What followed this silent action?
 43882	
 43883	Somnolent invocation, less somnolent recognition, incipient excitation,
 43884	catechetical interrogation.
 43885	
 43886	
 43887	With what modifications did the narrator reply to this interrogation?
 43888	
 43889	Negative: he omitted to mention the clandestine correspondence between
 43890	Martha Clifford and Henry Flower, the public altercation at, in and
 43891	in the vicinity of the licensed premises of Bernard Kiernan and Co,
 43892	Limited, 8, 9 and 10 Little Britain street, the erotic provocation
 43893	and response thereto caused by the exhibitionism of Gertrude (Gerty),
 43894	surname unknown. Positive: he included mention of a performance by Mrs
 43895	Bandmann Palmer of LEAH at the Gaiety Theatre, 46, 47, 48, 49 South King
 43896	street, an invitation to supper at Wynn's (Murphy's) Hotel, 35, 36 and
 43897	37 Lower Abbey street, a volume of peccaminous pornographical tendency
 43898	entituled SWEETS OF SIN, anonymous author a gentleman of fashion, a
 43899	temporary concussion caused by a falsely calculated movement in the
 43900	course of a postcenal gymnastic display, the victim (since completely
 43901	recovered) being Stephen Dedalus, professor and author, eldest surviving
 43902	son of Simon Dedalus, of no fixed occupation, an aeronautical feat
 43903	executed by him (narrator) in the presence of a witness, the professor
 43904	and author aforesaid, with promptitude of decision and gymnastic
 43905	flexibility.
 43906	
 43907	
 43908	Was the narration otherwise unaltered by modifications?
 43909	
 43910	Absolutely.
 43911	
 43912	
 43913	Which event or person emerged as the salient point of his narration?
 43914	
 43915	Stephen Dedalus, professor and author.
 43916	
 43917	
 43918	What limitations of activity and inhibitions of conjugal rights were
 43919	perceived by listener and narrator concerning themselves during the
 43920	course of this intermittent and increasingly more laconic narration?
 43921	
 43922	By the listener a limitation of fertility inasmuch as marriage had been
 43923	celebrated 1 calendar month after the 18th anniversary of her birth (8
 43924	September 1870), viz. 8 October, and consummated on the same date with
 43925	female issue born 15 June 1889, having been anticipatorily consummated
 43926	on the lo September of the same year and complete carnal intercourse,
 43927	with ejaculation of semen within the natural female organ, having last
 43928	taken place 5 weeks previous, viz. 27 November 1893, to the birth on 29
 43929	December 1893 of second (and only male) issue, deceased 9 January 1894,
 43930	aged 11 days, there remained a period of 10 years, 5 months and 18 days
 43931	during which carnal intercourse had been incomplete, without ejaculation
 43932	of semen within the natural female organ. By the narrator a limitation
 43933	of activity, mental and corporal, inasmuch as complete mental
 43934	intercourse between himself and the listener had not taken place since
 43935	the consummation of puberty, indicated by catamenic hemorrhage, of the
 43936	female issue of narrator and listener, 15 September 1903, there remained
 43937	a period of 9 months and 1 day during which, in consequence of a
 43938	preestablished natural comprehension in incomprehension between the
 43939	consummated females (listener and issue), complete corporal liberty of
 43940	action had been circumscribed.
 43941	
 43942	
 43943	How?
 43944	
 43945	By various reiterated feminine interrogation concerning the masculine
 43946	destination whither, the place where, the time at which, the duration
 43947	for which, the object with which in the case of temporary absences,
 43948	projected or effected.
 43949	
 43950	
 43951	What moved visibly above the listener's and the narrator's invisible
 43952	thoughts?
 43953	
 43954	The upcast reflection of a lamp and shade, an inconstant series of
 43955	concentric circles of varying gradations of light and shadow.
 43956	
 43957	
 43958	In what directions did listener and narrator lie?
 43959	
 43960	Listener, S. E. by E.: Narrator, N. W. by W.: on the 53rd parallel
 43961	of latitude, N., and 6th meridian of longitude, W.: at an angle of 45
 43962	degrees to the terrestrial equator.
 43963	
 43964	
 43965	In what state of rest or motion?
 43966	
 43967	At rest relatively to themselves and to each other. In motion being each
 43968	and both carried westward, forward and rereward respectively, by the
 43969	proper perpetual motion of the earth through everchanging tracks of
 43970	neverchanging space.
 43971	
 43972	
 43973	In what posture?
 43974	
 43975	Listener: reclined semilaterally, left, left hand under head, right
 43976	leg extended in a straight line and resting on left leg, flexed, in the
 43977	attitude of Gea-Tellus, fulfilled, recumbent, big with seed. Narrator:
 43978	reclined laterally, left, with right and left legs flexed, the index
 43979	finger and thumb of the right hand resting on the bridge of the nose, in
 43980	the attitude depicted in a snapshot photograph made by Percy Apjohn, the
 43981	childman weary, the manchild in the womb.
 43982	
 43983	
 43984	Womb? Weary?
 43985	
 43986	He rests. He has travelled.
 43987	
 43988	
 43989	With?
 43990	
 43991	Sinbad the Sailor and Tinbad the Tailor and Jinbad the Jailer and
 43992	Whinbad the Whaler and Ninbad the Nailer and Finbad the Failer and
 43993	Binbad the Bailer and Pinbad the Pailer and Minbad the Mailer and Hinbad
 43994	the Hailer and Rinbad the Railer and Dinbad the Kailer and Vinbad the
 43995	Quailer and Linbad the Yailer and Xinbad the Phthailer.
 43996	
 43997	
 43998	When?
 43999	
 44000	Going to dark bed there was a square round Sinbad the Sailor roc's auk's
 44001	egg in the night of the bed of all the auks of the rocs of Darkinbad the
 44002	Brightdayler.
 44003	
 44004	
 44005	Where?
 44006	
 44007	
 44008	
 44009	Yes because he never did a thing like that before as ask to get his
 44010	breakfast in bed with a couple of eggs since the _City Arms_ hotel
 44011	when he used to be pretending to be laid up with a sick voice doing his
 44012	highness to make himself interesting for that old faggot Mrs Riordan
 44013	that he thought he had a great leg of and she never left us a farthing
 44014	all for masses for herself and her soul greatest miser ever was actually
 44015	afraid to lay out 4d for her methylated spirit telling me all her
 44016	ailments she had too much old chat in her about politics and earthquakes
 44017	and the end of the world let us have a bit of fun first God help the
 44018	world if all the women were her sort down on bathingsuits and lownecks
 44019	of course nobody wanted her to wear them I suppose she was pious because
 44020	no man would look at her twice I hope Ill never be like her a wonder
 44021	she didnt want us to cover our faces but she was a welleducated woman
 44022	certainly and her gabby talk about Mr Riordan here and Mr Riordan there
 44023	I suppose he was glad to get shut of her and her dog smelling my fur and
 44024	always edging to get up under my petticoats especially then still I like
 44025	that in him polite to old women like that and waiters and beggars too
 44026	hes not proud out of nothing but not always if ever he got anything
 44027	really serious the matter with him its much better for them to go into
 44028	a hospital where everything is clean but I suppose Id have to dring it
 44029	into him for a month yes and then wed have a hospital nurse next thing
 44030	on the carpet have him staying there till they throw him out or a nun
 44031	maybe like the smutty photo he has shes as much a nun as Im not yes
 44032	because theyre so weak and puling when theyre sick they want a woman
 44033	to get well if his nose bleeds youd think it was O tragic and that
 44034	dyinglooking one off the south circular when he sprained his foot at
 44035	the choir party at the sugarloaf Mountain the day I wore that dress
 44036	Miss Stack bringing him flowers the worst old ones she could find at the
 44037	bottom of the basket anything at all to get into a mans bedroom with
 44038	her old maids voice trying to imagine he was dying on account of her to
 44039	never see thy face again though he looked more like a man with his beard
 44040	a bit grown in the bed father was the same besides I hate bandaging and
 44041	dosing when he cut his toe with the razor paring his corns afraid hed
 44042	get bloodpoisoning but if it was a thing I was sick then wed see what
 44043	attention only of course the woman hides it not to give all the trouble
 44044	they do yes he came somewhere Im sure by his appetite anyway love its
 44045	not or hed be off his feed thinking of her so either it was one of those
 44046	night women if it was down there he was really and the hotel story he
 44047	made up a pack of lies to hide it planning it Hynes kept me who did I
 44048	meet ah yes I met do you remember Menton and who else who let me see
 44049	that big babbyface I saw him and he not long married flirting with a
 44050	young girl at Pooles Myriorama and turned my back on him when he slinked
 44051	out looking quite conscious what harm but he had the impudence to make
 44052	up to me one time well done to him mouth almighty and his boiled eyes of
 44053	all the big stupoes I ever met and thats called a solicitor only for
 44054	I hate having a long wrangle in bed or else if its not that its some
 44055	little bitch or other he got in with somewhere or picked up on the
 44056	sly if they only knew him as well as I do yes because the day before
 44057	yesterday he was scribbling something a letter when I came into the
 44058	front room to show him Dignams death in the paper as if something told
 44059	me and he covered it up with the blottingpaper pretending to be thinking
 44060	about business so very probably that was it to somebody who thinks
 44061	she has a softy in him because all men get a bit like that at his age
 44062	especially getting on to forty he is now so as to wheedle any money she
 44063	can out of him no fool like an old fool and then the usual kissing my
 44064	bottom was to hide it not that I care two straws now who he does it with
 44065	or knew before that way though Id like to find out so long as I dont
 44066	have the two of them under my nose all the time like that slut that Mary
 44067	we had in Ontario terrace padding out her false bottom to excite him bad
 44068	enough to get the smell of those painted women off him once or twice
 44069	I had a suspicion by getting him to come near me when I found the
 44070	long hair on his coat without that one when I went into the kitchen
 44071	pretending he was drinking water 1 woman is not enough for them it was
 44072	all his fault of course ruining servants then proposing that she could
 44073	eat at our table on Christmas day if you please O no thank you not in my
 44074	house stealing my potatoes and the oysters 2/6 per doz going out to see
 44075	her aunt if you please common robbery so it was but I was sure he had
 44076	something on with that one it takes me to find out a thing like that he
 44077	said you have no proof it was her proof O yes her aunt was very fond of
 44078	oysters but I told her what I thought of her suggesting me to go out to
 44079	be alone with her I wouldnt lower myself to spy on them the garters I
 44080	found in her room the Friday she was out that was enough for me a little
 44081	bit too much her face swelled up on her with temper when I gave her her
 44082	weeks notice I saw to that better do without them altogether do out the
 44083	rooms myself quicker only for the damn cooking and throwing out the dirt
 44084	I gave it to him anyhow either she or me leaves the house I couldnt even
 44085	touch him if I thought he was with a dirty barefaced liar and sloven
 44086	like that one denying it up to my face and singing about the place in
 44087	the W C too because she knew she was too well off yes because he couldnt
 44088	possibly do without it that long so he must do it somewhere and the last
 44089	time he came on my bottom when was it the night Boylan gave my hand a
 44090	great squeeze going along by the Tolka in my hand there steals another
 44091	I just pressed the back of his like that with my thumb to squeeze back
 44092	singing the young May moon shes beaming love because he has an idea
 44093	about him and me hes not such a fool he said Im dining out and going to
 44094	the Gaiety though Im not going to give him the satisfaction in any case
 44095	God knows hes a change in a way not to be always and ever wearing the
 44096	same old hat unless I paid some nicelooking boy to do it since I cant do
 44097	it myself a young boy would like me Id confuse him a little alone with
 44098	him if we were Id let him see my garters the new ones and make him turn
 44099	red looking at him seduce him I know what boys feel with that down
 44100	on their cheek doing that frigging drawing out the thing by the hour
 44101	question and answer would you do this that and the other with the
 44102	coalman yes with a bishop yes I would because I told him about some dean
 44103	or bishop was sitting beside me in the jews temples gardens when I was
 44104	knitting that woollen thing a stranger to Dublin what place was it and
 44105	so on about the monuments and he tired me out with statues encouraging
 44106	him making him worse than he is who is in your mind now tell me who are
 44107	you thinking of who is it tell me his name who tell me who the german
 44108	Emperor is it yes imagine Im him think of him can you feel him trying to
 44109	make a whore of me what he never will he ought to give it up now at this
 44110	age of his life simply ruination for any woman and no satisfaction in it
 44111	pretending to like it till he comes and then finish it off myself anyway
 44112	and it makes your lips pale anyhow its done now once and for all with
 44113	all the talk of the world about it people make its only the first time
 44114	after that its just the ordinary do it and think no more about it why
 44115	cant you kiss a man without going and marrying him first you sometimes
 44116	love to wildly when you feel that way so nice all over you you cant help
 44117	yourself I wish some man or other would take me sometime when hes there
 44118	and kiss me in his arms theres nothing like a kiss long and hot down to
 44119	your soul almost paralyses you then I hate that confession when I used
 44120	to go to Father Corrigan he touched me father and what harm if he did
 44121	where and I said on the canal bank like a fool but whereabouts on your
 44122	person my child on the leg behind high up was it yes rather high up was
 44123	it where you sit down yes O Lord couldnt he say bottom right out and
 44124	have done with it what has that got to do with it and did you whatever
 44125	way he put it I forget no father and I always think of the real father
 44126	what did he want to know for when I already confessed it to God he had
 44127	a nice fat hand the palm moist always I wouldnt mind feeling it neither
 44128	would he Id say by the bullneck in his horsecollar I wonder did he know
 44129	me in the box I could see his face he couldnt see mine of course hed
 44130	never turn or let on still his eyes were red when his father died theyre
 44131	lost for a woman of course must be terrible when a man cries let alone
 44132	them Id like to be embraced by one in his vestments and the smell of
 44133	incense off him like the pope besides theres no danger with a priest if
 44134	youre married hes too careful about himself then give something to H
 44135	H the pope for a penance I wonder was he satisfied with me one thing I
 44136	didnt like his slapping me behind going away so familiarly in the hall
 44137	though I laughed Im not a horse or an ass am I I suppose he was thinking
 44138	of his fathers I wonder is he awake thinking of me or dreaming am I in
 44139	it who gave him that flower he said he bought he smelt of some kind of
 44140	drink not whisky or stout or perhaps the sweety kind of paste they stick
 44141	their bills up with some liqueur Id like to sip those richlooking green
 44142	and yellow expensive drinks those stagedoor johnnies drink with the
 44143	opera hats I tasted once with my finger dipped out of that American that
 44144	had the squirrel talking stamps with father he had all he could do to
 44145	keep himself from falling asleep after the last time after we took the
 44146	port and potted meat it had a fine salty taste yes because I felt lovely
 44147	and tired myself and fell asleep as sound as a top the moment I popped
 44148	straight into bed till that thunder woke me up God be merciful to us
 44149	I thought the heavens were coming down about us to punish us when I
 44150	blessed myself and said a Hail Mary like those awful thunderbolts in
 44151	Gibraltar as if the world was coming to an end and then they come and
 44152	tell you theres no God what could you do if it was running and rushing
 44153	about nothing only make an act of contrition the candle I lit that
 44154	evening in Whitefriars street chapel for the month of May see it brought
 44155	its luck though hed scoff if he heard because he never goes to church
 44156	mass or meeting he says your soul you have no soul inside only grey
 44157	matter because he doesnt know what it is to have one yes when I lit the
 44158	lamp because he must have come 3 or 4 times with that tremendous big red
 44159	brute of a thing he has I thought the vein or whatever the dickens they
 44160	call it was going to burst though his nose is not so big after I took
 44161	off all my things with the blinds down after my hours dressing and
 44162	perfuming and combing it like iron or some kind of a thick crowbar
 44163	standing all the time he must have eaten oysters I think a few dozen he
 44164	was in great singing voice no I never in all my life felt anyone had
 44165	one the size of that to make you feel full up he must have eaten a whole
 44166	sheep after whats the idea making us like that with a big hole in the
 44167	middle of us or like a Stallion driving it up into you because thats all
 44168	they want out of you with that determined vicious look in his eye I had
 44169	to halfshut my eyes still he hasnt such a tremendous amount of spunk in
 44170	him when I made him pull out and do it on me considering how big it is
 44171	so much the better in case any of it wasnt washed out properly the last
 44172	time I let him finish it in me nice invention they made for women for
 44173	him to get all the pleasure but if someone gave them a touch of it
 44174	themselves theyd know what I went through with Milly nobody would
 44175	believe cutting her teeth too and Mina Purefoys husband give us a swing
 44176	out of your whiskers filling her up with a child or twins once a year
 44177	as regular as the clock always with a smell of children off her the one
 44178	they called budgers or something like a nigger with a shock of hair on
 44179	it Jesusjack the child is a black the last time I was there a squad of
 44180	them falling over one another and bawling you couldnt hear your ears
 44181	supposed to be healthy not satisfied till they have us swollen out like
 44182	elephants or I dont know what supposing I risked having another not off
 44183	him though still if he was married Im sure hed have a fine strong child
 44184	but I dont know Poldy has more spunk in him yes thatd be awfully jolly
 44185	I suppose it was meeting Josie Powell and the funeral and thinking about
 44186	me and Boylan set him off well he can think what he likes now if thatll
 44187	do him any good I know they were spooning a bit when I came on the scene
 44188	he was dancing and sitting out with her the night of Georgina Simpsons
 44189	housewarming and then he wanted to ram it down my neck it was on account
 44190	of not liking to see her a wallflower that was why we had the standup
 44191	row over politics he began it not me when he said about Our Lord being a
 44192	carpenter at last he made me cry of course a woman is so sensitive about
 44193	everything I was fuming with myself after for giving in only for I knew
 44194	he was gone on me and the first socialist he said He was he annoyed me
 44195	so much I couldnt put him into a temper still he knows a lot of mixedup
 44196	things especially about the body and the inside I often wanted to study
 44197	up that myself what we have inside us in that family physician I could
 44198	always hear his voice talking when the room was crowded and watch him
 44199	after that I pretended I had a coolness on with her over him because he
 44200	used to be a bit on the jealous side whenever he asked who are you going
 44201	to and I said over to Floey and he made me the present of Byron's poems
 44202	and the three pairs of gloves so that finished that I could quite easily
 44203	get him to make it up any time I know how Id even supposing he got in
 44204	with her again and was going out to see her somewhere Id know if he
 44205	refused to eat the onions I know plenty of ways ask him to tuck down the
 44206	collar of my blouse or touch him with my veil and gloves on going out I
 44207	kiss then would send them all spinning however alright well see then let
 44208	him go to her she of course would only be too delighted to pretend shes
 44209	mad in love with him that I wouldnt so much mind Id just go to her and
 44210	ask her do you love him and look her square in the eyes she couldnt fool
 44211	me but he might imagine he was and make a declaration to her with his
 44212	plabbery kind of a manner like he did to me though I had the devils own
 44213	job to get it out of him though I liked him for that it showed he could
 44214	hold in and wasnt to be got for the asking he was on the pop of asking
 44215	me too the night in the kitchen I was rolling the potato cake theres
 44216	something I want to say to you only for I put him off letting on I was
 44217	in a temper with my hands and arms full of pasty flour in any case I let
 44218	out too much the night before talking of dreams so I didnt want to let
 44219	him know more than was good for him she used to be always embracing me
 44220	Josie whenever he was there meaning him of course glauming me over and
 44221	when I said I washed up and down as far as possible asking me and did
 44222	you wash possible the women are always egging on to that putting it on
 44223	thick when hes there they know by his sly eye blinking a bit putting on
 44224	the indifferent when they come out with something the kind he is what
 44225	spoils him I dont wonder in the least because he was very handsome at
 44226	that time trying to look like Lord Byron I said I liked though he
 44227	was too beautiful for a man and he was a little before we got engaged
 44228	afterwards though she didnt like it so much the day I was in fits of
 44229	laughing with the giggles I couldnt stop about all my hairpins falling
 44230	out one after another with the mass of hair I had youre always in great
 44231	humour she said yes because it grigged her because she knew what it
 44232	meant because I used to tell her a good bit of what went on between us
 44233	not all but just enough to make her mouth water but that wasnt my fault
 44234	she didnt darken the door much after we were married I wonder what shes
 44235	got like now after living with that dotty husband of hers she had her
 44236	face beginning to look drawn and run down the last time I saw her she
 44237	must have been just after a row with him because I saw on the moment she
 44238	was edging to draw down a conversation about husbands and talk about him
 44239	to run him down what was it she told me O yes that sometimes he used to
 44240	go to bed with his muddy boots on when the maggot takes him just imagine
 44241	having to get into bed with a thing like that that might murder you
 44242	any moment what a man well its not the one way everyone goes mad Poldy
 44243	anyhow whatever he does always wipes his feet on the mat when he comes
 44244	in wet or shine and always blacks his own boots too and he always takes
 44245	off his hat when he comes up in the street like then and now hes going
 44246	about in his slippers to look for 10000 pounds for a postcard U p up
 44247	O sweetheart May wouldnt a thing like that simply bore you stiff to
 44248	extinction actually too stupid even to take his boots off now what
 44249	could you make of a man like that Id rather die 20 times over than marry
 44250	another of their sex of course hed never find another woman like me to
 44251	put up with him the way I do know me come sleep with me yes and he knows
 44252	that too at the bottom of his heart take that Mrs Maybrick that poisoned
 44253	her husband for what I wonder in love with some other man yes it was
 44254	found out on her wasnt she the downright villain to go and do a thing
 44255	like that of course some men can be dreadfully aggravating drive you mad
 44256	and always the worst word in the world what do they ask us to marry them
 44257	for if were so bad as all that comes to yes because they cant get on
 44258	without us white Arsenic she put in his tea off flypaper wasnt it I
 44259	wonder why they call it that if I asked him hed say its from the Greek
 44260	leave us as wise as we were before she must have been madly in love with
 44261	the other fellow to run the chance of being hanged O she didnt care if
 44262	that was her nature what could she do besides theyre not brutes enough
 44263	to go and hang a woman surely are they
 44264	
 44265	theyre all so different Boylan talking about the shape of my foot he
 44266	noticed at once even before he was introduced when I was in the D B C
 44267	with Poldy laughing and trying to listen I was waggling my foot we both
 44268	ordered 2 teas and plain bread and butter I saw him looking with his
 44269	two old maids of sisters when I stood up and asked the girl where it was
 44270	what do I care with it dropping out of me and that black closed breeches
 44271	he made me buy takes you half an hour to let them down wetting all
 44272	myself always with some brandnew fad every other week such a long one I
 44273	did I forgot my suede gloves on the seat behind that I never got after
 44274	some robber of a woman and he wanted me to put it in the Irish times
 44275	lost in the ladies lavatory D B C Dame street finder return to Mrs
 44276	Marion Bloom and I saw his eyes on my feet going out through the turning
 44277	door he was looking when I looked back and I went there for tea 2 days
 44278	after in the hope but he wasnt now how did that excite him because I was
 44279	crossing them when we were in the other room first he meant the shoes
 44280	that are too tight to walk in my hand is nice like that if I only had a
 44281	ring with the stone for my month a nice aquamarine Ill stick him for one
 44282	and a gold bracelet I dont like my foot so much still I made him spend
 44283	once with my foot the night after Goodwins botchup of a concert so cold
 44284	and windy it was well we had that rum in the house to mull and the fire
 44285	wasnt black out when he asked to take off my stockings lying on the
 44286	hearthrug in Lombard street west and another time it was my muddy boots
 44287	hed like me to walk in all the horses dung I could find but of course
 44288	hes not natural like the rest of the world that I what did he say I
 44289	could give 9 points in 10 to Katty Lanner and beat her what does that
 44290	mean I asked him I forget what he said because the stoppress edition
 44291	just passed and the man with the curly hair in the Lucan dairy thats so
 44292	polite I think I saw his face before somewhere I noticed him when I was
 44293	tasting the butter so I took my time Bartell dArcy too that he used to
 44294	make fun of when he commenced kissing me on the choir stairs after I
 44295	sang Gounods _Ave Maria_ what are we waiting for O my heart kiss me
 44296	straight on the brow and part which is my brown part he was pretty hot
 44297	for all his tinny voice too my low notes he was always raving about if
 44298	you can believe him I liked the way he used his mouth singing then he
 44299	said wasnt it terrible to do that there in a place like that I dont see
 44300	anything so terrible about it Ill tell him about that some day not now
 44301	and surprise him ay and Ill take him there and show him the very place
 44302	too we did it so now there you are like it or lump it he thinks nothing
 44303	can happen without him knowing he hadnt an idea about my mother till we
 44304	were engaged otherwise hed never have got me so cheap as he did he was
 44305	lo times worse himself anyhow begging me to give him a tiny bit cut off
 44306	my drawers that was the evening coming along Kenilworth square he kissed
 44307	me in the eye of my glove and I had to take it off asking me questions
 44308	is it permitted to enquire the shape of my bedroom so I let him keep it
 44309	as if I forgot it to think of me when I saw him slip it into his pocket
 44310	of course hes mad on the subject of drawers thats plain to be seen
 44311	always skeezing at those brazenfaced things on the bicycles with their
 44312	skirts blowing up to their navels even when Milly and I were out with
 44313	him at the open air fete that one in the cream muslin standing right
 44314	against the sun so he could see every atom she had on when he saw me
 44315	from behind following in the rain I saw him before he saw me however
 44316	standing at the corner of the Harolds cross road with a new raincoat on
 44317	him with the muffler in the Zingari colours to show off his complexion
 44318	and the brown hat looking slyboots as usual what was he doing there
 44319	where hed no business they can go and get whatever they like from
 44320	anything at all with a skirt on it and were not to ask any questions but
 44321	they want to know where were you where are you going I could feel him
 44322	coming along skulking after me his eyes on my neck he had been keeping
 44323	away from the house he felt it was getting too warm for him so I
 44324	halfturned and stopped then he pestered me to say yes till I took off my
 44325	glove slowly watching him he said my openwork sleeves were too cold for
 44326	the rain anything for an excuse to put his hand anear me drawers drawers
 44327	the whole blessed time till I promised to give him the pair off my doll
 44328	to carry about in his waistcoat pocket _O Maria Santisima_ he did look
 44329	a big fool dreeping in the rain splendid set of teeth he had made me
 44330	hungry to look at them and beseeched of me to lift the orange petticoat
 44331	I had on with the sunray pleats that there was nobody he said hed kneel
 44332	down in the wet if I didnt so persevering he would too and ruin his new
 44333	raincoat you never know what freak theyd take alone with you theyre so
 44334	savage for it if anyone was passing so I lifted them a bit and touched
 44335	his trousers outside the way I used to Gardner after with my ring hand
 44336	to keep him from doing worse where it was too public I was dying to find
 44337	out was he circumcised he was shaking like a jelly all over they want
 44338	to do everything too quick take all the pleasure out of it and father
 44339	waiting all the time for his dinner he told me to say I left my purse in
 44340	the butchers and had to go back for it what a Deceiver then he wrote me
 44341	that letter with all those words in it how could he have the face to any
 44342	woman after his company manners making it so awkward after when we met
 44343	asking me have I offended you with my eyelids down of course he saw I
 44344	wasnt he had a few brains not like that other fool Henny Doyle he was
 44345	always breaking or tearing something in the charades I hate an unlucky
 44346	man and if I knew what it meant of course I had to say no for form sake
 44347	dont understand you I said and wasnt it natural so it is of course
 44348	it used to be written up with a picture of a womans on that wall in
 44349	Gibraltar with that word I couldnt find anywhere only for children
 44350	seeing it too young then writing every morning a letter sometimes twice
 44351	a day I liked the way he made love then he knew the way to take a woman
 44352	when he sent me the 8 big poppies because mine was the 8th then I wrote
 44353	the night he kissed my heart at Dolphins barn I couldnt describe it
 44354	simply it makes you feel like nothing on earth but he never knew how to
 44355	embrace well like Gardner I hope hell come on Monday as he said at the
 44356	same time four I hate people who come at all hours answer the door you
 44357	think its the vegetables then its somebody and you all undressed or
 44358	the door of the filthy sloppy kitchen blows open the day old frostyface
 44359	Goodwin called about the concert in Lombard street and I just after
 44360	dinner all flushed and tossed with boiling old stew dont look at me
 44361	professor I had to say Im a fright yes but he was a real old gent in his
 44362	way it was impossible to be more respectful nobody to say youre out you
 44363	have to peep out through the blind like the messengerboy today I thought
 44364	it was a putoff first him sending the port and the peaches first and I
 44365	was just beginning to yawn with nerves thinking he was trying to make a
 44366	fool of me when I knew his tattarrattat at the door he must have been
 44367	a bit late because it was l/4 after 3 when I saw the 2 Dedalus girls
 44368	coming from school I never know the time even that watch he gave me
 44369	never seems to go properly Id want to get it looked after when I threw
 44370	the penny to that lame sailor for England home and beauty when I was
 44371	whistling there is a charming girl I love and I hadnt even put on my
 44372	clean shift or powdered myself or a thing then this day week were to go
 44373	to Belfast just as well he has to go to Ennis his fathers anniversary
 44374	the 27th it wouldnt be pleasant if he did suppose our rooms at the hotel
 44375	were beside each other and any fooling went on in the new bed I couldnt
 44376	tell him to stop and not bother me with him in the next room or perhaps
 44377	some protestant clergyman with a cough knocking on the wall then hed
 44378	never believe the next day we didnt do something its all very well a
 44379	husband but you cant fool a lover after me telling him we never did
 44380	anything of course he didnt believe me no its better hes going where
 44381	he is besides something always happens with him the time going to the
 44382	Mallow concert at Maryborough ordering boiling soup for the two of
 44383	us then the bell rang out he walks down the platform with the soup
 44384	splashing about taking spoonfuls of it hadnt he the nerve and the waiter
 44385	after him making a holy show of us screeching and confusion for the
 44386	engine to start but he wouldnt pay till he finished it the two gentlemen
 44387	in the 3rd class carriage said he was quite right so he was too hes so
 44388	pigheaded sometimes when he gets a thing into his head a good job he was
 44389	able to open the carriage door with his knife or theyd have taken us on
 44390	to Cork I suppose that was done out of revenge on him O I love jaunting
 44391	in a train or a car with lovely soft cushions I wonder will he take
 44392	a 1st class for me he might want to do it in the train by tipping the
 44393	guard well O I suppose therell be the usual idiots of men gaping at
 44394	us with their eyes as stupid as ever they can possibly be that was an
 44395	exceptional man that common workman that left us alone in the carriage
 44396	that day going to Howth Id like to find out something about him l or 2
 44397	tunnels perhaps then you have to look out of the window all the nicer
 44398	then coming back suppose I never came back what would they say eloped
 44399	with him that gets you on on the stage the last concert I sang at where
 44400	its over a year ago when was it St Teresas hall Clarendon St little
 44401	chits of missies they have now singing Kathleen Kearney and her like
 44402	on account of father being in the army and my singing the absentminded
 44403	beggar and wearing a brooch for Lord Roberts when I had the map of it
 44404	all and Poldy not Irish enough was it him managed it this time I wouldnt
 44405	put it past him like he got me on to sing in the _Stabat Mater_ by going
 44406	around saying he was putting Lead Kindly Light to music I put him up to
 44407	that till the jesuits found out he was a freemason thumping the piano
 44408	lead Thou me on copied from some old opera yes and he was going about
 44409	with some of them Sinner Fein lately or whatever they call themselves
 44410	talking his usual trash and nonsense he says that little man he showed
 44411	me without the neck is very intelligent the coming man Griffiths is he
 44412	well he doesnt look it thats all I can say still it must have been him
 44413	he knew there was a boycott I hate the mention of their politics after
 44414	the war that Pretoria and Ladysmith and Bloemfontein where Gardner lieut
 44415	Stanley G 8th Bn 2nd East Lancs Rgt of enteric fever he was a lovely
 44416	fellow in khaki and just the right height over me Im sure he was brave
 44417	too he said I was lovely the evening we kissed goodbye at the canal lock
 44418	my Irish beauty he was pale with excitement about going away or wed be
 44419	seen from the road he couldnt stand properly and I so hot as I never
 44420	felt they could have made their peace in the beginning or old oom Paul
 44421	and the rest of the other old Krugers go and fight it out between them
 44422	instead of dragging on for years killing any finelooking men there were
 44423	with their fever if he was even decently shot it wouldnt have been so
 44424	bad I love to see a regiment pass in review the first time I saw the
 44425	Spanish cavalry at La Roque it was lovely after looking across the bay
 44426	from Algeciras all the lights of the rock like fireflies or those sham
 44427	battles on the 15 acres the Black Watch with their kilts in time at the
 44428	march past the 10th hussars the prince of Wales own or the lancers O the
 44429	lancers theyre grand or the Dublins that won Tugela his father made his
 44430	money over selling the horses for the cavalry well he could buy me a
 44431	nice present up in Belfast after what I gave him theyve lovely linen up
 44432	there or one of those nice kimono things I must buy a mothball like I
 44433	had before to keep in the drawer with them it would be exciting going
 44434	round with him shopping buying those things in a new city better leave
 44435	this ring behind want to keep turning and turning to get it over the
 44436	knuckle there or they might bell it round the town in their papers or
 44437	tell the police on me but theyd think were married O let them all go and
 44438	smother themselves for the fat lot I care he has plenty of money and hes
 44439	not a marrying man so somebody better get it out of him if I could find
 44440	out whether he likes me I looked a bit washy of course when I looked
 44441	close in the handglass powdering a mirror never gives you the expression
 44442	besides scrooching down on me like that all the time with his big
 44443	hipbones hes heavy too with his hairy chest for this heat always having
 44444	to lie down for them better for him put it into me from behind the way
 44445	Mrs Mastiansky told me her husband made her like the dogs do it and
 44446	stick out her tongue as far as ever she could and he so quiet and mild
 44447	with his tingating cither can you ever be up to men the way it takes
 44448	them lovely stuff in that blue suit he had on and stylish tie and socks
 44449	with the skyblue silk things on them hes certainly well off I know by
 44450	the cut his clothes have and his heavy watch but he was like a perfect
 44451	devil for a few minutes after he came back with the stoppress tearing up
 44452	the tickets and swearing blazes because he lost 20 quid he said he lost
 44453	over that outsider that won and half he put on for me on account of
 44454	Lenehans tip cursing him to the lowest pits that sponger he was making
 44455	free with me after the Glencree dinner coming back that long joult over
 44456	the featherbed mountain after the lord Mayor looking at me with his
 44457	dirty eyes Val Dillon that big heathen I first noticed him at dessert
 44458	when I was cracking the nuts with my teeth I wished I could have picked
 44459	every morsel of that chicken out of my fingers it was so tasty
 44460	and browned and as tender as anything only for I didnt want to eat
 44461	everything on my plate those forks and fishslicers were hallmarked
 44462	silver too I wish I had some I could easily have slipped a couple into
 44463	my muff when I was playing with them then always hanging out of them for
 44464	money in a restaurant for the bit you put down your throat we have to
 44465	be thankful for our mangy cup of tea itself as a great compliment to be
 44466	noticed the way the world is divided in any case if its going to go on I
 44467	want at least two other good chemises for one thing and but I dont know
 44468	what kind of drawers he likes none at all I think didnt he say yes and
 44469	half the girls in Gibraltar never wore them either naked as God made
 44470	them that Andalusian singing her Manola she didnt make much secret of
 44471	what she hadnt yes and the second pair of silkette stockings is laddered
 44472	after one days wear I could have brought them back to Lewers this
 44473	morning and kicked up a row and made that one change them only not to
 44474	upset myself and run the risk of walking into him and ruining the whole
 44475	thing and one of those kidfitting corsets Id want advertised cheap in
 44476	the Gentlewoman with elastic gores on the hips he saved the one I have
 44477	but thats no good what did they say they give a delightful figure line
 44478	11/6 obviating that unsightly broad appearance across the lower back to
 44479	reduce flesh my belly is a bit too big Ill have to knock off the
 44480	stout at dinner or am I getting too fond of it the last they sent from
 44481	ORourkes was as flat as a pancake he makes his money easy Larry they
 44482	call him the old mangy parcel he sent at Xmas a cottage cake and a
 44483	bottle of hogwash he tried to palm off as claret that he couldnt get
 44484	anyone to drink God spare his spit for fear hed die of the drouth or
 44485	I must do a few breathing exercises I wonder is that antifat any good
 44486	might overdo it the thin ones are not so much the fashion now garters
 44487	that much I have the violet pair I wore today thats all he bought me
 44488	out of the cheque he got on the first O no there was the face lotion
 44489	I finished the last of yesterday that made my skin like new I told him
 44490	over and over again get that made up in the same place and dont forget
 44491	it God only knows whether he did after all I said to him 111 know by
 44492	the bottle anyway if not I suppose 111 only have to wash in my piss like
 44493	beeftea or chickensoup with some of that opoponax and violet I thought
 44494	it was beginning to look coarse or old a bit the skin underneath is much
 44495	finer where it peeled off there on my finger after the burn its a pity
 44496	it isnt all like that and the four paltry handkerchiefs about 6/- in all
 44497	sure you cant get on in this world without style all going in food and
 44498	rent when I get it Ill lash it around I tell you in fine style I always
 44499	want to throw a handful of tea into the pot measuring and mincing if
 44500	I buy a pair of old brogues itself do you like those new shoes yes how
 44501	much were they Ive no clothes at all the brown costume and the skirt and
 44502	jacket and the one at the cleaners 3 whats that for any woman cutting
 44503	up this old hat and patching up the other the men wont look at you and
 44504	women try to walk on you because they know youve no man then with all
 44505	the things getting dearer every day for the 4 years more I have of life
 44506	up to 35 no Im what am I at all 111 be 33 in September will I what O
 44507	well look at that Mrs Galbraith shes much older than me I saw her when
 44508	I was out last week her beautys on the wane she was a lovely woman
 44509	magnificent head of hair on her down to her waist tossing it back like
 44510	that like Kitty OShea in Grantham street 1st thing I did every morning
 44511	to look across see her combing it as if she loved it and was full of it
 44512	pity I only got to know her the day before we left and that Mrs Langtry
 44513	the jersey lily the prince of Wales was in love with I suppose hes like
 44514	the first man going the roads only for the name of a king theyre all
 44515	made the one way only a black mans Id like to try a beauty up to what
 44516	was she 45 there was some funny story about the jealous old husband what
 44517	was it at all and an oyster knife he went no he made her wear a kind
 44518	of a tin thing round her and the prince of Wales yes he had the oyster
 44519	knife cant be true a thing like that like some of those books he brings
 44520	me the works of Master Francois Somebody supposed to be a priest about
 44521	a child born out of her ear because her bumgut fell out a nice word for
 44522	any priest to write and her a--e as if any fool wouldnt know what that
 44523	meant I hate that pretending of all things with that old blackguards
 44524	face on him anybody can see its not true and that Ruby and Fair Tyrants
 44525	he brought me that twice I remember when I came to page 5 o the part
 44526	about where she hangs him up out of a hook with a cord flagellate
 44527	sure theres nothing for a woman in that all invention made up about he
 44528	drinking the champagne out of her slipper after the ball was over like
 44529	the infant Jesus in the crib at Inchicore in the Blessed Virgins arms
 44530	sure no woman could have a child that big taken out of her and I thought
 44531	first it came out of her side because how could she go to the chamber
 44532	when she wanted to and she a rich lady of course she felt honoured H R H
 44533	he was in Gibraltar the year I was born I bet he found lilies there too
 44534	where he planted the tree he planted more than that in his time he might
 44535	have planted me too if hed come a bit sooner then I wouldnt be here as
 44536	I am he ought to chuck that Freeman with the paltry few shillings
 44537	he knocks out of it and go into an office or something where hed get
 44538	regular pay or a bank where they could put him up on a throne to count
 44539	the money all the day of course he prefers plottering about the house
 44540	so you cant stir with him any side whats your programme today I wish hed
 44541	even smoke a pipe like father to get the smell of a man or pretending
 44542	to be mooching about for advertisements when he could have been in Mr
 44543	Cuffes still only for what he did then sending me to try and patch it up
 44544	I could have got him promoted there to be the manager he gave me a great
 44545	mirada once or twice first he was as stiff as the mischief really and
 44546	truly Mrs Bloom only I felt rotten simply with the old rubbishy dress
 44547	that I lost the leads out of the tails with no cut in it but theyre
 44548	coming into fashion again I bought it simply to please him I knew it was
 44549	no good by the finish pity I changed my mind of going to Todd and Bums
 44550	as I said and not Lees it was just like the shop itself rummage sale a
 44551	lot of trash I hate those rich shops get on your nerves nothing kills me
 44552	altogether only he thinks he knows a great lot about a womans dress and
 44553	cooking mathering everything he can scour off the shelves into it if
 44554	I went by his advices every blessed hat I put on does that suit me yes
 44555	take that thats alright the one like a weddingcake standing up miles
 44556	off my head he said suited me or the dishcover one coming down on my
 44557	backside on pins and needles about the shopgirl in that place in Grafton
 44558	street I had the misfortune to bring him into and she as insolent as
 44559	ever she could be with her smirk saying Im afraid were giving you too
 44560	much trouble what shes there for but I stared it out of her yes he was
 44561	awfully stiff and no wonder but he changed the second time he looked
 44562	Poldy pigheaded as usual like the soup but I could see him looking very
 44563	hard at my chest when he stood up to open the door for me it was nice of
 44564	him to show me out in any case Im extremely sorry Mrs Bloom believe me
 44565	without making it too marked the first time after him being insulted and
 44566	me being supposed to be his wife I just half smiled I know my chest was
 44567	out that way at the door when he said Im extremely sorry and Im sure you
 44568	were

 44595	afraid going about of getting a kick or a bang of something there the

 44602	that word met something with hoses in it and he came out with some
 44603	jawbreakers about the incarnation he never can explain a thing simply
 44604	the way a body can understand then he goes and burns the bottom out of
 44605	the pan all for his Kidney this one not so much theres the mark of his
 44606	teeth still where he tried to bite the nipple I had to scream out arent
 44607	they fearful trying to hurt you I had a great breast of milk with Milly
 44608	enough for two what was the reason of that he said I could have got a
 44609	pound a week as a wet nurse all swelled out the morning that delicate
 44610	looking student that stopped in no 28 with the Citrons Penrose nearly
 44611	caught me washing through the window only for I snapped up the towel to
 44612	my face that was his studenting hurt me they used to weaning her till he
 44613	got doctor Brady to give me the belladonna prescription I had to get him
 44614	to suck them they were so hard he said it was sweeter and thicker than
 44615	cows then he wanted to milk me into the tea well hes beyond everything I
 44616	declare somebody ought to put him in the budget if I only could remember
 44617	the I half of the things and write a book out of it the works of Master
 44618	Poldy yes and its so much smoother the skin much an hour he was at them
 44619	Im sure by the clock like some kind of a big infant I had at me they
 44620	want everything in their mouth all the pleasure those men get out of a
 44621	woman I can feel his mouth O Lord I must stretch myself I wished he was
 44622	here or somebody to let myself go with and come again like that I feel
 44623	all fire inside me or if I could dream it when he made me spend the 2nd
 44624	time tickling me behind with his finger I was coming for about 5 minutes
 44625	with my legs round him I had to hug him after O Lord I wanted to shout
 44626	out all sorts of things fuck or shit or anything at all only not to look
 44627	ugly or those lines from the strain who knows the way hed take it you
 44628	want to feel your way with a man theyre not all like him thank God some
 44629	of them want you to be so nice about it I noticed the contrast he does
 44630	it and doesnt talk I gave my eyes that look with my hair a bit loose
 44631	from the tumbling and my tongue between my lips up to him the savage
 44632	brute Thursday Friday one Saturday two Sunday three O Lord I cant wait
 44633	till Monday

 44641	hes getting very careless and threw the rest of them up in the W C 111

 44664	x x x x she didnt look a bit married just like a girl he was years older
 44665	than her wogger he was awfully fond of me when he held down the wire
 44666	with his foot for me to step over at the bullfight at La Linea when
 44667	that matador Gomez was given the bulls ear these clothes we have to wear
 44668	whoever invented them expecting you to walk up Killiney hill then for
 44669	example at that picnic all staysed up you cant do a blessed thing in
 44670	them in a crowd run or jump out of the way thats why I was afraid when
 44671	that other ferocious old Bull began to charge the banderilleros with
 44672	the sashes and the 2 things in their hats and the brutes of men shouting
 44673	bravo toro sure the women were as bad in their nice white mantillas
 44674	ripping all the whole insides out of those poor horses I never heard of
 44675	such a thing in all my life yes he used to break his heart at me taking
 44676	off the dog barking in bell lane poor brute and it sick what became
 44677	of them ever I suppose theyre dead long ago the 2 of them its like all
 44678	through a mist makes you feel so old I made the scones of course I had
 44679	everything all to myself then a girl Hester we used to compare our hair
 44680	mine was thicker than hers she showed me how to settle it at the back
 44681	when I put it up and whats this else how to make a knot on a thread with
 44682	the one hand we were like cousins what age was I then the night of the
 44683	storm I slept in her bed she had her arms round me then we were fighting
 44684	in the morning with the pillow what fun he was watching me whenever he
 44685	got an opportunity at the band on the Alameda esplanade when I was with
 44686	father and captain Grove I looked up at the church first and then at the
 44687	windows then down and our eyes met I felt something go through me like
 44688	all needles my eyes were dancing I remember after when I looked
 44689	at myself in the glass hardly recognised myself the change he was
 44690	attractive to a girl in spite of his being a little bald intelligent
 44691	looking disappointed and gay at the same time he was like Thomas in
 44692	the shadow of Ashlydyat I had a splendid skin from the sun and the
 44693	excitement like a rose I didnt get a wink of sleep it wouldnt have been
 44694	nice on account of her but I could have stopped it in time she gave me
 44695	the Moonstone to read that was the first I read of Wilkie Collins East
 44696	Lynne I read and the shadow of Ashlydyat Mrs Henry Wood Henry Dunbar by
 44697	that other woman I lent him afterwards with Mulveys photo in it so as he
 44698	see I wasnt without and Lord Lytton Eugene Aram Molly bawn she gave me
 44699	by Mrs Hungerford on account of the name I dont like books with a Molly
 44700	in them like that one he brought me about the one from Flanders a whore
 44701	always shoplifting anything she could cloth and stuff and yards of it
 44702	O this blanket is too heavy on me thats better I havent even one decent
 44703	nightdress this thing gets all rolled under me besides him and his
 44704	fooling thats better I used to be weltering then in the heat my shift
 44705	drenched with the sweat stuck in the cheeks of my bottom on the chair
 44706	when I stood up they were so fattish and firm when I got up on the sofa
 44707	cushions to see with my clothes up and the bugs tons of them at night
 44708	and the mosquito nets I couldnt read a line Lord how long ago it seems
 44709	centuries of course they never came back and she didnt put her address
 44710	right on it either she may have noticed her wogger people were always
 44711	going away and we never I remember that day with the waves and the
 44712	boats with their high heads rocking and the smell of ship those Officers
 44713	uniforms on shore leave made me seasick he didnt say anything he was
 44714	very serious I had the high buttoned boots on and my skirt was blowing
 44715	she kissed me six or seven times didnt I cry yes I believe I did or near
 44716	it my lips were taittering when I said goodbye she had a Gorgeous wrap
 44717	of some special kind of blue colour on her for the voyage made very
 44718	peculiarly to one side like and it was extremely pretty it got as dull
 44719	as the devil after they went I was almost planning to run away mad out
 44720	of it somewhere were never easy where we are father or aunt or marriage
 44721	waiting always waiting to guiiiide him toooo me waiting nor speeeed
 44722	his flying feet their damn guns bursting and booming all over the shop
 44723	especially the Queens birthday and throwing everything down in all
 44724	directions if you didnt open the windows when general Ulysses Grant
 44725	whoever he was or did supposed to be some great fellow landed off the
 44726	ship and old Sprague the consul that was there from before the flood
 44727	dressed up poor man and he in mourning for the son then the same old
 44728	bugles for reveille in the morning and drums rolling and the unfortunate
 44729	poor devils of soldiers walking about with messtins smelling the place
 44730	more than the old longbearded jews in their jellibees and levites
 44731	assembly and sound clear and gunfire for the men to cross the lines and
 44732	the warden marching with his keys to lock the gates and the bagpipes and
 44733	only captain Groves and father talking about Rorkes drift and Plevna and
 44734	sir Garnet Wolseley and Gordon at Khartoum lighting their pipes for
 44735	them everytime they went out drunken old devil with his grog on the
 44736	windowsill catch him leaving any of it picking his nose trying to think
 44737	of some other dirty story to tell up in a corner but he never forgot
 44738	himself when I was there sending me out of the room on some blind excuse
 44739	paying his compliments the Bushmills whisky talking of course but hed
 44740	do the same to the next woman that came along I suppose he died of
 44741	galloping drink ages ago the days like years not a letter from a living
 44742	soul except the odd few I posted to myself with bits of paper in them so
 44743	bored sometimes I could fight with my nails listening to that old Arab
 44744	with the one eye and his heass of an instrument singing his heah heah
 44745	aheah all my compriments on your hotchapotch of your heass as bad as now
 44746	with the hands hanging off me looking out of the window if there was a
 44747	nice fellow even in the opposite house that medical in Holles street the
 44748	nurse was after when I put on my gloves and hat at the window to show
 44749	I was going out not a notion what I meant arent they thick never
 44750	understand what you say even youd want to print it up on a big poster
 44751	for them not even if you shake hands twice with the left he didnt
 44752	recognise me either when I half frowned at him outside Westland row
 44753	chapel where does their great intelligence come in Id like to know
 44754	grey matter they have it all in their tail if you ask me those country
 44755	gougers up in the City Arms intelligence they had a damn sight less than
 44756	the bulls and cows they were selling the meat and the coalmans bell that
 44757	noisy bugger trying to swindle me with the wrong bill he took out of his
 44758	hat what a pair of paws and pots and pans and kettles to mend any broken
 44759	bottles for a poor man today and no visitors or post ever except his
 44760	cheques or some advertisement like that wonderworker they sent him
 44761	addressed dear Madam only his letter and the card from Milly this
 44762	morning see she wrote a letter to him who did I get the last letter from
 44763	O Mrs Dwenn now what possessed her to write from Canada after so many
 44764	years to know the recipe I had for pisto madrileno Floey Dillon since
 44765	she wrote to say she was married to a very rich architect if Im to
 44766	believe all I hear with a villa and eight rooms her father was an
 44767	awfully nice man he was near seventy always goodhumoured well now Miss
 44768	Tweedy or Miss Gillespie theres the piannyer that was a solid silver
 44769	coffee service he had too on the mahogany sideboard then dying so far
 44770	away I hate people that have always their poor story to tell everybody
 44771	has their own troubles that poor Nancy Blake died a month ago of acute
 44772	neumonia well I didnt know her so well as all that she was Floeys friend
 44773	more than mine poor Nancy its a bother having to answer he always tells
 44774	me the wrong things and no stops to say like making a speech your sad
 44775	bereavement symphathy I always make that mistake and newphew with 2
 44776	double yous in I hope hell write me a longer letter the next time if its
 44777	a thing he really likes me O thanks be to the great God I got somebody
 44778	to give me what I badly wanted to put some heart up into me youve no
 44779	chances at all in this place like you used long ago I wish somebody
 44780	would write me a loveletter his wasnt much and I told him he could write
 44781	what he liked yours ever Hugh Boylan in old Madrid stuff silly women
 44782	believe love is sighing I am dying still if he wrote it I suppose thered
 44783	be some truth in it true or no it fills up your whole day and life
 44784	always something to think about every moment and see it all round you
 44785	like a new world I could write the answer in bed to let him imagine me
 44786	short just a few words not those long crossed letters Atty Dillon used
 44787	to write to the fellow that was something in the four courts that jilted
 44788	her after out of the ladies letterwriter when I told her to say a few
 44789	simple words he could twist how he liked not acting with precipat precip
 44790	itancy with equal candour the greatest earthly happiness answer to a
 44791	gentlemans proposal affirmatively my goodness theres nothing else its
 44792	all very fine for them but as for being a woman as soon as youre old
 44793	they might as well throw you out in the bottom of the ashpit.
